Griffith: Then passing through the sieve into the ample room, the God throws off the dregs according to his wish.
Devanāgarī: तिरः पवित्रं परियन्नुरु ज्रयो नि शर्याणि दधते देव आ वरम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | roruvat | abhi | pūrvāḥ | acikradat | upa-āruhaḥ | śrathayan | svādate | hariḥ || tiraḥ | pavitram | pari-yan | uru | jrayaḥ | ni | śaryāṇi | dadhate | devaḥ | ā | varam ||9.68.2||

IAST: vi yo mame yamyā saṁyatī madaḥ sākaṁvṛdhā payasā pinvad akṣitā
Griffith: The gladdening drink that measured out the meeting Twins fills full with milk the Eternal Ever-waxing Pai
Devanāgarī: वि यो ममे यम्या संयती मदः साकंवृधा पयसा पिन्वदक्षिता
pada pāṭha: vi | yaḥ | mame | yamyā | saṁyatī iti sam-yatī | madaḥ | sākam-vr̥dhā | payasā | pinvat | akṣitā || mahī iti | apāre iti | rajasī iti | vi-vevidat | abhi-vrajan | akṣitam | pājaḥ | ā | dade ||9.68.3||

IAST: mahī apāre rajasī vivevidad abhivrajann akṣitam pāja ā dade
Griffith: Bringing to light the Two great Regions limitless, moving above them he gained sheen that never fades.
Devanāgarī: मही अपारे रजसी विवेविददभिव्रजन्नक्षितं पाज आ ददे
pada pāṭha: vi | yaḥ | mame | yamyā | saṁyatī iti sam-yatī | madaḥ | sākam-vr̥dhā | payasā | pinvat | akṣitā || mahī iti | apāre iti | rajasī iti | vi-vevidat | abhi-vrajan | akṣitam | pājaḥ | ā | dade ||9.68.3||

IAST: sa mātarā vicaran vājayann apaḥ pra medhiraḥ svadhayā pinvate padam
Griffith: Wandering through, the Parents, strengthening the floods, the Sage makes his place swell with his own nati
Devanāgarī: स मातरा विचरन्वाजयन्नपः प्र मेधिरः स्वधया पिन्वते पदम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mātarā | vi-caran | vājayan | apaḥ | pra | medhiraḥ | svadhayā | pinvate | padam || aṁśuḥ | yavena | pipiśe | yataḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | sam | jāmi-bhiḥ | nasate | rakṣate | śiraḥ ||9.68.4||

IAST: aṁśur yavena pipiśe yato nṛbhiḥ saṁ jāmibhir nasate rakṣate śiraḥ
Griffith: The stalk is mixed with grain: he comes led by the men together with the sisters, and preserves the Head
Devanāgarī: अंशुर्यवेन पिपिशे यतो नृभिः सं जामिभिर्नसते रक्षते शिरः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mātarā | vi-caran | vājayan | apaḥ | pra | medhiraḥ | svadhayā | pinvate | padam || aṁśuḥ | yavena | pipiśe | yataḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | sam | jāmi-bhiḥ | nasate | rakṣate | śiraḥ ||9.68.4||

IAST: saṁ dakṣeṇa manasā jāyate kavir ṛtasya garbho nihito yamā paraḥ
Griffith: With energetic intellect the Sage is born, deposited as germ of Law, far from the Twins.
Devanāgarī: सं दक्षेण मनसा जायते कविरृतस्य गर्भो निहितो यमा परः
pada pāṭha: sam | dakṣeṇa | manasā | jāyate | kaviḥ | r̥tasya | garbhaḥ | ni-hitaḥ | yamā | paraḥ || yūnā | ha | santā | prathamam | vi | jajñatuḥ | guhā | hitam | janima | nemam | ut-yatam ||9.68.5||

IAST: yūnā ha santā prathamaṁ vi jajñatur guhā hitaṁ janima nemam udyatam
Griffith: They being young at first showed visibly distinct the Creature that is half-concealed and half-exposed.
Devanāgarī: यूना ह सन्ता प्रथमं वि जज्ञतुर्गुहा हितं जनिम नेममुद्यतम्
pada pāṭha: sam | dakṣeṇa | manasā | jāyate | kaviḥ | r̥tasya | garbhaḥ | ni-hitaḥ | yamā | paraḥ || yūnā | ha | santā | prathamam | vi | jajñatuḥ | guhā | hitam | janima | nemam | ut-yatam ||9.68.5||

IAST: mandrasya rūpaṁ vividur manīṣiṇaḥ śyeno yad andho abharat parāvataḥ
Griffith: The sages knew the form of him the Gladdener, what time the Falcon brought the plant from far away.
Devanāgarī: मन्द्रस्य रूपं विविदुर्मनीषिणः श्येनो यदन्धो अभरत्परावतः
pada pāṭha: mandrasya | rūpam | vividuḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | śyenaḥ | yat | andhaḥ | abharat | parā-vataḥ || tam | marjayanta | su-vr̥dham | nadīṣu | ā | uśantam | aṁśum | pari-yantam | r̥gmiyam ||9.68.6||

IAST: tam marjayanta suvṛdhaṁ nadīṣv ām̐ uśantam aṁśum pariyantam ṛgmiyam
Griffith: Him who assures success they beautified in streams, the stalk who yearned therefor, mighty and meet for
Devanāgarī: तं मर्जयन्त सुवृधं नदीष्वाँ उशन्तमंशुं परियन्तमृग्मियम्
pada pāṭha: mandrasya | rūpam | vividuḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | śyenaḥ | yat | andhaḥ | abharat | parā-vataḥ || tam | marjayanta | su-vr̥dham | nadīṣu | ā | uśantam | aṁśum | pari-yantam | r̥gmiyam ||9.68.6||

IAST: tvām mṛjanti daśa yoṣaṇaḥ sutaṁ soma ṛṣibhir matibhir dhītibhir hitam
Griffith: Together with the Rsis, with their prayers and hymns ten women deck thee, Soma, friendly when effused.
Devanāgarī: त्वां मृजन्ति दश योषणः सुतं सोम ऋषिभिर्मतिभिर्धीतिभिर्हितम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | mr̥janti | daśa | yoṣaṇaḥ | sutam | soma | r̥ṣi-bhiḥ | mati-bhiḥ | dhīti-bhiḥ | hitam || avyaḥ | vārebhiḥ | uta | devahūti-bhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | vājam | ā | darṣi | sātaye ||9.68.7||

IAST: avyo vārebhir uta devahūtibhir nṛbhir yato vājam ā darṣi sātaye
Griffith: Led by the men, with invocations of the Gods, through the fleece, thou hast given us strength to win the
Devanāgarī: अव्यो वारेभिरुत देवहूतिभिर्नृभिर्यतो वाजमा दर्षि सातये
pada pāṭha: tvām | mr̥janti | daśa | yoṣaṇaḥ | sutam | soma | r̥ṣi-bhiḥ | mati-bhiḥ | dhīti-bhiḥ | hitam || avyaḥ | vārebhiḥ | uta | devahūti-bhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | vājam | ā | darṣi | sātaye ||9.68.7||

IAST: pariprayantaṁ vayyaṁ suṣaṁsadaṁ somam manīṣā abhy anūṣata stubhaḥ
Griffith: Songs resonant with praise have celebrated him. Soma, Friend, springing forth with his fair company.
Devanāgarī: परिप्रयन्तं वय्यं सुषंसदं सोमं मनीषा अभ्यनूषत स्तुभः
pada pāṭha: pari-prayantam | vayyam | su-saṁsadam | somam | manīṣāḥ | abhi | anūṣata | stubhaḥ || yaḥ | dhārayā | madhu-mān | ūrmiṇā | divaḥ | iyarti | vācam | rayiṣāṭ | amartyaḥ ||9.68.8||

IAST: yo dhārayā madhumām̐ ūrmiṇā diva iyarti vācaṁ rayiṣāḻ amartyaḥ
Griffith: Even him who rich in meath, with undulating stream, Winnner of Wealth, Immortal, sends his voice from he
Devanāgarī: यो धारया मधुमाँ ऊर्मिणा दिव इयर्ति वाचं रयिषाळमर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: pari-prayantam | vayyam | su-saṁsadam | somam | manīṣāḥ | abhi | anūṣata | stubhaḥ || yaḥ | dhārayā | madhu-mān | ūrmiṇā | divaḥ | iyarti | vācam | rayiṣāṭ | amartyaḥ ||9.68.8||

IAST: ayaṁ diva iyarti viśvam ā rajaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati
Griffith: He sends it into all the region forth from heaven. Soma, while he is filtcred, settles in the jars.
Devanāgarī: अयं दिव इयर्ति विश्वमा रजः सोमः पुनानः कलशेषु सीदति
pada pāṭha: ayam | divaḥ | iyarti | viśvam | ā | rajaḥ | somaḥ | punānaḥ | kalaśeṣu | sīdati || at-bhiḥ | gobhiḥ | mr̥jyate | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | punānaḥ | induḥ | varivaḥ | vidat | priyam ||9.68.9||

IAST: adbhir gobhir mṛjyate adribhiḥ sutaḥ punāna indur varivo vidat priyam
Griffith: With milk and waters is he decked when pressed with stones: Indu, when purified, shall find sweet rest a
Devanāgarī: अद्भिर्गोभिर्मृज्यते अद्रिभिः सुतः पुनान इन्दुर्वरिवो विदत्प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | divaḥ | iyarti | viśvam | ā | rajaḥ | somaḥ | punānaḥ | kalaśeṣu | sīdati || at-bhiḥ | gobhiḥ | mr̥jyate | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | punānaḥ | induḥ | varivaḥ | vidat | priyam ||9.68.9||

IAST: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāno vayo dadhac citratamam pavasva
Griffith: Even thus poured forth How on thy way, O Soma, vouchsafing us most manifold lively vigour.
Devanāgarī: एवा नः सोम परिषिच्यमानो वयो दधच्चित्रतमं पवस्व
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | soma | pari-sicyamānaḥ | vayaḥ | dadhat | citra-tamam | pavasva || adveṣe iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | huvema | devāḥ | dhatta | rayim | asme iti | su-vīram ||9.68.10||

IAST: adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayim asme suvīram
Griffith: We will invoke benevolent Earth and Heaven. Give us, ye Gods, riches with noble heroes.
Devanāgarī: अद्वेषे द्यावापृथिवी हुवेम देवा धत्त रयिमस्मे सुवीरम्
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | soma | pari-sicyamānaḥ | vayaḥ | dadhat | citra-tamam | pavasva || adveṣe iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | huvema | devāḥ | dhatta | rayim | asme iti | su-vīram ||9.68.10||

IAST: iṣur na dhanvan prati dhīyate matir vatso na mātur upa sarjy ūdhani
Griffith: LAID like an arrow on the bow the hymn hath been loosed like a young calf to the udder of its dam.
Devanāgarī: इषुर्न धन्वन्प्रति धीयते मतिर्वत्सो न मातुरुप सर्ज्यूधनि
pada pāṭha: iṣuḥ | na | dhanvan | prati | dhīyate | matiḥ | vatsaḥ | na | mātuḥ | upa | sarji | ūrdhani || urudhārā-iva | duhe | agre | ā-yatī | asya | vrateṣu | api | somaḥ | iṣyate ||9.69.1||

IAST: urudhāreva duhe agra āyaty asya vrateṣv api soma iṣyate
Griffith: As one who cometh first with full stream she is milked the Soma is impelled to this man's holy rites.
Devanāgarī: उरुधारेव दुहे अग्र आयत्यस्य व्रतेष्वपि सोम इष्यते
pada pāṭha: iṣuḥ | na | dhanvan | prati | dhīyate | matiḥ | vatsaḥ | na | mātuḥ | upa | sarji | ūrdhani || urudhārā-iva | duhe | agre | ā-yatī | asya | vrateṣu | api | somaḥ | iṣyate ||9.69.1||

IAST: upo matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antar āsani
Griffith: The thought is deeply fixed; the savoury juice is shed; the tongue with joyous sound is stirring in the mo
Devanāgarī: उपो मतिः पृच्यते सिच्यते मधु मन्द्राजनी चोदते अन्तरासनि
pada pāṭha: upo iti | matiḥ | pr̥cyate | sicyate | madhu | mandra-ajanī | codate | antaḥ | āsani || pavamānaḥ | sam-taniḥ | praghnatām-iva | madhu-mān | drapsaḥ | pari | vāram | arṣati ||9.69.2||

IAST: pavamānaḥ saṁtaniḥ praghnatām iva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāram arṣati
Griffith: And Pavamana, like the shout of combatants, the drop rising in sweet juice, is flowing through the fleec
Devanāgarī: पवमानः संतनिः प्रघ्नतामिव मधुमान्द्रप्सः परि वारमर्षति
pada pāṭha: upo iti | matiḥ | pr̥cyate | sicyate | madhu | mandra-ajanī | codate | antaḥ | āsani || pavamānaḥ | sam-taniḥ | praghnatām-iva | madhu-mān | drapsaḥ | pari | vāram | arṣati ||9.69.2||

IAST: avye vadhūyuḥ pavate pari tvaci śrathnīte naptīr aditer ṛtaṁ yate
Griffith: He flows about the sheep-skin, longing for a bride: he looses Aditi's Daughters for the worshipper.
Devanāgarī: अव्ये वधूयुः पवते परि त्वचि श्रथ्नीते नप्तीरदितेरृतं यते
pada pāṭha: avye | vadhū-yuḥ | pavate | pari | tvaci | śrathnīte | naptīḥ | aditeḥ | r̥tam | yate || hariḥ | akrān | yajataḥ | sam-yataḥ | madaḥ | nr̥mnā | śiśānaḥ | mahiṣaḥ | na | śobhate ||9.69.3||

IAST: harir akrān yajataḥ saṁyato mado nṛmṇā śiśāno mahiṣo na śobhate
Griffith: The sacred drink hath come, gold-tinted, well-restrained: like a strong Bull he shines, whetting his ma
Devanāgarī: हरिरक्रान्यजतः संयतो मदो नृम्णा शिशानो महिषो न शोभते
pada pāṭha: avye | vadhū-yuḥ | pavate | pari | tvaci | śrathnīte | naptīḥ | aditeḥ | r̥tam | yate || hariḥ | akrān | yajataḥ | sam-yataḥ | madaḥ | nr̥mnā | śiśānaḥ | mahiṣaḥ | na | śobhate ||9.69.3||

IAST: ukṣā mimāti prati yanti dhenavo devasya devīr upa yanti niṣkṛtam
Griffith: The Bull is bellowing; the Cows are coming nigh: the Goddesses approach the God's own resting-place.
Devanāgarī: उक्षा मिमाति प्रति यन्ति धेनवो देवस्य देवीरुप यन्ति निष्कृतम्
pada pāṭha: ukṣā | mimāti | prati | yanti | dhenavaḥ | devasya | devīḥ | upa | yanti | niḥ-kr̥tam || ati | akramīt | arjunam | vāram | avyayam | atkam | na | niktam | pari | somaḥ | avyata ||9.69.4||

IAST: aty akramīd arjunaṁ vāram avyayam atkaṁ na niktam pari somo avyata
Griffith: Onward hath Soma passed through the sheep's fair bright fleece, and hath, as 'twere, endued a garment ne
Devanāgarī: अत्यक्रमीदर्जुनं वारमव्ययमत्कं न निक्तं परि सोमो अव्यत
pada pāṭha: ukṣā | mimāti | prati | yanti | dhenavaḥ | devasya | devīḥ | upa | yanti | niḥ-kr̥tam || ati | akramīt | arjunam | vāram | avyayam | atkam | na | niktam | pari | somaḥ | avyata ||9.69.4||

IAST: amṛktena ruśatā vāsasā harir amartyo nirṇijānaḥ pari vyata
Griffith: The golden-hued, Immortal, newly bathed, puts on a brightly shining vesture that is never harmed.
Devanāgarī: अमृक्तेन रुशता वाससा हरिरमर्त्यो निर्णिजानः परि व्यत
pada pāṭha: amr̥ktena | ruśatā | vāsasā | hariḥ | amartyaḥ | niḥ-nijānaḥ | pari | vyata || divaḥ | pr̥ṣṭham | barhaṇā | niḥ-nije | kr̥ta | upa-staraṇam | camvoḥ | nabhasmayam ||9.69.5||

IAST: divas pṛṣṭham barhaṇā nirṇije kṛtopastaraṇaṁ camvor nabhasmayam
Griffith: He made the ridge of heaven to be his radiant robe, by sprinkling of the bowls from moisture of the sky
pada pāṭha: amr̥ktena | ruśatā | vāsasā | hariḥ | amartyaḥ | niḥ-nijānaḥ | pari | vyata || divaḥ | pr̥ṣṭham | barhaṇā | niḥ-nije | kr̥ta | upa-staraṇam | camvoḥ | nabhasmayam ||9.69.5||

IAST: sūryasyeva raśmayo drāvayitnavo matsarāsaḥ prasupaḥ sākam īrate
Griffith: Even as the beams of Surya, urging men to speed, that cheer and send to sleep, together rush they forth,
Devanāgarī: सूर्यस्येव रश्मयो द्रावयित्नवो मत्सरासः प्रसुपः साकमीरते
pada pāṭha: sūryasya-iva | raśmayaḥ | dravayitnavaḥ | matsarāsaḥ | pra-supaḥ | sākam | īrate || tantum | tatam | pari | sargāsaḥ | āśavaḥ | na | indrāt | r̥te | pavate | dhāma | kim | cana ||9.69.6||

IAST: tantuṁ tatam pari sargāsa āśavo nendrād ṛte pavate dhāma kiṁ cana
Griffith: These swift outpourings in long course of holy rites: no form save only Indra shows itself so pure.
Devanāgarī: तन्तुं ततं परि सर्गास आशवो नेन्द्रादृते पवते धाम किं चन
pada pāṭha: sūryasya-iva | raśmayaḥ | dravayitnavaḥ | matsarāsaḥ | pra-supaḥ | sākam | īrate || tantum | tatam | pari | sargāsaḥ | āśavaḥ | na | indrāt | r̥te | pavate | dhāma | kim | cana ||9.69.6||

IAST: sindhor iva pravaṇe nimna āśavo vṛṣacyutā madāso gātum āśata
Griffith: As down the steep slope of a river to the vale, drawn from the Steer the swift strong draughts have found
Devanāgarī: सिन्धोरिव प्रवणे निम्न आशवो वृषच्युता मदासो गातुमाशत
pada pāṭha: sindhoḥ-iva | pravaṇe | nimne | āśavaḥ | vr̥ṣa-cyutāḥ | madāsaḥ | gātum | āśata || śam | naḥ | ni-veśe | dvi-pade | catuḥ-pade | asme iti | vājāḥ | soma | tiṣṭhantu | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||9.69.7||

IAST: śaṁ no niveśe dvipade catuṣpade 'sme vājāḥ soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: Well be it with the men and cattle in our home. May powers, O Soma, may the people stay with us.
Devanāgarī: शं नो निवेशे द्विपदे चतुष्पदेऽस्मे वाजाः सोम तिष्ठन्तु कृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: sindhoḥ-iva | pravaṇe | nimne | āśavaḥ | vr̥ṣa-cyutāḥ | madāsaḥ | gātum | āśata || śam | naḥ | ni-veśe | dvi-pade | catuḥ-pade | asme iti | vājāḥ | soma | tiṣṭhantu | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||9.69.7||

IAST: ā naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavad aśvāvad gomad yavamat suvīryam
Griffith: Pour out upon us wealth in goods, in gold, in steeds, in cattle and in corn, and great heroic strength.
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | pavasva | vasu-mat | hiraṇya-vat | aśva-vat | go-mat | yava-mat | su-vīryam || yūyam | hi | soma | pitaraḥ | mama | sthana | divaḥ | mūrdhānaḥ | pra-sthitāḥ | vayaḥ-kr̥taḥ ||9.69.8||

IAST: yūyaṁ hi soma pitaro mama sthana divo mūrdhānaḥ prasthitā vayaskṛtaḥ
Griffith: Ye, Soma, are my Fathers, lifted up on high as heads of heaven and makers of the strength of life.
Devanāgarī: यूयं हि सोम पितरो मम स्थन दिवो मूर्धानः प्रस्थिता वयस्कृतः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | pavasva | vasu-mat | hiraṇya-vat | aśva-vat | go-mat | yava-mat | su-vīryam || yūyam | hi | soma | pitaraḥ | mama | sthana | divaḥ | mūrdhānaḥ | pra-sthitāḥ | vayaḥ-kr̥taḥ ||9.69.8||

IAST: ete somāḥ pavamānāsa indraṁ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sātim accha
Griffith: These Pavamanas here, these drops of Soma, to Indra have sped forth like cars to booty.
Devanāgarī: एते सोमाः पवमानास इन्द्रं रथा इव प्र ययुः सातिमच्छ
pada pāṭha: ete | somāḥ | pavamānāsaḥ | indram | rathāḥ-iva | pra | yayuḥ | sātim | accha || sutāḥ | pavitram | ati | yanti | avyam | hitvī | vavrim | haritaḥ | vr̥ṣṭim | accha ||9.69.9||

IAST: sutāḥ pavitram ati yanty avyaṁ hitvī vavriṁ harito vṛṣṭim accha
Griffith: Effused, they pass the cleansing fleece, while, gold-hued, they cast their covering off to pour the rai
Devanāgarī: सुताः पवित्रमति यन्त्यव्यं हित्वी वव्रिं हरितो वृष्टिमच्छ
pada pāṭha: ete | somāḥ | pavamānāsaḥ | indram | rathāḥ-iva | pra | yayuḥ | sātim | accha || sutāḥ | pavitram | ati | yanti | avyam | hitvī | vavrim | haritaḥ | vr̥ṣṭim | accha ||9.69.9||

IAST: indav indrāya bṛhate pavasva sumṛḻīko anavadyo riśādāḥ
Griffith: O Indu, flow thou on for lofty Indra, flow blameless, very gracious, foe-destroyer.
Devanāgarī: इन्दविन्द्राय बृहते पवस्व सुमृळीको अनवद्यो रिशादाः
pada pāṭha: indo iti | indrāya | br̥hate | pavasva | su-mr̥ḷīkaḥ | anavadyaḥ | riśādāḥ || bhara | candrāṇi | gr̥ṇate | vasūni | devaiḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | pra | avatam | naḥ ||9.69.10||

IAST: bharā candrāṇi gṛṇate vasūni devair dyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṁ naḥ
Griffith: Bring splendid treasures to the man who lauds thee. O Heaven and Earth, with all the Gods protect. us.
Devanāgarī: भरा चन्द्राणि गृणते वसूनि देवैर्द्यावापृथिवी प्रावतं नः
pada pāṭha: indo iti | indrāya | br̥hate | pavasva | su-mr̥ḷīkaḥ | anavadyaḥ | riśādāḥ || bhara | candrāṇi | gr̥ṇate | vasūni | devaiḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | pra | avatam | naḥ ||9.69.10||

IAST: trir asmai sapta dhenavo duduhre satyām āśiram pūrvye vyomani
Griffith: THE three times seven Milch-kine in the eastern heaven have for this Soma poured the genuine milky draugh
Devanāgarī: त्रिरस्मै सप्त धेनवो दुदुह्रे सत्यामाशिरं पूर्व्ये व्योमनि
pada pāṭha: triḥ | asmai | sapta | dhenavaḥ | duduhre | satyām | ā-śiram | pūrvye | vi-omani || catvāri | anyā | bhuvanāni | niḥ-nije | cārūṇi | cakre | yat | r̥taiḥ | avardhata ||9.70.1||

IAST: catvāry anyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yad ṛtair avardhata
Griffith: Four other beauteous Creatures hath he made for his adornment, when he waxed in strength through holy ri
Devanāgarī: चत्वार्यन्या भुवनानि निर्णिजे चारूणि चक्रे यदृतैरवर्धत
pada pāṭha: triḥ | asmai | sapta | dhenavaḥ | duduhre | satyām | ā-śiram | pūrvye | vi-omani || catvāri | anyā | bhuvanāni | niḥ-nije | cārūṇi | cakre | yat | r̥taiḥ | avardhata ||9.70.1||

IAST: sa bhikṣamāṇo amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe dyāvā kāvyenā vi śaśrathe
Griffith: Longing for lovely Amrta, by his wisdom he divided, each apart from other, earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: स भिक्षमाणो अमृतस्य चारुण उभे द्यावा काव्येना वि शश्रथे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bhikṣamāṇaḥ | amr̥tasya | cāruṇaḥ | ubhe iti | dyāvā | kāvyena | vi | śaśrathe || tejiṣṭhāḥ | apaḥ | maṁhanā | pari | vyata | yadi | devasya | śravasā | sadaḥ | viduḥ ||9.70.2||

IAST: tejiṣṭhā apo maṁhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sado viduḥ
Griffith: He gladly wrapped himself in the most lucid floods, when through their glory they found the God's resti
Devanāgarī: तेजिष्ठा अपो मंहना परि व्यत यदी देवस्य श्रवसा सदो विदुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bhikṣamāṇaḥ | amr̥tasya | cāruṇaḥ | ubhe iti | dyāvā | kāvyena | vi | śaśrathe || tejiṣṭhāḥ | apaḥ | maṁhanā | pari | vyata | yadi | devasya | śravasā | sadaḥ | viduḥ ||9.70.2||

IAST: te asya santu ketavo 'mṛtyavo 'dābhyāso januṣī ubhe anu
Griffith: May those his brilliant rays he ever free from death, inviolate, for both classes of created things,-
Devanāgarī: ते अस्य सन्तु केतवोऽमृत्यवोऽदाभ्यासो जनुषी उभे अनु
pada pāṭha: te | asya | santu | ketavaḥ | amr̥tyavaḥ | adābhyāsaḥ | januṣī iti | ubhe iti | anu || yebhiḥ | nr̥mṇā | ca | devyā | ca | punate | āt | it | rājānam | mananāḥ | agr̥bhṇata ||9.70.3||

IAST: yebhir nṛmṇā ca devyā ca punata ād id rājānam mananā agṛbhṇata
Griffith: Rays wherewith powers of men and Gods are purified. Yea, even for this have sageswelcomed him as King.
Devanāgarī: येभिर्नृम्णा च देव्या च पुनत आदिद्राजानं मनना अगृभ्णत
pada pāṭha: te | asya | santu | ketavaḥ | amr̥tyavaḥ | adābhyāsaḥ | januṣī iti | ubhe iti | anu || yebhiḥ | nr̥mṇā | ca | devyā | ca | punate | āt | it | rājānam | mananāḥ | agr̥bhṇata ||9.70.3||

IAST: sa mṛjyamāno daśabhiḥ sukarmabhiḥ pra madhyamāsu mātṛṣu prame sacā
Griffith: He, while he is adorned by the ten skilful ones, that he too in the Midmost Mothers may create,
Devanāgarī: स मृज्यमानो दशभिः सुकर्मभिः प्र मध्यमासु मातृषु प्रमे सचा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mr̥jyamānaḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | sukarma-bhiḥ | pra | madhyamāsu | mātr̥ṣu | pra-me | sacā || vratāni | pānaḥ | amr̥tasya | cāruṇaḥ | ubhe iti | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | anu | paśyate | viśau ||9.70.4||

IAST: vratāni pāno amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe nṛcakṣā anu paśyate viśau
Griffith: While he is watching o'er the lovely Amrta's ways, looks on both races as Beholder of mankind.
Devanāgarī: व्रतानि पानो अमृतस्य चारुण उभे नृचक्षा अनु पश्यते विशौ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mr̥jyamānaḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | sukarma-bhiḥ | pra | madhyamāsu | mātr̥ṣu | pra-me | sacā || vratāni | pānaḥ | amr̥tasya | cāruṇaḥ | ubhe iti | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | anu | paśyate | viśau ||9.70.4||

IAST: sa marmṛjāna indriyāya dhāyasa obhe antā rodasī harṣate hitaḥ
Griffith: He, while he is adorned to stream forth mighty strength, rejoices in his place between the earth and heave
Devanāgarī: स मर्मृजान इन्द्रियाय धायस ओभे अन्ता रोदसी हर्षते हितः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | marmr̥jānaḥ | indriyāya | dhāyase | ā | ubhe iti | antariti | rodasī iti | harṣate | hitaḥ || vr̥ṣā | śuṣmeṇa | bādhate | vi | duḥ-matīḥ | ādediśānaḥ | śaryahā-iva | śurudhaḥ ||9.70.5||

IAST: vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa bādhate vi durmatīr ādediśānaḥ śaryaheva śurudhaḥ
Griffith: The Steer dispels the evil-hearted with his might, aiming at offerings as an archer at the game.
Devanāgarī: वृषा शुष्मेण बाधते वि दुर्मतीरादेदिशानः शर्यहेव शुरुधः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | marmr̥jānaḥ | indriyāya | dhāyase | ā | ubhe iti | antariti | rodasī iti | harṣate | hitaḥ || vr̥ṣā | śuṣmeṇa | bādhate | vi | duḥ-matīḥ | ādediśānaḥ | śaryahā-iva | śurudhaḥ ||9.70.5||

IAST: sa mātarā na dadṛśāna usriyo nānadad eti marutām iva svanaḥ
Griffith: Beholding, as it were, Two Mother Cows, the Steer goes roaring on his way even as the Maruts roar.
Devanāgarī: स मातरा न ददृशान उस्रियो नानददेति मरुतामिव स्वनः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mātarā | na | dadr̥śānaḥ | usriyaḥ | nānadat | eti | marutām-iva | svanaḥ || jānan | r̥tam | prathamam | yat | svaḥ-naram | pra-śastaye | kam | avr̥ṇīta | su-kratuḥ ||9.70.6||

IAST: jānann ṛtam prathamaṁ yat svarṇaram praśastaye kam avṛṇīta sukratuḥ
Griffith: Knowing Eternal Law, the earliest light of heaven, he, passing wise, was chosen out to tell it forth.
Devanāgarī: जानन्नृतं प्रथमं यत्स्वर्णरं प्रशस्तये कमवृणीत सुक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mātarā | na | dadr̥śānaḥ | usriyaḥ | nānadat | eti | marutām-iva | svanaḥ || jānan | r̥tam | prathamam | yat | svaḥ-naram | pra-śastaye | kam | avr̥ṇīta | su-kratuḥ ||9.70.6||

IAST: ruvati bhīmo vṛṣabhas taviṣyayā śṛṅge śiśāno hariṇī vicakṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: The fearful Bull is bellowing with violent might, far-sighted, sharpening his yellowcoloured horns.
Devanāgarī: रुवति भीमो वृषभस्तविष्यया शृङ्गे शिशानो हरिणी विचक्षणः
pada pāṭha: ruvati | bhīmaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | taviṣyayā | śr̥ṅge iti | śiśānaḥ | hariṇī iti | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ || ā | yonim | somaḥ | su-kr̥tam | ni | sīdati | gavyayī | tvak | bhavati | niḥ-nik | avyayī ||9.70.7||

IAST: ā yoniṁ somaḥ sukṛtaṁ ni ṣīdati gavyayī tvag bhavati nirṇig avyayī
Griffith: Soma assumes his seat in the well-fashioned place: the cowhide and the sheepskin are his ornament.
Devanāgarī: आ योनिं सोमः सुकृतं नि षीदति गव्ययी त्वग्भवति निर्णिगव्ययी
pada pāṭha: ruvati | bhīmaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | taviṣyayā | śr̥ṅge iti | śiśānaḥ | hariṇī iti | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ || ā | yonim | somaḥ | su-kr̥tam | ni | sīdati | gavyayī | tvak | bhavati | niḥ-nik | avyayī ||9.70.7||

IAST: śuciḥ punānas tanvam arepasam avye harir ny adhāviṣṭa sānavi
Griffith: Bright, making pure his body free from spot and stain, on the sheep's back the Golden-coloured hath flowed
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | punānaḥ | tanvam | arepasam | avye | hariḥ | ni | adhāviṣṭa | sānavi || juṣṭaḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | vāyave | tri-dhātu | madhu | kriyate | sukarma-bhiḥ ||9.70.8||

IAST: juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave tridhātu madhu kriyate sukarmabhiḥ
Griffith: Acceptable to Mitra, Vayu, Varuna, he is prepared as threefold meal by skilful men.
Devanāgarī: जुष्टो मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे त्रिधातु मधु क्रियते सुकर्मभिः
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | punānaḥ | tanvam | arepasam | avye | hariḥ | ni | adhāviṣṭa | sānavi || juṣṭaḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | vāyave | tri-dhātu | madhu | kriyate | sukarma-bhiḥ ||9.70.8||

IAST: pavasva soma devavītaye vṛṣendrasya hārdi somadhānam ā viśa
Griffith: Flow on for the God's banquet, Soma, as a Steer, and enter Indra's heart, the Soma's reservoir.
Devanāgarī: पवस्व सोम देववीतये वृषेन्द्रस्य हार्दि सोमधानमा विश
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | deva-vītaye | vr̥ṣā | indrasya | hārdi | soma-dhānam | ā | viśa || purā | naḥ | bādhāt | duḥ-itā | ati | pāraya | kṣetra-vit | hi | diśaḥ | āha | vi-pr̥cchate ||9.70.9||

IAST: purā no bādhād duritāti pāraya kṣetravid dhi diśa āhā vipṛcchate
Griffith: Bear us beyond misfortune ere we be oppres. sed. the man who knows the land directs the man who asks.
Devanāgarī: पुरा नो बाधाद्दुरिताति पारय क्षेत्रविद्धि दिश आहा विपृच्छते
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | deva-vītaye | vr̥ṣā | indrasya | hārdi | soma-dhānam | ā | viśa || purā | naḥ | bādhāt | duḥ-itā | ati | pāraya | kṣetra-vit | hi | diśaḥ | āha | vi-pr̥cchate ||9.70.9||

IAST: hito na saptir abhi vājam arṣendrasyendo jaṭharam ā pavasva
Griffith: Urged like a car-steed flow to strength, O Soma: Indu, flow onward to the throat of Indra.
Devanāgarī: हितो न सप्तिरभि वाजमर्षेन्द्रस्येन्दो जठरमा पवस्व
pada pāṭha: hitaḥ | na | saptiḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa | indrasya | indo iti | jaṭharam | ā | pavasva || nāvā | na | sindhum | ati | parṣi | vidvān | śūraḥ | na | yudhyan | ava | naḥ | nidaḥ | spariti spaḥ ||9.70.10||

IAST: nāvā na sindhum ati parṣi vidvāñ chūro na yudhyann ava no nidaḥ spaḥ
Griffith: Skilled, bear us past, as in a boat o'er water: as battling Hero save us from the foeman.
Devanāgarī: नावा न सिन्धुमति पर्षि विद्वाञ्छूरो न युध्यन्नव नो निदः स्पः
pada pāṭha: hitaḥ | na | saptiḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa | indrasya | indo iti | jaṭharam | ā | pavasva || nāvā | na | sindhum | ati | parṣi | vidvān | śūraḥ | na | yudhyan | ava | naḥ | nidaḥ | spariti spaḥ ||9.70.10||

IAST: ā dakṣiṇā sṛjyate śuṣmy āsadaṁ veti druho rakṣasaḥ pāti jāgṛviḥ
Griffith: THE guerdon is bestowed: the Mighty takes his Seat, and, ever-Watchful, guards from fiend and evil sprite
Devanāgarī: आ दक्षिणा सृज्यते शुष्म्यासदं वेति द्रुहो रक्षसः पाति जागृविः
pada pāṭha: ā | dakṣiṇā | sr̥jyate | śuṣmī | ā-sadam | veti | druhaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | pāti | jāgr̥viḥ || hariḥ | opaśam | kr̥ṇute | nabhaḥ | payaḥ | upa-stire | camvoḥ | brahma | niḥ-nije ||9.71.1||

IAST: harir opaśaṁ kṛṇute nabhas paya upastire camvor brahma nirṇije
Griffith: Gold-hued, he makes the cloud his diadem, the milk his carpet in both worlds, and prayer his robe of sta
Devanāgarī: हरिरोपशं कृणुते नभस्पय उपस्तिरे चम्वोर्ब्रह्म निर्णिजे
pada pāṭha: ā | dakṣiṇā | sr̥jyate | śuṣmī | ā-sadam | veti | druhaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | pāti | jāgr̥viḥ || hariḥ | opaśam | kr̥ṇute | nabhaḥ | payaḥ | upa-stire | camvoḥ | brahma | niḥ-nije ||9.71.1||

IAST: pra kṛṣṭiheva śūṣa eti roruvad asuryaṁ varṇaṁ ni riṇīte asya tam
Griffith: Strong, bellowing, he goes, like one who slays the folk; he lets this hue of Asuras flow off from him,
Devanāgarī: प्र कृष्टिहेव शूष एति रोरुवदसुर्यं वर्णं नि रिणीते अस्य तम्
pada pāṭha: pra | kr̥ṣṭihā-iva | śūṣaḥ | eti | roruvat | asuryam | varṇam | ni | riṇīte | asya | tam || jahāti | vavrim | pituḥ | eti | niḥ-kr̥tam | upa-prutam | kr̥ṇute | niḥ-nijam | tanā ||9.71.2||

IAST: jahāti vavrim pitur eti niṣkṛtam upaprutaṁ kṛṇute nirṇijaṁ tanā
Griffith: Throws off his covering, seeks his father's meeting-place, and thus makes for himself the bright robe he
Devanāgarī: जहाति वव्रिं पितुरेति निष्कृतमुपप्रुतं कृणुते निर्णिजं तना
pada pāṭha: pra | kr̥ṣṭihā-iva | śūṣaḥ | eti | roruvat | asuryam | varṇam | ni | riṇīte | asya | tam || jahāti | vavrim | pituḥ | eti | niḥ-kr̥tam | upa-prutam | kr̥ṇute | niḥ-nijam | tanā ||9.71.2||

IAST: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavate gabhastyor vṛṣāyate nabhasā vepate matī
Griffith: Onward he flows, from both the hands, pressed out with stones: excited by the prayer, the water makes him
Devanāgarī: अद्रिभिः सुतः पवते गभस्त्योर्वृषायते नभसा वेपते मती
pada pāṭha: adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | pavate | gabhastyoḥ | vr̥ṣa-yate | nabhasā | vepate | matī || saḥ | modate | nasate | sādhate | girā | nenikte | ap-su | yajate | parīmaṇi ||9.71.3||

IAST: sa modate nasate sādhate girā nenikte apsu yajate parīmaṇi
Griffith: He frolics and draws near, completes his work with song, and bathes in streams to satisfy the worshippe
Devanāgarī: स मोदते नसते साधते गिरा नेनिक्ते अप्सु यजते परीमणि
pada pāṭha: adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | pavate | gabhastyoḥ | vr̥ṣa-yate | nabhasā | vepate | matī || saḥ | modate | nasate | sādhate | girā | nenikte | ap-su | yajate | parīmaṇi ||9.71.3||

IAST: pari dyukṣaṁ sahasaḥ parvatāvṛdham madhvaḥ siñcanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim
Griffith: They pour out meath around the Master of the house, Celestial Strengthener of the mountain that gives mig
Devanāgarī: परि द्युक्षं सहसः पर्वतावृधं मध्वः सिञ्चन्ति हर्म्यस्य सक्षणिम्
pada pāṭha: pari | dyukṣam | sahasaḥ | parvata-vr̥dham | madhvaḥ | siñcanti | harmyasya | sakṣaṇim || ā | yasmin | gāvaḥ | suhuta-adaḥ | ūdhani | mūrdhan | śrīṇanti | agriyam | varīma-bhiḥ ||9.71.4||

IAST: ā yasmin gāvaḥ suhutāda ūdhani mūrdhañ chrīṇanty agriyaṁ varīmabhiḥ
Griffith: In whom, through his great powers, oblation-eating cows in their uplifted udder mix their choicest milk
Devanāgarī: आ यस्मिन्गावः सुहुताद ऊधनि मूर्धञ्छ्रीणन्त्यग्रियं वरीमभिः
pada pāṭha: pari | dyukṣam | sahasaḥ | parvata-vr̥dham | madhvaḥ | siñcanti | harmyasya | sakṣaṇim || ā | yasmin | gāvaḥ | suhuta-adaḥ | ūdhani | mūrdhan | śrīṇanti | agriyam | varīma-bhiḥ ||9.71.4||

IAST: sam ī rathaṁ na bhurijor aheṣata daśa svasāro aditer upastha ā
Griffith: They, the ten sisters, on the lap of Aditi, have sent him forward like a car from both the arms.
Devanāgarī: समी रथं न भुरिजोरहेषत दश स्वसारो अदितेरुपस्थ आ
pada pāṭha: sam | īmiti | ratham | na | bhurijoḥ | aheṣata | daśa | svasāraḥ | aditeḥ | upa-sthe | ā || jigāt | upa | jrayati | goḥ | apīcyam | padam | yat | asya | matuthāḥ | ajījanan ||9.71.5||

IAST: jigād upa jrayati gor apīcyam padaṁ yad asya matuthā ajījanan
Griffith: He wanders and comes near the Cow's mysterious place, even the place which his inventions have produced
Devanāgarī: जिगादुप ज्रयति गोरपीच्यं पदं यदस्य मतुथा अजीजनन्
pada pāṭha: sam | īmiti | ratham | na | bhurijoḥ | aheṣata | daśa | svasāraḥ | aditeḥ | upa-sthe | ā || jigāt | upa | jrayati | goḥ | apīcyam | padam | yat | asya | matuthāḥ | ajījanan ||9.71.5||

IAST: śyeno na yoniṁ sadanaṁ dhiyā kṛtaṁ hiraṇyayam āsadaṁ deva eṣati
Griffith: Like as a falcon to his home, so speeds the God to his own golden wisely-tashioned place to rest.
Devanāgarī: श्येनो न योनिं सदनं धिया कृतं हिरण्ययमासदं देव एषति
pada pāṭha: śyenaḥ | na | yonim | sadanam | dhiyā | kr̥tam | hiraṇyayam | ā-sadam | devaḥ | ā | īṣati || ā | īmiti | riṇanti | barhiṣi | priyam | girā | aśvaḥ | na | devān | api | eti | yajñiyaḥ ||9.71.6||

IAST: e riṇanti barhiṣi priyaṁ girāśvo na devām̐ apy eti yajñiyaḥ
Griffith: With song they urge the darling to the sacred grass: the Holy One goes like a courser to the Gods.
Devanāgarī: ए रिणन्ति बर्हिषि प्रियं गिराश्वो न देवाँ अप्येति यज्ञियः
pada pāṭha: śyenaḥ | na | yonim | sadanam | dhiyā | kr̥tam | hiraṇyayam | ā-sadam | devaḥ | ā | īṣati || ā | īmiti | riṇanti | barhiṣi | priyam | girā | aśvaḥ | na | devān | api | eti | yajñiyaḥ ||9.71.6||

IAST: parā vyakto aruṣo divaḥ kavir vṛṣā tripṛṣṭho anaviṣṭa gā abhi
Griffith: From far away, from heaven, the redhued noted Sage, Steer of the triple height, hath sung unto the kine.
Devanāgarī: परा व्यक्तो अरुषो दिवः कविर्वृषा त्रिपृष्ठो अनविष्ट गा अभि
pada pāṭha: parā | vi-aktaḥ | aruṣaḥ | divaḥ | kaviḥ | vr̥ṣā | tri-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | anaviṣṭa | gāḥ | abhi || sahasra-nītiḥ | yatiḥ | parā-yatiḥ | rebhaḥ | na | pūrvīḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi | rājati ||9.71.7||

IAST: sahasraṇītir yatiḥ parāyatī rebho na pūrvīr uṣaso vi rājati
Griffith: With thousand guidings he, leading this way and that, shines, as a singer, splendidly through many a mo
Devanāgarī: सहस्रणीतिर्यतिः परायती रेभो न पूर्वीरुषसो वि राजति
pada pāṭha: parā | vi-aktaḥ | aruṣaḥ | divaḥ | kaviḥ | vr̥ṣā | tri-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | anaviṣṭa | gāḥ | abhi || sahasra-nītiḥ | yatiḥ | parā-yatiḥ | rebhaḥ | na | pūrvīḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi | rājati ||9.71.7||

IAST: tveṣaṁ rūpaṁ kṛṇute varṇo asya sa yatrāśayat samṛtā sedhati sridhaḥ
Griffith: His covering assumes a radiant hue; where'er he comes into the fight he drives the foe afar.
Devanāgarī: त्वेषं रूपं कृणुते वर्णो अस्य स यत्राशयत्समृता सेधति स्रिधः
pada pāṭha: tveṣam | rūpam | kr̥ṇute | varṇaḥ | asya | saḥ | yatra | aśayat | sam-r̥tā | sedhati | sridhaḥ || apsāḥ | yāti | svadhayā | daivyam | janam | sam | su-stutī | nasate | sam | go-agrayā ||9.71.8||

IAST: apsā yāti svadhayā daivyaṁ janaṁ saṁ suṣṭutī nasate saṁ goagrayā
Griffith: The Winner of the Floods, with food he seeks the host of heaven, he comes to praises glorified with mil
Devanāgarī: अप्सा याति स्वधया दैव्यं जनं सं सुष्टुती नसते सं गोअग्रया
pada pāṭha: tveṣam | rūpam | kr̥ṇute | varṇaḥ | asya | saḥ | yatra | aśayat | sam-r̥tā | sedhati | sridhaḥ || apsāḥ | yāti | svadhayā | daivyam | janam | sam | su-stutī | nasate | sam | go-agrayā ||9.71.8||

IAST: ukṣeva yūthā pariyann arāvīd adhi tviṣīr adhita sūryasya
Griffith: Like a bull roaming round the herds he bellows: he hath assumed the brilliancy of Surya.
pada pāṭha: ukṣā-iva | yūthā | pari-yan | arāvīt | adhi | tviṣīḥ | adhita | sūryasya || divyaḥ | su-parṇaḥ | ava | cakṣata | kṣām | somaḥ | pari | kratunā | paśyate | jāḥ ||9.71.9||

IAST: divyaḥ suparṇo 'va cakṣata kṣāṁ somaḥ pari kratunā paśyate jāḥ
Griffith: Down to the earth hath looked the heavenly Falcon: Soma with wisdom views all living creatures.
Devanāgarī: दिव्यः सुपर्णोऽव चक्षत क्षां सोमः परि क्रतुना पश्यते जाः
pada pāṭha: ukṣā-iva | yūthā | pari-yan | arāvīt | adhi | tviṣīḥ | adhita | sūryasya || divyaḥ | su-parṇaḥ | ava | cakṣata | kṣām | somaḥ | pari | kratunā | paśyate | jāḥ ||9.71.9||

IAST: harim mṛjanty aruṣo na yujyate saṁ dhenubhiḥ kalaśe somo ajyate
Griffith: THEY cleanse the Gold-hued: like a red Steed is he yoked, and Soma in the jar is mingled with the milk.
Devanāgarī: हरिं मृजन्त्यरुषो न युज्यते सं धेनुभिः कलशे सोमो अज्यते
pada pāṭha: harim | mr̥janti | aruṣaḥ | na | yujyate | sam | dhenu-bhiḥ | kalaśe | somaḥ | ajyate || ut | vācam | īrayati | hinvate | matī | puru-stutasya | kati | cit | pari-priyaḥ ||9.72.1||

IAST: ud vācam īrayati hinvate matī puruṣṭutasya kati cit paripriyaḥ
Griffith: He sendeth out his voice, and many loving friends of him the highly lauded hasten with their songs.
Devanāgarī: उद्वाचमीरयति हिन्वते मती पुरुष्टुतस्य कति चित्परिप्रियः
pada pāṭha: harim | mr̥janti | aruṣaḥ | na | yujyate | sam | dhenu-bhiḥ | kalaśe | somaḥ | ajyate || ut | vācam | īrayati | hinvate | matī | puru-stutasya | kati | cit | pari-priyaḥ ||9.72.1||

IAST: sākaṁ vadanti bahavo manīṣiṇa indrasya somaṁ jaṭhare yad āduhuḥ
Griffith: The many sages utter words in unison, while into Indra's throat they pour the Soma juice,
Devanāgarī: साकं वदन्ति बहवो मनीषिण इन्द्रस्य सोमं जठरे यदादुहुः
pada pāṭha: sākam | vadanti | bahavaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | indrasya | somam | jaṭhare | yat | ā-duhuḥ || yadi | mr̥janti | su-gabhastayaḥ | naraḥ | sa-nīḷābhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | kāmyam | madhu ||9.72.2||

IAST: yadī mṛjanti sugabhastayo naraḥ sanīḻābhir daśabhiḥ kāmyam madhu
Griffith: When, with the ten that dwell together closely joined, the men whose hands are skilful cleanse the lovel
Devanāgarī: यदी मृजन्ति सुगभस्तयो नरः सनीळाभिर्दशभिः काम्यं मधु
pada pāṭha: sākam | vadanti | bahavaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | indrasya | somam | jaṭhare | yat | ā-duhuḥ || yadi | mr̥janti | su-gabhastayaḥ | naraḥ | sa-nīḷābhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | kāmyam | madhu ||9.72.2||

IAST: aramamāṇo aty eti gā abhi sūryasya priyaṁ duhitus tiro ravam
Griffith: He goes upon his way, unresting, to the cows, over the roaring sound which Sarya's Daughter loves.
Devanāgarī: अरममाणो अत्येति गा अभि सूर्यस्य प्रियं दुहितुस्तिरो रवम्
pada pāṭha: aramamāṇaḥ | ati | eti | gāḥ | abhi | sūryasya | priyam | duhituḥ | tiraḥ | ravam || anu | asmai | joṣam | abharat | vinam-gr̥saḥ | sam | dvayībhiḥ | svasr̥-bhiḥ | kṣeti | jāmi-bhiḥ ||9.72.3||

IAST: anv asmai joṣam abharad vinaṁgṛsaḥ saṁ dvayībhiḥ svasṛbhiḥ kṣeti jāmibhiḥ
Griffith: The Falcon brought it to him for his own delight: now with the twofold kindred sisters is his home.
Devanāgarī: अन्वस्मै जोषमभरद्विनंगृसः सं द्वयीभिः स्वसृभिः क्षेति जामिभिः
pada pāṭha: aramamāṇaḥ | ati | eti | gāḥ | abhi | sūryasya | priyam | duhituḥ | tiraḥ | ravam || anu | asmai | joṣam | abharat | vinam-gr̥saḥ | sam | dvayībhiḥ | svasr̥-bhiḥ | kṣeti | jāmi-bhiḥ ||9.72.3||

IAST: nṛdhūto adriṣuto barhiṣi priyaḥ patir gavām pradiva indur ṛtviyaḥ
Griffith: Washed by the men, stone-pressed, dear on the holy grass, faithful to seasons, Lord of cattle from of old
Devanāgarī: नृधूतो अद्रिषुतो बर्हिषि प्रियः पतिर्गवां प्रदिव इन्दुरृत्वियः
pada pāṭha: nr̥-dhūtaḥ | adri-sutaḥ | barhiṣi | priyaḥ | patiḥ | gavām | pra-divaḥ | induḥ | r̥tviyaḥ || purandhi-vān | manuṣaḥ | yajña-sādhanaḥ | śuciḥ | dhiyā | pavate | somaḥ | indra | te ||9.72.4||

IAST: puraṁdhivān manuṣo yajñasādhanaḥ śucir dhiyā pavate soma indra te
Griffith: Most liberal, completing sacrifice for men, O Indra, pure bright Soma, Indu, flows for thee.
Devanāgarī: पुरंधिवान्मनुषो यज्ञसाधनः शुचिर्धिया पवते सोम इन्द्र ते
pada pāṭha: nr̥-dhūtaḥ | adri-sutaḥ | barhiṣi | priyaḥ | patiḥ | gavām | pra-divaḥ | induḥ | r̥tviyaḥ || purandhi-vān | manuṣaḥ | yajña-sādhanaḥ | śuciḥ | dhiyā | pavate | somaḥ | indra | te ||9.72.4||

IAST: nṛbāhubhyāṁ codito dhārayā suto 'nuṣvadham pavate soma indra te
Griffith: O Indra, urged by arms of men and poured in streams, Soma flows on for thee after.his Godlike kind.
Devanāgarī: नृबाहुभ्यां चोदितो धारया सुतोऽनुष्वधं पवते सोम इन्द्र ते
pada pāṭha: nr̥bāhu-bhyām | coditaḥ | dhārayā | sutaḥ | anu-svadham | pavate | somaḥ | indra | te || ā | aprāḥ | kratūn | sam | ajaiḥ | adhvare | matīḥ | veḥ | na | dru-sat | camvoḥ | ā | asadat | hariḥ ||9.72.5||

IAST: āprāḥ kratūn sam ajair adhvare matīr ver na druṣac camvor āsadad dhariḥ
Griffith: Plans thou fulfillest, gatherest thoughts for sacrifice: in the bowls sits the Gold-hued like a roosting
pada pāṭha: nr̥bāhu-bhyām | coditaḥ | dhārayā | sutaḥ | anu-svadham | pavate | somaḥ | indra | te || ā | aprāḥ | kratūn | sam | ajaiḥ | adhvare | matīḥ | veḥ | na | dru-sat | camvoḥ | ā | asadat | hariḥ ||9.72.5||

IAST: aṁśuṁ duhanti stanayantam akṣitaṁ kaviṁ kavayo 'paso manīṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: Sages well-skilled in work, intelligent, drain out the stalk that roars, the Sage, the Everlasting One.
Devanāgarī: अंशुं दुहन्ति स्तनयन्तमक्षितं कविं कवयोऽपसो मनीषिणः
pada pāṭha: aṁśum | duhanti | stanayantam | akṣitam | kavim | kavayaḥ | apasaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ || sam | īmiti | gāvaḥ | matayaḥ | yanti | sam-yataḥ | r̥tasya | yonā | sadane | punaḥ-bhuvaḥ ||9.72.6||

IAST: sam ī gāvo matayo yanti saṁyata ṛtasya yonā sadane punarbhuvaḥ
Griffith: The milk, the hymns unite them with him in the place of sacrifice, his seat who is produced anew.
Devanāgarī: समी गावो मतयो यन्ति संयत ऋतस्य योना सदने पुनर्भुवः
pada pāṭha: aṁśum | duhanti | stanayantam | akṣitam | kavim | kavayaḥ | apasaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ || sam | īmiti | gāvaḥ | matayaḥ | yanti | sam-yataḥ | r̥tasya | yonā | sadane | punaḥ-bhuvaḥ ||9.72.6||

IAST: nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divo 'pām ūrmau sindhuṣv antar ukṣitaḥ
Griffith: Earth's central point, sustainer of the mighty heavens, distilled into the streams, into the waters' wave
Devanāgarī: नाभा पृथिव्या धरुणो महो दिवोऽपामूर्मौ सिन्धुष्वन्तरुक्षितः
pada pāṭha: nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | dharuṇaḥ | mahaḥ | divaḥ | apām | ūrmau | sindhuṣu | antaḥ | ukṣitaḥ || indrasya | vajraḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vibhu-vasuḥ | somaḥ | hr̥de | pavate | cāru | matsaraḥ ||9.72.7||

IAST: indrasya vajro vṛṣabho vibhūvasuḥ somo hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ
Griffith: As Indra's thunderbolt, Steer with farspreading wealth, Soma is flowing on to make the heart rejoice.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य वज्रो वृषभो विभूवसुः सोमो हृदे पवते चारु मत्सरः
pada pāṭha: nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | dharuṇaḥ | mahaḥ | divaḥ | apām | ūrmau | sindhuṣu | antaḥ | ukṣitaḥ || indrasya | vajraḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vibhu-vasuḥ | somaḥ | hr̥de | pavate | cāru | matsaraḥ ||9.72.7||

IAST: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṁ rajaḥ stotre śikṣann ādhūnvate ca sukrato
Griffith: Over the earthly region flow thou on thy way, helping the praiser and the pourer, thou Most Wise.
Devanāgarī: स तू पवस्व परि पार्थिवं रजः स्तोत्रे शिक्षन्नाधून्वते च सुक्रतो
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | pavasva | pari | pārthivam | rajaḥ | stotre | śikṣan | ā-dhūnvate | ca | sukrato iti su-krato || mā | naḥ | niḥ | bhāk | vasunaḥ | sadana-spr̥śaḥ | rayim | piśaṅgam | bahulam | vasīmahi ||9.72.8||

IAST: mā no nir bhāg vasunaḥ sādanaspṛśo rayim piśaṅgam bahulaṁ vasīmahi
Griffith: Let us not lack rich treasure reaching to our home, and may we clothe ourselves in manifold bright weal
Devanāgarī: मा नो निर्भाग्वसुनः सादनस्पृशो रयिं पिशङ्गं बहुलं वसीमहि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | pavasva | pari | pārthivam | rajaḥ | stotre | śikṣan | ā-dhūnvate | ca | sukrato iti su-krato || mā | naḥ | niḥ | bhāk | vasunaḥ | sadana-spr̥śaḥ | rayim | piśaṅgam | bahulam | vasīmahi ||9.72.8||

IAST: ā tū na indo śatadātv aśvyaṁ sahasradātu paśumad dhiraṇyavat
Griffith: Hither, O Indu, unto us a hundred gifts of steeds, a thousand gifts of cattle and of gold,
Devanāgarī: आ तू न इन्दो शतदात्वश्व्यं सहस्रदातु पशुमद्धिरण्यवत्
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | naḥ | indo iti | śata-dātu | aśvyam | sahasra-dātu | paśu-mat | hiraṇya-vat || upa | māsva | br̥hatīḥ | revatīḥ | iṣaḥ | adhi | stotrasya | pavamāna | naḥ | gahi ||9.72.9||

IAST: upa māsva bṛhatī revatīr iṣo 'dhi stotrasya pavamāna no gahi
Griffith: Measure thou forth, yea, splendid ample strengthening food do thou, O Pavamana, heed this laud of ours.
Devanāgarī: उप मास्व बृहती रेवतीरिषोऽधि स्तोत्रस्य पवमान नो गहि
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | naḥ | indo iti | śata-dātu | aśvyam | sahasra-dātu | paśu-mat | hiraṇya-vat || upa | māsva | br̥hatīḥ | revatīḥ | iṣaḥ | adhi | stotrasya | pavamāna | naḥ | gahi ||9.72.9||

IAST: srakve drapsasya dhamataḥ sam asvarann ṛtasya yonā sam aranta nābhayaḥ
Griffith: THEY from the spouting drop have sounded at the rim: naves speed together to the place of sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: स्रक्वे द्रप्सस्य धमतः समस्वरन्नृतस्य योना समरन्त नाभयः
pada pāṭha: srakve | drapsasya | dhamataḥ | sam | asvaran | r̥tasya | yonā | sam | aranta | nābhayaḥ || trīn | saḥ | mūrdhnaḥ | asuraḥ | cakre | ā-rabhe | satyasya | nāvaḥ | su-kr̥tam | apīparan ||9.73.1||

IAST: trīn sa mūrdhno asuraś cakra ārabhe satyasya nāvaḥ sukṛtam apīparan
Griffith: That Asura hath formed, to seize, three lofty heights. The ships of truth have borne the pious man acros
Devanāgarī: त्रीन्स मूर्ध्नो असुरश्चक्र आरभे सत्यस्य नावः सुकृतमपीपरन्
pada pāṭha: srakve | drapsasya | dhamataḥ | sam | asvaran | r̥tasya | yonā | sam | aranta | nābhayaḥ || trīn | saḥ | mūrdhnaḥ | asuraḥ | cakre | ā-rabhe | satyasya | nāvaḥ | su-kr̥tam | apīparan ||9.73.1||

IAST: samyak samyañco mahiṣā aheṣata sindhor ūrmāv adhi venā avīvipan
Griffith: The strong Steers, gathering, have duly stirred themselves,and over the stream's wave the friends sent fo
Devanāgarī: सम्यक्सम्यञ्चो महिषा अहेषत सिन्धोरूर्मावधि वेना अवीविपन्
pada pāṭha: samyak | samyañcaḥ | mahiṣāḥ | aheṣata | sindhoḥ | ūrmau | adhi | venāḥ | avīvipan || madhoḥ | dhārābhiḥ | janayantaḥ | arkam | it | priyām | indrasya | tanvam | avīvr̥dhan ||9.73.2||

IAST: madhor dhārābhir janayanto arkam it priyām indrasya tanvam avīvṛdhan
Griffith: Engendering the hymn, with flowing streams of meath, Indra's dear body have they caused to wax in streng
pada pāṭha: samyak | samyañcaḥ | mahiṣāḥ | aheṣata | sindhoḥ | ūrmau | adhi | venāḥ | avīvipan || madhoḥ | dhārābhiḥ | janayantaḥ | arkam | it | priyām | indrasya | tanvam | avīvr̥dhan ||9.73.2||

IAST: pavitravantaḥ pari vācam āsate pitaiṣām pratno abhi rakṣati vratam
Griffith: With sanctifying gear they sit around the song: their ancient Father guards their holy work from harm.
Devanāgarī: पवित्रवन्तः परि वाचमासते पितैषां प्रत्नो अभि रक्षति व्रतम्
pada pāṭha: pavitra-vantaḥ | pari | vācam | āsate | pitā | eṣām | pratnaḥ | abhi | rakṣati | vratam || mahaḥ | samudram | varuṇaḥ | tiraḥ | dadhe | dhīrāḥ | it | śekuḥ | dharuṇeṣu | ā-rabham ||9.73.3||

IAST: mahaḥ samudraṁ varuṇas tiro dadhe dhīrā ic chekur dharuṇeṣv ārabham
Griffith: Varuna hath o'erspread the mighty sea of air. Sages had power to hold him in sustaining floods.
Devanāgarī: महः समुद्रं वरुणस्तिरो दधे धीरा इच्छेकुर्धरुणेष्वारभम्
pada pāṭha: pavitra-vantaḥ | pari | vācam | āsate | pitā | eṣām | pratnaḥ | abhi | rakṣati | vratam || mahaḥ | samudram | varuṇaḥ | tiraḥ | dadhe | dhīrāḥ | it | śekuḥ | dharuṇeṣu | ā-rabham ||9.73.3||

IAST: sahasradhāre 'va te sam asvaran divo nāke madhujihvā asaścataḥ
Griffith: Sweet-tongued, exhaustless, they have sent their voices down togetlier, in heaven's vault that pours a tho
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारेऽव ते समस्वरन्दिवो नाके मधुजिह्वा असश्चतः
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāre | ava | te | sam | asvaran | divaḥ | nāke | madhu-jihvāḥ | asaścataḥ || asya | spaśaḥ | na | ni | miṣanti | bhūrṇayaḥ | pade-pade | pāśinaḥ | santi | setavaḥ ||9.73.4||

IAST: asya spaśo na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ pade-pade pāśinaḥ santi setavaḥ
Griffith: His wildly-restless warders never close an eye: in every place are found the bonds that bind man last.
Devanāgarī: अस्य स्पशो न नि मिषन्ति भूर्णयः पदेपदे पाशिनः सन्ति सेतवः
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāre | ava | te | sam | asvaran | divaḥ | nāke | madhu-jihvāḥ | asaścataḥ || asya | spaśaḥ | na | ni | miṣanti | bhūrṇayaḥ | pade-pade | pāśinaḥ | santi | setavaḥ ||9.73.4||

IAST: pitur mātur adhy ā ye samasvarann ṛcā śocantaḥ saṁdahanto avratān
Griffith: O'er Sire and Mother they have roared in unison bright with the verse of praise, burning up riteless men,
Devanāgarī: पितुर्मातुरध्या ये समस्वरन्नृचा शोचन्तः संदहन्तो अव्रतान्
pada pāṭha: pituḥ | mātuḥ | adhi | ā | ye | sam-asvaran | r̥cā | śocantaḥ | sam-dahantaḥ | avratān || indra-dviṣṭām | apa | dhamanti | māyayā | tvacam | asiknīm | bhūmanaḥ | divaḥ | pari ||9.73.5||

IAST: indradviṣṭām apa dhamanti māyayā tvacam asiknīm bhūmano divas pari
Griffith: Blowing away with supernatural might from earth and from the heavens the swarthy skin which Indra hates
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रद्विष्टामप धमन्ति मायया त्वचमसिक्नीं भूमनो दिवस्परि
pada pāṭha: pituḥ | mātuḥ | adhi | ā | ye | sam-asvaran | r̥cā | śocantaḥ | sam-dahantaḥ | avratān || indra-dviṣṭām | apa | dhamanti | māyayā | tvacam | asiknīm | bhūmanaḥ | divaḥ | pari ||9.73.5||

IAST: pratnān mānād adhy ā ye samasvarañ chlokayantrāso rabhasasya mantavaḥ
Griffith: Those which, as guides of song and counsellors of speed, were manifested from their ancient dwelling place
pada pāṭha: pratnāt | mānāt | adhi | ā | ye | sam-asvaran | śloka-yantrāsaḥ | rabhasasya | mantavaḥ || apa | anakṣāsaḥ | badhirāḥ | ahāsata | r̥tasya | panthām | na | taranti | duḥ-kr̥taḥ ||9.73.6||

IAST: apānakṣāso badhirā ahāsata ṛtasya panthāṁ na taranti duṣkṛtaḥ
Griffith: From these the eyeless and the deaf have turned aside: the wicked travel not the pathway of the Law.
Devanāgarī: अपानक्षासो बधिरा अहासत ऋतस्य पन्थां न तरन्ति दुष्कृतः
pada pāṭha: pratnāt | mānāt | adhi | ā | ye | sam-asvaran | śloka-yantrāsaḥ | rabhasasya | mantavaḥ || apa | anakṣāsaḥ | badhirāḥ | ahāsata | r̥tasya | panthām | na | taranti | duḥ-kr̥taḥ ||9.73.6||

IAST: sahasradhāre vitate pavitra ā vācam punanti kavayo manīṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: What time the filter with a thousand streams is stretched, the thoughtful sages purify their song therein
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारे वितते पवित्र आ वाचं पुनन्ति कवयो मनीषिणः
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāre | vi-tate | pavitre | ā | vācam | punanti | kavayaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ || rudrāsaḥ | eṣām | iṣirāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | spaśaḥ | su-añcaḥ | su-dr̥śaḥ | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ ||9.73.7||

IAST: rudrāsa eṣām iṣirāso adruhaḥ spaśaḥ svañcaḥ sudṛśo nṛcakṣasaḥ
Griffith: Bright-coloured are their spies, vigorous, void of guile, excellent, fair to see, beholders of mankind.
Devanāgarī: रुद्रास एषामिषिरासो अद्रुहः स्पशः स्वञ्चः सुदृशो नृचक्षसः
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāre | vi-tate | pavitre | ā | vācam | punanti | kavayaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ || rudrāsaḥ | eṣām | iṣirāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | spaśaḥ | su-añcaḥ | su-dr̥śaḥ | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ ||9.73.7||

IAST: ṛtasya gopā na dabhāya sukratus trī ṣa pavitrā hṛdy antar ā dadhe
Griffith: Guardian of Law, most wise, he may not be deceived: three Purifiers hath he set within his heart.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य गोपा न दभाय सुक्रतुस्त्री ष पवित्रा हृद्यन्तरा दधे
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | gopāḥ | na | dabhāya | su-kratuḥ | trī | saḥ | pavitrā | hr̥di | antaḥ | ā | dadhe || vidvān | saḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | paśyati | ava | ajuṣṭān | vidhyati | karte | avratān ||9.73.8||

IAST: vidvān sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paśyaty avājuṣṭān vidhyati karte avratān
Griffith: With wisdom he beholds all creatures that exist: he drives into the pit the hated riteliess ones.
Devanāgarī: विद्वान्स विश्वा भुवनाभि पश्यत्यवाजुष्टान्विध्यति कर्ते अव्रतान्
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | gopāḥ | na | dabhāya | su-kratuḥ | trī | saḥ | pavitrā | hr̥di | antaḥ | ā | dadhe || vidvān | saḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | paśyati | ava | ajuṣṭān | vidhyati | karte | avratān ||9.73.8||

IAST: ṛtasya tantur vitataḥ pavitra ā jihvāyā agre varuṇasya māyayā
Griffith: The thread of sacrifice spun in the cleansing sieve, on Varuna's tongue-tip, by supernatural might,-
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य तन्तुर्विततः पवित्र आ जिह्वाया अग्रे वरुणस्य मायया
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | tantuḥ | vi-tataḥ | pavitre | ā | jihvāyāḥ | agre | varuṇasya | māyayā || dhīrāḥ | cit | tat | sam-inakṣantaḥ | āśata | atra | kartam | ava | padāti | apra-bhuḥ ||9.73.9||

IAST: dhīrāś cit tat saminakṣanta āśatātrā kartam ava padāty aprabhuḥ
Griffith: This, by their striving, have the prudent ones attained: he who hath not this power shall sink into the
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | tantuḥ | vi-tataḥ | pavitre | ā | jihvāyāḥ | agre | varuṇasya | māyayā || dhīrāḥ | cit | tat | sam-inakṣantaḥ | āśata | atra | kartam | ava | padāti | apra-bhuḥ ||9.73.9||

IAST: śiśur na jāto 'va cakradad vane svar yad vājy aruṣaḥ siṣāsati
Griffith: BORN like a youngling he hath clamoured in the wood, when he, the Red, the Strong, would win the light of
pada pāṭha: śiśuḥ | na | jātaḥ | ava | cakradat | vane | svaḥ | yat | vājī | aruṣaḥ | sisāsati || divaḥ | retasā | sacate | payaḥ-vr̥dhā | tam | īmahe | su-matī | śarma | sa-prathaḥ ||9.74.1||

IAST: divo retasā sacate payovṛdhā tam īmahe sumatī śarma saprathaḥ
Griffith: He comes with heavenly seed that makes the water swell: him for wide-spreading shelter we implore with
Devanāgarī: दिवो रेतसा सचते पयोवृधा तमीमहे सुमती शर्म सप्रथः
pada pāṭha: śiśuḥ | na | jātaḥ | ava | cakradat | vane | svaḥ | yat | vājī | aruṣaḥ | sisāsati || divaḥ | retasā | sacate | payaḥ-vr̥dhā | tam | īmahe | su-matī | śarma | sa-prathaḥ ||9.74.1||

IAST: divo yaḥ skambho dharuṇaḥ svātata āpūrṇo aṁśuḥ paryeti viśvataḥ
Griffith: A far-extended pillar that supports the sky the Soma-stalk, filled full, moves itself every way.
Devanāgarī: दिवो यः स्कम्भो धरुणः स्वातत आपूर्णो अंशुः पर्येति विश्वतः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | yaḥ | skambhaḥ | dharuṇaḥ | su-ātataḥ | ā-pūrṇaḥ | aṁśuḥ | pari-eti | viśvataḥ || saḥ | ime iti | mahī iti | rodasī iti | yakṣat | ā-vr̥tā | samīcīne iti sam-īcīne | dāhāra | sam | iṣaḥ | kaviḥ ||9.74.2||

IAST: seme mahī rodasī yakṣad āvṛtā samīcīne dādhāra sam iṣaḥ kaviḥ
Griffith: He shall bring both these great worlds while the rite proceeds: the Sage holds these who move! together
Devanāgarī: सेमे मही रोदसी यक्षदावृता समीचीने दाधार समिषः कविः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | yaḥ | skambhaḥ | dharuṇaḥ | su-ātataḥ | ā-pūrṇaḥ | aṁśuḥ | pari-eti | viśvataḥ || saḥ | ime iti | mahī iti | rodasī iti | yakṣat | ā-vr̥tā | samīcīne iti sam-īcīne | dāhāra | sam | iṣaḥ | kaviḥ ||9.74.2||

IAST: mahi psaraḥ sukṛtaṁ somyam madhūrvī gavyūtir aditer ṛtaṁ yate
Griffith: Wide space hath he who follows Aditi's right path, and mighty, well-made food, meath blent with Soma juice
Devanāgarī: महि प्सरः सुकृतं सोम्यं मधूर्वी गव्यूतिरदितेरृतं यते
pada pāṭha: mahi | psaraḥ | su-kr̥tam | somyam | madhu | urvī | gavyūtiḥ | aditeḥ | r̥tam | yate || īśe | yaḥ | vr̥ṣṭeḥ | itaḥ | usriyaḥ | vr̥ṣā | apām | netā | yaḥ | itaḥ-ūtiḥ | r̥gmiyaḥ ||9.74.3||

IAST: īśe yo vṛṣṭer ita usriyo vṛṣāpāṁ netā ya itaūtir ṛgmiyaḥ
Griffith: He who from hence commands the rain, Steer of the kine, Leader of floods, who helps us hence, who claims
Devanāgarī: ईशे यो वृष्टेरित उस्रियो वृषापां नेता य इतऊतिरृग्मियः
pada pāṭha: mahi | psaraḥ | su-kr̥tam | somyam | madhu | urvī | gavyūtiḥ | aditeḥ | r̥tam | yate || īśe | yaḥ | vr̥ṣṭeḥ | itaḥ | usriyaḥ | vr̥ṣā | apām | netā | yaḥ | itaḥ-ūtiḥ | r̥gmiyaḥ ||9.74.3||

IAST: ātmanvan nabho duhyate ghṛtam paya ṛtasya nābhir amṛtaṁ vi jāyate
Griffith: Butter and milk are drawn from animated cloud; thence Amrta is produced, centre of sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: आत्मन्वन्नभो दुह्यते घृतं पय ऋतस्य नाभिरमृतं वि जायते
pada pāṭha: ātman-vat | nabhaḥ | duhyate | ghr̥tam | payaḥ | r̥tasya | nābhiḥ | amr̥tam | vi | jāyate || sam-īcīnāḥ | su-dānavaḥ | prīṇanti | tam | naraḥ | hitam | ava | mehanti | peravaḥ ||9.74.4||

IAST: samīcīnāḥ sudānavaḥ prīṇanti taṁ naro hitam ava mehanti peravaḥ
Griffith: Hini the Most Bounteous Ones, ever united, love; him as ouir Friend the Men who make all swell rain dow
Devanāgarī: समीचीनाः सुदानवः प्रीणन्ति तं नरो हितमव मेहन्ति पेरवः
pada pāṭha: ātman-vat | nabhaḥ | duhyate | ghr̥tam | payaḥ | r̥tasya | nābhiḥ | amr̥tam | vi | jāyate || sam-īcīnāḥ | su-dānavaḥ | prīṇanti | tam | naraḥ | hitam | ava | mehanti | peravaḥ ||9.74.4||

IAST: arāvīd aṁśuḥ sacamāna ūrmiṇā devāvyam manuṣe pinvati tvacam
Griffith: The Soma-stalk hath roared, following with the wave: he swells with sap for man the skin which Gods enjoy
Devanāgarī: अरावीदंशुः सचमान ऊर्मिणा देवाव्यं मनुषे पिन्वति त्वचम्
pada pāṭha: arāvīt | aṁśuḥ | sacamānaḥ | ūrmiṇā | deva-avyam | manuṣe | pinvati | tvacam || dadhāti | garbham | aditeḥ | upa-sthe | ā | yena | tokam | ca | tanayam | ca | dhāmahe ||9.74.5||

IAST: dadhāti garbham aditer upastha ā yena tokaṁ ca tanayaṁ ca dhāmahe
Griffith: Upon the lap of Aditi he lays the germ, by means whereof we gain children and progeny.
Devanāgarī: दधाति गर्भमदितेरुपस्थ आ येन तोकं च तनयं च धामहे
pada pāṭha: arāvīt | aṁśuḥ | sacamānaḥ | ūrmiṇā | deva-avyam | manuṣe | pinvati | tvacam || dadhāti | garbham | aditeḥ | upa-sthe | ā | yena | tokam | ca | tanayam | ca | dhāmahe ||9.74.5||

IAST: sahasradhāre 'va tā asaścatas tṛtīye santu rajasi prajāvatīḥ
Griffith: In the third region which distils a thousand streams, may the Exhaustless Ones descend with procreant powe
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारेऽव ता असश्चतस्तृतीये सन्तु रजसि प्रजावतीः
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāre | ava | tāḥ | asaścataḥ | tr̥tīye | santu | rajasi | prajā-vatīḥ || catasraḥ | nābhaḥ | ni-hitāḥ | avaḥ | divaḥ | haviḥ | bharanti | amr̥tam | ghr̥ta-ścutaḥ ||9.74.6||

IAST: catasro nābho nihitā avo divo havir bharanty amṛtaṁ ghṛtaścutaḥ
Griffith: The kindred Four have been sent downward from the heavens: dropping with oil they bring Amrta and sacred
Devanāgarī: चतस्रो नाभो निहिता अवो दिवो हविर्भरन्त्यमृतं घृतश्चुतः
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāre | ava | tāḥ | asaścataḥ | tr̥tīye | santu | rajasi | prajā-vatīḥ || catasraḥ | nābhaḥ | ni-hitāḥ | avaḥ | divaḥ | haviḥ | bharanti | amr̥tam | ghr̥ta-ścutaḥ ||9.74.6||

IAST: śvetaṁ rūpaṁ kṛṇute yat siṣāsati somo mīḍhvām̐ asuro veda bhūmanaḥ
Griffith: Soma assumes white colour when he strives to gain: the bounteous Asura knows full many a precious boon.
Devanāgarī: श्वेतं रूपं कृणुते यत्सिषासति सोमो मीढ्वाँ असुरो वेद भूमनः
pada pāṭha: śvetam | rūpam | kr̥ṇute | yat | sisāsati | somaḥ | mīḍhvān | asuraḥ | veda | bhūmanaḥ || dhiyā | śamī | sacate | saḥ | īm | abhi | pra-vat | divaḥ | kavandham | ava | darṣat | udriṇam ||9.74.7||

IAST: dhiyā śamī sacate sem abhi pravad divas kavandham ava darṣad udriṇam
Griffith: Down the steep slope, through song, he comes to sacrifice, and he will burst the water-holding cask of
Devanāgarī: धिया शमी सचते सेमभि प्रवद्दिवस्कवन्धमव दर्षदुद्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: śvetam | rūpam | kr̥ṇute | yat | sisāsati | somaḥ | mīḍhvān | asuraḥ | veda | bhūmanaḥ || dhiyā | śamī | sacate | saḥ | īm | abhi | pra-vat | divaḥ | kavandham | ava | darṣat | udriṇam ||9.74.7||

IAST: adha śvetaṁ kalaśaṁ gobhir aktaṁ kārṣmann ā vājy akramīt sasavān
Griffith: Yea, to the shining milk-anointed beaker, as to his goal, hath stepped the conquering Courser.
Devanāgarī: अध श्वेतं कलशं गोभिरक्तं कार्ष्मन्ना वाज्यक्रमीत्ससवान्
pada pāṭha: adha | śvetam | kalaśam | gobhiḥ | aktam | kārṣman | ā | vājī | akramīt | sasa-vān || ā | hinvire | manasā | deva-yantaḥ | kakṣīvate | śata-himāya | gonām ||9.74.8||

IAST: ā hinvire manasā devayantaḥ kakṣīvate śatahimāya gonām
Griffith: Pious-souled men have sent their giffi of cattle unto Kaksivan of the hundred winters.
Devanāgarī: आ हिन्विरे मनसा देवयन्तः कक्षीवते शतहिमाय गोनाम्
pada pāṭha: adha | śvetam | kalaśam | gobhiḥ | aktam | kārṣman | ā | vājī | akramīt | sasa-vān || ā | hinvire | manasā | deva-yantaḥ | kakṣīvate | śata-himāya | gonām ||9.74.8||

IAST: adbhiḥ soma papṛcānasya te raso 'vyo vāraṁ vi pavamāna dhāvati
Griffith: Soma, thy juice when thou art blended with the streams, flows, Pavamana, through the long wool of the shee
Devanāgarī: अद्भिः सोम पपृचानस्य ते रसोऽव्यो वारं वि पवमान धावति
pada pāṭha: at-bhiḥ | soma | papr̥cānasya | te | rasaḥ | avyaḥ | vāram | vi | pavamāna | dhāvati || saḥ | mr̥jyamānaḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | madin-tama | svadasva | indrāya | pavamāna | pītaye ||9.74.9||

IAST: sa mṛjyamānaḥ kavibhir madintama svadasvendrāya pavamāna pītaye
Griffith: So, cleansed by sages. O best giver of delight, grow sweet for Indra, Pavamana! for his drink.
Devanāgarī: स मृज्यमानः कविभिर्मदिन्तम स्वदस्वेन्द्राय पवमान पीतये
pada pāṭha: at-bhiḥ | soma | papr̥cānasya | te | rasaḥ | avyaḥ | vāram | vi | pavamāna | dhāvati || saḥ | mr̥jyamānaḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | madin-tama | svadasva | indrāya | pavamāna | pītaye ||9.74.9||

IAST: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohito nāmāni yahvo adhi yeṣu vardhate
Griffith: GRACIOUSLY-MINDED he is flowing on his way to win dear names o'er which the Youthful One grows great.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्रियाणि पवते चनोहितो नामानि यह्वो अधि येषु वर्धते
pada pāṭha: abhi | priyāṇi | pavate | canaḥ-hitaḥ | nāmāni | yahvaḥ | adhi | yeṣu | vardhate || ā | sūryasya | br̥hataḥ | br̥han | adhi | ratham | viṣvañcam | aruhat | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.75.1||

IAST: ā sūryasya bṛhato bṛhann adhi rathaṁ viṣvañcam aruhad vicakṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: The Mighty and Far-seeing One hath mounted now the mighty Surya's car which moves to every side.
Devanāgarī: आ सूर्यस्य बृहतो बृहन्नधि रथं विष्वञ्चमरुहद्विचक्षणः
pada pāṭha: abhi | priyāṇi | pavate | canaḥ-hitaḥ | nāmāni | yahvaḥ | adhi | yeṣu | vardhate || ā | sūryasya | br̥hataḥ | br̥han | adhi | ratham | viṣvañcam | aruhat | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.75.1||

IAST: ṛtasya jihvā pavate madhu priyaṁ vaktā patir dhiyo asyā adābhyaḥ
Griffith: The Speaker, unassailable Master of this hymn, the Tongue of sacrifice pours forth the pleasant meath.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य जिह्वा पवते मधु प्रियं वक्ता पतिर्धियो अस्या अदाभ्यः
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | jihvā | pavate | madhu | priyam | vaktā | patiḥ | dhiyaḥ | asyāḥ | adābhyaḥ || dadhāti | putraḥ | pitroḥ | apīcyam | nāma | tr̥tīyam | adhi | rocane | divaḥ ||9.75.2||

IAST: dadhāti putraḥ pitror apīcyaṁ nāma tṛtīyam adhi rocane divaḥ
Griffith: Within the lustrous region of the heavens the Son makes the third secret name of Mother and of Sire.
Devanāgarī: दधाति पुत्रः पित्रोरपीच्यं नाम तृतीयमधि रोचने दिवः
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | jihvā | pavate | madhu | priyam | vaktā | patiḥ | dhiyaḥ | asyāḥ | adābhyaḥ || dadhāti | putraḥ | pitroḥ | apīcyam | nāma | tr̥tīyam | adhi | rocane | divaḥ ||9.75.2||

IAST: ava dyutānaḥ kalaśām̐ acikradan nṛbhir yemānaḥ kośa ā hiraṇyaye
Griffith: Sending forth flashes he hath bellowed to the jars, led by the men into the golden reservoir.
Devanāgarī: अव द्युतानः कलशाँ अचिक्रदन्नृभिर्येमानः कोश आ हिरण्यये
pada pāṭha: ava | dyutānaḥ | kalaśān | acikradat | nr̥-bhiḥ | yemānaḥ | kośe | ā | hiraṇyaye || abhi | īm | r̥tasya | dohanāḥ | anūṣata | adhi | tri-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi | rājati ||9.75.3||

IAST: abhīm ṛtasya dohanā anūṣatādhi tripṛṣṭha uṣaso vi rājati
Griffith: The milky streams of sacrifice have sung to him: he of the triple height shines brightly through the mo
Devanāgarī: अभीमृतस्य दोहना अनूषताधि त्रिपृष्ठ उषसो वि राजति
pada pāṭha: ava | dyutānaḥ | kalaśān | acikradat | nr̥-bhiḥ | yemānaḥ | kośe | ā | hiraṇyaye || abhi | īm | r̥tasya | dohanāḥ | anūṣata | adhi | tri-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi | rājati ||9.75.3||

IAST: adribhiḥ suto matibhiś canohitaḥ prarocayan rodasī mātarā śuciḥ
Griffith: Pressed by the stones, with hymns, and graciously inclined, illuminating both the Parents, Heaven and Ear
Devanāgarī: अद्रिभिः सुतो मतिभिश्चनोहितः प्ररोचयन्रोदसी मातरा शुचिः
pada pāṭha: adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | canaḥ-hitaḥ | pra-rocayan | rodasī iti | mātarā | śuciḥ || romāṇi | avyā | samayā | vi | dhāvati | madhoḥ | dhārā | pinvamānā | dive-dive ||9.75.4||

IAST: romāṇy avyā samayā vi dhāvati madhor dhārā pinvamānā dive-dive
Griffith: He flows in ordered season onward through the flee, a current of sweet juice still swelling day by day.
Devanāgarī: रोमाण्यव्या समया वि धावति मधोर्धारा पिन्वमाना दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | canaḥ-hitaḥ | pra-rocayan | rodasī iti | mātarā | śuciḥ || romāṇi | avyā | samayā | vi | dhāvati | madhoḥ | dhārā | pinvamānā | dive-dive ||9.75.4||

IAST: pari soma pra dhanvā svastaye nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vāsayāśiram
Griffith: Flow onward, Soma, flow to bring prosperity: cleansed by the men, invest thee with the milky draught.
Devanāgarī: परि सोम प्र धन्वा स्वस्तये नृभिः पुनानो अभि वासयाशिरम्
pada pāṭha: pari | soma | pra | dhanva | svastaye | nr̥-bhiḥ | punānaḥ | abhi | vāsaya | ā-śiram || ye | te | madāḥ | āhanasaḥ | vi-hāyasaḥ | tebhiḥ | indram | codaya | dātave | magham ||9.75.5||

IAST: ye te madā āhanaso vihāyasas tebhir indraṁ codaya dātave magham
Griffith: What gladdening drinks thou hast, foaming, exceeding strong, even with these incite Indra to give us wea
Devanāgarī: ये ते मदा आहनसो विहायसस्तेभिरिन्द्रं चोदय दातवे मघम्
pada pāṭha: pari | soma | pra | dhanva | svastaye | nr̥-bhiḥ | punānaḥ | abhi | vāsaya | ā-śiram || ye | te | madāḥ | āhanasaḥ | vi-hāyasaḥ | tebhiḥ | indram | codaya | dātave | magham ||9.75.5||

IAST: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso dakṣo devānām anumādyo nṛbhiḥ
Griffith: ON flows the potent juice, sustainer of the heavens, the strength of Gods, whom men must hail with shouts
Devanāgarī: धर्ता दिवः पवते कृत्व्यो रसो दक्षो देवानामनुमाद्यो नृभिः
pada pāṭha: dhartā | divaḥ | pavate | kr̥tvyaḥ | rasaḥ | dakṣaḥ | devānām | anu-mādyaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ || hariḥ | sr̥jānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | satva-bhiḥ | vr̥thā | pājāṁsi | kr̥ṇute | nadīṣu | ā ||9.76.1||

IAST: hariḥ sṛjāno atyo na satvabhir vṛthā pājāṁsi kṛṇute nadīṣv ā
Griffith: The Gold-hued, started like a courser by brave men, impetuously winneth splendour in the streams.
Devanāgarī: हरिः सृजानो अत्यो न सत्वभिर्वृथा पाजांसि कृणुते नदीष्वा
pada pāṭha: dhartā | divaḥ | pavate | kr̥tvyaḥ | rasaḥ | dakṣaḥ | devānām | anu-mādyaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ || hariḥ | sr̥jānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | satva-bhiḥ | vr̥thā | pājāṁsi | kr̥ṇute | nadīṣu | ā ||9.76.1||

IAST: śūro na dhatta āyudhā gabhastyoḥ svaḥ siṣāsan rathiro gaviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: He takes his weapons, like a hero, in his hands, fain to win light, car-borne, in forays for the kine.
Devanāgarī: शूरो न धत्त आयुधा गभस्त्योः स्वः सिषासन्रथिरो गविष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: śūraḥ | na | dhatte | āyudhā | gabhastyoḥ | svariti svaḥ | sisāsan | rathiraḥ | go-iṣṭiṣu || indrasya | śuṣmam | īrayan | apasyu-bhiḥ | induḥ | hinvānaḥ | ajyate | manīṣi-bhiḥ ||9.76.2||

IAST: indrasya śuṣmam īrayann apasyubhir indur hinvāno ajyate manīṣibhiḥ
Griffith: Indu, while stimulating India's might, is urged forward and balmed by sages skilful in their task.
pada pāṭha: śūraḥ | na | dhatte | āyudhā | gabhastyoḥ | svariti svaḥ | sisāsan | rathiraḥ | go-iṣṭiṣu || indrasya | śuṣmam | īrayan | apasyu-bhiḥ | induḥ | hinvānaḥ | ajyate | manīṣi-bhiḥ ||9.76.2||

IAST: indrasya soma pavamāna ūrmiṇā taviṣyamāṇo jaṭhareṣv ā viśa
Griffith: Soma, as thou art purified with flowing wave, exhibiting thy strength enter thou Indra's throat.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य सोम पवमान ऊर्मिणा तविष्यमाणो जठरेष्वा विश
pada pāṭha: indrasya | soma | pavamānaḥ | ūrmiṇā | taviṣyamāṇaḥ | jaṭhareṣu | ā | viśa || pra | naḥ | pinva | vi-dyut | abhrā-iva | rodasī iti | dhiyā | na | vājān | upa | māsi | śaśvataḥ ||9.76.3||

IAST: pra ṇaḥ pinva vidyud abhreva rodasī dhiyā na vājām̐ upa māsi śaśvataḥ
Griffith: Make both worlds stream for us, as lightning doth the clouds: mete out exhaustless powers for us, as 'tw
Devanāgarī: प्र णः पिन्व विद्युदभ्रेव रोदसी धिया न वाजाँ उप मासि शश्वतः
pada pāṭha: indrasya | soma | pavamānaḥ | ūrmiṇā | taviṣyamāṇaḥ | jaṭhareṣu | ā | viśa || pra | naḥ | pinva | vi-dyut | abhrā-iva | rodasī iti | dhiyā | na | vājān | upa | māsi | śaśvataḥ ||9.76.3||

IAST: viśvasya rājā pavate svardṛśa ṛtasya dhītim ṛṣiṣāḻ avīvaśat
Griffith: Onward he flows, the King of all that sees the light: the Rsis' Lord hath raised the song of sacrifice;
Devanāgarī: विश्वस्य राजा पवते स्वर्दृश ऋतस्य धीतिमृषिषाळवीवशत्
pada pāṭha: viśvasya | rājā | pavate | svaḥ-dr̥śaḥ | r̥tasya | dhītim | r̥ṣiṣāṭ | avīvaśat || yaḥ | sūryasya | asireṇa | mr̥jyate | pitā | matīnām | asamaṣṭa-kāvyaḥ ||9.76.4||

IAST: yaḥ sūryasyāsireṇa mṛjyate pitā matīnām asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ
Griffith: Even he who is adorned with Surya's arrowy beam, Father of hymns, whose wisdom is beyond our reach.
pada pāṭha: viśvasya | rājā | pavate | svaḥ-dr̥śaḥ | r̥tasya | dhītim | r̥ṣiṣāṭ | avīvaśat || yaḥ | sūryasya | asireṇa | mr̥jyate | pitā | matīnām | asamaṣṭa-kāvyaḥ ||9.76.4||

IAST: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośam arṣasy apām upasthe vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradat
Griffith: Like as a bull to herds, thou flowest to the pail, bellowing as a steer upon the water's lap.
Devanāgarī: वृषेव यूथा परि कोशमर्षस्यपामुपस्थे वृषभः कनिक्रदत्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā-iva | yūthā | pari | kośam | arṣasi | apām | upa-sthe | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | kanikradat || saḥ | indrāya | pavase | matsarin-tamaḥ | yathā | jeṣāma | sam-ithe | tvā-ūtayaḥ ||9.76.5||

IAST: sa indrāya pavase matsarintamo yathā jeṣāma samithe tvotayaḥ
Griffith: So, best of Cheerers, thou for Indra flowest on that we, with thy protection, may o'ercome in fight.
Devanāgarī: स इन्द्राय पवसे मत्सरिन्तमो यथा जेषाम समिथे त्वोतयः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā-iva | yūthā | pari | kośam | arṣasi | apām | upa-sthe | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | kanikradat || saḥ | indrāya | pavase | matsarin-tamaḥ | yathā | jeṣāma | sam-ithe | tvā-ūtayaḥ ||9.76.5||

IAST: eṣa pra kośe madhumām̐ acikradad indrasya vajro vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraḥ
Griffith: MORE beauteous than the beautiful, as Indra's bolt, this Soma, rich in sweets, hath clamoured in the vat.
Devanāgarī: एष प्र कोशे मधुमाँ अचिक्रददिन्द्रस्य वज्रो वपुषो वपुष्टरः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | pra | kośe | madhu-mān | acikradat | indrasya | vajraḥ | vapuṣaḥ | vapuḥ-taraḥ || abhi | īm | r̥tasya | su-dughāḥ | ghr̥ta-ścutaḥ | vāśrāḥ | arṣanti | payasā-iva | dhenavaḥ ||9.77.1||

IAST: abhīm ṛtasya sudughā ghṛtaścuto vāśrā arṣanti payaseva dhenavaḥ
Griffith: Dropping with oil, abundant, streams of sacrifice flow unto him like milch-kine, lowing, with their mil
Devanāgarī: अभीमृतस्य सुदुघा घृतश्चुतो वाश्रा अर्षन्ति पयसेव धेनवः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | pra | kośe | madhu-mān | acikradat | indrasya | vajraḥ | vapuṣaḥ | vapuḥ-taraḥ || abhi | īm | r̥tasya | su-dughāḥ | ghr̥ta-ścutaḥ | vāśrāḥ | arṣanti | payasā-iva | dhenavaḥ ||9.77.1||

IAST: sa pūrvyaḥ pavate yaṁ divas pari śyeno mathāyad iṣitas tiro rajaḥ
Griffith: On flows that Ancient One whom, hitherward, from heaven, sped through the region of the air, the Falcon s
Devanāgarī: स पूर्व्यः पवते यं दिवस्परि श्येनो मथायदिषितस्तिरो रजः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pūrvyaḥ | pavate | yam | divaḥ | pari | śyenaḥ | mathāyat | iṣitaḥ | tiraḥ | rajaḥ || saḥ | madhvaḥ | ā | yuvate | vevijānaḥ | it | kr̥śānoḥ | astuḥ | manasā | aha | bibhyuṣā ||9.77.2||

IAST: sa madhva ā yuvate vevijāna it kṛśānor astur manasāha bibhyuṣā
Griffith: He, quivering with alarm and terrified in heart before bow-armed Krsanu, holdeth fast the sweet.
Devanāgarī: स मध्व आ युवते वेविजान इत्कृशानोरस्तुर्मनसाह बिभ्युषा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pūrvyaḥ | pavate | yam | divaḥ | pari | śyenaḥ | mathāyat | iṣitaḥ | tiraḥ | rajaḥ || saḥ | madhvaḥ | ā | yuvate | vevijānaḥ | it | kr̥śānoḥ | astuḥ | manasā | aha | bibhyuṣā ||9.77.2||

IAST: te naḥ pūrvāsa uparāsa indavo mahe vājāya dhanvantu gomate
Griffith: May those first freshest drops of Soma juice effused flow on, their way to bring us mighty strength in ki
Devanāgarī: ते नः पूर्वास उपरास इन्दवो महे वाजाय धन्वन्तु गोमते
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | pūrvāsaḥ | uparāsaḥ | indavaḥ | mahe | vājāya | dhanvantu | go-mate || īkṣeṇyāsaḥ | ahyaḥ | na | cāravaḥ | brahma-brahma | ye | jujuṣuḥ | haviḥ-haviḥ ||9.77.3||

IAST: īkṣeṇyāso ahyo na cāravo brahma-brahma ye jujuṣur havir-haviḥ
Griffith: Beauteous as serpents, worthy to be looked upon, they whom each sacred gift and all our prayers have ple
Devanāgarī: ईक्षेण्यासो अह्यो न चारवो ब्रह्मब्रह्म ये जुजुषुर्हविर्हविः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | pūrvāsaḥ | uparāsaḥ | indavaḥ | mahe | vājāya | dhanvantu | go-mate || īkṣeṇyāsaḥ | ahyaḥ | na | cāravaḥ | brahma-brahma | ye | jujuṣuḥ | haviḥ-haviḥ ||9.77.3||

IAST: ayaṁ no vidvān vanavad vanuṣyata induḥ satrācā manasā puruṣṭutaḥ
Griffith: May that much-lauded Indu, with a heart inclined to us, well-knowing, fight against our enemies.
Devanāgarī: अयं नो विद्वान्वनवद्वनुष्यत इन्दुः सत्राचा मनसा पुरुष्टुतः
pada pāṭha: ayam | naḥ | vidvān | vanavat | vanuṣyataḥ | induḥ | satrācā | manasā | puru-stutaḥ || inasya | yaḥ | sadane | garbham | ā-dadhe | gavām | urubjam | abhi | arṣati | vrajam ||9.77.4||

IAST: inasya yaḥ sadane garbham ādadhe gavām urubjam abhy arṣati vrajam
Griffith: He who hath brought the germ beside the Strong One's seat moves onward to the widely-opcned stall of ki
Devanāgarī: इनस्य यः सदने गर्भमादधे गवामुरुब्जमभ्यर्षति व्रजम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | naḥ | vidvān | vanavat | vanuṣyataḥ | induḥ | satrācā | manasā | puru-stutaḥ || inasya | yaḥ | sadane | garbham | ā-dadhe | gavām | urubjam | abhi | arṣati | vrajam ||9.77.4||

IAST: cakrir divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso mahām̐ adabdho varuṇo hurug yate
Griffith: The active potent juice of heaven is flowing on, great Varuna whom the forward man can ne'er deceive.
Devanāgarī: चक्रिर्दिवः पवते कृत्व्यो रसो महाँ अदब्धो वरुणो हुरुग्यते
pada pāṭha: cakriḥ | divaḥ | pavate | kr̥tvyaḥ | rasaḥ | mahān | adabdhaḥ | varuṇaḥ | huruk | yate || asāvi | mitraḥ | vr̥janeṣu | yajñiyaḥ | atyaḥ | na | yūthe | vr̥ṣa-yuḥ | kanikradat ||9.77.5||

IAST: asāvi mitro vṛjaneṣu yajñiyo 'tyo na yūthe vṛṣayuḥ kanikradat
Griffith: Mitra, the Holy, hath been pressed for troubled times, neighing like an impatient horse amid the herd,
Devanāgarī: असावि मित्रो वृजनेषु यज्ञियोऽत्यो न यूथे वृषयुः कनिक्रदत्
pada pāṭha: cakriḥ | divaḥ | pavate | kr̥tvyaḥ | rasaḥ | mahān | adabdhaḥ | varuṇaḥ | huruk | yate || asāvi | mitraḥ | vr̥janeṣu | yajñiyaḥ | atyaḥ | na | yūthe | vr̥ṣa-yuḥ | kanikradat ||9.77.5||

IAST: pra rājā vācaṁ janayann asiṣyadad apo vasāno abhi gā iyakṣati
Griffith: RAISING his voice the King hath flowed upon his way: invested with the waters he would win the kine.
Devanāgarī: प्र राजा वाचं जनयन्नसिष्यददपो वसानो अभि गा इयक्षति
pada pāṭha: pra | rājā | vācam | janayan | asisyadat | apaḥ | vasānaḥ | abhi | gāḥ | iyakṣati || gr̥bhṇāti | ripram | aviḥ | asya | tānvā | śuddhaḥ | devānām | upa | yāti | niḥ-kr̥tam ||9.78.1||

IAST: gṛbhṇāti ripram avir asya tānvā śuddho devānām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
Griffith: The fleece retains his solid parts as though impure, and bright and cleansed he seeks the special place
Devanāgarī: गृभ्णाति रिप्रमविरस्य तान्वा शुद्धो देवानामुप याति निष्कृतम्
pada pāṭha: pra | rājā | vācam | janayan | asisyadat | apaḥ | vasānaḥ | abhi | gāḥ | iyakṣati || gr̥bhṇāti | ripram | aviḥ | asya | tānvā | śuddhaḥ | devānām | upa | yāti | niḥ-kr̥tam ||9.78.1||

IAST: indrāya soma pari ṣicyase nṛbhir nṛcakṣā ūrmiḥ kavir ajyase vane
Griffith: Thou, Soma, art effused for Indra by the men, balmed in the wood as wave, Sage, Viewer of mankind.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय सोम परि षिच्यसे नृभिर्नृचक्षा ऊर्मिः कविरज्यसे वने
pada pāṭha: indrāya | soma | pari | sicyase | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | ūrmiḥ | kaviḥ | ajyase | vane || pūrvīḥ | hi | te | srutayaḥ | santi | yātave | sahasram | aśvāḥ | harayaḥ | camū-sadaḥ ||9.78.2||

IAST: pūrvīr hi te srutayaḥ santi yātave sahasram aśvā harayaś camūṣadaḥ
Griffith: Full many are the paths whereon thou mayest go: a thousand bay steeds hast thou resting in the bowls.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीर्हि ते स्रुतयः सन्ति यातवे सहस्रमश्वा हरयश्चमूषदः
pada pāṭha: indrāya | soma | pari | sicyase | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | ūrmiḥ | kaviḥ | ajyase | vane || pūrvīḥ | hi | te | srutayaḥ | santi | yātave | sahasram | aśvāḥ | harayaḥ | camū-sadaḥ ||9.78.2||

IAST: samudriyā apsaraso manīṣiṇam āsīnā antar abhi somam akṣaran
Griffith: Apsarases who dwell in waters of the sea, sitting within, have flowed to Soma wise of heart.
pada pāṭha: samudriyāḥ | apsarasaḥ | manīṣiṇam | āsīnāḥ | antaḥ | abhi | somam | akṣaran || tāḥ | īm | hinvanti | harmyasya | sakṣaṇim | yācante | sumnam | pavamānam | akṣitam ||9.78.3||

IAST: tā īṁ hinvanti harmyasya sakṣaṇiṁ yācante sumnam pavamānam akṣitam
Griffith: They urge the Master of the house upon his way, and to the Eternal Pavamana pray for bliss.
Devanāgarī: ता ईं हिन्वन्ति हर्म्यस्य सक्षणिं याचन्ते सुम्नं पवमानमक्षितम्
pada pāṭha: samudriyāḥ | apsarasaḥ | manīṣiṇam | āsīnāḥ | antaḥ | abhi | somam | akṣaran || tāḥ | īm | hinvanti | harmyasya | sakṣaṇim | yācante | sumnam | pavamānam | akṣitam ||9.78.3||

IAST: gojin naḥ somo rathajid dhiraṇyajit svarjid abjit pavate sahasrajit
Griffith: Soma flows on for u's as winner of the kine, winner of thousands, cars, water, and light, and gold;
pada pāṭha: go-jit | naḥ | somaḥ | ratha-jit | hiraṇya-jit | svaḥ-jit | ap-jit | pavate | sahasra-jit || yam | devāsaḥ | cakrire | pītaye | madam | svādiṣṭham | drapsam | aruṇam | mayaḥ-bhuvam ||9.78.4||

IAST: yaṁ devāsaś cakrire pītaye madaṁ svādiṣṭhaṁ drapsam aruṇam mayobhuvam
Griffith: He whom the Gods have made a gladdening draught to drink, the drop most sweet to taste, weal-bringing,
Devanāgarī: यं देवासश्चक्रिरे पीतये मदं स्वादिष्ठं द्रप्समरुणं मयोभुवम्
pada pāṭha: go-jit | naḥ | somaḥ | ratha-jit | hiraṇya-jit | svaḥ-jit | ap-jit | pavate | sahasra-jit || yam | devāsaḥ | cakrire | pītaye | madam | svādiṣṭham | drapsam | aruṇam | mayaḥ-bhuvam ||9.78.4||

IAST: etāni soma pavamāno asmayuḥ satyāni kṛṇvan draviṇāny arṣasi
Griffith: Soma, as Pavamana thou, our faithful Friend, making for us these real treasures, flowest on.
Devanāgarī: एतानि सोम पवमानो अस्मयुः सत्यानि कृण्वन्द्रविणान्यर्षसि
pada pāṭha: etāni | soma | pavamānaḥ | asma-yuḥ | satyāni | kr̥ṇvan | draviṇāni | arṣasi || jahi | śatrum | antike | dūrake | ca | yaḥ | urvīm | gavyūtim | abhayam | ca | naḥ | kr̥dhi ||9.78.5||

IAST: jahi śatrum antike dūrake ca ya urvīṁ gavyūtim abhayaṁ ca nas kṛdhi
Griffith: Slay thou the enemy both near and,far away: grant us security and ample pasturage.
Devanāgarī: जहि शत्रुमन्तिके दूरके च य उर्वीं गव्यूतिमभयं च नस्कृधि
pada pāṭha: etāni | soma | pavamānaḥ | asma-yuḥ | satyāni | kr̥ṇvan | draviṇāni | arṣasi || jahi | śatrum | antike | dūrake | ca | yaḥ | urvīm | gavyūtim | abhayam | ca | naḥ | kr̥dhi ||9.78.5||

IAST: acodaso no dhanvantv indavaḥ pra suvānāso bṛhaddiveṣu harayaḥ
Griffith: SPONTANEOUS let our drops of Soma juice flow on, pressed, golden-hued, among the Gods of lofty heaven.
Devanāgarī: अचोदसो नो धन्वन्त्विन्दवः प्र सुवानासो बृहद्दिवेषु हरयः
pada pāṭha: acodasaḥ | naḥ | dhanvantu | indavaḥ | pra | suvānāsaḥ | br̥hat-diveṣu | harayaḥ || vi | ca | naśan | naḥ | iṣaḥ | arātayaḥ | aryaḥ | naśanta | saniṣanta | naḥ | dhiyaḥ ||9.79.1||

IAST: vi ca naśan na iṣo arātayo 'ryo naśanta saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Perish among us they who give no gifts of food! perish the godless! May our prayers obtain success.
Devanāgarī: वि च नशन्न इषो अरातयोऽर्यो नशन्त सनिषन्त नो धियः
pada pāṭha: acodasaḥ | naḥ | dhanvantu | indavaḥ | pra | suvānāsaḥ | br̥hat-diveṣu | harayaḥ || vi | ca | naśan | naḥ | iṣaḥ | arātayaḥ | aryaḥ | naśanta | saniṣanta | naḥ | dhiyaḥ ||9.79.1||

IAST: pra ṇo dhanvantv indavo madacyuto dhanā vā yebhir arvato junīmasi
Griffith: Forward to us the drops, distilling meath, shall flow, like riches for whose sake we urge the horses on.
Devanāgarī: प्र णो धन्वन्त्विन्दवो मदच्युतो धना वा येभिरर्वतो जुनीमसि
pada pāṭha: pra | naḥ | dhanvantu | indavaḥ | mada-cyutaḥ | dhanā | vā | yebhiḥ | arvataḥ | junīmasi || tiraḥ | martasya | kasya | cit | pari-hvr̥tim | vayam | dhanāni | viśvadhā | bharemahi ||9.79.2||

IAST: tiro martasya kasya cit parihvṛtiṁ vayaṁ dhanāni viśvadhā bharemahi
Griffith: Beyond the crafty hindering of all mortal men may we continually bear precious wealth away.
Devanāgarī: तिरो मर्तस्य कस्य चित्परिह्वृतिं वयं धनानि विश्वधा भरेमहि
pada pāṭha: pra | naḥ | dhanvantu | indavaḥ | mada-cyutaḥ | dhanā | vā | yebhiḥ | arvataḥ | junīmasi || tiraḥ | martasya | kasya | cit | pari-hvr̥tim | vayam | dhanāni | viśvadhā | bharemahi ||9.79.2||

IAST: uta svasyā arātyā arir hi ṣa utānyasyā arātyā vṛko hi ṣaḥ
Griffith: Yea, yerily, foe of hate shown to himself is he, yea, verity, destroyer too of other hate.
Devanāgarī: उत स्वस्या अरात्या अरिर्हि ष उतान्यस्या अरात्या वृको हि षः
pada pāṭha: uta | svasyāḥ | arātyāḥ | ariḥ | hi | saḥ | uta | anyasyāḥ | arātyāḥ | vr̥kaḥ | hi | saḥ || dhanvan | na | tr̥ṣṇā | sam | arīta | tān | abhi | soma | jahi | pavamāna | duḥ-ādhyaḥ ||9.79.3||

IAST: dhanvan na tṛṣṇā sam arīta tām̐ abhi soma jahi pavamāna durādhyaḥ
Griffith: As thirst subdueth in the desert, conquer thou, O Soma Pavarnana, men of evil thoughts.
Devanāgarī: धन्वन्न तृष्णा समरीत ताँ अभि सोम जहि पवमान दुराध्यः
pada pāṭha: uta | svasyāḥ | arātyāḥ | ariḥ | hi | saḥ | uta | anyasyāḥ | arātyāḥ | vr̥kaḥ | hi | saḥ || dhanvan | na | tr̥ṣṇā | sam | arīta | tān | abhi | soma | jahi | pavamāna | duḥ-ādhyaḥ ||9.79.3||

IAST: divi te nābhā paramo ya ādade pṛthivyās te ruruhuḥ sānavi kṣipaḥ
Griffith: Near kin to thee is he, raised loftiest in the heavens: upon the earth's high ridge thy scions have grown
Devanāgarī: दिवि ते नाभा परमो य आददे पृथिव्यास्ते रुरुहुः सानवि क्षिपः
pada pāṭha: divi | te | nābhā | paramaḥ | yaḥ | ā-dade | pr̥thivyāḥ | te | ruruhuḥ | sānavi | kṣipaḥ || adrayaḥ | tvā | bapsati | goḥ | adhi | tvaci | ap-su | tvā | hastaiḥ | duduhuḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ ||9.79.4||

IAST: adrayas tvā bapsati gor adhi tvacy apsu tvā hastair duduhur manīṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: The press-stones chew and crunch thee on the ox's hide: sages have milked thee with their hands into the
Devanāgarī: अद्रयस्त्वा बप्सति गोरधि त्वच्यप्सु त्वा हस्तैर्दुदुहुर्मनीषिणः
pada pāṭha: divi | te | nābhā | paramaḥ | yaḥ | ā-dade | pr̥thivyāḥ | te | ruruhuḥ | sānavi | kṣipaḥ || adrayaḥ | tvā | bapsati | goḥ | adhi | tvaci | ap-su | tvā | hastaiḥ | duduhuḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ ||9.79.4||

IAST: evā ta indo subhvaṁ supeśasaṁ rasaṁ tuñjanti prathamā abhiśriyaḥ
Griffith: So do they hurry on thy strong and beauteous juice, O Indu, as the first ingredient of the draught.
Devanāgarī: एवा त इन्दो सुभ्वं सुपेशसं रसं तुञ्जन्ति प्रथमा अभिश्रियः
pada pāṭha: eva | te | indo iti | su-bhvam | su-peśasam | rasam | tuñjanti | prathamāḥ | abhi-śriyaḥ || nidam-nidam | pavamāna | ni | tāriṣaḥ | āviḥ | te | śuṣmaḥ | bhavatu | priyaḥ | madaḥ ||9.79.5||

IAST: nidaṁ-nidam pavamāna ni tāriṣa āvis te śuṣmo bhavatu priyo madaḥ
Griffith: Bring low, thou Pavamana, every single foe, and be thy might shown forth as sweet and gladdening drink.
Devanāgarī: निदंनिदं पवमान नि तारिष आविस्ते शुष्मो भवतु प्रियो मदः
pada pāṭha: eva | te | indo iti | su-bhvam | su-peśasam | rasam | tuñjanti | prathamāḥ | abhi-śriyaḥ || nidam-nidam | pavamāna | ni | tāriṣaḥ | āviḥ | te | śuṣmaḥ | bhavatu | priyaḥ | madaḥ ||9.79.5||

IAST: somasya dhārā pavate nṛcakṣasa ṛtena devān havate divas pari
Griffith: ON flows the stream of Soma who beholds mankind: by everlasting Law he calls the Gods from heaven.
Devanāgarī: सोमस्य धारा पवते नृचक्षस ऋतेन देवान्हवते दिवस्परि
pada pāṭha: somasya | dhārā | pavate | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ | r̥tena | devān | havate | divaḥ | pari || br̥haspateḥ | ravathena | vi | didyute | samudrāsaḥ | na | savanāni | vivyacuḥ ||9.80.1||

IAST: bṛhaspate ravathenā vi didyute samudrāso na savanāni vivyacuḥ
Griffith: He lightens with the roaring of Br aspati: h the lakes have not contained the pourings of juice.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते रवथेना वि दिद्युते समुद्रासो न सवनानि विव्यचुः
pada pāṭha: somasya | dhārā | pavate | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ | r̥tena | devān | havate | divaḥ | pari || br̥haspateḥ | ravathena | vi | didyute | samudrāsaḥ | na | savanāni | vivyacuḥ ||9.80.1||

IAST: yaṁ tvā vājinn aghnyā abhy anūṣatāyohataṁ yonim ā rohasi dyumān
