Griffith: Thou, powerful Soma, thou to whom the cows have -lowed, ascendest bright with sheen, thine iron-fashioned
Devanāgarī: यं त्वा वाजिन्नघ्न्या अभ्यनूषतायोहतं योनिमा रोहसि द्युमान्
pada pāṭha: yam | tvā | vājin | aghnyāḥ | abhi | anūṣata | ayaḥ-hatam | yonim | ā | rohasi | dyu-mān || maghonām | āyuḥ | pra-tiran | mahi | śravaḥ | indrāya | soma | pavase | vr̥ṣā | madaḥ ||9.80.2||

IAST: maghonām āyuḥ pratiran mahi śrava indrāya soma pavase vṛṣā madaḥ
Griffith: Thou, lengthening our princes' life and high renown, flowest for Indra as his might to gladdening drink
Devanāgarī: मघोनामायुः प्रतिरन्महि श्रव इन्द्राय सोम पवसे वृषा मदः
pada pāṭha: yam | tvā | vājin | aghnyāḥ | abhi | anūṣata | ayaḥ-hatam | yonim | ā | rohasi | dyu-mān || maghonām | āyuḥ | pra-tiran | mahi | śravaḥ | indrāya | soma | pavase | vr̥ṣā | madaḥ ||9.80.2||

IAST: endrasya kukṣā pavate madintama ūrjaṁ vasānaḥ śravase sumaṅgalaḥ
Griffith: Best giver of delight, he flows to Indra's throat, robing himself in might, Auspicious One, for fame.
Devanāgarī: एन्द्रस्य कुक्षा पवते मदिन्तम ऊर्जं वसानः श्रवसे सुमङ्गलः
pada pāṭha: ā | indrasya | kukṣā | pavate | madin-tamaḥ | ūrjam | vasānaḥ | śravase | su-maṅgalaḥ || pratyaṅ | saḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | paprathe | krīḷan | hariḥ | atyaḥ | syandate | vr̥ṣā ||9.80.3||

IAST: pratyaṅ sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paprathe krīḻan harir atyaḥ syandate vṛṣā
Griffith: He spreads himself abroad to meet all things that be: the vigorous Tawny Steed flows sporting on his way
Devanāgarī: प्रत्यङ्स विश्वा भुवनाभि पप्रथे क्रीळन्हरिरत्यः स्यन्दते वृषा
pada pāṭha: ā | indrasya | kukṣā | pavate | madin-tamaḥ | ūrjam | vasānaḥ | śravase | su-maṅgalaḥ || pratyaṅ | saḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | paprathe | krīḷan | hariḥ | atyaḥ | syandate | vr̥ṣā ||9.80.3||

IAST: taṁ tvā devebhyo madhumattamaṁ naraḥ sahasradhāraṁ duhate daśa kṣipaḥ
Griffith: The men, the ten swift fingers, milk thee out for Gods, even thee most rich in meath, with thousand flowi
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमं नरः सहस्रधारं दुहते दश क्षिपः
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | devebhyaḥ | madhumat-tamam | naraḥ | sahasra-dhāram | duhate | daśa | kṣipaḥ || nr̥-bhiḥ | soma | pra-cyutaḥ | grāva-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | viśvān | devān | ā | pavasva | sahasra-jit ||9.80.4||

IAST: nṛbhiḥ soma pracyuto grāvabhiḥ suto viśvān devām̐ ā pavasvā sahasrajit
Griffith: Soma who winnest thousands, driven by the men, expressed with stones, bring, as thou flowest, all the Go
Devanāgarī: नृभिः सोम प्रच्युतो ग्रावभिः सुतो विश्वान्देवाँ आ पवस्वा सहस्रजित्
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | devebhyaḥ | madhumat-tamam | naraḥ | sahasra-dhāram | duhate | daśa | kṣipaḥ || nr̥-bhiḥ | soma | pra-cyutaḥ | grāva-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | viśvān | devān | ā | pavasva | sahasra-jit ||9.80.4||

IAST: taṁ tvā hastino madhumantam adribhir duhanty apsu vṛṣabhaṁ daśa kṣipaḥ
Griffith: Deft-handed men with stones, the ten swift fingers, drain thee into waters, thee, the Steer enriched with
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा हस्तिनो मधुमन्तमद्रिभिर्दुहन्त्यप्सु वृषभं दश क्षिपः
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | hastinaḥ | madhu-mantam | adri-bhiḥ | duhanti | ap-su | vr̥ṣabham | daśa | kṣipaḥ || indram | soma | mādayan | daivyam | janam | sindhoḥ-iva | ūrmiḥ | pavamānaḥ | arṣasi ||9.80.5||

IAST: indraṁ soma mādayan daivyaṁ janaṁ sindhor ivormiḥ pavamāno arṣasi
Griffith: Thou, Soma, gladdening Indra, and the Heavenly Host, flowest as Pavamana like a river's wave.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं सोम मादयन्दैव्यं जनं सिन्धोरिवोर्मिः पवमानो अर्षसि
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | hastinaḥ | madhu-mantam | adri-bhiḥ | duhanti | ap-su | vr̥ṣabham | daśa | kṣipaḥ || indram | soma | mādayan | daivyam | janam | sindhoḥ-iva | ūrmiḥ | pavamānaḥ | arṣasi ||9.80.5||

IAST: pra somasya pavamānasyormaya indrasya yanti jaṭharaṁ supeśasaḥ
Griffith: ONWARD to Indra's throat move, beauteously adorned, the waves of Soma as he purifies himself,
Devanāgarī: प्र सोमस्य पवमानस्योर्मय इन्द्रस्य यन्ति जठरं सुपेशसः
pada pāṭha: pra | somasya | pavamānasya | ūrmayaḥ | indrasya | yanti | jaṭharam | su-peśasaḥ || dadhnā | yat | īm | ut-nītāḥ | yaśasā | gavām | dānāya | śūram | ut-amandiṣuḥ | sutāḥ ||9.81.1||

IAST: dadhnā yad īm unnītā yaśasā gavāṁ dānāya śūram udamandiṣuḥ sutāḥ
Griffith: When they, brought forward with the lovely curd of kine, effused, have cheered the Hero to bestow his gi
Devanāgarī: दध्ना यदीमुन्नीता यशसा गवां दानाय शूरमुदमन्दिषुः सुताः
pada pāṭha: pra | somasya | pavamānasya | ūrmayaḥ | indrasya | yanti | jaṭharam | su-peśasaḥ || dadhnā | yat | īm | ut-nītāḥ | yaśasā | gavām | dānāya | śūram | ut-amandiṣuḥ | sutāḥ ||9.81.1||

IAST: acchā hi somaḥ kalaśām̐ asiṣyadad atyo na voḻhā raghuvartanir vṛṣā
Griffith: Hither hath Soma flowed unto the beakers, like a chariot-horse, a stallion swift upon his way.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा हि सोमः कलशाँ असिष्यददत्यो न वोळ्हा रघुवर्तनिर्वृषा
pada pāṭha: accha | hi | somaḥ | kalaśān | asisyadat | atyaḥ | na | voḷhā | raghu-vartaniḥ | vr̥ṣā || atha | devānām | ubhayasya | janmanaḥ | vidvān | aśnoti | amutaḥ | itaḥ | ca | yat ||9.81.2||

IAST: athā devānām ubhayasya janmano vidvām̐ aśnoty amuta itaś ca yat
Griffith: Thus, knowing both the generations, he obtains the rights and dues of Gods from yonder and from hence.
Devanāgarī: अथा देवानामुभयस्य जन्मनो विद्वाँ अश्नोत्यमुत इतश्च यत्
pada pāṭha: accha | hi | somaḥ | kalaśān | asisyadat | atyaḥ | na | voḷhā | raghu-vartaniḥ | vr̥ṣā || atha | devānām | ubhayasya | janmanaḥ | vidvān | aśnoti | amutaḥ | itaḥ | ca | yat ||9.81.2||

IAST: ā naḥ soma pavamānaḥ kirā vasv indo bhava maghavā rādhaso mahaḥ
Griffith: While thou art cleansed, O Soma, scatter wealth on us; Indu, bestow great bounty as a liberal Prince.
Devanāgarī: आ नः सोम पवमानः किरा वस्विन्दो भव मघवा राधसो महः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | soma | pavamānaḥ | kira | vasu | indo iti | bhava | magha-vā | rādhasaḥ | mahaḥ || śikṣa | vayaḥ-dhaḥ | vasave | su | cetunā | mā | naḥ | gayam | āre | asmat | parā | sicaḥ ||9.81.3||

IAST: śikṣā vayodho vasave su cetunā mā no gayam āre asmat parā sicaḥ
Griffith: Giver of life, with wisdom help to opulence; strew not our home possessions far away from us.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा वयोधो वसवे सु चेतुना मा नो गयमारे अस्मत्परा सिचः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | soma | pavamānaḥ | kira | vasu | indo iti | bhava | magha-vā | rādhasaḥ | mahaḥ || śikṣa | vayaḥ-dhaḥ | vasave | su | cetunā | mā | naḥ | gayam | āre | asmat | parā | sicaḥ ||9.81.3||

IAST: ā naḥ pūṣā pavamānaḥ surātayo mitro gacchantu varuṇaḥ sajoṣasaḥ
Griffith: Hither let Pusan Pavamana come to us, Varuna, Mitra, bountiful, of one accord,
Devanāgarī: आ नः पूषा पवमानः सुरातयो मित्रो गच्छन्तु वरुणः सजोषसः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | pūṣā | pavamānaḥ | su-rātayaḥ | mitraḥ | gacchantu | varuṇaḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ || br̥haspatiḥ | marutaḥ | vāyuḥ | aśvinā | tvaṣṭā | savitā | su-yamā | sarasvatī ||9.81.4||

IAST: bṛhaspatir maruto vāyur aśvinā tvaṣṭā savitā suyamā sarasvatī
Griffith: The Maruts, Asvins, Vayu, and Brhaspati, Savitar, Tvastar, tractable Sarasvati.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिर्मरुतो वायुरश्विना त्वष्टा सविता सुयमा सरस्वती
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | pūṣā | pavamānaḥ | su-rātayaḥ | mitraḥ | gacchantu | varuṇaḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ || br̥haspatiḥ | marutaḥ | vāyuḥ | aśvinā | tvaṣṭā | savitā | su-yamā | sarasvatī ||9.81.4||

IAST: ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaminve aryamā devo aditir vidhātā
Griffith: Both Heaven and Earth, the all-invigorating Pair, Vidhatar, Aditi, and Aryaman the God,
Devanāgarī: उभे द्यावापृथिवी विश्वमिन्वे अर्यमा देवो अदितिर्विधाता
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | viśvam-inve | aryamā | devaḥ | aditiḥ | vi-dhātā || bhagaḥ | nr̥-śaṁsaḥ | uru | antarikṣam | viśve | devāḥ | pavamānam | juṣanta ||9.81.5||

IAST: bhago nṛśaṁsa urv antarikṣaṁ viśve devāḥ pavamānaṁ juṣanta
Griffith: Bhaga who blesses men, the spacious Firmament,-let all the Gods in Pavamana take delight.
Devanāgarī: भगो नृशंस उर्वन्तरिक्षं विश्वे देवाः पवमानं जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | viśvam-inve | aryamā | devaḥ | aditiḥ | vi-dhātā || bhagaḥ | nr̥-śaṁsaḥ | uru | antarikṣam | viśve | devāḥ | pavamānam | juṣanta ||9.81.5||

IAST: asāvi somo aruṣo vṛṣā harī rājeva dasmo abhi gā acikradat
Griffith: EVEN as a King hath Soma, red and tawny Bull, been pressed: the Wondrous One hath bellowed to the kine.
Devanāgarī: असावि सोमो अरुषो वृषा हरी राजेव दस्मो अभि गा अचिक्रदत्
pada pāṭha: asāvi | somaḥ | aruṣaḥ | vr̥ṣā | hariḥ | rājā-iva | dasmaḥ | abhi | gāḥ | acikradat || punānaḥ | vāram | pari | eti | avyayam | śyenaḥ | na | yonim | ghr̥ta-vantam | ā-sadam ||9.82.1||

IAST: punāno vāram pary ety avyayaṁ śyeno na yoniṁ ghṛtavantam āsadam
Griffith: While purified he passes through the filtering fleece to seat him hawk-like on the place that drops wit
Devanāgarī: पुनानो वारं पर्येत्यव्ययं श्येनो न योनिं घृतवन्तमासदम्
pada pāṭha: asāvi | somaḥ | aruṣaḥ | vr̥ṣā | hariḥ | rājā-iva | dasmaḥ | abhi | gāḥ | acikradat || punānaḥ | vāram | pari | eti | avyayam | śyenaḥ | na | yonim | ghr̥ta-vantam | ā-sadam ||9.82.1||

IAST: kavir vedhasyā pary eṣi māhinam atyo na mṛṣṭo abhi vājam arṣasi
Griffith: To glory goest thou, Sage with disposing skill, like a groomed steed thou rusbest forward to the prize.
Devanāgarī: कविर्वेधस्या पर्येषि माहिनमत्यो न मृष्टो अभि वाजमर्षसि
pada pāṭha: kaviḥ | vedhasyā | pari | eṣi | māhinam | atyaḥ | na | mr̥ṣṭaḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣasi || apa-sedhan | duḥ-itā | soma | mr̥ḷaya | ghr̥tam | vasānaḥ | pari | yāsi | niḥ-nijam ||9.82.2||

IAST: apasedhan duritā soma mṛḻaya ghṛtaṁ vasānaḥ pari yāsi nirṇijam
Griffith: O Soma, be thou gracious, driving off distress: thou goest, clothed in butter, to a robe of state.
Devanāgarī: अपसेधन्दुरिता सोम मृळय घृतं वसानः परि यासि निर्णिजम्
pada pāṭha: kaviḥ | vedhasyā | pari | eṣi | māhinam | atyaḥ | na | mr̥ṣṭaḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣasi || apa-sedhan | duḥ-itā | soma | mr̥ḷaya | ghr̥tam | vasānaḥ | pari | yāsi | niḥ-nijam ||9.82.2||

IAST: parjanyaḥ pitā mahiṣasya parṇino nābhā pṛthivyā giriṣu kṣayaṁ dadhe
Griffith: Parjanya is the Father of the Mighty Bird: on mountains, in earth's centre hath he made his home.
Devanāgarī: पर्जन्यः पिता महिषस्य पर्णिनो नाभा पृथिव्या गिरिषु क्षयं दधे
pada pāṭha: parjanyaḥ | pitā | mahiṣasya | parṇinaḥ | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | giriṣu | kṣayam | dadhe || svasāraḥ | āpaḥ | abhi | gāḥ | uta | asaran | sam | grāva-bhiḥ | nasate | vīte | adhvare ||9.82.3||

IAST: svasāra āpo abhi gā utāsaran saṁ grāvabhir nasate vīte adhvare
Griffith: The waters too have flowed, the Sisters, to the kine: he meets the pressing-stones at the beloved rite.
Devanāgarī: स्वसार आपो अभि गा उतासरन्सं ग्रावभिर्नसते वीते अध्वरे
pada pāṭha: parjanyaḥ | pitā | mahiṣasya | parṇinaḥ | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | giriṣu | kṣayam | dadhe || svasāraḥ | āpaḥ | abhi | gāḥ | uta | asaran | sam | grāva-bhiḥ | nasate | vīte | adhvare ||9.82.3||

IAST: jāyeva patyāv adhi śeva maṁhase pajrāyā garbha śṛṇuhi bravīmi te
Griffith: Thou givest pleasure as a wife delights her lord. Listen, O Child of Pajri, for to thee I speak.
Devanāgarī: जायेव पत्यावधि शेव मंहसे पज्राया गर्भ शृणुहि ब्रवीमि ते
pada pāṭha: jāyā-iva | patyau | adhi | śeva | maṁhase | pajrāyāḥ | garbha | śr̥ṇuhi | bravīmi | te || antaḥ | vāṇīṣu | pra | cara | su | jīvase | anindyaḥ | vr̥jane | soma | jāgr̥hi ||9.82.4||

IAST: antar vāṇīṣu pra carā su jīvase 'nindyo vṛjane soma jāgṛhi
Griffith: Amid the holy songs go on that we may live: in time of trouble, Soma, watch thou free from blame.
Devanāgarī: अन्तर्वाणीषु प्र चरा सु जीवसेऽनिन्द्यो वृजने सोम जागृहि
pada pāṭha: jāyā-iva | patyau | adhi | śeva | maṁhase | pajrāyāḥ | garbha | śr̥ṇuhi | bravīmi | te || antaḥ | vāṇīṣu | pra | cara | su | jīvase | anindyaḥ | vr̥jane | soma | jāgr̥hi ||9.82.4||

IAST: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ śatasā amṛdhraḥ sahasrasāḥ paryayā vājam indo
Griffith: As to the men of old thou camest, Indu unharmed, to strengthen, winning hundreds, thousands,
Devanāgarī: यथा पूर्वेभ्यः शतसा अमृध्रः सहस्रसाः पर्यया वाजमिन्दो
pada pāṭha: yathā | pūrvebhyaḥ | śata-sāḥ | amr̥dhraḥ | sahasra-sāḥ | pari-ayāḥ | vājam | indo iti || eva | pavasva | suvitāya | navyase | tava | vratam | anu | āpaḥ | sacante ||9.82.5||

IAST: evā pavasva suvitāya navyase tava vratam anv āpaḥ sacante
Griffith: So now for new felicity flow onward: the waters follow as thy law ordaineth.
Devanāgarī: एवा पवस्व सुविताय नव्यसे तव व्रतमन्वापः सचन्ते
pada pāṭha: yathā | pūrvebhyaḥ | śata-sāḥ | amr̥dhraḥ | sahasra-sāḥ | pari-ayāḥ | vājam | indo iti || eva | pavasva | suvitāya | navyase | tava | vratam | anu | āpaḥ | sacante ||9.82.5||

IAST: pavitraṁ te vitatam brahmaṇas pate prabhur gātrāṇi pary eṣi viśvataḥ
Griffith: SPREAD is thy cleansing filter, Brahmanaspati: as Prince, thou enterest its limbs from every side.
Devanāgarī: पवित्रं ते विततं ब्रह्मणस्पते प्रभुर्गात्राणि पर्येषि विश्वतः
pada pāṭha: pavitram | te | vi-tatam | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | pra-bhuḥ | gātrāṇi | pari | eṣi | viśvataḥ || atapta-tanūḥ | na | tat | āmaḥ | aśnute | śr̥tāsaḥ | it | vahantaḥ | tat | sam | āśata ||9.83.1||

IAST: ataptatanūr na tad āmo aśnute śṛtāsa id vahantas tat sam āśata
Griffith: The raw, whose mass hath not been heated gains not this: they only which are dressed, which bear, attai
pada pāṭha: pavitram | te | vi-tatam | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | pra-bhuḥ | gātrāṇi | pari | eṣi | viśvataḥ || atapta-tanūḥ | na | tat | āmaḥ | aśnute | śr̥tāsaḥ | it | vahantaḥ | tat | sam | āśata ||9.83.1||

IAST: tapoṣ pavitraṁ vitataṁ divas pade śocanto asya tantavo vy asthiran
Griffith: High in the seat of heaven is spread the Scorcher's sieve: its threads are standing separate, glittering w
Devanāgarī: तपोष्पवित्रं विततं दिवस्पदे शोचन्तो अस्य तन्तवो व्यस्थिरन्
pada pāṭha: tapoḥ | pavitram | vi-tatam | divaḥ | pade | śocantaḥ | asya | tantavaḥ | vi | asthiran || avanti | asya | pavitāram | āśavaḥ | divaḥ | pr̥ṣṭham | adhi | tiṣṭhanti | cetasā ||9.83.2||

IAST: avanty asya pavītāram āśavo divas pṛṣṭham adhi tiṣṭhanti cetasā
Griffith: The Swift Ones favour him who purifieth this: with consciousness they stand upon the height of heaven.
pada pāṭha: tapoḥ | pavitram | vi-tatam | divaḥ | pade | śocantaḥ | asya | tantavaḥ | vi | asthiran || avanti | asya | pavitāram | āśavaḥ | divaḥ | pr̥ṣṭham | adhi | tiṣṭhanti | cetasā ||9.83.2||

IAST: arūrucad uṣasaḥ pṛśnir agriya ukṣā bibharti bhuvanāni vājayuḥ
Griffith: The foremost spotted Steer hath made the Mornings shine, and yearning after strength sustains all things
Devanāgarī: अरूरुचदुषसः पृश्निरग्रिय उक्षा बिभर्ति भुवनानि वाजयुः
pada pāṭha: arūrucat | uṣasaḥ | pr̥śniḥ | agriyaḥ | ukṣā | bibharti | bhuvanāni | vāja-yuḥ || māyā-vinaḥ | mamire | asya | māyayā | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ | pitaraḥ | garbham | ā | dadhuḥ ||9.83.3||

IAST: māyāvino mamire asya māyayā nṛcakṣasaḥ pitaro garbham ā dadhuḥ
Griffith: By his high wisdom have the mighty Sages wrought: the Fathers who behold mankind laid down the germ,
Devanāgarī: मायाविनो ममिरे अस्य मायया नृचक्षसः पितरो गर्भमा दधुः
pada pāṭha: arūrucat | uṣasaḥ | pr̥śniḥ | agriyaḥ | ukṣā | bibharti | bhuvanāni | vāja-yuḥ || māyā-vinaḥ | mamire | asya | māyayā | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ | pitaraḥ | garbham | ā | dadhuḥ ||9.83.3||

IAST: gandharva itthā padam asya rakṣati pāti devānāṁ janimāny adbhutaḥ
Griffith: Gandharva verily protects his dwellingplace; Wondrous, he guards the generations of the Gods.
Devanāgarī: गन्धर्व इत्था पदमस्य रक्षति पाति देवानां जनिमान्यद्भुतः
pada pāṭha: gandharvaḥ | itthā | padam | asya | rakṣati | pāti | devānām | janimāni | adbhutaḥ || gr̥bhṇāti | ripum | ni-dhayā | nidhā-patiḥ | sukr̥t-tamāḥ | madhunaḥ | bhakṣam | āśata ||9.83.4||

IAST: gṛbhṇāti ripuṁ nidhayā nidhāpatiḥ sukṛttamā madhuno bhakṣam āśata
Griffith: Lord of the snare, he takes the foeman with the snare: those who are most devout have gained a share of
Devanāgarī: गृभ्णाति रिपुं निधया निधापतिः सुकृत्तमा मधुनो भक्षमाशत
pada pāṭha: gandharvaḥ | itthā | padam | asya | rakṣati | pāti | devānām | janimāni | adbhutaḥ || gr̥bhṇāti | ripum | ni-dhayā | nidhā-patiḥ | sukr̥t-tamāḥ | madhunaḥ | bhakṣam | āśata ||9.83.4||

IAST: havir haviṣmo mahi sadma daivyaṁ nabho vasānaḥ pari yāsy adhvaram
Griffith: Rich in oblations! robed in cloud, thou corapassest oblation, sacrifice, the mighty seat of Gods.
Devanāgarī: हविर्हविष्मो महि सद्म दैव्यं नभो वसानः परि यास्यध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: haviḥ | haviṣmaḥ | mahi | sadma | daivyam | nabhaḥ | vasānaḥ | pari | yāsi | adhvaram || rājā | pavitra-rathaḥ | vājam | ā | aruhaḥ | sahasra-bhr̥ṣṭiḥ | jayasi | śravaḥ | br̥hat ||9.83.5||

IAST: rājā pavitraratho vājam āruhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭir jayasi śravo bṛhat
Griffith: King, on thy chariot-sieve thou goest up to war, and with a thousand weapons winnest lofty fame.
Devanāgarī: राजा पवित्ररथो वाजमारुहः सहस्रभृष्टिर्जयसि श्रवो बृहत्
pada pāṭha: haviḥ | haviṣmaḥ | mahi | sadma | daivyam | nabhaḥ | vasānaḥ | pari | yāsi | adhvaram || rājā | pavitra-rathaḥ | vājam | ā | aruhaḥ | sahasra-bhr̥ṣṭiḥ | jayasi | śravaḥ | br̥hat ||9.83.5||

IAST: pavasva devamādano vicarṣaṇir apsā indrāya varuṇāya vāyave
Griffith: FLOW, cheering Gods, most active, winner of the flood, for Indra, and for Vayu, and for Varuna.
Devanāgarī: पवस्व देवमादनो विचर्षणिरप्सा इन्द्राय वरुणाय वायवे
pada pāṭha: pavasva | deva-mādanaḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ | apsāḥ | indrāya | varuṇāya | vāyave || kr̥dhi | naḥ | adya | varivaḥ | svasti-mat | uru-kṣitau | gr̥ṇīhi | daivyam | janam ||9.84.1||

IAST: kṛdhī no adya varivaḥ svastimad urukṣitau gṛṇīhi daivyaṁ janam
Griffith: Bestow on us to-day wide room with happiness, and in tbine ample dwelling laud the Host of Heaven.
Devanāgarī: कृधी नो अद्य वरिवः स्वस्तिमदुरुक्षितौ गृणीहि दैव्यं जनम्
pada pāṭha: pavasva | deva-mādanaḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ | apsāḥ | indrāya | varuṇāya | vāyave || kr̥dhi | naḥ | adya | varivaḥ | svasti-mat | uru-kṣitau | gr̥ṇīhi | daivyam | janam ||9.84.1||

IAST: ā yas tasthau bhuvanāny amartyo viśvāni somaḥ pari tāny arṣati
Griffith: He who hath come anear to creatures that have life, Immortal Soma flows onward to all of them.
Devanāgarī: आ यस्तस्थौ भुवनान्यमर्त्यो विश्वानि सोमः परि तान्यर्षति
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | tasthau | bhuvanāni | amartyaḥ | viśvāni | somaḥ | pari | tāni | arṣati || kr̥ṇvan | sam-cr̥tam | vi-cr̥tam | abhiṣṭaye | induḥ | sisakti | uṣasam | na | sūryaḥ ||9.84.2||

IAST: kṛṇvan saṁcṛtaṁ vicṛtam abhiṣṭaya induḥ siṣakty uṣasaṁ na sūryaḥ
Griffith: Effecting, for our aid, both union and release, Indu, like Surya, follows closely after Dawn.
Devanāgarī: कृण्वन्संचृतं विचृतमभिष्टय इन्दुः सिषक्त्युषसं न सूर्यः
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | tasthau | bhuvanāni | amartyaḥ | viśvāni | somaḥ | pari | tāni | arṣati || kr̥ṇvan | sam-cr̥tam | vi-cr̥tam | abhiṣṭaye | induḥ | sisakti | uṣasam | na | sūryaḥ ||9.84.2||

IAST: ā yo gobhiḥ sṛjyata oṣadhīṣv ā devānāṁ sumna iṣayann upāvasuḥ
Griffith: He who is poured with milk, he who within the plants hastes bringing treasure for the happiness of Gods,
Devanāgarī: आ यो गोभिः सृज्यत ओषधीष्वा देवानां सुम्न इषयन्नुपावसुः
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | gobhiḥ | sr̥jyate | oṣadhīṣu | ā | devānām | sumne | iṣayan | upa-vasuḥ || ā | vi-dyutā | pavate | dhārayā | sutaḥ | indram | somaḥ | mādayan | daivyam | janam ||9.84.3||

IAST: ā vidyutā pavate dhārayā suta indraṁ somo mādayan daivyaṁ janam
Griffith: He, poured forth in a stream flows with the lightning's flash, Soma who gladdens Indra and the Host of H
Devanāgarī: आ विद्युता पवते धारया सुत इन्द्रं सोमो मादयन्दैव्यं जनम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | gobhiḥ | sr̥jyate | oṣadhīṣu | ā | devānām | sumne | iṣayan | upa-vasuḥ || ā | vi-dyutā | pavate | dhārayā | sutaḥ | indram | somaḥ | mādayan | daivyam | janam ||9.84.3||

IAST: eṣa sya somaḥ pavate sahasrajid dhinvāno vācam iṣirām uṣarbudham
Griffith: Winner of thousands, he, this Soma, flows along, raising a vigorous voice that wakens with the dawn.
Devanāgarī: एष स्य सोमः पवते सहस्रजिद्धिन्वानो वाचमिषिरामुषर्बुधम्
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | somaḥ | pavate | sahasra-jit | hinvānaḥ | vācam | iṣirām | uṣaḥ-budham || induḥ | samudram | ut | iyarti | vāyu-bhiḥ | ā | indrasya | hārdi | kalaśeṣu | sīdati ||9.84.4||

IAST: induḥ samudram ud iyarti vāyubhir endrasya hārdi kalaśeṣu sīdati
Griffith: Indu with winds drives on the ocean of the air, he sinks within the jars, he rests in Indra's heart.
Devanāgarī: इन्दुः समुद्रमुदियर्ति वायुभिरेन्द्रस्य हार्दि कलशेषु सीदति
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | somaḥ | pavate | sahasra-jit | hinvānaḥ | vācam | iṣirām | uṣaḥ-budham || induḥ | samudram | ut | iyarti | vāyu-bhiḥ | ā | indrasya | hārdi | kalaśeṣu | sīdati ||9.84.4||

IAST: abhi tyaṁ gāvaḥ payasā payovṛdhaṁ somaṁ śrīṇanti matibhiḥ svarvidam
Griffith: The kine with milk dress him who makes the milk increase, Soma, amid the songs, who finds the light of hea
Devanāgarī: अभि त्यं गावः पयसा पयोवृधं सोमं श्रीणन्ति मतिभिः स्वर्विदम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | tyam | gāvaḥ | payasā | payaḥ-vr̥dham | somam | śrīṇanti | mati-bhiḥ | svaḥ-vidam || dhanam-jayaḥ | pavate | kr̥tvyaḥ | rasaḥ | vipraḥ | kaviḥ | kāvyena | svaḥ-canāḥ ||9.84.5||

IAST: dhanaṁjayaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso vipraḥ kaviḥ kāvyenā svarcanāḥ
Griffith: Winner of wealth, the effectual juice is flowing on, Singer and Sage by wisdom, dear as heaven itself.
Devanāgarī: धनंजयः पवते कृत्व्यो रसो विप्रः कविः काव्येना स्वर्चनाः
pada pāṭha: abhi | tyam | gāvaḥ | payasā | payaḥ-vr̥dham | somam | śrīṇanti | mati-bhiḥ | svaḥ-vidam || dhanam-jayaḥ | pavate | kr̥tvyaḥ | rasaḥ | vipraḥ | kaviḥ | kāvyena | svaḥ-canāḥ ||9.84.5||

IAST: indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari sravāpāmīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha
Griffith: I. FLOW on to Indra, Soma, carefully effused: let sickness stay afar together with the fiends.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय सोम सुषुतः परि स्रवापामीवा भवतु रक्षसा सह
pada pāṭha: indrāya | soma | su-sutaḥ | pari | srava | apa | amīvā | bhavatu | rakṣasā | saha || mā | te | rasasya | matsata | dvayāvinaḥ | draviṇasvantaḥ | iha | santu | indavaḥ ||9.85.1||

IAST: mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvino draviṇasvanta iha santv indavaḥ
Griffith: Let not the double-tongued delight them with thy juice. here be thy flowing drops laden with opulence.
Devanāgarī: मा ते रसस्य मत्सत द्वयाविनो द्रविणस्वन्त इह सन्त्विन्दवः
pada pāṭha: indrāya | soma | su-sutaḥ | pari | srava | apa | amīvā | bhavatu | rakṣasā | saha || mā | te | rasasya | matsata | dvayāvinaḥ | draviṇasvantaḥ | iha | santu | indavaḥ ||9.85.1||

IAST: asmān samarye pavamāna codaya dakṣo devānām asi hi priyo madaḥ
Griffith: O Pavamana, urge us forward in the fight thou art the vigour of the Gods, the well-loved drink.
Devanāgarī: अस्मान्समर्ये पवमान चोदय दक्षो देवानामसि हि प्रियो मदः
pada pāṭha: asmān | sa-marye | pavamāna | codaya | dakṣaḥ | devānām | asi | hi | priyaḥ | madaḥ || jahi | śatrūn | abhi | ā | bhandanā-yataḥ | piba | indra | somam | ava | naḥ | mr̥dhaḥ | jahi ||9.85.2||

IAST: jahi śatrūm̐r abhy ā bhandanāyataḥ pibendra somam ava no mṛdho jahi
Griffith: Smite thou our enemies who raise the shout of joy: Indra, drink Soma juice, and drive away our foes.
Devanāgarī: जहि शत्रूँरभ्या भन्दनायतः पिबेन्द्र सोममव नो मृधो जहि
pada pāṭha: asmān | sa-marye | pavamāna | codaya | dakṣaḥ | devānām | asi | hi | priyaḥ | madaḥ || jahi | śatrūn | abhi | ā | bhandanā-yataḥ | piba | indra | somam | ava | naḥ | mr̥dhaḥ | jahi ||9.85.2||

IAST: adabdha indo pavase madintama ātmendrasya bhavasi dhāsir uttamaḥ
Griffith: Unharmed, best Cheerer, thou, O Indu, flowest on: thou, even thou thyself, art Indra's noblest food.
Devanāgarī: अदब्ध इन्दो पवसे मदिन्तम आत्मेन्द्रस्य भवसि धासिरुत्तमः
pada pāṭha: adabdhaḥ | indo iti | pavase | madin-tamaḥ | ātmā | indrasya | bhavasi | dhāsiḥ | ut-tamaḥ || abhi | svaranti | bahavaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | rājānam | asya | bhuvanasya | niṁsate ||9.85.3||

IAST: abhi svaranti bahavo manīṣiṇo rājānam asya bhuvanasya niṁsate
Griffith: Full many a wise man lifts to thee the song of praise, and hails thee with a kiss as Sovran of this worl
Devanāgarī: अभि स्वरन्ति बहवो मनीषिणो राजानमस्य भुवनस्य निंसते
pada pāṭha: adabdhaḥ | indo iti | pavase | madin-tamaḥ | ātmā | indrasya | bhavasi | dhāsiḥ | ut-tamaḥ || abhi | svaranti | bahavaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | rājānam | asya | bhuvanasya | niṁsate ||9.85.3||

IAST: sahasraṇīthaḥ śatadhāro adbhuta indrāyenduḥ pavate kāmyam madhu
Griffith: Wondrous, with hundred streams, hymned in a thousand songs, Indu pours out for Indra his delightrul meath
Devanāgarī: सहस्रणीथः शतधारो अद्भुत इन्द्रायेन्दुः पवते काम्यं मधु
pada pāṭha: sahasra-nīthaḥ | śata-dhāraḥ | adbhutaḥ | indrāya | induḥ | pavate | kāmyam | madhu || jayan | kṣetram | abhi | arṣa | jayan | apaḥ | urum | naḥ | gātum | kr̥ṇu | soma | mīḍhvaḥ ||9.85.4||

IAST: jayan kṣetram abhy arṣā jayann apa uruṁ no gātuṁ kṛṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ
Griffith: Winning us land and waters, flow thou hitherward: Rainer of bounties, Soma, make broad way for us.
Devanāgarī: जयन्क्षेत्रमभ्यर्षा जयन्नप उरुं नो गातुं कृणु सोम मीढ्वः
pada pāṭha: sahasra-nīthaḥ | śata-dhāraḥ | adbhutaḥ | indrāya | induḥ | pavate | kāmyam | madhu || jayan | kṣetram | abhi | arṣa | jayan | apaḥ | urum | naḥ | gātum | kr̥ṇu | soma | mīḍhvaḥ ||9.85.4||

IAST: kanikradat kalaśe gobhir ajyase vy avyayaṁ samayā vāram arṣasi
Griffith: Roaring within the beaker thou art balmed with milk: thou passest through the fleecy filter all at once.
pada pāṭha: kanikradat | kalaśe | gobhiḥ | ajyase | vi | avyayam | samayā | vāram | arṣasi || marmr̥jyamānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | sānasiḥ | indrasya | soma | jaṭhare | sam | akṣaraḥ ||9.85.5||

IAST: marmṛjyamāno atyo na sānasir indrasya soma jaṭhare sam akṣaraḥ
Griffith: Carefully cleansed and decked like a prizewinning steed, O Soma, thou hast flowed down within Indra's t
Devanāgarī: मर्मृज्यमानो अत्यो न सानसिरिन्द्रस्य सोम जठरे समक्षरः
pada pāṭha: kanikradat | kalaśe | gobhiḥ | ajyase | vi | avyayam | samayā | vāram | arṣasi || marmr̥jyamānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | sānasiḥ | indrasya | soma | jaṭhare | sam | akṣaraḥ ||9.85.5||

IAST: svāduḥ pavasva divyāya janmane svādur indrāya suhavītunāmne
Griffith: Flow onward sweet of flavour for the Heavenly Race, for Indra sweet, whose name is easily invoked:
Devanāgarī: स्वादुः पवस्व दिव्याय जन्मने स्वादुरिन्द्राय सुहवीतुनाम्ने
pada pāṭha: svāduḥ | pavasva | divyāya | janmane | svāduḥ | indrāya | suhavītu-nāmne || svāduḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | vāyave | br̥haspataye | madhu-mān | adābhyaḥ ||9.85.6||

IAST: svādur mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave bṛhaspataye madhumām̐ adābhyaḥ
Griffith: Flow sweet for Mitra, Varuna, and Vayu, rich in meath, inviolable for Brhaspati.
Devanāgarī: स्वादुर्मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे बृहस्पतये मधुमाँ अदाभ्यः
pada pāṭha: svāduḥ | pavasva | divyāya | janmane | svāduḥ | indrāya | suhavītu-nāmne || svāduḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | vāyave | br̥haspataye | madhu-mān | adābhyaḥ ||9.85.6||

IAST: atyam mṛjanti kalaśe daśa kṣipaḥ pra viprāṇām matayo vāca īrate
Griffith: Ten rapid fingers deck the Courser in the jar: with hymns the holy singers send their voices forth.
Devanāgarī: अत्यं मृजन्ति कलशे दश क्षिपः प्र विप्राणां मतयो वाच ईरते
pada pāṭha: atyam | mr̥janti | kalaśe | daśa | kṣipaḥ | pra | viprāṇām | matayaḥ | vācaḥ | īrate || pavamānāḥ | abhi | arṣanti | su-stutim | ā | indram | viśanti | madirāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||9.85.7||

IAST: pavamānā abhy arṣanti suṣṭutim endraṁ viśanti madirāsa indavaḥ
Griffith: The filtering juices hasten to their eulogy, the drops that gladden find their way to Indra's heart.
Devanāgarī: पवमाना अभ्यर्षन्ति सुष्टुतिमेन्द्रं विशन्ति मदिरास इन्दवः
pada pāṭha: atyam | mr̥janti | kalaśe | daśa | kṣipaḥ | pra | viprāṇām | matayaḥ | vācaḥ | īrate || pavamānāḥ | abhi | arṣanti | su-stutim | ā | indram | viśanti | madirāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||9.85.7||

IAST: pavamāno abhy arṣā suvīryam urvīṁ gavyūtim mahi śarma saprathaḥ
Griffith: While thou art purified pour on us hero strength, great, far-extended shelter, spacious pasturage.
Devanāgarī: पवमानो अभ्यर्षा सुवीर्यमुर्वीं गव्यूतिं महि शर्म सप्रथः
pada pāṭha: pavamānaḥ | abhi | arṣa | su-vīryam | urvīm | gavyūtim | mahi | śarma | sa-prathaḥ || mākiḥ | naḥ | asya | pari-sūtiḥ | īśata | indo iti | jayema | tvayā | dhanam-dhanam ||9.85.8||

IAST: mākir no asya pariṣūtir īśatendo jayema tvayā dhanaṁ-dhanam
Griffith: Let no oppression master this our holy work: may we, O Indu, gain all opulence through thee.
Devanāgarī: माकिर्नो अस्य परिषूतिरीशतेन्दो जयेम त्वया धनंधनम्
pada pāṭha: pavamānaḥ | abhi | arṣa | su-vīryam | urvīm | gavyūtim | mahi | śarma | sa-prathaḥ || mākiḥ | naḥ | asya | pari-sūtiḥ | īśata | indo iti | jayema | tvayā | dhanam-dhanam ||9.85.8||

IAST: adhi dyām asthād vṛṣabho vicakṣaṇo 'rūrucad vi divo rocanā kaviḥ
Griffith: The Steer who sees afar hath risen above the sky: the Sage hath caused the lights of heaven to give their
Devanāgarī: अधि द्यामस्थाद्वृषभो विचक्षणोऽरूरुचद्वि दिवो रोचना कविः
pada pāṭha: adhi | dyām | asthāt | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | arūrucat | vi | divaḥ | rocanā | kaviḥ || rājā | pavitram | ati | eti | roruvat | divaḥ | pīyūṣam | duhate | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ ||9.85.9||

IAST: rājā pavitram aty eti roruvad divaḥ pīyūṣaṁ duhate nṛcakṣasaḥ
Griffith: The. King is passing through the filter with a roar: they drain the milk of heaven from him who looks o
Devanāgarī: राजा पवित्रमत्येति रोरुवद्दिवः पीयूषं दुहते नृचक्षसः
pada pāṭha: adhi | dyām | asthāt | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | arūrucat | vi | divaḥ | rocanā | kaviḥ || rājā | pavitram | ati | eti | roruvat | divaḥ | pīyūṣam | duhate | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ ||9.85.9||

IAST: divo nāke madhujihvā asaścato venā duhanty ukṣaṇaṁ giriṣṭhām
Griffith: High in the vault of heaven, unceasing, honey-tongued, the Loving Ones drain out the mountain-haunting S
Devanāgarī: दिवो नाके मधुजिह्वा असश्चतो वेना दुहन्त्युक्षणं गिरिष्ठाम्
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | nāke | madhu-jihvāḥ | asaścataḥ | venāḥ | duhanti | ukṣaṇam | giri-sthām || ap-su | drapsam | vavr̥dhānam | samudre | ā | sindhoḥ | ūrmā | madhu-mantam | pavitre | ā ||9.85.10||

IAST: apsu drapsaṁ vāvṛdhānaṁ samudra ā sindhor ūrmā madhumantam pavitra ā
Griffith: The drop that hath grown great in waters, in the lake meath-rich, in the stream's wave and in the cleans
Devanāgarī: अप्सु द्रप्सं वावृधानं समुद्र आ सिन्धोरूर्मा मधुमन्तं पवित्र आ
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | nāke | madhu-jihvāḥ | asaścataḥ | venāḥ | duhanti | ukṣaṇam | giri-sthām || ap-su | drapsam | vavr̥dhānam | samudre | ā | sindhoḥ | ūrmā | madhu-mantam | pavitre | ā ||9.85.10||

IAST: nāke suparṇam upapaptivāṁsaṁ giro venānām akṛpanta pūrvīḥ
Griffith: The Loving Ones besought with many voices the Eagle who had flown away to heaven.
pada pāṭha: nāke | su-parṇam | upapapti-vāṁsam | giraḥ | venānām | akr̥panta | pūrvīḥ || śiśum | rihanti | matayaḥ | panipnatam | hiraṇyayam | śakunam | kṣāmaṇi | sthām ||9.85.11||

IAST: śiśuṁ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṁ hiraṇyayaṁ śakunaṁ kṣāmaṇi sthām
Griffith: Hymns kiss the Youngling worthy of laudation, resting on earth, the Bird of golden colour.
Devanāgarī: शिशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतं हिरण्ययं शकुनं क्षामणि स्थाम्
pada pāṭha: nāke | su-parṇam | upapapti-vāṁsam | giraḥ | venānām | akr̥panta | pūrvīḥ || śiśum | rihanti | matayaḥ | panipnatam | hiraṇyayam | śakunam | kṣāmaṇi | sthām ||9.85.11||

IAST: ūrdhvo gandharvo adhi nāke asthād viśvā rūpā praticakṣāṇo asya
Griffith: High to heaven's vault hath the Gandharva risen, beholding all his varied forms and figures.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वो गन्धर्वो अधि नाके अस्थाद्विश्वा रूपा प्रतिचक्षाणो अस्य
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | gandharvaḥ | adhi | nāke | asthāt | viśvā | rūpā | prati-cakṣāṇaḥ | asya || bhānuḥ | śukreṇa | śociṣā | vi | adyaut | pra | arūrucat | rodasī iti | mātarā | śuciḥ ||9.85.12||

IAST: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā vy adyaut prārūrucad rodasī mātarā śuciḥ
Griffith: His ray hath shone abroad with gleaming splendour: pure, he hath lighted both the worlds, the Parents.
Devanāgarī: भानुः शुक्रेण शोचिषा व्यद्यौत्प्रारूरुचद्रोदसी मातरा शुचिः
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | gandharvaḥ | adhi | nāke | asthāt | viśvā | rūpā | prati-cakṣāṇaḥ | asya || bhānuḥ | śukreṇa | śociṣā | vi | adyaut | pra | arūrucat | rodasī iti | mātarā | śuciḥ ||9.85.12||

IAST: pra ta āśavaḥ pavamāna dhījavo madā arṣanti raghujā iva tmanā
Griffith: THY gladdening draughts, O Pavamana, urged by song flow swiftly of themselves like sons of fleet-foot mare
Devanāgarī: प्र त आशवः पवमान धीजवो मदा अर्षन्ति रघुजा इव त्मना
pada pāṭha: pra | te | āśavaḥ | pavamāna | dhī-javaḥ | madāḥ | arṣanti | raghujāḥ-iva | tmanā || divyāḥ | su-parṇāḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | indavaḥ | madin-tamāsaḥ | pari | kośam | āsate ||9.86.1||

IAST: divyāḥ suparṇā madhumanta indavo madintamāsaḥ pari kośam āsate
Griffith: The drops of Soma juice, those eagles of the heavens, most cheering, rich in meath, rest in the reservoi
Devanāgarī: दिव्याः सुपर्णा मधुमन्त इन्दवो मदिन्तमासः परि कोशमासते
pada pāṭha: pra | te | āśavaḥ | pavamāna | dhī-javaḥ | madāḥ | arṣanti | raghujāḥ-iva | tmanā || divyāḥ | su-parṇāḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | indavaḥ | madin-tamāsaḥ | pari | kośam | āsate ||9.86.1||

IAST: pra te madāso madirāsa āśavo 'sṛkṣata rathyāso yathā pṛthak
Griffith: As rapid chariot-steeds, so turned in several ways have thine exhilarating juices darted forth,
Devanāgarī: प्र ते मदासो मदिरास आशवोऽसृक्षत रथ्यासो यथा पृथक्
pada pāṭha: pra | te | madāsaḥ | madirāsaḥ | āśavaḥ | asr̥kṣata | rathyāsaḥ | yathā | pr̥thak || dhenuḥ | na | vatsam | payasā | abhi | vajriṇam | indram | indavaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | ūrmayaḥ ||9.86.2||

IAST: dhenur na vatsam payasābhi vajriṇam indram indavo madhumanta ūrmayaḥ
Griffith: Soma-drops rich in meath, waves, to the Thunder-armed, to Indra, like milch-kine who seek their calf wi
Devanāgarī: धेनुर्न वत्सं पयसाभि वज्रिणमिन्द्रमिन्दवो मधुमन्त ऊर्मयः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | madāsaḥ | madirāsaḥ | āśavaḥ | asr̥kṣata | rathyāsaḥ | yathā | pr̥thak || dhenuḥ | na | vatsam | payasā | abhi | vajriṇam | indram | indavaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | ūrmayaḥ ||9.86.2||

IAST: atyo na hiyāno abhi vājam arṣa svarvit kośaṁ divo adrimātaram
Griffith: Like a steed urged to battle, finder of the light; speed onward to the cloud-born reservoir of heaven,
Devanāgarī: अत्यो न हियानो अभि वाजमर्ष स्वर्वित्कोशं दिवो अद्रिमातरम्
pada pāṭha: atyaḥ | na | hiyānaḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa | svaḥ-vit | kośam | divaḥ | adri-mātaram || vr̥ṣā | pavitre | adhi | sānau | avyaye | somaḥ | punānaḥ | indriyāya | dhāyase ||9.86.3||

IAST: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avyaye somaḥ punāna indriyāya dhāyase
Griffith: A Steer that o'er the woolly surface seeks the sieve, Soma while purified for Indra's nourishment.
Devanāgarī: वृषा पवित्रे अधि सानो अव्यये सोमः पुनान इन्द्रियाय धायसे
pada pāṭha: atyaḥ | na | hiyānaḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa | svaḥ-vit | kośam | divaḥ | adri-mātaram || vr̥ṣā | pavitre | adhi | sānau | avyaye | somaḥ | punānaḥ | indriyāya | dhāyase ||9.86.3||

IAST: pra ta āśvinīḥ pavamāna dhījuvo divyā asṛgran payasā dharīmaṇi
Griffith: Fleet as swift steeds, thy drops, divine, thought-swift, have been, O Pavamana, poured with milk into the
Devanāgarī: प्र त आश्विनीः पवमान धीजुवो दिव्या असृग्रन्पयसा धरीमणि
pada pāṭha: pra | te | āśvinīḥ | pavamāna | dhī-juvaḥ | divyāḥ | asr̥gran | payasā | dharīmaṇi || pra | antaḥ | r̥ṣayaḥ | sthāvirīḥ | asr̥kṣata | ye | tvā | mr̥janti | r̥ṣi-sāna | vedhasaḥ ||9.86.4||

IAST: prāntar ṛṣayaḥ sthāvirīr asṛkṣata ye tvā mṛjanty ṛṣiṣāṇa vedhasaḥ
Griffith: The Rsis have poured in continuous Soma drops, ordainers who adorn thee, Friend whom Rsis love.
Devanāgarī: प्रान्तरृषयः स्थाविरीरसृक्षत ये त्वा मृजन्त्यृषिषाण वेधसः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | āśvinīḥ | pavamāna | dhī-juvaḥ | divyāḥ | asr̥gran | payasā | dharīmaṇi || pra | antaḥ | r̥ṣayaḥ | sthāvirīḥ | asr̥kṣata | ye | tvā | mr̥janti | r̥ṣi-sāna | vedhasaḥ ||9.86.4||

IAST: viśvā dhāmāni viśvacakṣa ṛbhvasaḥ prabhos te sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ
Griffith: O thou who seest all things, Sovran as thou art and passing strong, thy rays encompass all abodes.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा धामानि विश्वचक्ष ऋभ्वसः प्रभोस्ते सतः परि यन्ति केतवः
pada pāṭha: viśvā | dhāmāni | viśva-cakṣaḥ | r̥bhvasaḥ | pra-bhoḥ | te | sataḥ | pari | yanti | ketavaḥ || vi-ānaśiḥ | pavase | soma | dharma-bhiḥ | patiḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājasi ||9.86.5||

IAST: vyānaśiḥ pavase soma dharmabhiḥ patir viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
Griffith: Pervading with thy natural powers thou flowest on, and as the whole world's Lord, O Soma, thou art King
Devanāgarī: व्यानशिः पवसे सोम धर्मभिः पतिर्विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसि
pada pāṭha: viśvā | dhāmāni | viśva-cakṣaḥ | r̥bhvasaḥ | pra-bhoḥ | te | sataḥ | pari | yanti | ketavaḥ || vi-ānaśiḥ | pavase | soma | dharma-bhiḥ | patiḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājasi ||9.86.5||

IAST: ubhayataḥ pavamānasya raśmayo dhruvasya sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ
Griffith: The beams of Pavamana, sent from earth and heaven, his ensigns who is ever steadfast, travel round.
Devanāgarī: उभयतः पवमानस्य रश्मयो ध्रुवस्य सतः परि यन्ति केतवः
pada pāṭha: ubhayataḥ | pavamānasya | raśmayaḥ | dhruvasya | sataḥ | pari | yanti | ketavaḥ || yadi | pavitre | adhi | mr̥jyate | hariḥ | sattā | ni | yonā | kalaśeṣu | sīdati ||9.86.6||

IAST: yadī pavitre adhi mṛjyate hariḥ sattā ni yonā kalaśeṣu sīdati
Griffith: When on the sieve the Golden-hued is cleansed, he rests within the vats as one who seats him in his plac
Devanāgarī: यदी पवित्रे अधि मृज्यते हरिः सत्ता नि योना कलशेषु सीदति
pada pāṭha: ubhayataḥ | pavamānasya | raśmayaḥ | dhruvasya | sataḥ | pari | yanti | ketavaḥ || yadi | pavitre | adhi | mr̥jyate | hariḥ | sattā | ni | yonā | kalaśeṣu | sīdati ||9.86.6||

IAST: yajñasya ketuḥ pavate svadhvaraḥ somo devānām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
Griffith: Served with fair rites he flows, ensign of sacrifice: Soma advances to the special place of Gods.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञस्य केतुः पवते स्वध्वरः सोमो देवानामुप याति निष्कृतम्
pada pāṭha: yajñasya | ketuḥ | pavate | su-adhvaraḥ | somaḥ | devānām | upa | yāti | niḥ-kr̥tam || sahasra-dhāraḥ | pari | kośam | arṣati | vr̥ṣā | pavitram | ati | eti | roruvat ||9.86.7||

IAST: sahasradhāraḥ pari kośam arṣati vṛṣā pavitram aty eti roruvat
Griffith: He speeds with thousand currents to the reservoir, and passes through the filter bellowing as a bull.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारः परि कोशमर्षति वृषा पवित्रमत्येति रोरुवत्
pada pāṭha: yajñasya | ketuḥ | pavate | su-adhvaraḥ | somaḥ | devānām | upa | yāti | niḥ-kr̥tam || sahasra-dhāraḥ | pari | kośam | arṣati | vr̥ṣā | pavitram | ati | eti | roruvat ||9.86.7||

IAST: rājā samudraṁ nadyo vi gāhate 'pām ūrmiṁ sacate sindhuṣu śritaḥ
Griffith: The Sovran dips him in the seain and the streams, and set in rivers with the waters' wave moves on.
Devanāgarī: राजा समुद्रं नद्यो वि गाहतेऽपामूर्मिं सचते सिन्धुषु श्रितः
pada pāṭha: rājā | samudram | nadyaḥ | vi | gāhate | apām | ūrmim | sacate | sindhuṣu | śritaḥ || adhi | asthāt | sānu | pavamānaḥ | avyayam | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | dharuṇaḥ | mahaḥ | divaḥ ||9.86.8||

IAST: adhy asthāt sānu pavamāno avyayaṁ nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divaḥ
Griffith: High heaven's Sustainer at the central point of earth, raised on the fleecy surface Pavamana stands.
Devanāgarī: अध्यस्थात्सानु पवमानो अव्ययं नाभा पृथिव्या धरुणो महो दिवः
pada pāṭha: rājā | samudram | nadyaḥ | vi | gāhate | apām | ūrmim | sacate | sindhuṣu | śritaḥ || adhi | asthāt | sānu | pavamānaḥ | avyayam | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | dharuṇaḥ | mahaḥ | divaḥ ||9.86.8||

IAST: divo na sānu stanayann acikradad dyauś ca yasya pṛthivī ca dharmabhiḥ
Griffith: He on whose high decree the heavens and earth depend nath roared and thundered like the summit of the sky
Devanāgarī: दिवो न सानु स्तनयन्नचिक्रदद्द्यौश्च यस्य पृथिवी च धर्मभिः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | na | sānu | stanayan | acikradat | dyauḥ | ca | yasya | pr̥thivī | ca | dharma-bhiḥ || indrasya | sakhyam | pavate | vi-vevidat | somaḥ | punānaḥ | kalaśeṣu | sīdati ||9.86.9||

IAST: indrasya sakhyam pavate vivevidat somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati
Griffith: Soma flows on obtaining Indra's friendly love, and, as they purify him, settles in the jars.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य सख्यं पवते विवेविदत्सोमः पुनानः कलशेषु सीदति
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | na | sānu | stanayan | acikradat | dyauḥ | ca | yasya | pr̥thivī | ca | dharma-bhiḥ || indrasya | sakhyam | pavate | vi-vevidat | somaḥ | punānaḥ | kalaśeṣu | sīdati ||9.86.9||

IAST: jyotir yajñasya pavate madhu priyam pitā devānāṁ janitā vibhūvasuḥ
Griffith: He, light of sacrifice distils delicious meath, most wealthy, Father and begetter of the Gods.
Devanāgarī: ज्योतिर्यज्ञस्य पवते मधु प्रियं पिता देवानां जनिता विभूवसुः
pada pāṭha: jyotiḥ | yajñasya | pavate | madhu | priyam | pitā | devānām | janitā | vibhu-vasuḥ || dadhāti | ratnam | svadhayoḥ | apīcyam | madin-tamaḥ | matsaraḥ | indriyaḥ | rasaḥ ||9.86.10||

IAST: dadhāti ratnaṁ svadhayor apīcyam madintamo matsara indriyo rasaḥ
Griffith: He, gladdening, best of Cheerers, juice!hat Indra loves, enriches with mysterious treasure earth and hea
Devanāgarī: दधाति रत्नं स्वधयोरपीच्यं मदिन्तमो मत्सर इन्द्रियो रसः
pada pāṭha: jyotiḥ | yajñasya | pavate | madhu | priyam | pitā | devānām | janitā | vibhu-vasuḥ || dadhāti | ratnam | svadhayoḥ | apīcyam | madin-tamaḥ | matsaraḥ | indriyaḥ | rasaḥ ||9.86.10||

IAST: abhikrandan kalaśaṁ vājy arṣati patir divaḥ śatadhāro vicakṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: The vigorous and far-seeing one, the Lord of heaven, flows, shouting to the beaker, with his thousand st
pada pāṭha: abhi-krandan | kalaśam | vājī | arṣati | patiḥ | divaḥ | śata-dhāraḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ || hariḥ | mitrasya | sadaneṣu | sīdati | marmr̥jānaḥ | avi-bhiḥ | sindhu-bhiḥ | vr̥ṣā ||9.86.11||

IAST: harir mitrasya sadaneṣu sīdati marmṛjāno 'vibhiḥ sindhubhir vṛṣā
Griffith: Coloured like gold he rests in seats where Mitra dwells, the Steer made beautiful by rivers and by shee
pada pāṭha: abhi-krandan | kalaśam | vājī | arṣati | patiḥ | divaḥ | śata-dhāraḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ || hariḥ | mitrasya | sadaneṣu | sīdati | marmr̥jānaḥ | avi-bhiḥ | sindhu-bhiḥ | vr̥ṣā ||9.86.11||

IAST: agre sindhūnām pavamāno arṣaty agre vāco agriyo goṣu gacchati
Griffith: In forefront of the rivers Pavamana speeds, in forefront of the hymn, foremost among the kine.
Devanāgarī: अग्रे सिन्धूनां पवमानो अर्षत्यग्रे वाचो अग्रियो गोषु गच्छति
pada pāṭha: agre | sindhūnām | pavamānaḥ | arṣati | agre | vācaḥ | agriyaḥ | goṣu | gacchati || agre | vājasya | bhajate | mahā-dhanam | su-āyudhaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ | pūyate | vr̥ṣā ||9.86.12||

IAST: agre vājasya bhajate mahādhanaṁ svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyate vṛṣā
Griffith: He shares the mighty booty in the van of war: the well-armed Steer is purified by worshippers.
Devanāgarī: अग्रे वाजस्य भजते महाधनं स्वायुधः सोतृभिः पूयते वृषा
pada pāṭha: agre | sindhūnām | pavamānaḥ | arṣati | agre | vācaḥ | agriyaḥ | goṣu | gacchati || agre | vājasya | bhajate | mahā-dhanam | su-āyudhaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ | pūyate | vr̥ṣā ||9.86.12||

IAST: ayam matavāñ chakuno yathā hito 'vye sasāra pavamāna ūrmiṇā
Griffith: This heedful Pavamana, like a bird sent forth, hath with his wave flowed onward to the fleecy sieve.
Devanāgarī: अयं मतवाञ्छकुनो यथा हितोऽव्ये ससार पवमान ऊर्मिणा
pada pāṭha: ayam | mata-vān | śakunaḥ | yathā | hitaḥ | avye | sasāra | pavamānaḥ | ūrmiṇā || tava | kratvā | rodasī iti | antarā | kave | śuciḥ | dhiyā | pavate | somaḥ | indra | te ||9.86.13||

IAST: tava kratvā rodasī antarā kave śucir dhiyā pavate soma indra te
Griffith: O Indra, through thy wisdom, b thy thought, O Sage, Soma flows bright and pure between the earth and hea
Devanāgarī: तव क्रत्वा रोदसी अन्तरा कवे शुचिर्धिया पवते सोम इन्द्र ते
pada pāṭha: ayam | mata-vān | śakunaḥ | yathā | hitaḥ | avye | sasāra | pavamānaḥ | ūrmiṇā || tava | kratvā | rodasī iti | antarā | kave | śuciḥ | dhiyā | pavate | somaḥ | indra | te ||9.86.13||

IAST: drāpiṁ vasāno yajato divispṛśam antarikṣaprā bhuvaneṣv arpitaḥ
Griffith: He, clad in mail that reaches heaven, the Holy One, filling the firmament stationed amid the worlds,
pada pāṭha: drāpim | vasānaḥ | yajataḥ | divi-spr̥śam | antarikṣa-prāḥ | bhuvaneṣu | arpitaḥ || svaḥ | jajñānaḥ | nabhasā | abhi | akramīt | pratnam | asya | pitaram | ā | vivāsati ||9.86.14||

IAST: svar jajñāno nabhasābhy akramīt pratnam asya pitaram ā vivāsati
Griffith: Knowing. the realm of light, hath come to us in rain: he summons to himself his own primeval Sire.
pada pāṭha: drāpim | vasānaḥ | yajataḥ | divi-spr̥śam | antarikṣa-prāḥ | bhuvaneṣu | arpitaḥ || svaḥ | jajñānaḥ | nabhasā | abhi | akramīt | pratnam | asya | pitaram | ā | vivāsati ||9.86.14||

IAST: so asya viśe mahi śarma yacchati yo asya dhāma prathamaṁ vyānaśe
Griffith: He who was first of all to penetrate his form bestowed upon his race wide shelter and defence.
Devanāgarī: सो अस्य विशे महि शर्म यच्छति यो अस्य धाम प्रथमं व्यानशे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | asya | viśe | mahi | śarma | yacchati | yaḥ | asya | dhāma | prathamam | vi-ānaśe || padam | yat | asya | parame | vi-omani | ataḥ | viśvāḥ | abhi | sam | yāti | sam-yataḥ ||9.86.15||

IAST: padaṁ yad asya parame vyomany ato viśvā abhi saṁ yāti saṁyataḥ
Griffith: From that high station which he hath in loftiest heaven he comes victorious to all encounters here.
Devanāgarī: पदं यदस्य परमे व्योमन्यतो विश्वा अभि सं याति संयतः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | asya | viśe | mahi | śarma | yacchati | yaḥ | asya | dhāma | prathamam | vi-ānaśe || padam | yat | asya | parame | vi-omani | ataḥ | viśvāḥ | abhi | sam | yāti | sam-yataḥ ||9.86.15||

IAST: pro ayāsīd indur indrasya niṣkṛtaṁ sakhā sakhyur na pra mināti saṁgiram
Griffith: Indu hath started for Indra's special place and slights not as a Friend the promise of his Friend.
Devanāgarī: प्रो अयासीदिन्दुरिन्द्रस्य निष्कृतं सखा सख्युर्न प्र मिनाति संगिरम्
pada pāṭha: pro iti | ayāsīt | induḥ | indrasya | niḥ-kr̥tam | sakhā | sakhyuḥ | na | pra | mināti | sam-giram || maryaḥ-iva | yuvati-bhiḥ | sam | arṣati | somaḥ | kalaśe | śata-yāmnā | pathā ||9.86.16||

IAST: marya iva yuvatibhiḥ sam arṣati somaḥ kalaśe śatayāmnā pathā
Griffith: Soma speeds onward like a youth to youtlitial maids, and gains the beaker by a course of bundred paths.
Devanāgarī: मर्य इव युवतिभिः समर्षति सोमः कलशे शतयाम्ना पथा
pada pāṭha: pro iti | ayāsīt | induḥ | indrasya | niḥ-kr̥tam | sakhā | sakhyuḥ | na | pra | mināti | sam-giram || maryaḥ-iva | yuvati-bhiḥ | sam | arṣati | somaḥ | kalaśe | śata-yāmnā | pathā ||9.86.16||

IAST: pra vo dhiyo mandrayuvo vipanyuvaḥ panasyuvaḥ saṁvasaneṣv akramuḥ
Griffith: Your songs, exhilarating, tuneful, uttering praise, are come into the placns where the people meet.
Devanāgarī: प्र वो धियो मन्द्रयुवो विपन्युवः पनस्युवः संवसनेष्वक्रमुः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | dhiyaḥ | mandra-yuvaḥ | vipanyuvaḥ | panasyuvaḥ | sam-vasaneṣu | akramuḥ || somam | manīṣāḥ | abhi | anūṣata | stubhaḥ | abhi | dhenavaḥ | payasā | īm | aśiśrayuḥ ||9.86.17||

IAST: somam manīṣā abhy anūṣata stubho 'bhi dhenavaḥ payasem aśiśrayuḥ
Griffith: Worshippers have exalted Soma with their hymns, and milch kine have come near to meet him with their mil
Devanāgarī: सोमं मनीषा अभ्यनूषत स्तुभोऽभि धेनवः पयसेमशिश्रयुः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | dhiyaḥ | mandra-yuvaḥ | vipanyuvaḥ | panasyuvaḥ | sam-vasaneṣu | akramuḥ || somam | manīṣāḥ | abhi | anūṣata | stubhaḥ | abhi | dhenavaḥ | payasā | īm | aśiśrayuḥ ||9.86.17||

IAST: ā naḥ soma saṁyatam pipyuṣīm iṣam indo pavasva pavamāno asridham
Griffith: O Soma, Indu, while they cleanse thee, pour on us accumulateds Plentiful, nutritious food,
Devanāgarī: आ नः सोम संयतं पिप्युषीमिषमिन्दो पवस्व पवमानो अस्रिधम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | soma | sam-yatam | pipyuṣīm | iṣam | indo iti | pavasva | pavamānaḥ | asridham || yā | naḥ | dohate | triḥ | ahan | asaścuṣī | kṣu-mat | vāja-vat | madhu-mat | su-vīryam ||9.86.18||

IAST: yā no dohate trir ahann asaścuṣī kṣumad vājavan madhumat suvīryam
Griffith: Which, ceaseless, thrice a day shall yield us hero power enriched with store of nourishment, and streng
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | soma | sam-yatam | pipyuṣīm | iṣam | indo iti | pavasva | pavamānaḥ | asridham || yā | naḥ | dohate | triḥ | ahan | asaścuṣī | kṣu-mat | vāja-vat | madhu-mat | su-vīryam ||9.86.18||

IAST: vṛṣā matīnām pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somo ahnaḥ pratarītoṣaso divaḥ
Griffith: Far-seeing Soma flows, the Steer, the Lord of hymns, the Furtherer of day, of morning, and of heaven.
Devanāgarī: वृषा मतीनां पवते विचक्षणः सोमो अह्नः प्रतरीतोषसो दिवः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | matīnām | pavate | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | somaḥ | ahnaḥ | pra-tarītā | uṣasaḥ | divaḥ || krāṇā | sindhūnām | kalaśān | avīvaśat | indrasya | hārdi | ā-viśan | manīṣi-bhiḥ ||9.86.19||

IAST: krāṇā sindhūnāṁ kalaśām̐ avīvaśad indrasya hārdy āviśan manīṣibhiḥ
Griffith: Mixt with the streams he caused the beakers to resound, and with the singers' aid they entered Indra's
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | matīnām | pavate | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | somaḥ | ahnaḥ | pra-tarītā | uṣasaḥ | divaḥ || krāṇā | sindhūnām | kalaśān | avīvaśat | indrasya | hārdi | ā-viśan | manīṣi-bhiḥ ||9.86.19||

IAST: manīṣibhiḥ pavate pūrvyaḥ kavir nṛbhir yataḥ pari kośām̐ acikradat
Griffith: On, with the prudent singers, flows the ancient Sage and guided by the men hath roared about the vats.
Devanāgarī: मनीषिभिः पवते पूर्व्यः कविर्नृभिर्यतः परि कोशाँ अचिक्रदत्
pada pāṭha: manīṣi-bhiḥ | pavate | pūrvyaḥ | kaviḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | pari | kośān | acikradat || tritasya | nāma | janayan | madhu | kṣarat | indrasya | vāyoḥ | sakhyāya | kartave ||9.86.20||

IAST: tritasya nāma janayan madhu kṣarad indrasya vāyoḥ sakhyāya kartave
Griffith: Producing Trita's name, may he pour forth the meath, that Vayu and that Indra may become his Friends.
Devanāgarī: त्रितस्य नाम जनयन्मधु क्षरदिन्द्रस्य वायोः सख्याय कर्तवे
pada pāṭha: manīṣi-bhiḥ | pavate | pūrvyaḥ | kaviḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | pari | kośān | acikradat || tritasya | nāma | janayan | madhu | kṣarat | indrasya | vāyoḥ | sakhyāya | kartave ||9.86.20||

IAST: ayam punāna uṣaso vi rocayad ayaṁ sindhubhyo abhavad u lokakṛt
Griffith: He, being purified, hath made the Mornings shine: this, even this is he who gave the rivers room.
Devanāgarī: अयं पुनान उषसो वि रोचयदयं सिन्धुभ्यो अभवदु लोककृत्
pada pāṭha: ayam | punānaḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi | rocayat | ayam | sindhu-bhyaḥ | abhavat | ūm̐ iti | loka-kr̥t || ayam | triḥ | sapta | duduhānaḥ | ā-śiram | somaḥ | hr̥de | pavate | cāru | matsaraḥ ||9.86.21||

IAST: ayaṁ triḥ sapta duduhāna āśiraṁ somo hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ
Griffith: He made the Three Times Seven pour out the milky flow: Soma, the Cheerer, yields whate'er the heart find
Devanāgarī: अयं त्रिः सप्त दुदुहान आशिरं सोमो हृदे पवते चारु मत्सरः
pada pāṭha: ayam | punānaḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi | rocayat | ayam | sindhu-bhyaḥ | abhavat | ūm̐ iti | loka-kr̥t || ayam | triḥ | sapta | duduhānaḥ | ā-śiram | somaḥ | hr̥de | pavate | cāru | matsaraḥ ||9.86.21||

IAST: pavasva soma divyeṣu dhāmasu sṛjāna indo kalaśe pavitra ā
Griffith: Flow, onward, Soma, in thine own celestial forms, flow, Indu, poured within the beaker and the sieve.
Devanāgarī: पवस्व सोम दिव्येषु धामसु सृजान इन्दो कलशे पवित्र आ
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | divyeṣu | dhāma-su | sr̥jānaḥ | indo iti | kalaśe | pavitre | ā || sīdan | indrasya | jaṭhare | kanikradat | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | sūryam | ā | arohayaḥ | divi ||9.86.22||

IAST: sīdann indrasya jaṭhare kanikradan nṛbhir yataḥ sūryam ārohayo divi
Griffith: Sinking into the throat of Indra with a roar, led by the men thou madest Surya mount to heaven.
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | divyeṣu | dhāma-su | sr̥jānaḥ | indo iti | kalaśe | pavitre | ā || sīdan | indrasya | jaṭhare | kanikradat | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | sūryam | ā | arohayaḥ | divi ||9.86.22||

IAST: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavase pavitra ām̐ indav indrasya jaṭhareṣv āviśan
Griffith: Pressed out with stones thou flowest onward to the sieve, O Indu, entering the depths of Indra's throat.
Devanāgarī: अद्रिभिः सुतः पवसे पवित्र आँ इन्दविन्द्रस्य जठरेष्वाविशन्
pada pāṭha: adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | pavase | pavitre | ā | indo iti | indrasya | jaṭhareṣu | ā-viśan || tvam | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | abhavaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇa | soma | gotram | aṅgiraḥ-bhyaḥ | avr̥ṇoḥ | apa ||9.86.23||

IAST: tvaṁ nṛcakṣā abhavo vicakṣaṇa soma gotram aṅgirobhyo 'vṛṇor apa
Griffith: Far-sighted Soma, now thou lookest on mankind: thou didst unbar the cowstall for the Angirases.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नृचक्षा अभवो विचक्षण सोम गोत्रमङ्गिरोभ्योऽवृणोरप
pada pāṭha: adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | pavase | pavitre | ā | indo iti | indrasya | jaṭhareṣu | ā-viśan || tvam | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | abhavaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇa | soma | gotram | aṅgiraḥ-bhyaḥ | avr̥ṇoḥ | apa ||9.86.23||

IAST: tvāṁ soma pavamānaṁ svādhyo 'nu viprāso amadann avasyavaḥ
Griffith: In thee, O Soma, while thou purifitedst thee, high-thoughted sages, seeking favour, have rejoiced.
Devanāgarī: त्वां सोम पवमानं स्वाध्योऽनु विप्रासो अमदन्नवस्यवः
pada pāṭha: tvām | soma | pavamānam | su-ādhyaḥ | anu | viprāsaḥ | amadan | avasyavaḥ || tvām | su-parṇaḥ | ā | abharat | divaḥ | pari | indo iti | viśvābhiḥ | mati-bhiḥ | pari-kr̥tam ||9.86.24||

IAST: tvāṁ suparṇa ābharad divas parīndo viśvābhir matibhiḥ pariṣkṛtam
Griffith: Down from the heavens the Falcon brought thee hitherward, even thee, O Indu, thee whom all our hymns ado
pada pāṭha: tvām | soma | pavamānam | su-ādhyaḥ | anu | viprāsaḥ | amadan | avasyavaḥ || tvām | su-parṇaḥ | ā | abharat | divaḥ | pari | indo iti | viśvābhiḥ | mati-bhiḥ | pari-kr̥tam ||9.86.24||

IAST: avye punānam pari vāra ūrmiṇā hariṁ navante abhi sapta dhenavaḥ
Griffith: Seven Milch-kine glorify the Tawny-coloured One while with his wave in wool he purifies himself.
Devanāgarī: अव्ये पुनानं परि वार ऊर्मिणा हरिं नवन्ते अभि सप्त धेनवः
pada pāṭha: avye | punānam | pari | vāre | ūrmiṇā | harim | navante | abhi | sapta | dhenavaḥ || apām | upa-sthe | adhi | āyavaḥ | kavim | r̥tasya | yonā | mahiṣāḥ | aheṣata ||9.86.25||

IAST: apām upasthe adhy āyavaḥ kavim ṛtasya yonā mahiṣā aheṣata
Griffith: The living men, the mighty, have impelled the Sage into the waters' lap, the place of sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: अपामुपस्थे अध्यायवः कविमृतस्य योना महिषा अहेषत
pada pāṭha: avye | punānam | pari | vāre | ūrmiṇā | harim | navante | abhi | sapta | dhenavaḥ || apām | upa-sthe | adhi | āyavaḥ | kavim | r̥tasya | yonā | mahiṣāḥ | aheṣata ||9.86.25||

IAST: induḥ punāno ati gāhate mṛdho viśvāni kṛṇvan supathāni yajyave
Griffith: Indu, attaining purity, plunges through the foe, making Ilis ways all easy for the pious man.
Devanāgarī: इन्दुः पुनानो अति गाहते मृधो विश्वानि कृण्वन्सुपथानि यज्यवे
pada pāṭha: induḥ | punānaḥ | ati | gāhate | mr̥dhaḥ | viśvāni | kr̥ṇvan | su-pathāni | yajyave || gāḥ | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | niḥ-nijam | haryataḥ | kaviḥ | atyaḥ | na | krīḷan | pari | vāram | arṣati ||9.86.26||

IAST: gāḥ kṛṇvāno nirṇijaṁ haryataḥ kavir atyo na krīḻan pari vāram arṣati
Griffith: Making the kine his mantle, he, the lovely Sage, runs like a sporting courser onward through the fleece
Devanāgarī: गाः कृण्वानो निर्णिजं हर्यतः कविरत्यो न क्रीळन्परि वारमर्षति
pada pāṭha: induḥ | punānaḥ | ati | gāhate | mr̥dhaḥ | viśvāni | kr̥ṇvan | su-pathāni | yajyave || gāḥ | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | niḥ-nijam | haryataḥ | kaviḥ | atyaḥ | na | krīḷan | pari | vāram | arṣati ||9.86.26||

IAST: asaścataḥ śatadhārā abhiśriyo hariṁ navante 'va tā udanyuvaḥ
Griffith: The ceaseless watery fountains with their hundred streams sing, as they hasten near, to him the Golden-h
Devanāgarī: असश्चतः शतधारा अभिश्रियो हरिं नवन्तेऽव ता उदन्युवः
pada pāṭha: asaścataḥ | śata-dhārāḥ | abhi-śriyaḥ | harim | navante | ava | tāḥ | udanyuvaḥ || kṣipaḥ | mr̥janti | pari | gobhiḥ | ā-vr̥tam | tr̥tīye | pr̥ṣṭhe | adhi | rocane | divaḥ ||9.86.27||

IAST: kṣipo mṛjanti pari gobhir āvṛtaṁ tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ
Griffith: Him, clad in robes of milk, swift fingers beautify on the third height and in the luminous realm of heav
Devanāgarī: क्षिपो मृजन्ति परि गोभिरावृतं तृतीये पृष्ठे अधि रोचने दिवः
pada pāṭha: asaścataḥ | śata-dhārāḥ | abhi-śriyaḥ | harim | navante | ava | tāḥ | udanyuvaḥ || kṣipaḥ | mr̥janti | pari | gobhiḥ | ā-vr̥tam | tr̥tīye | pr̥ṣṭhe | adhi | rocane | divaḥ ||9.86.27||

IAST: tavemāḥ prajā divyasya retasas tvaṁ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
Griffith: These are thy generations of celestial seed thou art the Sovran Lord of all the world of life.
Devanāgarī: तवेमाः प्रजा दिव्यस्य रेतसस्त्वं विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसि
pada pāṭha: tava | imāḥ | pra-jāḥ | divyasya | retasaḥ | tvam | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājasi || atha | idam | viśvam | pavamāna | te | vaśe | tvam | indo iti | prathamaḥ | dhāma-dhāḥ | asi ||9.86.28||

IAST: athedaṁ viśvam pavamāna te vaśe tvam indo prathamo dhāmadhā asi
Griffith: This universe, O Pavamana, owns thy sway; thou, Indu, art the first establisher of Law.
Devanāgarī: अथेदं विश्वं पवमान ते वशे त्वमिन्दो प्रथमो धामधा असि
pada pāṭha: tava | imāḥ | pra-jāḥ | divyasya | retasaḥ | tvam | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājasi || atha | idam | viśvam | pavamāna | te | vaśe | tvam | indo iti | prathamaḥ | dhāma-dhāḥ | asi ||9.86.28||

IAST: tvaṁ samudro asi viśvavit kave tavemāḥ pañca pradiśo vidharmaṇi
Griffith: Thou art the sea, O Sage who bringest alf to light: under thy Law are these five regions of the world.
Devanāgarī: त्वं समुद्रो असि विश्ववित्कवे तवेमाः पञ्च प्रदिशो विधर्मणि
pada pāṭha: tvam | samudraḥ | asi | viśva-vit | kave | tava | imāḥ | pañca | pra-diśaḥ | vi-dharmaṇi || tvam | dyām | ca | pr̥thivīm | ca | ati | jabhriṣe | tava | jyotīṁṣi | pavamāna | sūryaḥ ||9.86.29||

IAST: tvaṁ dyāṁ ca pṛthivīṁ cāti jabhriṣe tava jyotīṁṣi pavamāna sūryaḥ
Griffith: Tlou reachest out beyond the earth, beyond the heavens: thine are the lights, O Pavamana, thine the Sun
Devanāgarī: त्वं द्यां च पृथिवीं चाति जभ्रिषे तव ज्योतींषि पवमान सूर्यः
pada pāṭha: tvam | samudraḥ | asi | viśva-vit | kave | tava | imāḥ | pañca | pra-diśaḥ | vi-dharmaṇi || tvam | dyām | ca | pr̥thivīm | ca | ati | jabhriṣe | tava | jyotīṁṣi | pavamāna | sūryaḥ ||9.86.29||

IAST: tvam pavitre rajaso vidharmaṇi devebhyaḥ soma pavamāna pūyase
Griffith: Thou in the filter, Soma Pavamana, art purified to support the region for the Gods.
Devanāgarī: त्वं पवित्रे रजसो विधर्मणि देवेभ्यः सोम पवमान पूयसे
pada pāṭha: tvam | pavitre | rajasaḥ | vi-dharmaṇi | devebhyaḥ | soma | pavamāna | pūyase || tvām | uśijaḥ | prathamāḥ | agr̥bhṇata | tubhya | imā | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire ||9.86.30||

IAST: tvām uśijaḥ prathamā agṛbhṇata tubhyemā viśvā bhuvanāni yemire
Griffith: The chief, the longing ones have sought to hold thee fast, and all these living creatures have been tur
Devanāgarī: त्वामुशिजः प्रथमा अगृभ्णत तुभ्येमा विश्वा भुवनानि येमिरे
pada pāṭha: tvam | pavitre | rajasaḥ | vi-dharmaṇi | devebhyaḥ | soma | pavamāna | pūyase || tvām | uśijaḥ | prathamāḥ | agr̥bhṇata | tubhya | imā | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire ||9.86.30||

IAST: pra rebha ety ati vāram avyayaṁ vṛṣā vaneṣv ava cakradad dhariḥ
Griffith: Onward the Singer travels o'er the fleecy sieve. the Tawny Steer hath bellowed in the wooden vats.
Devanāgarī: प्र रेभ एत्यति वारमव्ययं वृषा वनेष्वव चक्रदद्धरिः
pada pāṭha: pra | rebhaḥ | eti | ati | vāram | avyayam | vr̥ṣā | vaneṣu | ava | cakradat | hariḥ || sam | dhītayaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | anūṣata | śiśum | rihanti | matayaḥ | panipnatam ||9.86.31||

IAST: saṁ dhītayo vāvaśānā anūṣata śiśuṁ rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam
Griffith: Hymns have been sung aloud in resonant harmony, and holy songs kiss him, the Child who claims our praise
Devanāgarī: सं धीतयो वावशाना अनूषत शिशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतम्
pada pāṭha: pra | rebhaḥ | eti | ati | vāram | avyayam | vr̥ṣā | vaneṣu | ava | cakradat | hariḥ || sam | dhītayaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | anūṣata | śiśum | rihanti | matayaḥ | panipnatam ||9.86.31||

IAST: sa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ pari vyata tantuṁ tanvānas trivṛtaṁ yathā vide
Griffith: He hath assumed the rays of Surya for his robe, spinning, as he knows bow, the triply-twisted thread.
Devanāgarī: स सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः परि व्यत तन्तुं तन्वानस्त्रिवृतं यथा विदे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sūryasya | raśmi-bhiḥ | pari | vyata | tantum | tanvānaḥ | tri-vr̥tam | yathā | vide || nayan | r̥tasya | pra-śiṣaḥ | navīyasīḥ | patiḥ | janīnām | upa | yāti | niḥ-kr̥tam ||9.86.32||

IAST: nayann ṛtasya praśiṣo navīyasīḥ patir janīnām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
Griffith: He, guiding to the newest rules of Holy Law, comes as the Women's Consort to the special place.
Devanāgarī: नयन्नृतस्य प्रशिषो नवीयसीः पतिर्जनीनामुप याति निष्कृतम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sūryasya | raśmi-bhiḥ | pari | vyata | tantum | tanvānaḥ | tri-vr̥tam | yathā | vide || nayan | r̥tasya | pra-śiṣaḥ | navīyasīḥ | patiḥ | janīnām | upa | yāti | niḥ-kr̥tam ||9.86.32||

IAST: rājā sindhūnām pavate patir diva ṛtasya yāti pathibhiḥ kanikradat
Griffith: On flows the King of rivers and the Lord of heaven: he follows with a shout the paths of Holy Law.
Devanāgarī: राजा सिन्धूनां पवते पतिर्दिव ऋतस्य याति पथिभिः कनिक्रदत्
pada pāṭha: rājā | sindhūnām | pavate | patiḥ | divaḥ | r̥tasya | yāti | pathi-bhiḥ | kanikradat || sahasra-dhāraḥ | pari | sicyate | hariḥ | punānaḥ | vācam | janayan | upa-vasuḥ ||9.86.33||

IAST: sahasradhāraḥ pari ṣicyate hariḥ punāno vācaṁ janayann upāvasuḥ
Griffith: The Golden-hued is poured forth, with his hundred streams, Wealth-bringer, lifting up his voice while p
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारः परि षिच्यते हरिः पुनानो वाचं जनयन्नुपावसुः
pada pāṭha: rājā | sindhūnām | pavate | patiḥ | divaḥ | r̥tasya | yāti | pathi-bhiḥ | kanikradat || sahasra-dhāraḥ | pari | sicyate | hariḥ | punānaḥ | vācam | janayan | upa-vasuḥ ||9.86.33||

IAST: pavamāna mahy arṇo vi dhāvasi sūro na citro avyayāni pavyayā
Griffith: Fain to be cleansed, thou, Pavamana, pourest out, like wondrous Surya, through the fleece, an ample sea.
Devanāgarī: पवमान मह्यर्णो वि धावसि सूरो न चित्रो अव्ययानि पव्यया
pada pāṭha: pavamāna | mahi | arṇaḥ | vi | dhāvasi | sūraḥ | na | citraḥ | avyayāni | pavyayā || gabhasti-pūtaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | mahe | vājāya | dhanyāya | dhanvasi ||9.86.34||

IAST: gabhastipūto nṛbhir adribhiḥ suto mahe vājāya dhanyāya dhanvasi
Griffith: Purified with the hands, pressed by the men with stones, thou speedest on to mighty booty-bringing war.
Devanāgarī: गभस्तिपूतो नृभिरद्रिभिः सुतो महे वाजाय धन्याय धन्वसि
pada pāṭha: pavamāna | mahi | arṇaḥ | vi | dhāvasi | sūraḥ | na | citraḥ | avyayāni | pavyayā || gabhasti-pūtaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | mahe | vājāya | dhanyāya | dhanvasi ||9.86.34||

IAST: iṣam ūrjam pavamānābhy arṣasi śyeno na vaṁsu kalaśeṣu sīdasi
Griffith: Thou, Pavamana, sendest food and power in streams. thou sittest in the beakers as a hawk on trees,
Devanāgarī: इषमूर्जं पवमानाभ्यर्षसि श्येनो न वंसु कलशेषु सीदसि
pada pāṭha: iṣam | ūrjam | pavamāna | abhi | arṣasi | śyenaḥ | na | vaṁsu | kalaśeṣu | sīdasi || indrāya | madvā | madyaḥ | madaḥ | sutaḥ | divaḥ | viṣṭambhaḥ | upa-maḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.86.35||

IAST: indrāya madvā madyo madaḥ suto divo viṣṭambha upamo vicakṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: For Indra poured as cheering juice to make him glad, as nearest and farseeing bearer-up of heaven.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय मद्वा मद्यो मदः सुतो दिवो विष्टम्भ उपमो विचक्षणः
pada pāṭha: iṣam | ūrjam | pavamāna | abhi | arṣasi | śyenaḥ | na | vaṁsu | kalaśeṣu | sīdasi || indrāya | madvā | madyaḥ | madaḥ | sutaḥ | divaḥ | viṣṭambhaḥ | upa-maḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.86.35||

IAST: sapta svasāro abhi mātaraḥ śiśuṁ navaṁ jajñānaṁ jenyaṁ vipaścitam
Griffith: The Sisters Seven, the Mothers, stand around the Babe, the noble, new-born Infant, skilled in holy song,
Devanāgarī: सप्त स्वसारो अभि मातरः शिशुं नवं जज्ञानं जेन्यं विपश्चितम्
pada pāṭha: sapta | svasāraḥ | abhi | mātaraḥ | śiśum | navam | jajñānam | jenyam | vipaḥ-citam || apām | gandharvam | divyam | nr̥-cakṣasam | somam | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājase ||9.86.36||

IAST: apāṁ gandharvaṁ divyaṁ nṛcakṣasaṁ somaṁ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājase
Griffith: Gandharva of the floods, divine, beholding men, Soma, that he may reign as King of all the world.
Devanāgarī: अपां गन्धर्वं दिव्यं नृचक्षसं सोमं विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसे
pada pāṭha: sapta | svasāraḥ | abhi | mātaraḥ | śiśum | navam | jajñānam | jenyam | vipaḥ-citam || apām | gandharvam | divyam | nr̥-cakṣasam | somam | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājase ||9.86.36||

IAST: īśāna imā bhuvanāni vīyase yujāna indo haritaḥ suparṇyaḥ
Griffith: As Sovran Lord thereof thou Passest through these worlds, O Indu, harnessing thy tawny well-winged Mares
Devanāgarī: ईशान इमा भुवनानि वीयसे युजान इन्दो हरितः सुपर्ण्यः
pada pāṭha: īśānaḥ | imā | bhuvanāni | vi | īyase | yujānaḥ | indo iti | haritaḥ | su-parṇyaḥ || tāḥ | te | kṣarantu | madhu-mat | ghr̥tam | payaḥ | tava | vrate | soma | tiṣṭhantu | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||9.86.37||

IAST: tās te kṣarantu madhumad ghṛtam payas tava vrate soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: May they pour forth for thee milk and oil rich in sweets: O Soma, let the folk abide in thy decree.
Devanāgarī: तास्ते क्षरन्तु मधुमद्घृतं पयस्तव व्रते सोम तिष्ठन्तु कृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: īśānaḥ | imā | bhuvanāni | vi | īyase | yujānaḥ | indo iti | haritaḥ | su-parṇyaḥ || tāḥ | te | kṣarantu | madhu-mat | ghr̥tam | payaḥ | tava | vrate | soma | tiṣṭhantu | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||9.86.37||

IAST: tvaṁ nṛcakṣā asi soma viśvataḥ pavamāna vṛṣabha tā vi dhāvasi
Griffith: O Soma, thou beholdest men from every side: O Pavamana, Steer, thou wanderest through these.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नृचक्षा असि सोम विश्वतः पवमान वृषभ ता वि धावसि
pada pāṭha: tvam | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | asi | soma | viśvataḥ | pavamāna | vr̥ṣabha | tā | vi | dhāvasi || saḥ | naḥ | pavasva | vasu-mat | hiraṇya-vat | vayam | syāma | bhuvaneṣu | jīvase ||9.86.38||

IAST: sa naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavad vayaṁ syāma bhuvaneṣu jīvase
Griffith: Pour out upon us wealth in treasure and in gold: may we have strength to live among the things that be.
Devanāgarī: स नः पवस्व वसुमद्धिरण्यवद्वयं स्याम भुवनेषु जीवसे
pada pāṭha: tvam | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | asi | soma | viśvataḥ | pavamāna | vr̥ṣabha | tā | vi | dhāvasi || saḥ | naḥ | pavasva | vasu-mat | hiraṇya-vat | vayam | syāma | bhuvaneṣu | jīvase ||9.86.38||

IAST: govit pavasva vasuvid dhiraṇyavid retodhā indo bhuvaneṣv arpitaḥ
Griffith: Winner of gold and goods and cattle flow thou on, set as impregner, Indu, mid the worlds of life.
pada pāṭha: go-vit | pavasva | vasu-vit | hiraṇya-vit | retaḥ-dhāḥ | indo iti | bhuvaneṣu | arpitaḥ || tvam | su-vīraḥ | asi | soma | viśva-vit | tam | tvā | viprāḥ | upa | girā | ime | āsate ||9.86.39||

IAST: tvaṁ suvīro asi soma viśvavit taṁ tvā viprā upa girema āsate
Griffith: Rich in brave men art thou, Soma, who winnest all: these holy singers wait upon thee with the song.
Devanāgarī: त्वं सुवीरो असि सोम विश्ववित्तं त्वा विप्रा उप गिरेम आसते
pada pāṭha: go-vit | pavasva | vasu-vit | hiraṇya-vit | retaḥ-dhāḥ | indo iti | bhuvaneṣu | arpitaḥ || tvam | su-vīraḥ | asi | soma | viśva-vit | tam | tvā | viprāḥ | upa | girā | ime | āsate ||9.86.39||

IAST: un madhva ūrmir vananā atiṣṭhipad apo vasāno mahiṣo vi gāhate
Griffith: The wave of flowing meath hath wakened up desires: the Steer enrobed in milk plunges into the streams.
Devanāgarī: उन्मध्व ऊर्मिर्वनना अतिष्ठिपदपो वसानो महिषो वि गाहते
pada pāṭha: ut | madhvaḥ | ūrmiḥ | vananāḥ | atisthipat | apaḥ | vasānaḥ | mahiṣaḥ | vi | gāhate || rājā | pavitra-rathaḥ | vājam | ā | aruhat | sahasra-bhr̥ṣṭiḥ | jayati | śravaḥ | br̥hat ||9.86.40||

IAST: rājā pavitraratho vājam āruhat sahasrabhṛṣṭir jayati śravo bṛhat
Griffith: Borne on his chariot-sieve the King hath risen to war, and with a thousand rays hath won him high renow
pada pāṭha: ut | madhvaḥ | ūrmiḥ | vananāḥ | atisthipat | apaḥ | vasānaḥ | mahiṣaḥ | vi | gāhate || rājā | pavitra-rathaḥ | vājam | ā | aruhat | sahasra-bhr̥ṣṭiḥ | jayati | śravaḥ | br̥hat ||9.86.40||

IAST: sa bhandanā ud iyarti prajāvatīr viśvāyur viśvāḥ subharā ahardivi
Griffith: Dear to all life, he sends triumphant praises forth, abundant, bringing offspring, each succeeding day.
Devanāgarī: स भन्दना उदियर्ति प्रजावतीर्विश्वायुर्विश्वाः सुभरा अहर्दिवि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bhandanāḥ | ut | iyarti | prajā-vatīḥ | viśva-āyuḥ | viśvāḥ | su-bharāḥ | ahaḥ-divi || brahma | prajā-vat | rayim | aśva-pastyam | pītaḥ | indo iti | indram | asmabhyam | yācatāt ||9.86.41||

IAST: brahma prajāvad rayim aśvapastyam pīta indav indram asmabhyaṁ yācatāt
Griffith: From Indra crave for us, Indu, when thou art quaffed, the blessing that gives children, wealth that har
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bhandanāḥ | ut | iyarti | prajā-vatīḥ | viśva-āyuḥ | viśvāḥ | su-bharāḥ | ahaḥ-divi || brahma | prajā-vat | rayim | aśva-pastyam | pītaḥ | indo iti | indram | asmabhyam | yācatāt ||9.86.41||

IAST: so agre ahnāṁ harir haryato madaḥ pra cetasā cetayate anu dyubhiḥ
Griffith: When days begin, the strong juice, lovely, golden-hued, is recognized by wisdom more and more each day,
Devanāgarī: सो अग्रे अह्नां हरिर्हर्यतो मदः प्र चेतसा चेतयते अनु द्युभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | agre | ahnām | hariḥ | haryataḥ | madaḥ | pra | cetasā | cetayate | anu | dyu-bhiḥ || dvā | janā | yātayan | antaḥ | īyate | narāśaṁsam | ca | daivyam | ca | dhartari ||9.86.42||

IAST: dvā janā yātayann antar īyate narā ca śaṁsaṁ daivyaṁ ca dhartari
Griffith: He, stirring both the Races, goes between the two, the bearer of the word of men and word of Gods.
Devanāgarī: द्वा जना यातयन्नन्तरीयते नरा च शंसं दैव्यं च धर्तरि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | agre | ahnām | hariḥ | haryataḥ | madaḥ | pra | cetasā | cetayate | anu | dyu-bhiḥ || dvā | janā | yātayan | antaḥ | īyate | narāśaṁsam | ca | daivyam | ca | dhartari ||9.86.42||

IAST: añjate vy añjate sam añjate kratuṁ rihanti madhunābhy añjate
Griffith: They balm him, balm him over balm him thoroughly, caress the mighty strength and balm it with the meath.
Devanāgarī: अञ्जते व्यञ्जते समञ्जते क्रतुं रिहन्ति मधुनाभ्यञ्जते
pada pāṭha: añjate | vi | añjate | sam | añjate | kratum | rihanti | madhunā | abhi | añjate || sindhoḥ | ut-śvāse | patayantam | ukṣaṇam | hiraṇya-pāvāḥ | paśum | āsu | gr̥bhṇate ||9.86.43||

IAST: sindhor ucchvāse patayantam ukṣaṇaṁ hiraṇyapāvāḥ paśum āsu gṛbhṇate
Griffith: They seize the flying Steer at the stream's breathing-place: cleansing with gold they grasp the Animal
pada pāṭha: añjate | vi | añjate | sam | añjate | kratum | rihanti | madhunā | abhi | añjate || sindhoḥ | ut-śvāse | patayantam | ukṣaṇam | hiraṇya-pāvāḥ | paśum | āsu | gr̥bhṇate ||9.86.43||

IAST: vipaścite pavamānāya gāyata mahī na dhārāty andho arṣati
Griffith: Sing forth to Pavamana skilled in holy song: the juice is flowing onward like a mighty stream.
Devanāgarī: विपश्चिते पवमानाय गायत मही न धारात्यन्धो अर्षति
pada pāṭha: vipaḥ-cite | pavamānāya | gāyata | mahī | na | dhārā | ati | andhaḥ | arṣati || ahiḥ | na | jūṇām | ati | sarpati | tvacam | atyaḥ | na | krīḷan | asarat | vr̥ṣā | hariḥ ||9.86.44||

IAST: ahir na jūrṇām ati sarpati tvacam atyo na krīḻann asarad vṛṣā hariḥ
Griffith: He.glideth like a serpent from his ancient skin, and like a playful horse the Tawny Steer hath run.
Devanāgarī: अहिर्न जूर्णामति सर्पति त्वचमत्यो न क्रीळन्नसरद्वृषा हरिः
pada pāṭha: vipaḥ-cite | pavamānāya | gāyata | mahī | na | dhārā | ati | andhaḥ | arṣati || ahiḥ | na | jūṇām | ati | sarpati | tvacam | atyaḥ | na | krīḷan | asarat | vr̥ṣā | hariḥ ||9.86.44||

IAST: agrego rājāpyas taviṣyate vimāno ahnām bhuvaneṣv arpitaḥ
Griffith: Dweller in floods, King, foremost, he displays his might, set among living things as measurer of days.
pada pāṭha: agre-gaḥ | rājā | apyaḥ | taviṣyate | vi-mānaḥ | ahnām | bhuvaneṣu | arpitaḥ || hariḥ | ghr̥ta-snuḥ | su-dr̥śīkaḥ | arṇavaḥ | jyotiḥ-rathaḥ | pavate | rāye | okyaḥ ||9.86.45||

IAST: harir ghṛtasnuḥ sudṛśīko arṇavo jyotīrathaḥ pavate rāya okyaḥ
Griffith: Distilling oil he flows, fair, billowy, golden-hued, borne on a car of light, sharing one hom-e with wea
Devanāgarī: हरिर्घृतस्नुः सुदृशीको अर्णवो ज्योतीरथः पवते राय ओक्यः
pada pāṭha: agre-gaḥ | rājā | apyaḥ | taviṣyate | vi-mānaḥ | ahnām | bhuvaneṣu | arpitaḥ || hariḥ | ghr̥ta-snuḥ | su-dr̥śīkaḥ | arṇavaḥ | jyotiḥ-rathaḥ | pavate | rāye | okyaḥ ||9.86.45||

IAST: asarji skambho diva udyato madaḥ pari tridhātur bhuvanāny arṣati
Griffith: Loosed is the heavens! support, the uplifted cheering juice: the triply-mingled draught flows round into
Devanāgarī: असर्जि स्कम्भो दिव उद्यतो मदः परि त्रिधातुर्भुवनान्यर्षति
pada pāṭha: asarji | skambhaḥ | divaḥ | ut-yataḥ | madaḥ | pari | tri-dhātuḥ | bhuvanāni | arṣati || aṁśum | rihanti | matayaḥ | panipnatam | girā | yadi | niḥ-nijam | r̥gmiṇaḥ | yayuḥ ||9.86.46||

IAST: aṁśuṁ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṁ girā yadi nirṇijam ṛgmiṇo yayuḥ
Griffith: The holy hymns caress the stalk that claims our praise, when singers have approached his beauteous robe
Devanāgarī: अंशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतं गिरा यदि निर्णिजमृग्मिणो ययुः
pada pāṭha: asarji | skambhaḥ | divaḥ | ut-yataḥ | madaḥ | pari | tri-dhātuḥ | bhuvanāni | arṣati || aṁśum | rihanti | matayaḥ | panipnatam | girā | yadi | niḥ-nijam | r̥gmiṇaḥ | yayuḥ ||9.86.46||

IAST: pra te dhārā aty aṇvāni meṣyaḥ punānasya saṁyato yanti raṁhayaḥ
Griffith: Thy strearns that flow forth rapidly collected run over the fine fleece of the sheep as thou art cleansed
Devanāgarī: प्र ते धारा अत्यण्वानि मेष्यः पुनानस्य संयतो यन्ति रंहयः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | dhārāḥ | ati | aṇvāni | meṣyaḥ | punānasya | sam-yataḥ | yanti | raṁhayaḥ || yat | gobhiḥ | indo iti | camvoḥ | sam-ajyase | ā | suvānaḥ | soma | kalaśeṣu | sīdasi ||9.86.47||

IAST: yad gobhir indo camvoḥ samajyasa ā suvānaḥ soma kalaśeṣu sīdasi
Griffith: When, Indu, thou art. balmed with milk within the bowl, thou sinkest in the jars, O Soma, when expressed
Devanāgarī: यद्गोभिरिन्दो चम्वोः समज्यस आ सुवानः सोम कलशेषु सीदसि
pada pāṭha: pra | te | dhārāḥ | ati | aṇvāni | meṣyaḥ | punānasya | sam-yataḥ | yanti | raṁhayaḥ || yat | gobhiḥ | indo iti | camvoḥ | sam-ajyase | ā | suvānaḥ | soma | kalaśeṣu | sīdasi ||9.86.47||

IAST: pavasva soma kratuvin na ukthyo 'vyo vāre pari dhāva madhu priyam
Griffith: Winner of' power, flow, Soma, worthy of our laud: run onward to the fleece as well-beloved meath.
Devanāgarī: पवस्व सोम क्रतुविन्न उक्थ्योऽव्यो वारे परि धाव मधु प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | kratu-vit | naḥ | ukthyaḥ | avyaḥ | vāre | pari | dhāva | madhu | priyam || jahi | viśvān | rakṣasaḥ | indo iti | atriṇaḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||9.86.48||

IAST: jahi viśvān rakṣasa indo atriṇo bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Destroy, O Indu, all voracious Raksasas. With brave sons in the assembly let our speech be bold.
Devanāgarī: जहि विश्वान्रक्षस इन्दो अत्रिणो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | kratu-vit | naḥ | ukthyaḥ | avyaḥ | vāre | pari | dhāva | madhu | priyam || jahi | viśvān | rakṣasaḥ | indo iti | atriṇaḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||9.86.48||

IAST: pra tu drava pari kośaṁ ni ṣīda nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vājam arṣa
Griffith: RUN onward to the reservoir and seat thee: cleansed by the men speed forward to the battle.
Devanāgarī: प्र तु द्रव परि कोशं नि षीद नृभिः पुनानो अभि वाजमर्ष
pada pāṭha: pra | tu | drava | pari | kośam | ni | sīda | nr̥-bhiḥ | punānaḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa || aśvam | na | tvā | vājinam | marjayantaḥ | accha | barhiḥ | raśanābhiḥ | nayanti ||9.87.1||

IAST: aśvaṁ na tvā vājinam marjayanto 'cchā barhī raśanābhir nayanti
Griffith: Making thee beauteous like an able courser, forth to the sacred grass with reins they lead thee.
Devanāgarī: अश्वं न त्वा वाजिनं मर्जयन्तोऽच्छा बर्ही रशनाभिर्नयन्ति
pada pāṭha: pra | tu | drava | pari | kośam | ni | sīda | nr̥-bhiḥ | punānaḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa || aśvam | na | tvā | vājinam | marjayantaḥ | accha | barhiḥ | raśanābhiḥ | nayanti ||9.87.1||

IAST: svāyudhaḥ pavate deva indur aśastihā vṛjanaṁ rakṣamāṇaḥ
Griffith: Indu, the well-armed God, is flowing onward, who quells the curse and guards from treacherous onslaught,
Devanāgarī: स्वायुधः पवते देव इन्दुरशस्तिहा वृजनं रक्षमाणः
pada pāṭha: su-āyudhaḥ | pavate | devaḥ | induḥ | aśasti-hā | vr̥janam | rakṣamāṇaḥ || pitā | devānām | janitā | su-dakṣaḥ | viṣṭambhaḥ | divaḥ | dharuṇaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ ||9.87.2||

IAST: pitā devānāṁ janitā sudakṣo viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: Father, begetter of the Gods, most skilful, the buttress of the heavens and earth's supporter.
Devanāgarī: पिता देवानां जनिता सुदक्षो विष्टम्भो दिवो धरुणः पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: su-āyudhaḥ | pavate | devaḥ | induḥ | aśasti-hā | vr̥janam | rakṣamāṇaḥ || pitā | devānām | janitā | su-dakṣaḥ | viṣṭambhaḥ | divaḥ | dharuṇaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ ||9.87.2||

IAST: ṛṣir vipraḥ puraetā janānām ṛbhur dhīra uśanā kāvyena
Griffith: Rsi and Sage, the Champion of the people, cleft and sagacious, Usana in wisdom,
pada pāṭha: r̥ṣiḥ | vipraḥ | puraḥ-etā | janānām | r̥bhuḥ | dhīraḥ | uśanā | kāvyena || saḥ | cit | viveda | ni-hitam | yat | āsām | apīcyam | guhyam | nāma | gonām ||9.87.3||

IAST: sa cid viveda nihitaṁ yad āsām apīcyaṁ guhyaṁ nāma gonām
Griffith: He hath discovered even their hidden nature, the Cows' concealed and most mysterious title.
Devanāgarī: स चिद्विवेद निहितं यदासामपीच्यं गुह्यं नाम गोनाम्
pada pāṭha: r̥ṣiḥ | vipraḥ | puraḥ-etā | janānām | r̥bhuḥ | dhīraḥ | uśanā | kāvyena || saḥ | cit | viveda | ni-hitam | yat | āsām | apīcyam | guhyam | nāma | gonām ||9.87.3||

IAST: eṣa sya te madhumām̐ indra somo vṛṣā vṛṣṇe pari pavitre akṣāḥ
Griffith: This thine own Soma rich in meath, O Indra, Steer for the Steer, hath flowed into the filter.
Devanāgarī: एष स्य ते मधुमाँ इन्द्र सोमो वृषा वृष्णे परि पवित्रे अक्षाः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | te | madhu-mān | indra | somaḥ | vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣṇe | pari | pavitre | akṣāriti || sahasra-sāḥ | śata-sāḥ | bhūri-dāvā | śaśvat-tamam | barhiḥ | ā | vājī | asthāt ||9.87.4||

IAST: sahasrasāḥ śatasā bhūridāvā śaśvattamam barhir ā vājy asthāt
Griffith: The strong Free-giver, winning hundreds, thousands, hath reached the holy grass that never fails him.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रसाः शतसा भूरिदावा शश्वत्तमं बर्हिरा वाज्यस्थात्
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | te | madhu-mān | indra | somaḥ | vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣṇe | pari | pavitre | akṣāriti || sahasra-sāḥ | śata-sāḥ | bhūri-dāvā | śaśvat-tamam | barhiḥ | ā | vājī | asthāt ||9.87.4||

IAST: ete somā abhi gavyā sahasrā mahe vājāyāmṛtāya śravāṁsi
Griffith: These Somas are for wealth of countless cattle, renown therefor, and mighty strength immortal.
Devanāgarī: एते सोमा अभि गव्या सहस्रा महे वाजायामृताय श्रवांसि
pada pāṭha: ete | somāḥ | abhi | gavyā | sahasrā | mahe | vājāya | amr̥tāya | śravāṁsi || pavitrebhiḥ | pavamānāḥ | asr̥gran | śravasyavaḥ | na | pr̥tanājaḥ | atyāḥ ||9.87.5||

IAST: pavitrebhiḥ pavamānā asṛgrañ chravasyavo na pṛtanājo atyāḥ
Griffith: These have been sent forth, urified by strainers, like steeds who rusg to battle fain for glory.
Devanāgarī: पवित्रेभिः पवमाना असृग्रञ्छ्रवस्यवो न पृतनाजो अत्याः
pada pāṭha: ete | somāḥ | abhi | gavyā | sahasrā | mahe | vājāya | amr̥tāya | śravāṁsi || pavitrebhiḥ | pavamānāḥ | asr̥gran | śravasyavaḥ | na | pr̥tanājaḥ | atyāḥ ||9.87.5||

IAST: pari hi ṣmā puruhūto janānāṁ viśvāsarad bhojanā pūyamānaḥ
Griffith: He, while he cleanses him, invoked of many, hath flowed to give the people all enjoyment.
Devanāgarī: परि हि ष्मा पुरुहूतो जनानां विश्वासरद्भोजना पूयमानः
pada pāṭha: pari | hi | sma | puru-hūtaḥ | janānām | viśvā | asarat | bhojanā | pūyamānaḥ || atha | ā | bhara | śyena-bhr̥ta | prayāṁsi | rayim | tuñjānaḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa ||9.87.6||

IAST: athā bhara śyenabhṛta prayāṁsi rayiṁ tuñjāno abhi vājam arṣa
Griffith: Thou whom the Falcon brought, bring, dainty viands, bestir thyself and send us wealth and booty.
Devanāgarī: अथा भर श्येनभृत प्रयांसि रयिं तुञ्जानो अभि वाजमर्ष
pada pāṭha: pari | hi | sma | puru-hūtaḥ | janānām | viśvā | asarat | bhojanā | pūyamānaḥ || atha | ā | bhara | śyena-bhr̥ta | prayāṁsi | rayim | tuñjānaḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa ||9.87.6||

IAST: eṣa suvānaḥ pari somaḥ pavitre sargo na sṛṣṭo adadhāvad arvā
Griffith: This Soma, pressed into the cleansing filter, hath run as 'twere a host let loose, the Courser;
Devanāgarī: एष सुवानः परि सोमः पवित्रे सर्गो न सृष्टो अदधावदर्वा
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | suvānaḥ | pari | somaḥ | pavitre | sargaḥ | na | sr̥ṣṭaḥ | adadhāvat | arvā || tigme iti | śiśānaḥ | mahiṣaḥ | na | śr̥ṅge iti | gāḥ | gavyan | abhi | śūraḥ | na | satvā ||9.87.7||

IAST: tigme śiśāno mahiṣo na śṛṅge gā gavyann abhi śūro na satvā
Griffith: Like a strong bull who whets his horns kpen-pointed, like a brave warrior in the fray for cattle.
Devanāgarī: तिग्मे शिशानो महिषो न शृङ्गे गा गव्यन्नभि शूरो न सत्वा
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | suvānaḥ | pari | somaḥ | pavitre | sargaḥ | na | sr̥ṣṭaḥ | adadhāvat | arvā || tigme iti | śiśānaḥ | mahiṣaḥ | na | śr̥ṅge iti | gāḥ | gavyan | abhi | śūraḥ | na | satvā ||9.87.7||

IAST: eṣā yayau paramād antar adreḥ kūcit satīr ūrve gā viveda
Griffith: He issued forth from out the loftiest mountain, and found kine hidden somewhere in a stable.
Devanāgarī: एषा ययौ परमादन्तरद्रेः कूचित्सतीरूर्वे गा विवेद
pada pāṭha: eṣā | ā | yayau | paramāt | antaḥ | adreḥ | kū-cit | satīḥ | ūrve | gāḥ | viveda || divaḥ | na | vi-dyut | stanayantī | abhraiḥ | somasya | te | pavate | indra | dhārā ||9.87.8||

IAST: divo na vidyut stanayanty abhraiḥ somasya te pavata indra dhārā
Griffith: Soma's stream clears itself for thee, O Indra, like lightning thundering through the clouds of heaven,
