Devanāgarī: दिवो न विद्युत्स्तनयन्त्यभ्रैः सोमस्य ते पवत इन्द्र धारा
pada pāṭha: eṣā | ā | yayau | paramāt | antaḥ | adreḥ | kū-cit | satīḥ | ūrve | gāḥ | viveda || divaḥ | na | vi-dyut | stanayantī | abhraiḥ | somasya | te | pavate | indra | dhārā ||9.87.8||

IAST: uta sma rāśim pari yāsi gonām indreṇa soma saratham punānaḥ
Griffith: Cleansing thyselr, and borne along with Indra, Soma, thou goest round the herd of cattle.
Devanāgarī: उत स्म राशिं परि यासि गोनामिन्द्रेण सोम सरथं पुनानः
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | rāśim | pari | yāsi | gonām | indreṇa | soma | sa-ratham | punānaḥ || pūrvīḥ | iṣaḥ | br̥hatīḥ | jīradāno iti jīra-dāno | śikṣa | śacī-vaḥ | tava | tāḥ | upa-stut ||9.87.9||

IAST: pūrvīr iṣo bṛhatīr jīradāno śikṣā śacīvas tava tā upaṣṭut
Griffith: May thy praise help us, Mighty One, prompt Giver, to the full ample food which thou bestowest.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीरिषो बृहतीर्जीरदानो शिक्षा शचीवस्तव ता उपष्टुत्
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | rāśim | pari | yāsi | gonām | indreṇa | soma | sa-ratham | punānaḥ || pūrvīḥ | iṣaḥ | br̥hatīḥ | jīradāno iti jīra-dāno | śikṣa | śacī-vaḥ | tava | tāḥ | upa-stut ||9.87.9||

IAST: ayaṁ soma indra tubhyaṁ sunve tubhyam pavate tvam asya pāhi
Griffith: FOR thee this Soma is effused, O Indra: drink of this juice; for thee the stream is flowing-
Devanāgarī: अयं सोम इन्द्र तुभ्यं सुन्वे तुभ्यं पवते त्वमस्य पाहि
pada pāṭha: ayam | somaḥ | indra | tubhyam | sunve | tubhyam | pavate | tvam | asya | pāhi || tvam | ha | yam | cakr̥ṣe | tvam | vavr̥ṣe | indum | madāya | yujyāya | somam ||9.88.1||

IAST: tvaṁ ha yaṁ cakṛṣe tvaṁ vavṛṣa indum madāya yujyāya somam
Griffith: Soma, which thou thyself hast made and chosen, even Indu, for thy special drink to cheer thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह यं चकृषे त्वं ववृष इन्दुं मदाय युज्याय सोमम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | somaḥ | indra | tubhyam | sunve | tubhyam | pavate | tvam | asya | pāhi || tvam | ha | yam | cakr̥ṣe | tvam | vavr̥ṣe | indum | madāya | yujyāya | somam ||9.88.1||

IAST: sa īṁ ratho na bhuriṣāḻ ayoji mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni
Griffith: Like a capacious car hath it been harnessed, the Mighty; to acquire abundant treasures.
Devanāgarī: स ईं रथो न भुरिषाळयोजि महः पुरूणि सातये वसूनि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | rathaḥ | na | bhuriṣāṭ | ayoji | mahaḥ | purūṇi | sātaye | vasūni || āt | īm | viśvā | nahuṣyāṇi | jātā | svaḥ-sātā | vane | ūrdhvā | navanta ||9.88.2||

IAST: ād īṁ viśvā nahuṣyāṇi jātā svarṣātā vana ūrdhvā navanta
Griffith: Then in the sacrifice they celebrated all triumphs won by Nahus -n the battle.
Devanāgarī: आदीं विश्वा नहुष्याणि जाता स्वर्षाता वन ऊर्ध्वा नवन्त
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | rathaḥ | na | bhuriṣāṭ | ayoji | mahaḥ | purūṇi | sātaye | vasūni || āt | īm | viśvā | nahuṣyāṇi | jātā | svaḥ-sātā | vane | ūrdhvā | navanta ||9.88.2||

IAST: vāyur na yo niyutvām̐ iṣṭayāmā nāsatyeva hava ā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Like Vayu with his team, moving at pleasure, most gracious when invoked like both Nasatyas,
Devanāgarī: वायुर्न यो नियुत्वाँ इष्टयामा नासत्येव हव आ शम्भविष्ठः
pada pāṭha: vāyuḥ | na | yaḥ | niyutvān | iṣṭa-yāmā | nāsatyā-iva | have | ā | śam-bhaviṣṭhaḥ || viśva-vāraḥ | draviṇodāḥ-iva | tman | pūṣā-iva | dhī-javanaḥ | asi | soma ||9.88.3||

IAST: viśvavāro draviṇodā iva tman pūṣeva dhījavano 'si soma
Griffith: Thou art thyself like the Wealth-Giver, Soma! who grants all boons, like song-inspiring Pusan.
Devanāgarī: विश्ववारो द्रविणोदा इव त्मन्पूषेव धीजवनोऽसि सोम
pada pāṭha: vāyuḥ | na | yaḥ | niyutvān | iṣṭa-yāmā | nāsatyā-iva | have | ā | śam-bhaviṣṭhaḥ || viśva-vāraḥ | draviṇodāḥ-iva | tman | pūṣā-iva | dhī-javanaḥ | asi | soma ||9.88.3||

IAST: indro na yo mahā karmāṇi cakrir hantā vṛtrāṇām asi soma pūrbhit
Griffith: Like Indra who hath done great deeds, thou, Soma, art slayer of the Vrtras, Fort-destroyer.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो न यो महा कर्माणि चक्रिर्हन्ता वृत्राणामसि सोम पूर्भित्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | na | yaḥ | mahā | karmāṇi | cakriḥ | hantā | vr̥trāṇām | asi | soma | pūḥ-bhit || paidvaḥ | na | hi | tvam | ahi-nāmnām | hantā | viśvasya | asi | soma | dasyoḥ ||9.88.4||

IAST: paidvo na hi tvam ahināmnāṁ hantā viśvasyāsi soma dasyoḥ
Griffith: Like Pedu's horse who killed the brood of serpents, thus thou, O Soma, slayest every Dasyu.
Devanāgarī: पैद्वो न हि त्वमहिनाम्नां हन्ता विश्वस्यासि सोम दस्योः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | na | yaḥ | mahā | karmāṇi | cakriḥ | hantā | vr̥trāṇām | asi | soma | pūḥ-bhit || paidvaḥ | na | hi | tvam | ahi-nāmnām | hantā | viśvasya | asi | soma | dasyoḥ ||9.88.4||

IAST: agnir na yo vana ā sṛjyamāno vṛthā pājāṁsi kṛṇute nadīṣu
Griffith: Like Agni loosed amid the forest, fiercely he winneth splendour in the running waters.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्न यो वन आ सृज्यमानो वृथा पाजांसि कृणुते नदीषु
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | na | yaḥ | vane | ā | sr̥jyamānaḥ | vr̥thā | pājāṁsi | kr̥ṇute | nadīṣu || janaḥ | na | yudhvā | mahataḥ | upabdiḥ | iyarti | somaḥ | pavamānaḥ | ūrmim ||9.88.5||

IAST: jano na yudhvā mahata upabdir iyarti somaḥ pavamāna ūrmim
Griffith: Like one who fights, the roaring of the mighty, thus Soma Pavamana sends his current.
Devanāgarī: जनो न युध्वा महत उपब्दिरियर्ति सोमः पवमान ऊर्मिम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | na | yaḥ | vane | ā | sr̥jyamānaḥ | vr̥thā | pājāṁsi | kr̥ṇute | nadīṣu || janaḥ | na | yudhvā | mahataḥ | upabdiḥ | iyarti | somaḥ | pavamānaḥ | ūrmim ||9.88.5||

IAST: ete somā ati vārāṇy avyā divyā na kośāso abhravarṣāḥ
Griffith: These Somas passing through the fleecy filter, like rain descending from the clouds of heaven,
Devanāgarī: एते सोमा अति वाराण्यव्या दिव्या न कोशासो अभ्रवर्षाः
pada pāṭha: ete | somāḥ | ati | vārāṇi | avyā | divyāḥ | na | kośāsaḥ | abhra-varṣāḥ || vr̥thā | samudram | sindhavaḥ | na | nīcīḥ | sutāsaḥ | abhi | kalaśān | asr̥gran ||9.88.6||

IAST: vṛthā samudraṁ sindhavo na nīcīḥ sutāso abhi kalaśām̐ asṛgran
Griffith: Have been effused and poured into the beakers, swiftly like rivers running lowly seaward.
Devanāgarī: वृथा समुद्रं सिन्धवो न नीचीः सुतासो अभि कलशाँ असृग्रन्
pada pāṭha: ete | somāḥ | ati | vārāṇi | avyā | divyāḥ | na | kośāsaḥ | abhra-varṣāḥ || vr̥thā | samudram | sindhavaḥ | na | nīcīḥ | sutāsaḥ | abhi | kalaśān | asr̥gran ||9.88.6||

IAST: śuṣmī śardho na mārutam pavasvānabhiśastā divyā yathā viṭ
Griffith: Flow onward like the potent band of Maruts, like that Celestial Host whom none revileth.
Devanāgarī: शुष्मी शर्धो न मारुतं पवस्वानभिशस्ता दिव्या यथा विट्
pada pāṭha: śuṣmī | śardhaḥ | na | mārutam | pavasva | anabhi-śastā | divyā | yathā | viṭ || āpaḥ | na | makṣu | su-matiḥ | bhava | naḥ | sahasra-apsāḥ | pr̥tanāṣāṭ | na | yajñaḥ ||9.88.7||

IAST: āpo na makṣū sumatir bhavā naḥ sahasrāpsāḥ pṛtanāṣāṇ na yajñaḥ
Griffith: Quickly be gracious unto us like waters, like sacrifice victorious, thousand-fashioned.
Devanāgarī: आपो न मक्षू सुमतिर्भवा नः सहस्राप्साः पृतनाषाण्न यज्ञः
pada pāṭha: śuṣmī | śardhaḥ | na | mārutam | pavasva | anabhi-śastā | divyā | yathā | viṭ || āpaḥ | na | makṣu | su-matiḥ | bhava | naḥ | sahasra-apsāḥ | pr̥tanāṣāṭ | na | yajñaḥ ||9.88.7||

IAST: rājño nu te varuṇasya vratāni bṛhad gabhīraṁ tava soma dhāma
Griffith: Thine are King Varuna's eternal statutes, lofty and deep, O Soma, is thy glory.
Devanāgarī: राज्ञो नु ते वरुणस्य व्रतानि बृहद्गभीरं तव सोम धाम
pada pāṭha: rājñaḥ | nu | te | varuṇasya | vratāni | br̥hat | gabhīram | tava | soma | dhāma || śuciḥ | tvam | asi | priyaḥ | na | mitraḥ | dakṣāyyaḥ | aryamā-iva | asi | soma ||9.88.8||

IAST: śuciṣ ṭvam asi priyo na mitro dakṣāyyo aryamevāsi soma
Griffith: All-pure art thou like Mitra the beloved, adorable, like Aryaman, O Soma.
Devanāgarī: शुचिष्ट्वमसि प्रियो न मित्रो दक्षाय्यो अर्यमेवासि सोम
pada pāṭha: rājñaḥ | nu | te | varuṇasya | vratāni | br̥hat | gabhīram | tava | soma | dhāma || śuciḥ | tvam | asi | priyaḥ | na | mitraḥ | dakṣāyyaḥ | aryamā-iva | asi | soma ||9.88.8||

IAST: pro sya vahniḥ pathyābhir asyān divo na vṛṣṭiḥ pavamāno akṣāḥ
Griffith: THIS Chariot-horse hath moved along the pathways, and Pavamana flowed like rain from heaven.
Devanāgarī: प्रो स्य वह्निः पथ्याभिरस्यान्दिवो न वृष्टिः पवमानो अक्षाः
pada pāṭha: pro iti | syaḥ | vahniḥ | pathyābhiḥ | asyān | divaḥ | na | vr̥ṣṭiḥ | pavamānaḥ | akṣāriti || sahasra-dhāraḥ | asadat | ni | asme iti | mātuḥ | upa-sthe | vane | ā | ca | somaḥ ||9.89.1||

IAST: sahasradhāro asadan ny asme mātur upasthe vana ā ca somaḥ
Griffith: With us hath Soma with a thousand currents sunk in the wood, upon his Mother's bosom.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारो असदन्न्यस्मे मातुरुपस्थे वन आ च सोमः
pada pāṭha: pro iti | syaḥ | vahniḥ | pathyābhiḥ | asyān | divaḥ | na | vr̥ṣṭiḥ | pavamānaḥ | akṣāriti || sahasra-dhāraḥ | asadat | ni | asme iti | mātuḥ | upa-sthe | vane | ā | ca | somaḥ ||9.89.1||

IAST: rājā sindhūnām avasiṣṭa vāsa ṛtasya nāvam āruhad rajiṣṭhām
Griffith: King, he hath clothed him in the robe of rivers, mounted the straightest-going ship of Order.
pada pāṭha: rājā | sindhūnām | avasiṣṭa | vāsaḥ | r̥tasya | nāvam | ā | aruhat | rajiṣṭhām || ap-su | drapsaḥ | vavr̥dhe | śyena-jūtaḥ | duhe | īm | pitā | duhe | īm | pituḥ | jām ||9.89.2||

IAST: apsu drapso vāvṛdhe śyenajūto duha īm pitā duha īm pitur jām
Griffith: Sped by the Hawk the drop hath waxed in waters: the father drains it, drains the Father's offspring.
Devanāgarī: अप्सु द्रप्सो वावृधे श्येनजूतो दुह ईं पिता दुह ईं पितुर्जाम्
pada pāṭha: rājā | sindhūnām | avasiṣṭa | vāsaḥ | r̥tasya | nāvam | ā | aruhat | rajiṣṭhām || ap-su | drapsaḥ | vavr̥dhe | śyena-jūtaḥ | duhe | īm | pitā | duhe | īm | pituḥ | jām ||9.89.2||

IAST: siṁhaṁ nasanta madhvo ayāsaṁ harim aruṣaṁ divo asya patim
Griffith: They come to him, red, tawny, Lord of Heaven, the watchful Guardian of the meath, the Lion.
Devanāgarī: सिंहं नसन्त मध्वो अयासं हरिमरुषं दिवो अस्य पतिम्
pada pāṭha: siṁham | nasanta | madhvaḥ | ayāsam | harim | aruṣam | divaḥ | asya | patim || śūraḥ | yut-su | prathamaḥ | pr̥cchate | gāḥ | asya | cakṣasā | pari | pāti | ukṣā ||9.89.3||

IAST: śūro yutsu prathamaḥ pṛcchate gā asya cakṣasā pari pāty ukṣā
Griffith: First, Hero in the fight, he seeks the cattle, and with his eye the Steer is our protector.
Devanāgarī: शूरो युत्सु प्रथमः पृच्छते गा अस्य चक्षसा परि पात्युक्षा
pada pāṭha: siṁham | nasanta | madhvaḥ | ayāsam | harim | aruṣam | divaḥ | asya | patim || śūraḥ | yut-su | prathamaḥ | pr̥cchate | gāḥ | asya | cakṣasā | pari | pāti | ukṣā ||9.89.3||

IAST: madhupṛṣṭhaṁ ghoram ayāsam aśvaṁ rathe yuñjanty urucakra ṛṣvam
Griffith: They harness to the broad-wheeled car the mighty Courser whose back bears meath, unwearied, awful.
pada pāṭha: madhu-pr̥ṣṭham | ghoram | ayāsam | aśvam | rathe | yuñjanti | uru-cakre | r̥ṣvam || svasāraḥ | īm | jāmayaḥ | marjayanti | sa-nābhayaḥ | vājinam | ūrjayanti ||9.89.4||

IAST: svasāra īṁ jāmayo marjayanti sanābhayo vājinam ūrjayanti
Griffith: The twins, the sisters brighten him, and strengthen-these children of one damethe vigorous Racer.
Devanāgarī: स्वसार ईं जामयो मर्जयन्ति सनाभयो वाजिनमूर्जयन्ति
pada pāṭha: madhu-pr̥ṣṭham | ghoram | ayāsam | aśvam | rathe | yuñjanti | uru-cakre | r̥ṣvam || svasāraḥ | īm | jāmayaḥ | marjayanti | sa-nābhayaḥ | vājinam | ūrjayanti ||9.89.4||

IAST: catasra īṁ ghṛtaduhaḥ sacante samāne antar dharuṇe niṣattāḥ
Griffith: Four pouring out the holy oil attend him, sitting together in the same container.
Devanāgarī: चतस्र ईं घृतदुहः सचन्ते समाने अन्तर्धरुणे निषत्ताः
pada pāṭha: catasraḥ | īm | ghr̥ta-duhaḥ | sacante | samāne | antaḥ | dharuṇe | ni-sattāḥ || tāḥ | īm | arṣanti | namasā | punānāḥ | tāḥ | īm | viśvataḥ | pari | santi | pūrvīḥ ||9.89.5||

IAST: tā īm arṣanti namasā punānās tā īṁ viśvataḥ pari ṣanti pūrvīḥ
Griffith: To him they flow, when purified, with homage, and still, from every side, are first about him.
Devanāgarī: ता ईमर्षन्ति नमसा पुनानास्ता ईं विश्वतः परि षन्ति पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: catasraḥ | īm | ghr̥ta-duhaḥ | sacante | samāne | antaḥ | dharuṇe | ni-sattāḥ || tāḥ | īm | arṣanti | namasā | punānāḥ | tāḥ | īm | viśvataḥ | pari | santi | pūrvīḥ ||9.89.5||

IAST: viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyā viśvā uta kṣitayo haste asya
Griffith: He is the buttress of the heavens, supporter of earth, and in his hand are all the people.
Devanāgarī: विष्टम्भो दिवो धरुणः पृथिव्या विश्वा उत क्षितयो हस्ते अस्य
pada pāṭha: viṣṭambhaḥ | divaḥ | dharuṇaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | viśvāḥ | uta | kṣitayaḥ | haste | asya || asat | te | utsaḥ | gr̥ṇate | niyutvān | madhvaḥ | aṁśuḥ | pavate | indriyāya ||9.89.6||

IAST: asat ta utso gṛṇate niyutvān madhvo aṁśuḥ pavata indriyāya
Griffith: Be the team's Lord a well to thee the singer: cleansed is the sweet plant's stalk for deed of glory.
Devanāgarī: असत्त उत्सो गृणते नियुत्वान्मध्वो अंशुः पवत इन्द्रियाय
pada pāṭha: viṣṭambhaḥ | divaḥ | dharuṇaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | viśvāḥ | uta | kṣitayaḥ | haste | asya || asat | te | utsaḥ | gr̥ṇate | niyutvān | madhvaḥ | aṁśuḥ | pavate | indriyāya ||9.89.6||

IAST: vanvann avāto abhi devavītim indrāya soma vṛtrahā pavasva
Griffith: Fighting, uninjured come where Gods are feasted; Soma, as Vitra-slayer flow for Indra.
Devanāgarī: वन्वन्नवातो अभि देववीतिमिन्द्राय सोम वृत्रहा पवस्व
pada pāṭha: vanvan | avātaḥ | abhi | deva-vītim | indrāya | soma | vr̥tra-hā | pavasva || śagdhi | mahaḥ | puru-candrasya | rāyaḥ | su-vīryasya | patayaḥ | syāma ||9.89.7||

IAST: śagdhi mahaḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma
Griffith: Vouchsafe us ample riches very splendid may we be masters of heroic vigour.
Devanāgarī: शग्धि महः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य रायः सुवीर्यस्य पतयः स्याम
pada pāṭha: vanvan | avātaḥ | abhi | deva-vītim | indrāya | soma | vr̥tra-hā | pavasva || śagdhi | mahaḥ | puru-candrasya | rāyaḥ | su-vīryasya | patayaḥ | syāma ||9.89.7||

IAST: pra hinvāno janitā rodasyo ratho na vājaṁ saniṣyann ayāsīt
Griffith: URGED On, the Father of the Earth and Heaven hath gone forth like a car to gather booty,
Devanāgarī: प्र हिन्वानो जनिता रोदस्यो रथो न वाजं सनिष्यन्नयासीत्
pada pāṭha: pra | hinvānaḥ | janitā | rodasyoḥ | rathaḥ | na | vājam | saniṣyan | ayāsīt || indram | gacchan | āyudhā | sam-śiśānaḥ | viśvā | vasu | hastayoḥ | ā-dadhānaḥ ||9.90.1||

IAST: indraṁ gacchann āyudhā saṁśiśāno viśvā vasu hastayor ādadhānaḥ
Griffith: Going to Indra, sharpening his weapons, and in his hand containing every treasure.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं गच्छन्नायुधा संशिशानो विश्वा वसु हस्तयोरादधानः
pada pāṭha: pra | hinvānaḥ | janitā | rodasyoḥ | rathaḥ | na | vājam | saniṣyan | ayāsīt || indram | gacchan | āyudhā | sam-śiśānaḥ | viśvā | vasu | hastayoḥ | ā-dadhānaḥ ||9.90.1||

IAST: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṁ vṛṣaṇaṁ vayodhām āṅgūṣāṇām avāvaśanta vāṇīḥ
Griffith: To him the tones of sacred song have sounded, Steer of the triple height, the Life-bestower.
pada pāṭha: abhi | tri-pr̥ṣṭham | vr̥ṣaṇam | vayaḥ-dhām | āṅgūṣāṇām | avāvaśanta | vāṇīḥ || vanā | vasānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | na | sindhūn | vi | ratna-dhāḥ | dayate | vāryāṇi ||9.90.2||

IAST: vanā vasāno varuṇo na sindhūn vi ratnadhā dayate vāryāṇi
Griffith: Dwelling in wood as Varuna in rivers, lavishing treasure he distributes blessings
Devanāgarī: वना वसानो वरुणो न सिन्धून्वि रत्नधा दयते वार्याणि
pada pāṭha: abhi | tri-pr̥ṣṭham | vr̥ṣaṇam | vayaḥ-dhām | āṅgūṣāṇām | avāvaśanta | vāṇīḥ || vanā | vasānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | na | sindhūn | vi | ratna-dhāḥ | dayate | vāryāṇi ||9.90.2||

IAST: śūragrāmaḥ sarvavīraḥ sahāvāñ jetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni
Griffith: Great Conqueror, warnor-girt, Lord of all heroes, flow on thy way as he who winneth riches;
Devanāgarī: शूरग्रामः सर्ववीरः सहावाञ्जेता पवस्व सनिता धनानि
pada pāṭha: śūra-grāmaḥ | sarva-vīraḥ | sahāvān | jetā | pavasva | sanitā | dhanāni || tigma-āyudhaḥ | kṣipra-dhanvā | samat-su | aṣāḷhaḥ | sahvān | pr̥tanāsu | śatrūn ||9.90.3||

IAST: tigmāyudhaḥ kṣipradhanvā samatsv aṣāḻhaḥ sāhvān pṛtanāsu śatrūn
Griffith: With sharpened. arms, with swift bow, never vanquished in battle, vanquishing in fight the foemen.
pada pāṭha: śūra-grāmaḥ | sarva-vīraḥ | sahāvān | jetā | pavasva | sanitā | dhanāni || tigma-āyudhaḥ | kṣipra-dhanvā | samat-su | aṣāḷhaḥ | sahvān | pr̥tanāsu | śatrūn ||9.90.3||

IAST: urugavyūtir abhayāni kṛṇvan samīcīne ā pavasvā puraṁdhī
Griffith: Giving security, Lord of wide dominion, send us both earth and heaven with all their fulness.
pada pāṭha: uru-gavyūtiḥ | abhayāni | kr̥ṇvan | samīcīne iti sam-īcīne | ā | pavasva | puraṁdhī iti puram-dhī || apaḥ | sisāsan | uṣasaḥ | svaḥ | gāḥ | sam | cikradaḥ | mahaḥ | asmabhyam | vājān ||9.90.4||

IAST: apaḥ siṣāsann uṣasaḥ svar gāḥ saṁ cikrado maho asmabhyaṁ vājān
Griffith: Striving to win the Dawns, the light, the waters, and cattle, call to us abundant vigour.
Devanāgarī: अपः सिषासन्नुषसः स्वर्गाः सं चिक्रदो महो अस्मभ्यं वाजान्
pada pāṭha: uru-gavyūtiḥ | abhayāni | kr̥ṇvan | samīcīne iti sam-īcīne | ā | pavasva | puraṁdhī iti puram-dhī || apaḥ | sisāsan | uṣasaḥ | svaḥ | gāḥ | sam | cikradaḥ | mahaḥ | asmabhyam | vājān ||9.90.4||

IAST: matsi soma varuṇam matsi mitram matsīndram indo pavamāna viṣṇum
Griffith: O Soma, gladden Varuna and Mitra; cheer, Indu Pavamana! Indra, Visnu.
Devanāgarī: मत्सि सोम वरुणं मत्सि मित्रं मत्सीन्द्रमिन्दो पवमान विष्णुम्
pada pāṭha: matsi | soma | varuṇam | matsi | mitram | matsi | indram | indo iti | pavamāna | viṣṇum || matsi | śardhaḥ | mārutam | matsi | devān | matsi | mahām | indram | indo iti | madāya ||9.90.5||

IAST: matsi śardho mārutam matsi devān matsi mahām indram indo madāya
Griffith: Cheer thou the Gods, the Company of Maruts: Indu, cheer mighty Indra to rejoicing.
Devanāgarī: मत्सि शर्धो मारुतं मत्सि देवान्मत्सि महामिन्द्रमिन्दो मदाय
pada pāṭha: matsi | soma | varuṇam | matsi | mitram | matsi | indram | indo iti | pavamāna | viṣṇum || matsi | śardhaḥ | mārutam | matsi | devān | matsi | mahām | indram | indo iti | madāya ||9.90.5||

IAST: evā rājeva kratumām̐ amena viśvā ghanighnad duritā pavasva
Griffith: Thus like a wise and potent King flow onward, destroying with thy vigour all misfortunes.
Devanāgarī: एवा राजेव क्रतुमाँ अमेन विश्वा घनिघ्नद्दुरिता पवस्व
pada pāṭha: eva | rājā-iva | kratu-mān | amena | viśvā | ghanighnat | duḥ-itā | pavasva || indo iti | su-uktāya | vacase | vayaḥ | dhāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||9.90.6||

IAST: indo sūktāya vacase vayo dhā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: For our well-spoken hymn give life, O Indu. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इन्दो सूक्ताय वचसे वयो धा यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eva | rājā-iva | kratu-mān | amena | viśvā | ghanighnat | duḥ-itā | pavasva || indo iti | su-uktāya | vacase | vayaḥ | dhāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||9.90.6||

IAST: asarji vakvā rathye yathājau dhiyā manotā prathamo manīṣī
Griffith: As for a chariot-race, the skilful Speaker, Chief, Sage, Inventor, hath, with song, been started.
Devanāgarī: असर्जि वक्वा रथ्ये यथाजौ धिया मनोता प्रथमो मनीषी
pada pāṭha: asarji | vakvā | rathye | yathā | ājau | dhiyā | manotā | prathamaḥ | manīṣī || daśa | svasāraḥ | adhi | sānau | avye | ajanti | vahnim | sadanāni | accha ||9.91.1||

IAST: daśa svasāro adhi sāno avye 'janti vahniṁ sadanāny accha
Griffith: The sisters ten upon the fleecy summit drive on the Car-horse to the resting places.
Devanāgarī: दश स्वसारो अधि सानो अव्येऽजन्ति वह्निं सदनान्यच्छ
pada pāṭha: asarji | vakvā | rathye | yathā | ājau | dhiyā | manotā | prathamaḥ | manīṣī || daśa | svasāraḥ | adhi | sānau | avye | ajanti | vahnim | sadanāni | accha ||9.91.1||

IAST: vītī janasya divyasya kavyair adhi suvāno nahuṣyebhir induḥ
Griffith: The drop of Soma, pressed by wise Nahusyas, becomes the banquet of the Heavenly People-
Devanāgarī: वीती जनस्य दिव्यस्य कव्यैरधि सुवानो नहुष्येभिरिन्दुः
pada pāṭha: vītī | janasya | divyasya | kavyaiḥ | adhi | suvānaḥ | nahuṣyebhiḥ | induḥ || pra | yaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | amr̥taḥ | martyebhiḥ | marmr̥jānaḥ | avi-bhiḥ | gobhiḥ | at-bhiḥ ||9.91.2||

IAST: pra yo nṛbhir amṛto martyebhir marmṛjāno 'vibhir gobhir adbhiḥ
Griffith: Indu, by hands of mortal men made beauteous, immortal, with the sheep and cows and waters.
pada pāṭha: vītī | janasya | divyasya | kavyaiḥ | adhi | suvānaḥ | nahuṣyebhiḥ | induḥ || pra | yaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | amr̥taḥ | martyebhiḥ | marmr̥jānaḥ | avi-bhiḥ | gobhiḥ | at-bhiḥ ||9.91.2||

IAST: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe roruvad aṁśur asmai pavamāno ruśad īrte payo goḥ
Griffith: Steer roaring unto Steer, this Pavamana, this juice runs to the white milk of the milch-cow.
Devanāgarī: वृषा वृष्णे रोरुवदंशुरस्मै पवमानो रुशदीर्ते पयो गोः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣṇe | roruvat | aṁśuḥ | asmai | pavamānaḥ | ruśat | īrte | payaḥ | goḥ || sahasram | r̥kvā | pathi-bhiḥ | vacaḥ-vit | adhvasma-bhiḥ | sūraḥ | aṇvam | vi | yāti ||9.91.3||

IAST: sahasram ṛkvā pathibhir vacovid adhvasmabhiḥ sūro aṇvaṁ vi yāti
Griffith: Through thousand fine hairs goes the tuneful Singer, like Sura by his fair and open pathways.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रमृक्वा पथिभिर्वचोविदध्वस्मभिः सूरो अण्वं वि याति
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣṇe | roruvat | aṁśuḥ | asmai | pavamānaḥ | ruśat | īrte | payaḥ | goḥ || sahasram | r̥kvā | pathi-bhiḥ | vacaḥ-vit | adhvasma-bhiḥ | sūraḥ | aṇvam | vi | yāti ||9.91.3||

IAST: rujā dṛḻhā cid rakṣasaḥ sadāṁsi punāna inda ūrṇuhi vi vājān
Griffith: Break down the, strong seats even of the demons: cleansing thee, Indu, robd thyself in vigour.
Devanāgarī: रुजा दृळ्हा चिद्रक्षसः सदांसि पुनान इन्द ऊर्णुहि वि वाजान्
pada pāṭha: ruja | dr̥ḷhā | cit | rakṣasaḥ | sadāṁsi | punānaḥ | indo iti | ūrṇuhi | vi | vājān || vr̥śca | upariṣṭāt | tujatā | vadhena | ye | anti | dūrāt | upa-nāyam | eṣām ||9.91.4||

IAST: vṛścopariṣṭāt tujatā vadhena ye anti dūrād upanāyam eṣām
Griffith: Rend with thy swift bolt, coming from above them, those who are near and those who yet are distant.
pada pāṭha: ruja | dr̥ḷhā | cit | rakṣasaḥ | sadāṁsi | punānaḥ | indo iti | ūrṇuhi | vi | vājān || vr̥śca | upariṣṭāt | tujatā | vadhena | ye | anti | dūrāt | upa-nāyam | eṣām ||9.91.4||

IAST: sa pratnavan navyase viśvavāra sūktāya pathaḥ kṛṇuhi prācaḥ
Griffith: Prepare the forward paths in ancient manner for the new bymn, thou Giver of all bounties.
Devanāgarī: स प्रत्नवन्नव्यसे विश्ववार सूक्ताय पथः कृणुहि प्राचः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pratna-vat | navyase | viśva-vāra | su-uktāya | pathaḥ | kr̥ṇuhi | prācaḥ || ye | duḥ-sahāsaḥ | vanuṣā | br̥hantaḥ | tān | te | aśyāma | puru-kr̥t | purukṣo iti puru-kṣo ||9.91.5||

IAST: ye duḥṣahāso vanuṣā bṛhantas tām̐s te aśyāma purukṛt purukṣo
Griffith: Those which are high and hard for foes to conquer may we gain from thee, Active! Food-bestower!
Devanāgarī: ये दुःषहासो वनुषा बृहन्तस्ताँस्ते अश्याम पुरुकृत्पुरुक्षो
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pratna-vat | navyase | viśva-vāra | su-uktāya | pathaḥ | kr̥ṇuhi | prācaḥ || ye | duḥ-sahāsaḥ | vanuṣā | br̥hantaḥ | tān | te | aśyāma | puru-kr̥t | purukṣo iti puru-kṣo ||9.91.5||

IAST: evā punāno apaḥ svar gā asmabhyaṁ tokā tanayāni bhūri
Griffith: So purifying thee vouchsafe us waters, heaven's light, and cows, offipring and many children.
Devanāgarī: एवा पुनानो अपः स्वर्गा अस्मभ्यं तोका तनयानि भूरि
pada pāṭha: eva | punānaḥ | apaḥ | svaḥ | gāḥ | asmabhyam | tokā | tanayāni | bhūri || śam | naḥ | kṣetram | uru | jyotīṁṣi | soma | jyok | naḥ | sūryam | dr̥śaye | rirīhi ||9.91.6||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ kṣetram uru jyotīṁṣi soma jyoṅ naḥ sūryaṁ dṛśaye rirīhi
Griffith: Give us health, ample land, and lights, O Soma, and grant us long to look upon the sunshine.
Devanāgarī: शं नः क्षेत्रमुरु ज्योतींषि सोम ज्योङ्नः सूर्यं दृशये रिरीहि
pada pāṭha: eva | punānaḥ | apaḥ | svaḥ | gāḥ | asmabhyam | tokā | tanayāni | bhūri || śam | naḥ | kṣetram | uru | jyotīṁṣi | soma | jyok | naḥ | sūryam | dr̥śaye | rirīhi ||9.91.6||

IAST: pari suvāno harir aṁśuḥ pavitre ratho na sarji sanaye hiyānaḥ
Griffith: THE gold-hued juice, poured out upon the filter, is started like a car sent forth to conquer.
Devanāgarī: परि सुवानो हरिरंशुः पवित्रे रथो न सर्जि सनये हियानः
pada pāṭha: pari | suvānaḥ | hariḥ | aṁśuḥ | pavitre | rathaḥ | na | sarji | sanaye | hiyānaḥ || āpat | ślokam | indriyam | pūyamānaḥ | prati | devān | ajuṣata | prayaḥ-bhiḥ ||9.92.1||

IAST: āpac chlokam indriyam pūyamānaḥ prati devām̐ ajuṣata prayobhiḥ
Griffith: He hath gained song and vigour while they cleansed him, and hath rejoiced the Gods with entertainments.
Devanāgarī: आपच्छ्लोकमिन्द्रियं पूयमानः प्रति देवाँ अजुषत प्रयोभिः
pada pāṭha: pari | suvānaḥ | hariḥ | aṁśuḥ | pavitre | rathaḥ | na | sarji | sanaye | hiyānaḥ || āpat | ślokam | indriyam | pūyamānaḥ | prati | devān | ajuṣata | prayaḥ-bhiḥ ||9.92.1||

IAST: acchā nṛcakṣā asarat pavitre nāma dadhānaḥ kavir asya yonau
Griffith: He who beholdeth man hath reached the filter: bearing his name, the Sage hath sought his dwelling.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा नृचक्षा असरत्पवित्रे नाम दधानः कविरस्य योनौ
pada pāṭha: accha | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | asarat | pavitre | nāma | dadhānaḥ | kaviḥ | asya | yonau || sīdan | hotā-iva | sadane | camūṣu | upa | īm | agman | r̥ṣayaḥ | sapta | viprāḥ ||9.92.2||

IAST: sīdan hoteva sadane camūṣūpem agmann ṛṣayaḥ sapta viprāḥ
Griffith: The Rsis came to him, seven holy singers, when in the bowls he settled as Invoker.
pada pāṭha: accha | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | asarat | pavitre | nāma | dadhānaḥ | kaviḥ | asya | yonau || sīdan | hotā-iva | sadane | camūṣu | upa | īm | agman | r̥ṣayaḥ | sapta | viprāḥ ||9.92.2||

IAST: pra sumedhā gātuvid viśvadevaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ sada eti nityam
Griffith: Shared by all Gods, mobt wise, propitious, Soma goes, while they cleanse him, to his constant station.
Devanāgarī: प्र सुमेधा गातुविद्विश्वदेवः सोमः पुनानः सद एति नित्यम्
pada pāṭha: pra | su-medhāḥ | gātu-vit | viśva-devaḥ | somaḥ | punānaḥ | sadaḥ | eti | nityam || bhuvat | viśveṣu | kāvyeṣu | rantā | anu | janān | yatate | pañca | dhīraḥ ||9.92.3||

IAST: bhuvad viśveṣu kāvyeṣu rantānu janān yatate pañca dhīraḥ
Griffith: Let him rejoice in all his lofty wisdom to the Five Tribes the Sage attains with labour.
Devanāgarī: भुवद्विश्वेषु काव्येषु रन्तानु जनान्यतते पञ्च धीरः
pada pāṭha: pra | su-medhāḥ | gātu-vit | viśva-devaḥ | somaḥ | punānaḥ | sadaḥ | eti | nityam || bhuvat | viśveṣu | kāvyeṣu | rantā | anu | janān | yatate | pañca | dhīraḥ ||9.92.3||

IAST: tava tye soma pavamāna niṇye viśve devās traya ekādaśāsaḥ
Griffith: In thy mysterious place, O Pavamana Soma, are all the Gods, the Thrice-Eleven.
Devanāgarī: तव त्ये सोम पवमान निण्ये विश्वे देवास्त्रय एकादशासः
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | soma | pavamāna | niṇye | viśve | devāḥ | trayaḥ | ekādaśāsaḥ || daśa | svadhābhiḥ | adhi | sānau | avye | mr̥janti | tvā | nadyaḥ | sapta | yahvīḥ ||9.92.4||

IAST: daśa svadhābhir adhi sāno avye mṛjanti tvā nadyaḥ sapta yahvīḥ
Griffith: Ten on the fleecy height, themselves, self-prompted, and seven fresh rivers, brighten and adorn thee.
Devanāgarī: दश स्वधाभिरधि सानो अव्ये मृजन्ति त्वा नद्यः सप्त यह्वीः
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | soma | pavamāna | niṇye | viśve | devāḥ | trayaḥ | ekādaśāsaḥ || daśa | svadhābhiḥ | adhi | sānau | avye | mr̥janti | tvā | nadyaḥ | sapta | yahvīḥ ||9.92.4||

IAST: tan nu satyam pavamānasyāstu yatra viśve kāravaḥ saṁnasanta
Griffith: Now let this be the truth of Pavamana, there where all singers gather them together,
Devanāgarī: तन्नु सत्यं पवमानस्यास्तु यत्र विश्वे कारवः संनसन्त
pada pāṭha: tat | nu | satyam | pavamānasya | astu | yatra | viśve | kāravaḥ | sam-nasanta || jyotiḥ | yat | ahne | akr̥ṇot | ūm̐ iti | lokam | pra | āvat | manum | dasyave | kaḥ | abhīkam ||9.92.5||

IAST: jyotir yad ahne akṛṇod u lokam prāvan manuṁ dasyave kar abhīkam
Griffith: That he hath given us room and made the daylight, hath holpen Manu and repelled the Dasyu.
Devanāgarī: ज्योतिर्यदह्ने अकृणोदु लोकं प्रावन्मनुं दस्यवे करभीकम्
pada pāṭha: tat | nu | satyam | pavamānasya | astu | yatra | viśve | kāravaḥ | sam-nasanta || jyotiḥ | yat | ahne | akr̥ṇot | ūm̐ iti | lokam | pra | āvat | manum | dasyave | kaḥ | abhīkam ||9.92.5||

IAST: pari sadmeva paśumānti hotā rājā na satyaḥ samitīr iyānaḥ
Griffith: As the priest seeks the station rich in cattle, like a true King who goes to great assemblies,
Devanāgarī: परि सद्मेव पशुमान्ति होता राजा न सत्यः समितीरियानः
pada pāṭha: pari | sadma-iva | paśu-manti | hotā | rājā | na | satyaḥ | sam-itīḥ | iyānaḥ || somaḥ | punānaḥ | kalaśān | ayāsīt | sīdan | mr̥gaḥ | na | mahiṣaḥ | vaneṣu ||9.92.6||

IAST: somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśām̐ ayāsīt sīdan mṛgo na mahiṣo vaneṣu
Griffith: Soma hath sought the beakers while they cleansed him, and like a wild bull, in the wood hath settled.
Devanāgarī: सोमः पुनानः कलशाँ अयासीत्सीदन्मृगो न महिषो वनेषु
pada pāṭha: pari | sadma-iva | paśu-manti | hotā | rājā | na | satyaḥ | sam-itīḥ | iyānaḥ || somaḥ | punānaḥ | kalaśān | ayāsīt | sīdan | mr̥gaḥ | na | mahiṣaḥ | vaneṣu ||9.92.6||

IAST: sākamukṣo marjayanta svasāro daśa dhīrasya dhītayo dhanutrīḥ
Griffith: TEN sisters, pouring out the rain together, swift-moving thinkers of the sage, adorn him.
Devanāgarī: साकमुक्षो मर्जयन्त स्वसारो दश धीरस्य धीतयो धनुत्रीः
pada pāṭha: sākam-ukṣaḥ | marjayanta | svasāraḥ | daśa | dhīrasya | dhītayaḥ | dhanutrīḥ || hariḥ | pari | adravat | jāḥ | sūryasya | droṇam | nanakṣe | atyaḥ | na | vājī ||9.93.1||

IAST: hariḥ pary adravaj jāḥ sūryasya droṇaṁ nanakṣe atyo na vājī
Griffith: Hither hath run the gold-hued Child of Surya and reached the vat like a fleet vigorous courser.
Devanāgarī: हरिः पर्यद्रवज्जाः सूर्यस्य द्रोणं ननक्षे अत्यो न वाजी
pada pāṭha: sākam-ukṣaḥ | marjayanta | svasāraḥ | daśa | dhīrasya | dhītayaḥ | dhanutrīḥ || hariḥ | pari | adravat | jāḥ | sūryasya | droṇam | nanakṣe | atyaḥ | na | vājī ||9.93.1||

IAST: sam mātṛbhir na śiśur vāvaśāno vṛṣā dadhanve puruvāro adbhiḥ
Griffith: Even as a youngling crying to his mothers, the bounteous Steer hath flowed along to waters.
Devanāgarī: सं मातृभिर्न शिशुर्वावशानो वृषा दधन्वे पुरुवारो अद्भिः
pada pāṭha: sam | mātr̥-bhiḥ | na | śiśuḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | vr̥ṣā | dadhanve | puru-vāraḥ | at-bhiḥ || maryaḥ | na | yoṣām | abhi | niḥ-kr̥tam | yan | sam | gacchate | kalaśe | usriyābhiḥ ||9.93.2||

IAST: maryo na yoṣām abhi niṣkṛtaṁ yan saṁ gacchate kalaśa usriyābhiḥ
Griffith: As youth to damsel, so with milk he hastens on to the. chose meeting-place, the beaker.
Devanāgarī: मर्यो न योषामभि निष्कृतं यन्सं गच्छते कलश उस्रियाभिः
pada pāṭha: sam | mātr̥-bhiḥ | na | śiśuḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | vr̥ṣā | dadhanve | puru-vāraḥ | at-bhiḥ || maryaḥ | na | yoṣām | abhi | niḥ-kr̥tam | yan | sam | gacchate | kalaśe | usriyābhiḥ ||9.93.2||

IAST: uta pra pipya ūdhar aghnyāyā indur dhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ
Griffith: Yea, swollen is the udder of the milch-cow: thither in streams goes very sapient Indu.
Devanāgarī: उत प्र पिप्य ऊधरघ्न्याया इन्दुर्धाराभिः सचते सुमेधाः
pada pāṭha: uta | pra | pipye | ūdhaḥ | aghnyāyāḥ | induḥ | dhārābhiḥ | sacate | su-medhāḥ || mūrdhānam | gāvaḥ | payasā | camūṣu | abhi | śrīṇanti | vasu-bhiḥ | na | niktaiḥ ||9.93.3||

IAST: mūrdhānaṁ gāvaḥ payasā camūṣv abhi śrīṇanti vasubhir na niktaiḥ
Griffith: The kine make ready, as with new-washed treasures, the Head and Chief with milk within the vessels.
Devanāgarī: मूर्धानं गावः पयसा चमूष्वभि श्रीणन्ति वसुभिर्न निक्तैः
pada pāṭha: uta | pra | pipye | ūdhaḥ | aghnyāyāḥ | induḥ | dhārābhiḥ | sacate | su-medhāḥ || mūrdhānam | gāvaḥ | payasā | camūṣu | abhi | śrīṇanti | vasu-bhiḥ | na | niktaiḥ ||9.93.3||

IAST: sa no devebhiḥ pavamāna radendo rayim aśvinaṁ vāvaśānaḥ
Griffith: With all the Gods, O Indu Pavamana, while thou art roaring send us wealth in horses.
Devanāgarī: स नो देवेभिः पवमान रदेन्दो रयिमश्विनं वावशानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | devebhiḥ | pavamāna | rada | indo iti | rayim | aśvinam | vāvaśānaḥ || rathirāyatām | uśatī | puram-dhiḥ | asmadryak | ā | dāvane | vasūnām ||9.93.4||

IAST: rathirāyatām uśatī puraṁdhir asmadryag ā dāvane vasūnām
Griffith: Hither upon her car come willing Plenty, inclined to us, to give us of her treasures.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | devebhiḥ | pavamāna | rada | indo iti | rayim | aśvinam | vāvaśānaḥ || rathirāyatām | uśatī | puram-dhiḥ | asmadryak | ā | dāvane | vasūnām ||9.93.4||

IAST: nū no rayim upa māsva nṛvantam punāno vātāpyaṁ viśvaścandram
Griffith: Now unto us mete riches, while they cleansethee, all-glorious, swelling wealth, with store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: नू नो रयिमुप मास्व नृवन्तं पुनानो वाताप्यं विश्वश्चन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | rayim | upa | māsva | nr̥-vantam | punānaḥ | vātāpyam | viśva-candram || pra | vandituḥ | indo iti | tāri | āyuḥ | prātaḥ | makṣu | dhiyā-vasuḥ | jagamyāt ||9.93.5||

IAST: pra vanditur indo tāry āyuḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt
Griffith: Long be his life who worships, thee, O Indu. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | rayim | upa | māsva | nr̥-vantam | punānaḥ | vātāpyam | viśva-candram || pra | vandituḥ | indo iti | tāri | āyuḥ | prātaḥ | makṣu | dhiyā-vasuḥ | jagamyāt ||9.93.5||

IAST: adhi yad asmin vājinīva śubhaḥ spardhante dhiyaḥ sūrye na viśaḥ
Griffith: WHEN beauties strive for him as for a charger, then strive the songs like soldiers for the sunlight.
Devanāgarī: अधि यदस्मिन्वाजिनीव शुभः स्पर्धन्ते धियः सूर्ये न विशः
pada pāṭha: adhi | yat | asmin | vājini-iva | śubhaḥ | spardhante | dhiyaḥ | sūrye | na | viśaḥ || apaḥ | vr̥ṇānaḥ | pavate | kavi-yan | vrajam | na | paśu-vardhanāya | manma ||9.94.1||

IAST: apo vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajaṁ na paśuvardhanāya manma
Griffith: Acting the Sage, he flows enrobed in waters and song as 'twere a stall that kine may prosper.
Devanāgarī: अपो वृणानः पवते कवीयन्व्रजं न पशुवर्धनाय मन्म
pada pāṭha: adhi | yat | asmin | vājini-iva | śubhaḥ | spardhante | dhiyaḥ | sūrye | na | viśaḥ || apaḥ | vr̥ṇānaḥ | pavate | kavi-yan | vrajam | na | paśu-vardhanāya | manma ||9.94.1||

IAST: dvitā vyūrṇvann amṛtasya dhāma svarvide bhuvanāni prathanta
Griffith: The worlds expand to hirn who from aforetime found light to spread the law of life eternal.
Devanāgarī: द्विता व्यूर्ण्वन्नमृतस्य धाम स्वर्विदे भुवनानि प्रथन्त
pada pāṭha: dvitā | vi-ūrṇvan | amr̥tasya | dhāma | svaḥ-vide | bhuvanāni | prathanta || dhiyaḥ | pinvānāḥ | svasare | na | gāvaḥ | r̥ta-yantīḥ | abhi | vāvaśre | indum ||9.94.2||

IAST: dhiyaḥ pinvānāḥ svasare na gāva ṛtāyantīr abhi vāvaśra indum
Griffith: The swelling songs, like kine within the stable, in deep devotion call aloud on Indu.
Devanāgarī: धियः पिन्वानाः स्वसरे न गाव ऋतायन्तीरभि वावश्र इन्दुम्
pada pāṭha: dvitā | vi-ūrṇvan | amr̥tasya | dhāma | svaḥ-vide | bhuvanāni | prathanta || dhiyaḥ | pinvānāḥ | svasare | na | gāvaḥ | r̥ta-yantīḥ | abhi | vāvaśre | indum ||9.94.2||

IAST: pari yat kaviḥ kāvyā bharate śūro na ratho bhuvanāni viśvā
Griffith: When the sage bears his holy wisdom round him, like a car visiting all worlds, the Hero,
Devanāgarī: परि यत्कविः काव्या भरते शूरो न रथो भुवनानि विश्वा
pada pāṭha: pari | yat | kaviḥ | kāvyā | bharate | śūraḥ | na | rathaḥ | bhuvanāni | viśvā || deveṣu | yaśaḥ | martāya | bhūṣan | dakṣāya | rāyaḥ | puru-bhūṣu | navyaḥ ||9.94.3||

IAST: deveṣu yaśo martāya bhūṣan dakṣāya rāyaḥ purubhūṣu navyaḥ
Griffith: Becoming fame, mid Gods, unto the mortal, wealth to the skilled, worth praise mid the Ever-present,
Devanāgarī: देवेषु यशो मर्ताय भूषन्दक्षाय रायः पुरुभूषु नव्यः
pada pāṭha: pari | yat | kaviḥ | kāvyā | bharate | śūraḥ | na | rathaḥ | bhuvanāni | viśvā || deveṣu | yaśaḥ | martāya | bhūṣan | dakṣāya | rāyaḥ | puru-bhūṣu | navyaḥ ||9.94.3||

IAST: śriye jātaḥ śriya ā nir iyāya śriyaṁ vayo jaritṛbhyo dadhāti
Griffith: For glory born be hath come forth to glory: he giveth life and glory to the singers.
Devanāgarī: श्रिये जातः श्रिय आ निरियाय श्रियं वयो जरितृभ्यो दधाति
pada pāṭha: śriye | jātaḥ | śriye | ā | niḥ | iyāya | śriyam | vayaḥ | jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | dadhāti || śriyam | vasānāḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | āyan | bhavanti | satyā | sam-ithā | mita-drau ||9.94.4||

IAST: śriyaṁ vasānā amṛtatvam āyan bhavanti satyā samithā mitadrau
Griffith: They, clothed in glory, have become immortal. He, measured in his course, makes frays successful.
Devanāgarī: श्रियं वसाना अमृतत्वमायन्भवन्ति सत्या समिथा मितद्रौ
pada pāṭha: śriye | jātaḥ | śriye | ā | niḥ | iyāya | śriyam | vayaḥ | jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | dadhāti || śriyam | vasānāḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | āyan | bhavanti | satyā | sam-ithā | mita-drau ||9.94.4||

IAST: iṣam ūrjam abhy arṣāśvaṁ gām uru jyotiḥ kṛṇuhi matsi devān
Griffith: Stream to us food and vigour, kine and horses: give us broad lights and fill thGods with rapture.
Devanāgarī: इषमूर्जमभ्यर्षाश्वं गामुरु ज्योतिः कृणुहि मत्सि देवान्
pada pāṭha: iṣam | ūrjam | abhi | arṣa | aśvam | gām | uru | jyotiḥ | kr̥ṇuhi | matsi | devān || viśvāni | hi | su-sahā | tāni | tubhyam | pavamāna | bādhase | soma | śatrūn ||9.94.5||

IAST: viśvāni hi suṣahā tāni tubhyam pavamāna bādhase soma śatrūn
Griffith: All ther are easy things for thee to master thou, Pavamana Soma, quellest foemen.
Devanāgarī: विश्वानि हि सुषहा तानि तुभ्यं पवमान बाधसे सोम शत्रून्
pada pāṭha: iṣam | ūrjam | abhi | arṣa | aśvam | gām | uru | jyotiḥ | kr̥ṇuhi | matsi | devān || viśvāni | hi | su-sahā | tāni | tubhyam | pavamāna | bādhase | soma | śatrūn ||9.94.5||

IAST: kanikranti harir ā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ
Griffith: Loud neighs the Tawny Steed when started, settling deep in the wooden vessel while they cleanse him.
Devanāgarī: कनिक्रन्ति हरिरा सृज्यमानः सीदन्वनस्य जठरे पुनानः
pada pāṭha: kanikranti | hariḥ | ā | sr̥jyamānaḥ | sīdan | vanasya | jaṭhare | punānaḥ || nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | kr̥ṇute | niḥ-nijam | gāḥ | ataḥ | matīḥ | janayata | svadhābhiḥ ||9.95.1||

IAST: nṛbhir yataḥ kṛṇute nirṇijaṁ gā ato matīr janayata svadhābhiḥ
Griffith: Led by the men he takes the milk for raiment: then shall he, through his powers, engender praise-songs.
Devanāgarī: नृभिर्यतः कृणुते निर्णिजं गा अतो मतीर्जनयत स्वधाभिः
pada pāṭha: kanikranti | hariḥ | ā | sr̥jyamānaḥ | sīdan | vanasya | jaṭhare | punānaḥ || nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | kr̥ṇute | niḥ-nijam | gāḥ | ataḥ | matīḥ | janayata | svadhābhiḥ ||9.95.1||

IAST: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ pathyām ṛtasyeyarti vācam ariteva nāvam
Griffith: As one who rows drives on his boat, he, Gold-hued, sends forth his voice, loosed on the path of Order.
pada pāṭha: hariḥ | sr̥jānaḥ | pathyām | r̥tasya | iyarti | vācam | aritā-iva | nāvam || devaḥ | devānām | guhyāni | nāma | āviḥ | kr̥ṇoti | barhiṣi | pra-vāce ||9.95.2||

IAST: devo devānāṁ guhyāni nāmāviṣ kṛṇoti barhiṣi pravāce
Griffith: As God, the secret names of Gods he utters, to be declared on sacred grass more widely.
Devanāgarī: देवो देवानां गुह्यानि नामाविष्कृणोति बर्हिषि प्रवाचे
pada pāṭha: hariḥ | sr̥jānaḥ | pathyām | r̥tasya | iyarti | vācam | aritā-iva | nāvam || devaḥ | devānām | guhyāni | nāma | āviḥ | kr̥ṇoti | barhiṣi | pra-vāce ||9.95.2||

IAST: apām ived ūrmayas tarturāṇāḥ pra manīṣā īrate somam accha
Griffith: Hastening onward like the waves of waters, our holy hymns are pressing nigh to Soma.
pada pāṭha: apām-iva | it | ūrmayaḥ | tarturāṇāḥ | pra | manīṣāḥ | īrate | somam | accha || namasyantīḥ | upa | ca | yanti | sam | ca | ā | ca | viśanti | uśatīḥ | uśantam ||9.95.3||

IAST: namasyantīr upa ca yanti saṁ cā ca viśanty uśatīr uśantam
Griffith: To him they come with lowly adoration, and, longing, enter him who longs to meet them.
Devanāgarī: नमस्यन्तीरुप च यन्ति सं चा च विशन्त्युशतीरुशन्तम्
pada pāṭha: apām-iva | it | ūrmayaḥ | tarturāṇāḥ | pra | manīṣāḥ | īrate | somam | accha || namasyantīḥ | upa | ca | yanti | sam | ca | ā | ca | viśanti | uśatīḥ | uśantam ||9.95.3||

IAST: tam marmṛjānam mahiṣaṁ na sānāv aṁśuṁ duhanty ukṣaṇaṁ giriṣṭhām
Griffith: They drain the stalk, the Steer who dwells on mountains, even as a Bull who decks him on the upland.
Devanāgarī: तं मर्मृजानं महिषं न सानावंशुं दुहन्त्युक्षणं गिरिष्ठाम्
pada pāṭha: tam | marmr̥jānam | mahiṣam | na | sānau | aṁśum | duhanti | ukṣaṇam | giri-sthām || tam | vāvaśānam | matayaḥ | sacante | tritaḥ | bibharti | varuṇam | samudre ||9.95.4||

IAST: taṁ vāvaśānam matayaḥ sacante trito bibharti varuṇaṁ samudre
Griffith: Hymns follow and attend him as he bellows: Trita bears Varuna aloft in ocean.
Devanāgarī: तं वावशानं मतयः सचन्ते त्रितो बिभर्ति वरुणं समुद्रे
pada pāṭha: tam | marmr̥jānam | mahiṣam | na | sānau | aṁśum | duhanti | ukṣaṇam | giri-sthām || tam | vāvaśānam | matayaḥ | sacante | tritaḥ | bibharti | varuṇam | samudre ||9.95.4||

IAST: iṣyan vācam upavakteva hotuḥ punāna indo vi ṣyā manīṣām
Griffith: Sending thy voice out as Director, loosen the Invoker's thought, O Indu, as they cleanse thee.
Devanāgarī: इष्यन्वाचमुपवक्तेव होतुः पुनान इन्दो वि ष्या मनीषाम्
pada pāṭha: iṣyan | vācam | upavaktā-iva | hotuḥ | punānaḥ | indo iti | vi | sya | manīṣām || indraḥ | ca | yat | kṣayathaḥ | saubhagāya | su-vīryasya | patayaḥ | syāma ||9.95.5||

IAST: indraś ca yat kṣayathaḥ saubhagāya suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma
Griffith: While thou and Indra rule for our advantage, may we be masters of heroic vigour.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रश्च यत्क्षयथः सौभगाय सुवीर्यस्य पतयः स्याम
pada pāṭha: iṣyan | vācam | upavaktā-iva | hotuḥ | punānaḥ | indo iti | vi | sya | manīṣām || indraḥ | ca | yat | kṣayathaḥ | saubhagāya | su-vīryasya | patayaḥ | syāma ||9.95.5||

IAST: pra senānīḥ śūro agre rathānāṁ gavyann eti harṣate asya senā
Griffith: IN forefront of the cars forth goes the Hero, the Leader, winning spoil: his host rejoices.
Devanāgarī: प्र सेनानीः शूरो अग्रे रथानां गव्यन्नेति हर्षते अस्य सेना
pada pāṭha: pra | senā-nīḥ | śūraḥ | agre | rathānām | gavyan | eti | harṣate | asya | senā || bhadrān | kr̥ṇvan | indra-havān | sakhi-bhyaḥ | ā | somaḥ | vastrā | rabhasāni | datte ||9.96.1||

IAST: bhadrān kṛṇvann indrahavān sakhibhya ā somo vastrā rabhasāni datte
Griffith: Soma endues his robes of lasting colours, and blesses, for his friends, their calls on Indra.
Devanāgarī: भद्रान्कृण्वन्निन्द्रहवान्सखिभ्य आ सोमो वस्त्रा रभसानि दत्ते
pada pāṭha: pra | senā-nīḥ | śūraḥ | agre | rathānām | gavyan | eti | harṣate | asya | senā || bhadrān | kr̥ṇvan | indra-havān | sakhi-bhyaḥ | ā | somaḥ | vastrā | rabhasāni | datte ||9.96.1||

IAST: sam asya hariṁ harayo mṛjanty aśvahayair aniśitaṁ namobhiḥ
Griffith: Men decked with gold adorn his golden tendril, incessantly with steed-impelling homage.
pada pāṭha: sam | asya | harim | harayaḥ | mr̥janti | aśva-hayaiḥ | ani-śitam | namaḥ-bhiḥ || ā | tiṣṭhati | ratham | indrasya | sakhā | vidvān | ena | su-matim | yāti | accha ||9.96.2||

IAST: ā tiṣṭhati ratham indrasya sakhā vidvām̐ enā sumatiṁ yāty accha
Griffith: The Friend of Indra mounts his car well-knowing, he comes thereon to meet the prayer we offer.
Devanāgarī: आ तिष्ठति रथमिन्द्रस्य सखा विद्वाँ एना सुमतिं यात्यच्छ
pada pāṭha: sam | asya | harim | harayaḥ | mr̥janti | aśva-hayaiḥ | ani-śitam | namaḥ-bhiḥ || ā | tiṣṭhati | ratham | indrasya | sakhā | vidvān | ena | su-matim | yāti | accha ||9.96.2||

IAST: sa no deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarasa indrapānaḥ
Griffith: O God, for service of the Gods flow onward, for food sublime, as Indra's drink, O Soma.
Devanāgarī: स नो देव देवताते पवस्व महे सोम प्सरस इन्द्रपानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | deva | deva-tāte | pavasva | mahe | soma | psarase | indra-pānaḥ || kr̥ṇvan | apaḥ | varṣayan | dyām | uta | imām | uroḥ | ā | naḥ | varivasya | punānaḥ ||9.96.3||

IAST: kṛṇvann apo varṣayan dyām utemām uror ā no varivasyā punānaḥ
Griffith: Making the floods, bedewing earth and heaven, come from the vast, comfort us while we cleanse thee
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | deva | deva-tāte | pavasva | mahe | soma | psarase | indra-pānaḥ || kr̥ṇvan | apaḥ | varṣayan | dyām | uta | imām | uroḥ | ā | naḥ | varivasya | punānaḥ ||9.96.3||

IAST: ajītaye 'hataye pavasva svastaye sarvatātaye bṛhate
Griffith: Flow for prosperity and constant Vigour, flow on for happiness and high perfection.
pada pāṭha: ajītaye | ahataye | pavasva | svastaye | sarva-tātaye | br̥hate || tat | uśanti | viśve | ime | sakhāyaḥ | tat | aham | vaśmi | pavamāna | soma ||9.96.4||

IAST: tad uśanti viśva ime sakhāyas tad ahaṁ vaśmi pavamāna soma
Griffith: This is the wish of these friends assembled: this is my wish, O Soma Pavamana.
Devanāgarī: तदुशन्ति विश्व इमे सखायस्तदहं वश्मि पवमान सोम
pada pāṭha: ajītaye | ahataye | pavasva | svastaye | sarva-tātaye | br̥hate || tat | uśanti | viśve | ime | sakhāyaḥ | tat | aham | vaśmi | pavamāna | soma ||9.96.4||

IAST: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnāṁ janitā divo janitā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: Father of holy hymns, Soma flows onward the Father of the earth, Father of heaven:
Devanāgarī: सोमः पवते जनिता मतीनां जनिता दिवो जनिता पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | pavate | janitā | matīnām | janitā | divaḥ | janitā | pr̥thivyāḥ || janitā | agneḥ | janitā | sūryasya | janitā | indrasya | janitā | uta | viṣṇoḥ ||9.96.5||

IAST: janitāgner janitā sūryasya janitendrasya janitota viṣṇoḥ
Griffith: Father of Agni, Surya's generator, the Father who begat Indra and Visnu.
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | pavate | janitā | matīnām | janitā | divaḥ | janitā | pr̥thivyāḥ || janitā | agneḥ | janitā | sūryasya | janitā | indrasya | janitā | uta | viṣṇoḥ ||9.96.5||

IAST: brahmā devānām padavīḥ kavīnām ṛṣir viprāṇām mahiṣo mṛgāṇām
Griffith: Brahman of Gods, the Leader of the poets, Rsi of sages, Bull of savage creatures,
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मा देवानां पदवीः कवीनामृषिर्विप्राणां महिषो मृगाणाम्
pada pāṭha: brahmā | devānām | pada-vīḥ | kavīnām | r̥ṣiḥ | viprāṇām | mahiṣaḥ | mr̥gāṇām || śyenaḥ | gr̥dhrāṇām | sva-dhitiḥ | vanānām | somaḥ | pavitram | ati | eti | rebhan ||9.96.6||

IAST: śyeno gṛdhrāṇāṁ svadhitir vanānāṁ somaḥ pavitram aty eti rebhan
Griffith: Falcon amid the vultures, Axe of forests, over the cleansing sieve goes Soma singing.
Devanāgarī: श्येनो गृध्राणां स्वधितिर्वनानां सोमः पवित्रमत्येति रेभन्
pada pāṭha: brahmā | devānām | pada-vīḥ | kavīnām | r̥ṣiḥ | viprāṇām | mahiṣaḥ | mr̥gāṇām || śyenaḥ | gr̥dhrāṇām | sva-dhitiḥ | vanānām | somaḥ | pavitram | ati | eti | rebhan ||9.96.6||

IAST: prāvīvipad vāca ūrmiṁ na sindhur giraḥ somaḥ pavamāno manīṣāḥ
Griffith: He, Soma Pavamana, like a river, hath stirred the wave of voice, our songs and praises.
Devanāgarī: प्रावीविपद्वाच ऊर्मिं न सिन्धुर्गिरः सोमः पवमानो मनीषाः
pada pāṭha: pra | avīvipat | vācaḥ | ūrmim | na | sindhuḥ | giraḥ | somaḥ | pavamānaḥ | manīṣāḥ || antariti | paśyan | vr̥janā | imā | avarāṇi | ā | tiṣṭhati | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | goṣu | jānan ||9.96.7||

IAST: antaḥ paśyan vṛjanemāvarāṇy ā tiṣṭhati vṛṣabho goṣu jānan
Griffith: Beholding these inferior powers in cattle, he rests among them as a Steer well-knowing.
Devanāgarī: अन्तः पश्यन्वृजनेमावराण्या तिष्ठति वृषभो गोषु जानन्
pada pāṭha: pra | avīvipat | vācaḥ | ūrmim | na | sindhuḥ | giraḥ | somaḥ | pavamānaḥ | manīṣāḥ || antariti | paśyan | vr̥janā | imā | avarāṇi | ā | tiṣṭhati | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | goṣu | jānan ||9.96.7||

IAST: sa matsaraḥ pṛtsu vanvann avātaḥ sahasraretā abhi vājam arṣa
Griffith: As Gladdener, Warrior never harmed in battle, with thousand genial streams, pour strength and vigour.
Devanāgarī: स मत्सरः पृत्सु वन्वन्नवातः सहस्ररेता अभि वाजमर्ष
pada pāṭha: saḥ | matsaraḥ | pr̥t-su | vanvan | avātaḥ | sahasra-retāḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa || indrāya | indo iti | pavamānaḥ | manīṣī | aṁśoḥ | ūrmim | īraya | gāḥ | iṣaṇyan ||9.96.8||

IAST: indrāyendo pavamāno manīṣy aṁśor ūrmim īraya gā iṣaṇyan
Griffith: As thoughtful Pavamana, urge O Indu, speeding the kine, the plant's wave on to Indra.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | matsaraḥ | pr̥t-su | vanvan | avātaḥ | sahasra-retāḥ | abhi | vājam | arṣa || indrāya | indo iti | pavamānaḥ | manīṣī | aṁśoḥ | ūrmim | īraya | gāḥ | iṣaṇyan ||9.96.8||

IAST: pari priyaḥ kalaśe devavāta indrāya somo raṇyo madāya
Griffith: Dear, grateful to the Gods, on to the beaker moves Soma, sweet to Indra, to delight him.
Devanāgarī: परि प्रियः कलशे देववात इन्द्राय सोमो रण्यो मदाय
pada pāṭha: pari | priyaḥ | kalaśe | deva-vātaḥ | indrāya | somaḥ | raṇyaḥ | madāya || sahasra-dhāraḥ | śata-vājaḥ | induḥ | vājī | na | saptiḥ | samanā | jigāti ||9.96.9||

IAST: sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja indur vājī na saptiḥ samanā jigāti
Griffith: With hundred powers, with thousand currents, Indu, like a strong car-horse, goes to the assembly.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारः शतवाज इन्दुर्वाजी न सप्तिः समना जिगाति
pada pāṭha: pari | priyaḥ | kalaśe | deva-vātaḥ | indrāya | somaḥ | raṇyaḥ | madāya || sahasra-dhāraḥ | śata-vājaḥ | induḥ | vājī | na | saptiḥ | samanā | jigāti ||9.96.9||

IAST: sa pūrvyo vasuvij jāyamāno mṛjāno apsu duduhāno adrau
Griffith: Born in old time as finder-out of treasures, drained with the stone, decking himself in waters,
Devanāgarī: स पूर्व्यो वसुविज्जायमानो मृजानो अप्सु दुदुहानो अद्रौ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pūrvyaḥ | vasu-vit | jāyamānaḥ | mr̥jānaḥ | ap-su | duduhānaḥ | adrau || abhiśasti-pāḥ | bhuvanasya | rājā | vidat | gātum | brahmaṇe | pūyamānaḥ ||9.96.10||

IAST: abhiśastipā bhuvanasya rājā vidad gātum brahmaṇe pūyamānaḥ
Griffith: Warding off curses, King of all existence, he shall find way for prayer the while they cleanse him.
Devanāgarī: अभिशस्तिपा भुवनस्य राजा विदद्गातुं ब्रह्मणे पूयमानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pūrvyaḥ | vasu-vit | jāyamānaḥ | mr̥jānaḥ | ap-su | duduhānaḥ | adrau || abhiśasti-pāḥ | bhuvanasya | rājā | vidat | gātum | brahmaṇe | pūyamānaḥ ||9.96.10||

IAST: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamāna dhīrāḥ
Griffith: For our sage fathers, Soma Pavamana, of old performed, by thee, their sacred duties.
Devanāgarī: त्वया हि नः पितरः सोम पूर्वे कर्माणि चक्रुः पवमान धीराः
pada pāṭha: tvayā | hi | naḥ | pitaraḥ | soma | pūrve | karmāṇi | cakruḥ | pavamāna | dhīrāḥ || vanvan | avātaḥ | pari-dhīn | apa | ūrṇu | vīrebhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | magha-vā | bhava | naḥ ||9.96.11||

IAST: vanvann avātaḥ paridhīm̐r aporṇu vīrebhir aśvair maghavā bhavā naḥ
Griffith: Fighting unvanquished, open the enclosures: enrich us with large gifts of steeds and heroes.
pada pāṭha: tvayā | hi | naḥ | pitaraḥ | soma | pūrve | karmāṇi | cakruḥ | pavamāna | dhīrāḥ || vanvan | avātaḥ | pari-dhīn | apa | ūrṇu | vīrebhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | magha-vā | bhava | naḥ ||9.96.11||

IAST: yathāpavathā manave vayodhā amitrahā varivovid dhaviṣmān
Griffith: As thou didst flow for Manu Life-bestowing, Foe-queller, Comforter, rich in oblations,
pada pāṭha: yathā | apavathāḥ | manave | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | amitra-hā | varivaḥ-vit | haviṣmān || eva | pavasva | draviṇam | dadhānaḥ | indre | sam | tiṣṭha | janaya | āyudhāni ||9.96.12||

IAST: evā pavasva draviṇaṁ dadhāna indre saṁ tiṣṭha janayāyudhāni
Griffith: Even thus flow onward now conferring riches: combine with Indra, and bring forth thy weapons.
Devanāgarī: एवा पवस्व द्रविणं दधान इन्द्रे सं तिष्ठ जनयायुधानि
pada pāṭha: yathā | apavathāḥ | manave | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | amitra-hā | varivaḥ-vit | haviṣmān || eva | pavasva | draviṇam | dadhānaḥ | indre | sam | tiṣṭha | janaya | āyudhāni ||9.96.12||

IAST: pavasva soma madhumām̐ ṛtāvāpo vasāno adhi sāno avye
Griffith: Flow onward, Soma, rich in sweets and holy,. enrobed in waters on the fleecy summit.
Devanāgarī: पवस्व सोम मधुमाँ ऋतावापो वसानो अधि सानो अव्ये
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | madhu-mān | r̥ta-vā | apaḥ | vasānaḥ | adhi | sānau | avye || ava | droṇāni | ghr̥ta-vanti | sīda | madin-tamaḥ | matsaraḥ | indra-pānaḥ ||9.96.13||

IAST: ava droṇāni ghṛtavānti sīda madintamo matsara indrapānaḥ
Griffith: Settle in vessels that are full of fatness, as cheering and most gladdening drink for Indra.
Devanāgarī: अव द्रोणानि घृतवान्ति सीद मदिन्तमो मत्सर इन्द्रपानः
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | madhu-mān | r̥ta-vā | apaḥ | vasānaḥ | adhi | sānau | avye || ava | droṇāni | ghr̥ta-vanti | sīda | madin-tamaḥ | matsaraḥ | indra-pānaḥ ||9.96.13||

IAST: vṛṣṭiṁ divaḥ śatadhāraḥ pavasva sahasrasā vājayur devavītau
Griffith: Pour, hundred-streamed, winner of thousands, mighty at the Gods' banquet, Pour the rain of heaven,
Devanāgarī: वृष्टिं दिवः शतधारः पवस्व सहस्रसा वाजयुर्देववीतौ
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṭim | divaḥ | śata-dhāraḥ | pavasva | sahasra-sāḥ | vāja-yuḥ | deva-vītau || sam | sindhu-bhiḥ | kalaśe | vāvaśānaḥ | sam | usriyābhiḥ | pra-tiran | naḥ | āyuḥ ||9.96.14||

IAST: saṁ sindhubhiḥ kalaśe vāvaśānaḥ sam usriyābhiḥ pratiran na āyuḥ
Griffith: While thou with rivers roarest in the beaker, and blent with milk prolongest our existence.
Devanāgarī: सं सिन्धुभिः कलशे वावशानः समुस्रियाभिः प्रतिरन्न आयुः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṭim | divaḥ | śata-dhāraḥ | pavasva | sahasra-sāḥ | vāja-yuḥ | deva-vītau || sam | sindhu-bhiḥ | kalaśe | vāvaśānaḥ | sam | usriyābhiḥ | pra-tiran | naḥ | āyuḥ ||9.96.14||

IAST: eṣa sya somo matibhiḥ punāno 'tyo na vājī taratīd arātīḥ
Griffith: Purified with our holy hymns, this Soma o'ertakes malignities like some strong charger,
Devanāgarī: एष स्य सोमो मतिभिः पुनानोऽत्यो न वाजी तरतीदरातीः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | somaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | punānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | vājī | tarati | it | arātīḥ || payaḥ | na | dugdham | aditeḥ | iṣiram | uru-iva | gātuḥ | su-yamaḥ | na | voḷhā ||9.96.15||

IAST: payo na dugdham aditer iṣiram urv iva gātuḥ suyamo na voḻhā
Griffith: Like fresh milk poured by Aditi, like passage in ample room, or like a docile car-horse.
Devanāgarī: पयो न दुग्धमदितेरिषिरमुर्विव गातुः सुयमो न वोळ्हा
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | somaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | punānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | vājī | tarati | it | arātīḥ || payaḥ | na | dugdham | aditeḥ | iṣiram | uru-iva | gātuḥ | su-yamaḥ | na | voḷhā ||9.96.15||

IAST: svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyamāno 'bhy arṣa guhyaṁ cāru nāma
Griffith: Cleansed by the pressers, armed with noble weapons, stream to us the fair secret name thou bearest.
Devanāgarī: स्वायुधः सोतृभिः पूयमानोऽभ्यर्ष गुह्यं चारु नाम
pada pāṭha: su-āyudhaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ | pūyamānaḥ | abhi | arṣa | guhyam | cāru | nāma || abhi | vājam | saptiḥ-iva | śravasyā | abhi | vāyum | abhi | gāḥ | deva | soma ||9.96.16||

IAST: abhi vājaṁ saptir iva śravasyābhi vāyum abhi gā deva soma
Griffith: Pour booty, like a horse, for love of glory God, Soma, send us kine, and send us Vayu.
Devanāgarī: अभि वाजं सप्तिरिव श्रवस्याभि वायुमभि गा देव सोम
pada pāṭha: su-āyudhaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ | pūyamānaḥ | abhi | arṣa | guhyam | cāru | nāma || abhi | vājam | saptiḥ-iva | śravasyā | abhi | vāyum | abhi | gāḥ | deva | soma ||9.96.16||

IAST: śiśuṁ jajñānaṁ haryatam mṛjanti śumbhanti vahnim maruto gaṇena
Griffith: They deck him at his birth, the lovely Infant, the Maruts with their troop adorn the Car-horse.
Devanāgarī: शिशुं जज्ञानं हर्यतं मृजन्ति शुम्भन्ति वह्निं मरुतो गणेन
pada pāṭha: śiśum | jajñānam | haryatam | mr̥janti | śumbhanti | vahnim | marutaḥ | gaṇena || kaviḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | kāvyena | kaviḥ | san | somaḥ | pavitram | ati | eti | rebhan ||9.96.17||

IAST: kavir gīrbhiḥ kāvyenā kaviḥ san somaḥ pavitram aty eti rebhan
Griffith: By songs a Poet and a Sage by wisdom, Soma joes singing through the cleansing filter.
Devanāgarī: कविर्गीर्भिः काव्येना कविः सन्सोमः पवित्रमत्येति रेभन्
pada pāṭha: śiśum | jajñānam | haryatam | mr̥janti | śumbhanti | vahnim | marutaḥ | gaṇena || kaviḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | kāvyena | kaviḥ | san | somaḥ | pavitram | ati | eti | rebhan ||9.96.17||

IAST: ṛṣimanā ya ṛṣikṛt svarṣāḥ sahasraṇīthaḥ padavīḥ kavīnām
Griffith: Light-winner, Rsi-mindcd, Rsi-maker, hymned in a thousand hymns, Leader of sages,
Devanāgarī: ऋषिमना य ऋषिकृत्स्वर्षाः सहस्रणीथः पदवीः कवीनाम्
pada pāṭha: r̥ṣi-manāḥ | yaḥ | r̥ṣi-kr̥t | svaḥ-sāḥ | sahasra-nīthaḥ | pada-vīḥ | kavīnām || tr̥tīyam | dhāma | mahiṣaḥ | sisāsan | somaḥ | vi-rājam | anu | rājati | stup ||9.96.18||

IAST: tṛtīyaṁ dhāma mahiṣaḥ siṣāsan somo virājam anu rājati ṣṭup
Griffith: A Steer who strives to gain his third form, Soma is, like Viraj, resplendent as a Singer.
Devanāgarī: तृतीयं धाम महिषः सिषासन्सोमो विराजमनु राजति ष्टुप्
pada pāṭha: r̥ṣi-manāḥ | yaḥ | r̥ṣi-kr̥t | svaḥ-sāḥ | sahasra-nīthaḥ | pada-vīḥ | kavīnām || tr̥tīyam | dhāma | mahiṣaḥ | sisāsan | somaḥ | vi-rājam | anu | rājati | stup ||9.96.18||

IAST: camūṣac chyenaḥ śakuno vibhṛtvā govindur drapsa āyudhāni bibhrat
Griffith: Hawk seated in the bowls, Bird wide-extended, the Banner seeking kine and wielding weapons,
Devanāgarī: चमूषच्छ्येनः शकुनो विभृत्वा गोविन्दुर्द्रप्स आयुधानि बिभ्रत्
pada pāṭha: camū-sat | śyenaḥ | śakunaḥ | vi-bhr̥tvā | go-vinduḥ | drapsaḥ | āyudhāni | bibhrat || apām | ūrmim | sacamānaḥ | samudram | turīyam | dhāma | mahiṣaḥ | vivakti ||9.96.19||

IAST: apām ūrmiṁ sacamānaḥ samudraṁ turīyaṁ dhāma mahiṣo vivakti
Griffith: Following close the sea, the wave of waters, the great Bull tells his fourth form and declares it.
Devanāgarī: अपामूर्मिं सचमानः समुद्रं तुरीयं धाम महिषो विवक्ति
pada pāṭha: camū-sat | śyenaḥ | śakunaḥ | vi-bhr̥tvā | go-vinduḥ | drapsaḥ | āyudhāni | bibhrat || apām | ūrmim | sacamānaḥ | samudram | turīyam | dhāma | mahiṣaḥ | vivakti ||9.96.19||

IAST: maryo na śubhras tanvam mṛjāno 'tyo na sṛtvā sanaye dhanānām
Griffith: Like a fair youth who decorates his body, a courser rushing to the gain of riches,
Devanāgarī: मर्यो न शुभ्रस्तन्वं मृजानोऽत्यो न सृत्वा सनये धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: maryaḥ | na | śubhraḥ | tanvam | mr̥jānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | sr̥tvā | sanaye | dhanānām || vr̥ṣā-iva | yūthā | pari | kośam | arṣan | kanikradat | camvoḥ | ā | viveśa ||9.96.20||

IAST: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośam arṣan kanikradac camvor ā viveśa
Griffith: A steer to herds, so, flowing to the pitcher, he with a roar hath passed into the beakers.
pada pāṭha: maryaḥ | na | śubhraḥ | tanvam | mr̥jānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | sr̥tvā | sanaye | dhanānām || vr̥ṣā-iva | yūthā | pari | kośam | arṣan | kanikradat | camvoḥ | ā | viveśa ||9.96.20||

IAST: pavasvendo pavamāno mahobhiḥ kanikradat pari vārāṇy arṣa
Griffith: Flow on with might as Pavamana, Indu flow loudly roaring through the fleecy filter.
pada pāṭha: pavasva | indo iti | pavamānaḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ | kanikradat | pari | vārāṇi | arṣa || krīḷan | camvoḥ | ā | viśa | pūyamānaḥ | indram | te | rasaḥ | madiraḥ | mamattu ||9.96.21||

IAST: krīḻañ camvor ā viśa pūyamāna indraṁ te raso madiro mamattu
Griffith: Enter the beakers sporting, as they cleanse thee, and let thy gladdening juice make Indra joyful.
Devanāgarī: क्रीळञ्चम्वोरा विश पूयमान इन्द्रं ते रसो मदिरो ममत्तु
pada pāṭha: pavasva | indo iti | pavamānaḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ | kanikradat | pari | vārāṇi | arṣa || krīḷan | camvoḥ | ā | viśa | pūyamānaḥ | indram | te | rasaḥ | madiraḥ | mamattu ||9.96.21||

IAST: prāsya dhārā bṛhatīr asṛgrann akto gobhiḥ kalaśām̐ ā viveśa
Griffith: His streams have been effused in all their fulness, and he hath entered, balmed with milk, the goblets.
Devanāgarī: प्रास्य धारा बृहतीरसृग्रन्नक्तो गोभिः कलशाँ आ विवेश
pada pāṭha: pra | asya | dhārāḥ | br̥hatīḥ | asr̥gran | aktaḥ | gobhiḥ | kalaśān | ā | viveśa || sāma | kr̥ṇvan | sāmanyaḥ | vipaḥ-cit | krandan | eti | abhi | sakhyuḥ | na | jāmim ||9.96.22||

IAST: sāma kṛṇvan sāmanyo vipaścit krandann ety abhi sakhyur na jāmim
Griffith: Singing his psalm, well-skilled in song, a Chanter, be comes as 'twere to his friend's sister roaring.
pada pāṭha: pra | asya | dhārāḥ | br̥hatīḥ | asr̥gran | aktaḥ | gobhiḥ | kalaśān | ā | viveśa || sāma | kr̥ṇvan | sāmanyaḥ | vipaḥ-cit | krandan | eti | abhi | sakhyuḥ | na | jāmim ||9.96.22||

IAST: apaghnann eṣi pavamāna śatrūn priyāṁ na jāro abhigīta induḥ
Griffith: Chasing our foes thou comest, Pavamana Indu, besting, as lover to his darling.
Devanāgarī: अपघ्नन्नेषि पवमान शत्रून्प्रियां न जारो अभिगीत इन्दुः
pada pāṭha: apa-ghnan | eṣi | pavamāna | śatrūn | priyām | na | jāraḥ | abhi-gītaḥ | induḥ || sīdan | vaneṣu | śakunaḥ | na | patvā | somaḥ | punānaḥ | kalaśeṣu | sattā ||9.96.23||

IAST: sīdan vaneṣu śakuno na patvā somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sattā
Griffith: As a bird flies and settles in the forest, thus Soma settles, purified, in goblets.
Devanāgarī: सीदन्वनेषु शकुनो न पत्वा सोमः पुनानः कलशेषु सत्ता
pada pāṭha: apa-ghnan | eṣi | pavamāna | śatrūn | priyām | na | jāraḥ | abhi-gītaḥ | induḥ || sīdan | vaneṣu | śakunaḥ | na | patvā | somaḥ | punānaḥ | kalaśeṣu | sattā ||9.96.23||

IAST: ā te rucaḥ pavamānasya soma yoṣeva yanti sudughāḥ sudhārāḥ
Griffith: With full stream and abundant milk, O Soma, thy beams come, like a woman, as they cleanse thee.
Devanāgarī: आ ते रुचः पवमानस्य सोम योषेव यन्ति सुदुघाः सुधाराः
pada pāṭha: ā | te | rucaḥ | pavamānasya | soma | yoṣā-iva | yanti | su-dughāḥ | su-dhārāḥ || hariḥ | ā-nītaḥ | puru-vāraḥ | ap-su | acikradat | kalaśe | deva-yūnām ||9.96.24||

IAST: harir ānītaḥ puruvāro apsv acikradat kalaśe devayūnām
Griffith: He, gold-hued, rich in boons, brought to the waters, hath roared within the goblet of the pious.
pada pāṭha: ā | te | rucaḥ | pavamānasya | soma | yoṣā-iva | yanti | su-dughāḥ | su-dhārāḥ || hariḥ | ā-nītaḥ | puru-vāraḥ | ap-su | acikradat | kalaśe | deva-yūnām ||9.96.24||

IAST: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamāno devo devebhiḥ sam apṛkta rasam
Griffith: MADE pure by this man's urgent zeal and impulse the God hath to the Gods his juice imparted.
Devanāgarī: अस्य प्रेषा हेमना पूयमानो देवो देवेभिः समपृक्त रसम्
pada pāṭha: asya | preṣā | hemanā | pūyamānaḥ | devaḥ | devebhiḥ | sam | apr̥kta | rasam || sutaḥ | pavitram | pari | eti | rebhan | mitā-iva | sadma | paśu-manti | hotā ||9.97.1||

IAST: sutaḥ pavitram pary eti rebhan miteva sadma paśumānti hotā
Griffith: He goes, effused and singing, to the filter, like priest to measured seats supplied with cattle.
Devanāgarī: सुतः पवित्रं पर्येति रेभन्मितेव सद्म पशुमान्ति होता
pada pāṭha: asya | preṣā | hemanā | pūyamānaḥ | devaḥ | devebhiḥ | sam | apr̥kta | rasam || sutaḥ | pavitram | pari | eti | rebhan | mitā-iva | sadma | paśu-manti | hotā ||9.97.1||

IAST: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasāno mahān kavir nivacanāni śaṁsan
Griffith: Robed in fair raiment meet to wear in battle, a mighty Sage pronouncing invocations.
Devanāgarī: भद्रा वस्त्रा समन्या वसानो महान्कविर्निवचनानि शंसन्
pada pāṭha: bhadrā | vastrā | samanyā | vasānaḥ | mahān | kaviḥ | ni-vacanāni | śaṁsan || ā | vacyasva | camvoḥ | pūyamānaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | jāgr̥viḥ | deva-vītau ||9.97.2||

IAST: ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamāno vicakṣaṇo jāgṛvir devavītau
Griffith: Roll onward to the beakers as they cleanse thee, far-seeing at the feast of Gods, and watchful.
Devanāgarī: आ वच्यस्व चम्वोः पूयमानो विचक्षणो जागृविर्देववीतौ
pada pāṭha: bhadrā | vastrā | samanyā | vasānaḥ | mahān | kaviḥ | ni-vacanāni | śaṁsan || ā | vacyasva | camvoḥ | pūyamānaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | jāgr̥viḥ | deva-vītau ||9.97.2||

IAST: sam u priyo mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaro yaśasāṁ kṣaito asme
Griffith: Dear, he is brightened on the fleecy summit, a Prince among us, nobler than the noble.
Devanāgarī: समु प्रियो मृज्यते सानो अव्ये यशस्तरो यशसां क्षैतो अस्मे
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | priyaḥ | mr̥jyate | sānau | avye | yaśaḥ-taraḥ | yaśasām | kṣaitaḥ | asme iti || abhi | svara | dhanva | pūyamānaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||9.97.3||

IAST: abhi svara dhanvā pūyamāno yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Roar out as thou art purified, run forward. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: अभि स्वर धन्वा पूयमानो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | priyaḥ | mr̥jyate | sānau | avye | yaśaḥ-taraḥ | yaśasām | kṣaitaḥ | asme iti || abhi | svara | dhanva | pūyamānaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||9.97.3||

IAST: pra gāyatābhy arcāma devān somaṁ hinota mahate dhanāya
Griffith: Let us sing praises to the Gods: sing loudly, send ye the Soma forth for mighty riches.
Devanāgarī: प्र गायताभ्यर्चाम देवान्सोमं हिनोत महते धनाय
pada pāṭha: pra | gāyata | abhi | arcāma | devān | somam | hinota | mahate | dhanāya || svāduḥ | pavāte | ati | vāram | avyam | ā | sīdāti | kalaśam | deva-yuḥ | naḥ ||9.97.4||

IAST: svāduḥ pavāte ati vāram avyam ā sīdāti kalaśaṁ devayur naḥ
Griffith: Let him flow, sweetly-flavoured, through the filter, and let our pious one rest in the pitcher.
Devanāgarī: स्वादुः पवाते अति वारमव्यमा सीदाति कलशं देवयुर्नः
pada pāṭha: pra | gāyata | abhi | arcāma | devān | somam | hinota | mahate | dhanāya || svāduḥ | pavāte | ati | vāram | avyam | ā | sīdāti | kalaśam | deva-yuḥ | naḥ ||9.97.4||

IAST: indur devānām upa sakhyam āyan sahasradhāraḥ pavate madāya
Griffith: Winning the friendship of the Deities, Indu flows in a thousand streams to make them joyful.
pada pāṭha: induḥ | devānām | upa | sakhyam | ā-yan | sahasra-dhāraḥ | pavate | madāya || nr̥-bhiḥ | stavānaḥ | anu | dhāma | pūrvam | agan | indram | mahate | saubhagāya ||9.97.5||

IAST: nṛbhiḥ stavāno anu dhāma pūrvam agann indram mahate saubhagāya
Griffith: Praised by the men after the ancient statute, he hath come nigh, for our great bliss, to Indra.
Devanāgarī: नृभिः स्तवानो अनु धाम पूर्वमगन्निन्द्रं महते सौभगाय
pada pāṭha: induḥ | devānām | upa | sakhyam | ā-yan | sahasra-dhāraḥ | pavate | madāya || nr̥-bhiḥ | stavānaḥ | anu | dhāma | pūrvam | agan | indram | mahate | saubhagāya ||9.97.5||

IAST: stotre rāye harir arṣā punāna indram mado gacchatu te bharāya
Griffith: Flow, Gold-hued, cleansing thee, to enrich the singer: let thy juice go to Indra to support him.
Devanāgarī: स्तोत्रे राये हरिरर्षा पुनान इन्द्रं मदो गच्छतु ते भराय
pada pāṭha: stotre | rāye | hariḥ | arṣa | punānaḥ | indram | madaḥ | gacchatu | te | bharāya || devaiḥ | yāhi | sa-ratham | rādhaḥ | accha | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||9.97.6||

IAST: devair yāhi sarathaṁ rādho acchā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Come nigh, together with the Gods, for bounty. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: देवैर्याहि सरथं राधो अच्छा यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: stotre | rāye | hariḥ | arṣa | punānaḥ | indram | madaḥ | gacchatu | te | bharāya || devaiḥ | yāhi | sa-ratham | rādhaḥ | accha | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||9.97.6||

IAST: pra kāvyam uśaneva bruvāṇo devo devānāṁ janimā vivakti
Griffith: The God declares the Deities' generations, like Usana, proclaiming lofty wisdom.
Devanāgarī: प्र काव्यमुशनेव ब्रुवाणो देवो देवानां जनिमा विवक्ति
pada pāṭha: pra | kāvyam | uśanā-iva | bruvāṇaḥ | devaḥ | devānām | janima | vivakti || mahi-vrataḥ | śuci-bandhuḥ | pāvakaḥ | padā | varāhaḥ | abhi | eti | rebhan ||9.97.7||

IAST: mahivrataḥ śucibandhuḥ pāvakaḥ padā varāho abhy eti rebhan
Griffith: With brilliant kin, far-ruling, sanctifying, the Boar advances, singing, to the places.
Devanāgarī: महिव्रतः शुचिबन्धुः पावकः पदा वराहो अभ्येति रेभन्
pada pāṭha: pra | kāvyam | uśanā-iva | bruvāṇaḥ | devaḥ | devānām | janima | vivakti || mahi-vrataḥ | śuci-bandhuḥ | pāvakaḥ | padā | varāhaḥ | abhi | eti | rebhan ||9.97.7||

IAST: pra haṁsāsas tṛpalam manyum acchāmād astaṁ vṛṣagaṇā ayāsuḥ
Griffith: The Swans, the Vrsaganas from anear us have brought their restless spirit to our dwelling.
pada pāṭha: pra | haṁsāsaḥ | tr̥palam | manyum | accha | amāt | astam | vr̥ṣa-gaṇāḥ | ayāsuḥ || āṅgūṣyam | pavamānam | sakhāyaḥ | duḥ-marṣam | sākam | pra | vadanti | vāṇam ||9.97.8||

IAST: āṅgūṣyam pavamānaṁ sakhāyo durmarṣaṁ sākam pra vadanti vāṇam
Griffith: Friends come to Pavamana meet for praises, and sound in concert their resistless music.
Devanāgarī: आङ्गूष्यं पवमानं सखायो दुर्मर्षं साकं प्र वदन्ति वाणम्
pada pāṭha: pra | haṁsāsaḥ | tr̥palam | manyum | accha | amāt | astam | vr̥ṣa-gaṇāḥ | ayāsuḥ || āṅgūṣyam | pavamānam | sakhāyaḥ | duḥ-marṣam | sākam | pra | vadanti | vāṇam ||9.97.8||

IAST: sa raṁhata urugāyasya jūtiṁ vṛthā krīḻantam mimate na gāvaḥ
Griffith: He follows the Wide-strider's rapid movement: cows low, as 'twere, to him who sports at pleasure.
Devanāgarī: स रंहत उरुगायस्य जूतिं वृथा क्रीळन्तं मिमते न गावः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | raṁhate | uru-gāyasya | jūtim | vr̥thā | krīḷantam | mimate | na | gāvaḥ || parīṇasam | kr̥ṇute | tigma-śr̥ṅgaḥ | divā | hariḥ | dadr̥śe | naktam | r̥jraḥ ||9.97.9||

IAST: parīṇasaṁ kṛṇute tigmaśṛṅgo divā harir dadṛśe naktam ṛjraḥ
Griffith: He with the sharpened horns brings forth abundance: the Silvery shines by night, by day the Golden.
Devanāgarī: परीणसं कृणुते तिग्मशृङ्गो दिवा हरिर्ददृशे नक्तमृज्रः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | raṁhate | uru-gāyasya | jūtim | vr̥thā | krīḷantam | mimate | na | gāvaḥ || parīṇasam | kr̥ṇute | tigma-śr̥ṅgaḥ | divā | hariḥ | dadr̥śe | naktam | r̥jraḥ ||9.97.9||

IAST: indur vājī pavate gonyoghā indre somaḥ saha invan madāya
Griffith: Strong Indu, bathed in milk, flows on for Indra, Soma exciting strength, to make him joyful.
Devanāgarī: इन्दुर्वाजी पवते गोन्योघा इन्द्रे सोमः सह इन्वन्मदाय
pada pāṭha: induḥ | vājī | pavate | go-nyoghāḥ | indre | somaḥ | saha | invan | madāya || hanti | rakṣaḥ | bādhate | pari | arātīḥ | varivaḥ | kr̥ṇvan | vr̥janasya | rājā ||9.97.10||

IAST: hanti rakṣo bādhate pary arātīr varivaḥ kṛṇvan vṛjanasya rājā
Griffith: He quells malignities and slays the demons, the King of mighty power who brings us comfort.
Devanāgarī: हन्ति रक्षो बाधते पर्यरातीर्वरिवः कृण्वन्वृजनस्य राजा
pada pāṭha: induḥ | vājī | pavate | go-nyoghāḥ | indre | somaḥ | saha | invan | madāya || hanti | rakṣaḥ | bādhate | pari | arātīḥ | varivaḥ | kr̥ṇvan | vr̥janasya | rājā ||9.97.10||

IAST: adha dhārayā madhvā pṛcānas tiro roma pavate adridugdhaḥ
Griffith: Then in a stream he flows, milked out with press-stones, mingled with sweetness, through the fleecy filte
Devanāgarī: अध धारया मध्वा पृचानस्तिरो रोम पवते अद्रिदुग्धः
pada pāṭha: adha | dhārayā | madhvā | pr̥cānaḥ | tiraḥ | roma | pavate | adri-dugdhaḥ || induḥ | indrasya | sakhyam | juṣāṇaḥ | devaḥ | devasya | matsaraḥ | madāya ||9.97.11||

IAST: indur indrasya sakhyaṁ juṣāṇo devo devasya matsaro madāya
Griffith: Indu rejoicing in the love of Indra, the God who gladdens, for the God's enjoyment.
Devanāgarī: इन्दुरिन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुषाणो देवो देवस्य मत्सरो मदाय
pada pāṭha: adha | dhārayā | madhvā | pr̥cānaḥ | tiraḥ | roma | pavate | adri-dugdhaḥ || induḥ | indrasya | sakhyam | juṣāṇaḥ | devaḥ | devasya | matsaraḥ | madāya ||9.97.11||

IAST: abhi priyāṇi pavate punāno devo devān svena rasena pṛñcan
Griffith: As he is purified he pours out treasures, a God bedewing Gods with his own juices.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्रियाणि पवते पुनानो देवो देवान्स्वेन रसेन पृञ्चन्
pada pāṭha: abhi | priyāṇi | pavate | punānaḥ | devaḥ | devān | svena | rasena | pr̥ñcan || induḥ | dharmāṇi | r̥tu-thā | vasānaḥ | daśa | kṣipaḥ | avyata | sānau | avye ||9.97.12||

IAST: indur dharmāṇy ṛtuthā vasāno daśa kṣipo avyata sāno avye
Griffith: Indu hath, wearing qualities by seasons, on the raised fleece engaged, the ten swift fingers.
Devanāgarī: इन्दुर्धर्माण्यृतुथा वसानो दश क्षिपो अव्यत सानो अव्ये
pada pāṭha: abhi | priyāṇi | pavate | punānaḥ | devaḥ | devān | svena | rasena | pr̥ñcan || induḥ | dharmāṇi | r̥tu-thā | vasānaḥ | daśa | kṣipaḥ | avyata | sānau | avye ||9.97.12||

IAST: vṛṣā śoṇo abhikanikradad gā nadayann eti pṛthivīm uta dyām
Griffith: The Red Bull bellowing to the kine advances, causing the heavens and earth to roar and tbunder.
Devanāgarī: वृषा शोणो अभिकनिक्रदद्गा नदयन्नेति पृथिवीमुत द्याम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | śoṇaḥ | abhi-kanikradat | gāḥ | nadayan | eti | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām || indrasya-iva | vagnuḥ | ā | śr̥ṇve | ājau | pra-cetayan | arṣati | vācam | ā | imām ||9.97.13||

IAST: indrasyeva vagnur ā śṛṇva ājau pracetayann arṣati vācam emām
Griffith: Well is he beard like Indra's shout in battle: letting this voice be known he hastens hither.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्येव वग्नुरा शृण्व आजौ प्रचेतयन्नर्षति वाचमेमाम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | śoṇaḥ | abhi-kanikradat | gāḥ | nadayan | eti | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām || indrasya-iva | vagnuḥ | ā | śr̥ṇve | ājau | pra-cetayan | arṣati | vācam | ā | imām ||9.97.13||

IAST: rasāyyaḥ payasā pinvamāna īrayann eṣi madhumantam aṁśum
Griffith: Swelling with milk, abounding in sweet flavours, urging the meath-rich plant thou goest onward.
pada pāṭha: rasāyyaḥ | payasā | pinvamānaḥ | īrayan | eṣi | madhu-mantam | aṁśum || pavamānaḥ | sam-tanim | eṣi | kr̥ṇvan | indrāya | soma | pari-sicyamānaḥ ||9.97.14||

IAST: pavamānaḥ saṁtanim eṣi kṛṇvann indrāya soma pariṣicyamānaḥ
Griffith: Raising a shout thou flowest as they cleanse thee, when thou, O Soma, art effused for Indra.
pada pāṭha: rasāyyaḥ | payasā | pinvamānaḥ | īrayan | eṣi | madhu-mantam | aṁśum || pavamānaḥ | sam-tanim | eṣi | kr̥ṇvan | indrāya | soma | pari-sicyamānaḥ ||9.97.14||

IAST: evā pavasva madiro madāyodagrābhasya namayan vadhasnaiḥ
Griffith: So flow thou on inspiriting, for rapture, aiming deatb-shafts at him who stays the waters,
pada pāṭha: eva | pavasva | madiraḥ | madāya | uda-grābhasya | namayan | vadha-snaiḥ || pari | varṇam | bharamāṇaḥ | ruśantam | gavyuḥ | naḥ | arṣa | pari | soma | siktaḥ ||9.97.15||

IAST: pari varṇam bharamāṇo ruśantaṁ gavyur no arṣa pari soma siktaḥ
Griffith: Flow to us wearing thy resplendent colour, effused and eager for the kine, O Soma.
Devanāgarī: परि वर्णं भरमाणो रुशन्तं गव्युर्नो अर्ष परि सोम सिक्तः
pada pāṭha: eva | pavasva | madiraḥ | madāya | uda-grābhasya | namayan | vadha-snaiḥ || pari | varṇam | bharamāṇaḥ | ruśantam | gavyuḥ | naḥ | arṣa | pari | soma | siktaḥ ||9.97.15||

IAST: juṣṭvī na indo supathā sugāny urau pavasva varivāṁsi kṛṇvan
Griffith: Pleased with us, Indu, send us as thou flowest good easy paths in ample space and comforts.
Devanāgarī: जुष्ट्वी न इन्दो सुपथा सुगान्युरौ पवस्व वरिवांसि कृण्वन्
pada pāṭha: juṣṭvī | naḥ | indo iti | su-pathā | su-gāni | urau | pavasva | varivāṁsi | kr̥ṇvan || ghanā-iva | viṣvak | duḥ-itāni | vi-ghnan | adhi | snunā | dhanva | sānau | avye ||9.97.16||

IAST: ghaneva viṣvag duritāni vighnann adhi ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye
Griffith: Dispelling, as 'twere with a club, misfortunes, run o'er the height, run o'er the fleecy summit.
Devanāgarī: घनेव विष्वग्दुरितानि विघ्नन्नधि ष्णुना धन्व सानो अव्ये
pada pāṭha: juṣṭvī | naḥ | indo iti | su-pathā | su-gāni | urau | pavasva | varivāṁsi | kr̥ṇvan || ghanā-iva | viṣvak | duḥ-itāni | vi-ghnan | adhi | snunā | dhanva | sānau | avye ||9.97.16||

IAST: vṛṣṭiṁ no arṣa divyāṁ jigatnum iḻāvatīṁ śaṁgayīṁ jīradānum
Griffith: Pour on us rain celestial, quickly streaming, refreshing, fraught with health and ready bounty.
Devanāgarī: वृष्टिं नो अर्ष दिव्यां जिगत्नुमिळावतीं शंगयीं जीरदानुम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṭim | naḥ | arṣa | divyām | jigatnum | iḷā-vatīm | śam-gayīm | jīra-dānum || stukā-iva | vītā | dhanva | vi-cinvan | bandhūn | imān | avarān | indo iti | vāyūn ||9.97.17||

IAST: stukeva vītā dhanvā vicinvan bandhūm̐r imām̐ avarām̐ indo vāyūn
Griffith: Flow, Indu, send these Winds thy lower kinsmen, setting them free like locks of hair unbraided.
Devanāgarī: स्तुकेव वीता धन्वा विचिन्वन्बन्धूँरिमाँ अवराँ इन्दो वायून्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṭim | naḥ | arṣa | divyām | jigatnum | iḷā-vatīm | śam-gayīm | jīra-dānum || stukā-iva | vītā | dhanva | vi-cinvan | bandhūn | imān | avarān | indo iti | vāyūn ||9.97.17||

IAST: granthiṁ na vi ṣya grathitam punāna ṛjuṁ ca gātuṁ vṛjinaṁ ca soma
Griffith: Part, like a knotted tangle, while they cleanse thee, O Soma, righteous and unrighteous conduct.
Devanāgarī: ग्रन्थिं न वि ष्य ग्रथितं पुनान ऋजुं च गातुं वृजिनं च सोम
pada pāṭha: granthim | na | vi | sya | grathitam | punānaḥ | r̥jum | ca | gātum | vr̥jinam | ca | soma || atyaḥ | na | kradaḥ | hariḥ | ā | sr̥jānaḥ | maryaḥ | deva | dhanva | pastya-vān ||9.97.18||

IAST: atyo na krado harir ā sṛjāno maryo deva dhanva pastyāvān
Griffith: Neigh like a tawny courser who is loosened, come like a youth, O God, a house-possessor.
Devanāgarī: अत्यो न क्रदो हरिरा सृजानो मर्यो देव धन्व पस्त्यावान्
pada pāṭha: granthim | na | vi | sya | grathitam | punānaḥ | r̥jum | ca | gātum | vr̥jinam | ca | soma || atyaḥ | na | kradaḥ | hariḥ | ā | sr̥jānaḥ | maryaḥ | deva | dhanva | pastya-vān ||9.97.18||

IAST: juṣṭo madāya devatāta indo pari ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye
Griffith: For the God's service, for delight, O Indu, run o'er the height, run o'ver the fleecy summit.
Devanāgarī: जुष्टो मदाय देवतात इन्दो परि ष्णुना धन्व सानो अव्ये
pada pāṭha: juṣṭaḥ | madāya | deva-tāte | indo iti | pari | snunā | dhanva | sānau | avye || sahasra-dhāraḥ | surabhiḥ | adabdhaḥ | pari | srava | vāja-sātau | nr̥-sahye ||9.97.19||

IAST: sahasradhāraḥ surabhir adabdhaḥ pari srava vājasātau nṛṣahye
Griffith: With thousand streams, inviolate, sweet-scented, flow on for gain of strength that conquers heroes.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारः सुरभिरदब्धः परि स्रव वाजसातौ नृषह्ये
pada pāṭha: juṣṭaḥ | madāya | deva-tāte | indo iti | pari | snunā | dhanva | sānau | avye || sahasra-dhāraḥ | surabhiḥ | adabdhaḥ | pari | srava | vāja-sātau | nr̥-sahye ||9.97.19||

IAST: araśmāno ye 'rathā ayuktā atyāso na sasṛjānāsa ājau
Griffith: Without a car, without a rein to guide them, unyoked, like coursers started in the contest,
Devanāgarī: अरश्मानो येऽरथा अयुक्ता अत्यासो न ससृजानास आजौ
pada pāṭha: araśmānaḥ | ye | arathāḥ | ayuktāḥ | atyāsaḥ | na | sasr̥jānāsaḥ | ājau || ete | śukrāsaḥ | dhanvanti | somāḥ | devāsaḥ | tān | upa | yāta | pibadhyai ||9.97.20||

IAST: ete śukrāso dhanvanti somā devāsas tām̐ upa yātā pibadhyai
Griffith: These brilliant drops of Soma juice run forward. Do ye, O Deities, come nigh to drink them.
Devanāgarī: एते शुक्रासो धन्वन्ति सोमा देवासस्ताँ उप याता पिबध्यै
pada pāṭha: araśmānaḥ | ye | arathāḥ | ayuktāḥ | atyāsaḥ | na | sasr̥jānāsaḥ | ājau || ete | śukrāsaḥ | dhanvanti | somāḥ | devāsaḥ | tān | upa | yāta | pibadhyai ||9.97.20||

IAST: evā na indo abhi devavītim pari srava nabho arṇaś camūṣu
Griffith: So for our banquet of the Gods, O Indu, pour down the rain of heaven into the vessels.
Devanāgarī: एवा न इन्दो अभि देववीतिं परि स्रव नभो अर्णश्चमूषु
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indo | abhi | deva-vītim | pari | srava | nabhaḥ | arṇaḥ | camūṣu || somaḥ | asmabhyam | kāmyam | br̥hantam | rayim | dadātu | vīra-vantam | ugram ||9.97.21||

IAST: somo asmabhyaṁ kāmyam bṛhantaṁ rayiṁ dadātu vīravantam ugram
Griffith: May Soma grant us riches sought with longing, mighty, exceeding strong, with store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: सोमो अस्मभ्यं काम्यं बृहन्तं रयिं ददातु वीरवन्तमुग्रम्
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indo | abhi | deva-vītim | pari | srava | nabhaḥ | arṇaḥ | camūṣu || somaḥ | asmabhyam | kāmyam | br̥hantam | rayim | dadātu | vīra-vantam | ugram ||9.97.21||

IAST: takṣad yadī manaso venato vāg jyeṣṭhasya vā dharmaṇi kṣor anīke
Griffith: What time the loving spirit's word had formed him Chief of all food, by statute of the Highest,
Devanāgarī: तक्षद्यदी मनसो वेनतो वाग्ज्येष्ठस्य वा धर्मणि क्षोरनीके
pada pāṭha: takṣat | yadi | manasaḥ | venataḥ | vāk | jyeṣṭhasya | vā | dharmaṇi | kṣoḥ | anīke || āt | īm | āyan | varam | ā | vāvaśānāḥ | juṣṭam | patim | kalaśe | gāvaḥ | indum ||9.97.22||

IAST: ād īm āyan varam ā vāvaśānā juṣṭam patiṁ kalaśe gāva indum
Griffith: Then loudly lowing came the cows to Indu, the chosen, well-loved Master in the beaker.
Devanāgarī: आदीमायन्वरमा वावशाना जुष्टं पतिं कलशे गाव इन्दुम्
pada pāṭha: takṣat | yadi | manasaḥ | venataḥ | vāk | jyeṣṭhasya | vā | dharmaṇi | kṣoḥ | anīke || āt | īm | āyan | varam | ā | vāvaśānāḥ | juṣṭam | patim | kalaśe | gāvaḥ | indum ||9.97.22||

IAST: pra dānudo divyo dānupinva ṛtam ṛtāya pavate sumedhāḥ
Griffith: The Sage, Celestial, liberal, raining bounties, pours as he flows the Genuine for the Truthful.
Devanāgarī: प्र दानुदो दिव्यो दानुपिन्व ऋतमृताय पवते सुमेधाः
pada pāṭha: pra | dānu-daḥ | divyaḥ | dānu-pinvaḥ | r̥tam | r̥tāya | pavate | su-medhāḥ || dharmā | bhuvat | vr̥janyasya | rājā | pra | rāsmi-bhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | bhāri | bhūma ||9.97.23||

IAST: dharmā bhuvad vṛjanyasya rājā pra raśmibhir daśabhir bhāri bhūma
Griffith: The King shall be effectual strength's upholder: he by the ten bright reins is mostly guided.
Devanāgarī: धर्मा भुवद्वृजन्यस्य राजा प्र रश्मिभिर्दशभिर्भारि भूम
pada pāṭha: pra | dānu-daḥ | divyaḥ | dānu-pinvaḥ | r̥tam | r̥tāya | pavate | su-medhāḥ || dharmā | bhuvat | vr̥janyasya | rājā | pra | rāsmi-bhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | bhāri | bhūma ||9.97.23||

IAST: pavitrebhiḥ pavamāno nṛcakṣā rājā devānām uta martyānām
Griffith: He who beholds mankind, made pure with filters, the King supreme of Deities and mortals,
Devanāgarī: पवित्रेभिः पवमानो नृचक्षा राजा देवानामुत मर्त्यानाम्
pada pāṭha: pavitrebhiḥ | pavamānaḥ | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | rājā | devānām | uta | martyānām || dvitā | bhuvat | rayi-patiḥ | rayīṇām | r̥tam | bharat | su-bhr̥tam | cāru | induḥ ||9.97.24||

IAST: dvitā bhuvad rayipatī rayīṇām ṛtam bharat subhṛtaṁ cārv induḥ
Griffith: From days of old is Treasure-Lord of riches: he, Indu, cherishes fair well-kept Order.
pada pāṭha: pavitrebhiḥ | pavamānaḥ | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | rājā | devānām | uta | martyānām || dvitā | bhuvat | rayi-patiḥ | rayīṇām | r̥tam | bharat | su-bhr̥tam | cāru | induḥ ||9.97.24||

IAST: arvām̐ iva śravase sātim acchendrasya vāyor abhi vītim arṣa
Griffith: Haste, like a steed, to vittory for glory, to Indra's and to Vayu's entertainment.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाँ इव श्रवसे सातिमच्छेन्द्रस्य वायोरभि वीतिमर्ष
pada pāṭha: arvān-iva | śravase | sātim | accha | indrasya | vāyoḥ | abhi | vītim | arṣa || saḥ | naḥ | sahasrā | br̥hatīḥ | iṣaḥ | dāḥ | bhava | soma | draviṇaḥ-vit | punānaḥ ||9.97.25||

IAST: sa naḥ sahasrā bṛhatīr iṣo dā bhavā soma draviṇovit punānaḥ
