Griffith: Give us food ample, thousandfold: be, Soma, the finder-out of riches when they cleanse thee.
Devanāgarī: स नः सहस्रा बृहतीरिषो दा भवा सोम द्रविणोवित्पुनानः
pada pāṭha: arvān-iva | śravase | sātim | accha | indrasya | vāyoḥ | abhi | vītim | arṣa || saḥ | naḥ | sahasrā | br̥hatīḥ | iṣaḥ | dāḥ | bhava | soma | draviṇaḥ-vit | punānaḥ ||9.97.25||

IAST: devāvyo naḥ pariṣicyamānāḥ kṣayaṁ suvīraṁ dhanvantu somāḥ
Griffith: Effused by us let God-delighting Somas bring as they flow a home with noble heroes.
Devanāgarī: देवाव्यो नः परिषिच्यमानाः क्षयं सुवीरं धन्वन्तु सोमाः
pada pāṭha: deva-avyaḥ | naḥ | pari-sicyamānāḥ | kṣayam | su-vīram | dhanvantu | somāḥ || ā-yajyavaḥ | su-matim | viśva-vārāḥ | hotāraḥ | na | divi-yajaḥ | mandra-tamāḥ ||9.97.26||

IAST: āyajyavaḥ sumatiṁ viśvavārā hotāro na diviyajo mandratamāḥ
Griffith: Rich in all boons like priests acquiring favour, the worshippers of heaven, the best of Cheerers.
Devanāgarī: आयज्यवः सुमतिं विश्ववारा होतारो न दिवियजो मन्द्रतमाः
pada pāṭha: deva-avyaḥ | naḥ | pari-sicyamānāḥ | kṣayam | su-vīram | dhanvantu | somāḥ || ā-yajyavaḥ | su-matim | viśva-vārāḥ | hotāraḥ | na | divi-yajaḥ | mandra-tamāḥ ||9.97.26||

IAST: evā deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase devapānaḥ
Griffith: So, God, for service of the Gods flow onward, flow, drink of Gods, for ample food, O Soma.
Devanāgarī: एवा देव देवताते पवस्व महे सोम प्सरसे देवपानः
pada pāṭha: eva | deva | deva-tāte | pavasva | mahe | soma | psarase | deva-pānaḥ || mahaḥ | cit | hi | smasi | hitāḥ | sa-marye | kr̥dhi | susthāne iti su-sthāne | rodasī iti | punānaḥ ||9.97.27||

IAST: mahaś cid dhi ṣmasi hitāḥ samarye kṛdhi suṣṭhāne rodasī punānaḥ
Griffith: For we go forth to war against the mighty make heaven and earth well stablished by thy cleansing.
Devanāgarī: महश्चिद्धि ष्मसि हिताः समर्ये कृधि सुष्ठाने रोदसी पुनानः
pada pāṭha: eva | deva | deva-tāte | pavasva | mahe | soma | psarase | deva-pānaḥ || mahaḥ | cit | hi | smasi | hitāḥ | sa-marye | kr̥dhi | susthāne iti su-sthāne | rodasī iti | punānaḥ ||9.97.27||

IAST: aśvo na krado vṛṣabhir yujānaḥ siṁho na bhīmo manaso javīyān
Griffith: Thou, yoked by strong men, neighest like a courser, swifter than thought is, like an awful lion.
Devanāgarī: अश्वो नो क्रदो वृषभिर्युजानः सिंहो न भीमो मनसो जवीयान्
pada pāṭha: aśvaḥ | na | kradaḥ | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | yujānaḥ | siṁhaḥ | na | bhīmaḥ | manasaḥ | javīyān || arvācīnaiḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | ye | rajiṣṭhāḥ | ā | pavasva | saumanasam | naḥ | indo iti ||9.97.28||

IAST: arvācīnaiḥ pathibhir ye rajiṣṭhā ā pavasva saumanasaṁ na indo
Griffith: By paths directed hitherward, the straightest, send thou us happiness, Indu, while they cleanse thee.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाचीनैः पथिभिर्ये रजिष्ठा आ पवस्व सौमनसं न इन्दो
pada pāṭha: aśvaḥ | na | kradaḥ | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | yujānaḥ | siṁhaḥ | na | bhīmaḥ | manasaḥ | javīyān || arvācīnaiḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | ye | rajiṣṭhāḥ | ā | pavasva | saumanasam | naḥ | indo iti ||9.97.28||

IAST: śataṁ dhārā devajātā asṛgran sahasram enāḥ kavayo mṛjanti
Griffith: Sprung from the Gods, a hundred streams, a thousand, have been effused: sages prepare and purge them.
Devanāgarī: शतं धारा देवजाता असृग्रन्सहस्रमेनाः कवयो मृजन्ति
pada pāṭha: śatam | dhārāḥ | deva-jātāḥ | asr̥gran | sahasram | enāḥ | kavayaḥ | mr̥janti || indo iti | sanitram | divaḥ | ā | pavasva | puraḥ-etā | asi | mahataḥ | dhanasya ||9.97.29||

IAST: indo sanitraṁ diva ā pavasva puraetāsi mahato dhanasya
Griffith: Bring us from heaven the means of winnning, Indu; thou art-forerunnner of abundant riches.
Devanāgarī: इन्दो सनित्रं दिव आ पवस्व पुरएतासि महतो धनस्य
pada pāṭha: śatam | dhārāḥ | deva-jātāḥ | asr̥gran | sahasram | enāḥ | kavayaḥ | mr̥janti || indo iti | sanitram | divaḥ | ā | pavasva | puraḥ-etā | asi | mahataḥ | dhanasya ||9.97.29||

IAST: divo na sargā asasṛgram ahnāṁ rājā na mitram pra mināti dhīraḥ
Griffith: The streams of days, were poured as 'twere from heaven: the wise King doth not treat his friend unkindly
Devanāgarī: दिवो न सर्गा अससृग्रमह्नां राजा न मित्रं प्र मिनाति धीरः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | na | sargāḥ | asasr̥gram | ahnām | rājā | na | mitram | pra | mināti | dhīraḥ || pituḥ | na | putraḥ | kratu-bhiḥ | yatānaḥ | ā | pavasva | viśe | asyai | ajītim ||9.97.30||

IAST: pitur na putraḥ kratubhir yatāna ā pavasva viśe asyā ajītim
Griffith: Like a son following his father's wishes, grant to this family success and safety.
Devanāgarī: पितुर्न पुत्रः क्रतुभिर्यतान आ पवस्व विशे अस्या अजीतिम्
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | na | sargāḥ | asasr̥gram | ahnām | rājā | na | mitram | pra | mināti | dhīraḥ || pituḥ | na | putraḥ | kratu-bhiḥ | yatānaḥ | ā | pavasva | viśe | asyai | ajītim ||9.97.30||

IAST: pra te dhārā madhumatīr asṛgran vārān yat pūto atyeṣy avyān
Griffith: Now are thy streams poured forth with all their sweetness, when, purified. thou goest through the filter
pada pāṭha: pra | te | dhārāḥ | madhu-matīḥ | asr̥gran | vārān | yat | pūtaḥ | ati-eṣi | avyān || pavamāna | pavase | dhāma | gonām | jajñānaḥ | sūryam | apinvaḥ | arkaiḥ ||9.97.31||

IAST: pavamāna pavase dhāma gonāṁ jajñānaḥ sūryam apinvo arkaiḥ
Griffith: The race of kine is thy gift, Pavarridna: when born thou madest Surya rich with brightness.
Devanāgarī: पवमान पवसे धाम गोनां जज्ञानः सूर्यमपिन्वो अर्कैः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | dhārāḥ | madhu-matīḥ | asr̥gran | vārān | yat | pūtaḥ | ati-eṣi | avyān || pavamāna | pavase | dhāma | gonām | jajñānaḥ | sūryam | apinvaḥ | arkaiḥ ||9.97.31||

IAST: kanikradad anu panthām ṛtasya śukro vi bhāsy amṛtasya dhāma
Griffith: Bright, bellowing aiong the path of Order, thou shinest as the form of life eternal.
Devanāgarī: कनिक्रददनु पन्थामृतस्य शुक्रो वि भास्यमृतस्य धाम
pada pāṭha: kanikradat | anu | panthām | r̥tasya | śukraḥ | vi | bhāsi | amr̥tasya | dhāma || saḥ | indrāya | pavase | matsara-vān | hinvānaḥ | vācam | mati-bhiḥ | kavīnām ||9.97.32||

IAST: sa indrāya pavase matsaravān hinvāno vācam matibhiḥ kavīnām
Griffith: Thou flowest on as gladdening drink for Indra, sending thy voice out with the hymns of sages.
Devanāgarī: स इन्द्राय पवसे मत्सरवान्हिन्वानो वाचं मतिभिः कवीनाम्
pada pāṭha: kanikradat | anu | panthām | r̥tasya | śukraḥ | vi | bhāsi | amr̥tasya | dhāma || saḥ | indrāya | pavase | matsara-vān | hinvānaḥ | vācam | mati-bhiḥ | kavīnām ||9.97.32||

IAST: divyaḥ suparṇo 'va cakṣi soma pinvan dhārāḥ karmaṇā devavītau
Griffith: Pouring out streams at the Gods' feast with service, thou, Soma, lookest down, a heavenly Eagle.
Devanāgarī: दिव्यः सुपर्णोऽव चक्षि सोम पिन्वन्धाराः कर्मणा देववीतौ
pada pāṭha: divyaḥ | su-parṇaḥ | ava | cakṣi | soma | pinvan | dhārāḥ | karmaṇā | deva-vītau || ā | indo iti | viśa | kalaśam | soma-dhānam | krandan | ihi | sūryasya | upa | raśmim ||9.97.33||

IAST: endo viśa kalaśaṁ somadhānaṁ krandann ihi sūryasyopa raśmim
Griffith: Enter the Soma-holding beaker, Indu, and with a roar approach the ray of Sarya.
Devanāgarī: एन्दो विश कलशं सोमधानं क्रन्दन्निहि सूर्यस्योप रश्मिम्
pada pāṭha: divyaḥ | su-parṇaḥ | ava | cakṣi | soma | pinvan | dhārāḥ | karmaṇā | deva-vītau || ā | indo iti | viśa | kalaśam | soma-dhānam | krandan | ihi | sūryasya | upa | raśmim ||9.97.33||

IAST: tisro vāca īrayati pra vahnir ṛtasya dhītim brahmaṇo manīṣām
Griffith: Three are the voices that the Courser utters: he speaks the thought of prayer, the law of Order.
Devanāgarī: तिस्रो वाच ईरयति प्र वह्निरृतस्य धीतिं ब्रह्मणो मनीषाम्
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | vācaḥ | īrayati | pra | vahniḥ | r̥tasya | dhītim | brahmaṇaḥ | manīṣām || gāvaḥ | yanti | go-patim | pr̥cchamānāḥ | somam | yanti | matayaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ ||9.97.34||

IAST: gāvo yanti gopatim pṛcchamānāḥ somaṁ yanti matayo vāvaśānāḥ
Griffith: To the Cow's Master come the Cows inquiring: the hymns with eager longing come to Soma.
Devanāgarī: गावो यन्ति गोपतिं पृच्छमानाः सोमं यन्ति मतयो वावशानाः
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | vācaḥ | īrayati | pra | vahniḥ | r̥tasya | dhītim | brahmaṇaḥ | manīṣām || gāvaḥ | yanti | go-patim | pr̥cchamānāḥ | somam | yanti | matayaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ ||9.97.34||

IAST: somaṁ gāvo dhenavo vāvaśānāḥ somaṁ viprā matibhiḥ pṛcchamānāḥ
Griffith: To Soma come the Cows, the Milch-kine longing, to Soma sages with their hvmns inquiring.
Devanāgarī: सोमं गावो धेनवो वावशानाः सोमं विप्रा मतिभिः पृच्छमानाः
pada pāṭha: somam | gāvaḥ | dhenavaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | somam | viprāḥ | mati-bhiḥ | pr̥cchamānāḥ || somaḥ | sutaḥ | pūyate | ajyamānaḥ | some | arkāḥ | tri-stubhaḥ | sam | navante ||9.97.35||

IAST: somaḥ sutaḥ pūyate ajyamānaḥ some arkās triṣṭubhaḥ saṁ navante
Griffith: Soma, effused, is purified and blended our hymns and Trstup songs unite in Soma.
Devanāgarī: सोमः सुतः पूयते अज्यमानः सोमे अर्कास्त्रिष्टुभः सं नवन्ते
pada pāṭha: somam | gāvaḥ | dhenavaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | somam | viprāḥ | mati-bhiḥ | pr̥cchamānāḥ || somaḥ | sutaḥ | pūyate | ajyamānaḥ | some | arkāḥ | tri-stubhaḥ | sam | navante ||9.97.35||

IAST: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāna ā pavasva pūyamānaḥ svasti
Griffith: Thus, Soma, as we pour thee into vessels, while thou art purified flow for our welfare.
Devanāgarī: एवा नः सोम परिषिच्यमान आ पवस्व पूयमानः स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | soma | pari-sicyamānaḥ | ā | pavasva | pūyamānaḥ | svasti || indram | ā | viśa | br̥hatā | raveṇa | vardhaya | vācam | janaya | puram-dhim ||9.97.36||

IAST: indram ā viśa bṛhatā raveṇa vardhayā vācaṁ janayā puraṁdhim
Griffith: Pass into Indra with a mighty roaring make the voice swell, and generate abundance.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमा विश बृहता रवेण वर्धया वाचं जनया पुरंधिम्
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | soma | pari-sicyamānaḥ | ā | pavasva | pūyamānaḥ | svasti || indram | ā | viśa | br̥hatā | raveṇa | vardhaya | vācam | janaya | puram-dhim ||9.97.36||

IAST: ā jāgṛvir vipra ṛtā matīnāṁ somaḥ punāno asadac camūṣu
Griffith: Singer of true songs, ever-watchful, Soma hath settled in the ladles when they cleanse him.
Devanāgarī: आ जागृविर्विप्र ऋता मतीनां सोमः पुनानो असदच्चमूषु
pada pāṭha: ā | jāgr̥viḥ | vipraḥ | r̥tā | matīnām | somaḥ | punānaḥ | asadat | camūṣu || sapanti | yam | mithunāsaḥ | ni-kāmāḥ | adhvaryavaḥ | rathirāsaḥ | su-hastāḥ ||9.97.37||

IAST: sapanti yam mithunāso nikāmā adhvaryavo rathirāsaḥ suhastāḥ
Griffith: Him the Adhvaryus, paired and eager, follow, leaders of sacrifice and skilful-handed.
Devanāgarī: सपन्ति यं मिथुनासो निकामा अध्वर्यवो रथिरासः सुहस्ताः
pada pāṭha: ā | jāgr̥viḥ | vipraḥ | r̥tā | matīnām | somaḥ | punānaḥ | asadat | camūṣu || sapanti | yam | mithunāsaḥ | ni-kāmāḥ | adhvaryavaḥ | rathirāsaḥ | su-hastāḥ ||9.97.37||

IAST: sa punāna upa sūre na dhātobhe aprā rodasī vi ṣa āvaḥ
Griffith: Cleansed near the Sun as 'twere he as Creator hath filled full heaven and earth, and hath disclosed them
Devanāgarī: स पुनान उप सूरे न धातोभे अप्रा रोदसी वि ष आवः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | punānaḥ | upa | sūre | na | dhātā | ā | ubhe iti | aprāḥ | rodasī iti | vi | saḥ | āvarityāvaḥ || priyā | cit | yasya | priyasāsaḥ | ūtī | saḥ | tu | dhanam | kāriṇe | na | pra | yaṁsat ||9.97.38||

IAST: priyā cid yasya priyasāsa ūtī sa tū dhanaṁ kāriṇe na pra yaṁsat
Griffith: He by whose dear help men gain all their wishes shall yield the precious meed as to a victor.
Devanāgarī: प्रिया चिद्यस्य प्रियसास ऊती स तू धनं कारिणे न प्र यंसत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | punānaḥ | upa | sūre | na | dhātā | ā | ubhe iti | aprāḥ | rodasī iti | vi | saḥ | āvarityāvaḥ || priyā | cit | yasya | priyasāsaḥ | ūtī | saḥ | tu | dhanam | kāriṇe | na | pra | yaṁsat ||9.97.38||

IAST: sa vardhitā vardhanaḥ pūyamānaḥ somo mīḍhvām̐ abhi no jyotiṣāvīt
Griffith: He, being cleansed, the Strengthener and Increaser, Soma the Bounteous, helped us with his lustre,
Devanāgarī: स वर्धिता वर्धनः पूयमानः सोमो मीढ्वाँ अभि नो ज्योतिषावीत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vardhitā | vardhanaḥ | pūyamānaḥ | somaḥ | mīḍhvān | abhi | naḥ | jyotiṣā | āvīt || yena | naḥ | pūrve | pitaraḥ | pada-jñāḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ | abhi | gāḥ | adrim | uṣṇan ||9.97.39||

IAST: yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñāḥ svarvido abhi gā adrim uṣṇan
Griffith: Wherewith our sires of old who knew the footsteps found light and stole the cattle from the mountain.
Devanāgarī: येना नः पूर्वे पितरः पदज्ञाः स्वर्विदो अभि गा अद्रिमुष्णन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vardhitā | vardhanaḥ | pūyamānaḥ | somaḥ | mīḍhvān | abhi | naḥ | jyotiṣā | āvīt || yena | naḥ | pūrve | pitaraḥ | pada-jñāḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ | abhi | gāḥ | adrim | uṣṇan ||9.97.39||

IAST: akrān samudraḥ prathame vidharmañ janayan prajā bhuvanasya rājā
Griffith: In the first vault of heaven loud roared the Ocean, King of all being, generating creatures.
pada pāṭha: akrān | samudraḥ | prathame | vi-dharman | janayan | pra-jāḥ | bhuvanasya | rājā || vr̥ṣā | pavitre | adhi | sānau | avye | br̥hat | somaḥ | vavr̥dhe | suvānaḥ | induḥ ||9.97.40||

IAST: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhat somo vāvṛdhe suvāna induḥ
Griffith: Steer, in the filter, on the fleecy summit, Soma, the Drop effused, hath waxen mighty.
Devanāgarī: वृषा पवित्रे अधि सानो अव्ये बृहत्सोमो वावृधे सुवान इन्दुः
pada pāṭha: akrān | samudraḥ | prathame | vi-dharman | janayan | pra-jāḥ | bhuvanasya | rājā || vr̥ṣā | pavitre | adhi | sānau | avye | br̥hat | somaḥ | vavr̥dhe | suvānaḥ | induḥ ||9.97.40||

IAST: mahat tat somo mahiṣaś cakārāpāṁ yad garbho 'vṛṇīta devān
Griffith: Soma the Steer, in that as Child of Waters he chose the Gods, performed that great achievement.
pada pāṭha: mahat | tat | somaḥ | mahiṣaḥ | cakāra | apām | yat | garbhaḥ | avr̥ṇīta | devān || adadhāt | indre | pavamānaḥ | ojaḥ | ajanayat | sūrye | jyotiḥ | induḥ ||9.97.41||

IAST: adadhād indre pavamāna ojo 'janayat sūrye jyotir induḥ
Griffith: He, Pavamana, granted strength to Indra; he, Indu, generated light in Surya.
pada pāṭha: mahat | tat | somaḥ | mahiṣaḥ | cakāra | apām | yat | garbhaḥ | avr̥ṇīta | devān || adadhāt | indre | pavamānaḥ | ojaḥ | ajanayat | sūrye | jyotiḥ | induḥ ||9.97.41||

IAST: matsi vāyum iṣṭaye rādhase ca matsi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
Griffith: Make Vayu glad,, for furtherance and bounty: cheer Varuna and Mitra, as they cleanse thee.
Devanāgarī: मत्सि वायुमिष्टये राधसे च मत्सि मित्रावरुणा पूयमानः
pada pāṭha: matsi | vāyum | iṣṭaye | rādhase | ca | matsi | mitrāvaruṇā | pūyamānaḥ || matsi | śardhaḥ | mārutam | matsi | devān | matsi | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | deva | soma ||9.97.42||

IAST: matsi śardho mārutam matsi devān matsi dyāvāpṛthivī deva soma
Griffith: Gladden the Gods, gladden the host of Maruts: make Heaven and Earth rejoice, O God, O Soma.
Devanāgarī: मत्सि शर्धो मारुतं मत्सि देवान्मत्सि द्यावापृथिवी देव सोम
pada pāṭha: matsi | vāyum | iṣṭaye | rādhase | ca | matsi | mitrāvaruṇā | pūyamānaḥ || matsi | śardhaḥ | mārutam | matsi | devān | matsi | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | deva | soma ||9.97.42||

IAST: ṛjuḥ pavasva vṛjinasya hantāpāmīvām bādhamāno mṛdhaś ca
Griffith: Flow onward righteous slayer of the wicked, driving away our enemies and sickness,
Devanāgarī: ऋजुः पवस्व वृजिनस्य हन्तापामीवां बाधमानो मृधश्च
pada pāṭha: r̥juḥ | pavasva | vr̥jinasya | hantā | apa | amīvām | bādhamānaḥ | mr̥dhaḥ | ca || abhi-śrīṇan | payaḥ | payasā | abhi | gonām | indrasya | tvam | tava | vayam | sakhāyaḥ ||9.97.43||

IAST: abhiśrīṇan payaḥ payasābhi gonām indrasya tvaṁ tava vayaṁ sakhāyaḥ
Griffith: Blending thy milk with milk which cows afford us. We are thy friends, thou art the Friend of Indra.
Devanāgarī: अभिश्रीणन्पयः पयसाभि गोनामिन्द्रस्य त्वं तव वयं सखायः
pada pāṭha: r̥juḥ | pavasva | vr̥jinasya | hantā | apa | amīvām | bādhamānaḥ | mr̥dhaḥ | ca || abhi-śrīṇan | payaḥ | payasā | abhi | gonām | indrasya | tvam | tava | vayam | sakhāyaḥ ||9.97.43||

IAST: madhvaḥ sūdam pavasva vasva utsaṁ vīraṁ ca na ā pavasvā bhagaṁ ca
Griffith: Pour us a fount of meath, a spring of treasure; send us a hero son and happy fortune.
Devanāgarī: मध्वः सूदं पवस्व वस्व उत्सं वीरं च न आ पवस्वा भगं च
pada pāṭha: madhvaḥ | sūdam | pavasva | vasvaḥ | utsam | vīram | ca | naḥ | ā | pavasva | bhagam | ca || svadasva | indrāya | pavamānaḥ | indo iti | rayim | ca | naḥ | ā | pavasva | samudrāt ||9.97.44||

IAST: svadasvendrāya pavamāna indo rayiṁ ca na ā pavasvā samudrāt
Griffith: Be sweet to India when they cleanse thee, Indu, and pour down riches on us from the ocean.
Devanāgarī: स्वदस्वेन्द्राय पवमान इन्दो रयिं च न आ पवस्वा समुद्रात्
pada pāṭha: madhvaḥ | sūdam | pavasva | vasvaḥ | utsam | vīram | ca | naḥ | ā | pavasva | bhagam | ca || svadasva | indrāya | pavamānaḥ | indo iti | rayim | ca | naḥ | ā | pavasva | samudrāt ||9.97.44||

IAST: somaḥ suto dhārayātyo na hitvā sindhur na nimnam abhi vājy akṣāḥ
Griffith: Strong Soma, pressed, like an impetuous courser, hath flowed in stream as a flood speeding downward.
Devanāgarī: सोमः सुतो धारयात्यो न हित्वा सिन्धुर्न निम्नमभि वाज्यक्षाः
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | sutaḥ | dhārayā | atyaḥ | na | hitvā | sindhuḥ | na | nimnam | abhi | vājī | akṣāriti || ā | yonim | vanyam | asadat | punānaḥ | sam | induḥ | gobhiḥ | asarat | sam | at-bhiḥ ||9.97.45||

IAST: ā yoniṁ vanyam asadat punānaḥ sam indur gobhir asarat sam adbhiḥ
Griffith: Cleansed, he hath settled in his wooden dwelling: Indu hath flowed with milk and with the waters.
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | sutaḥ | dhārayā | atyaḥ | na | hitvā | sindhuḥ | na | nimnam | abhi | vājī | akṣāriti || ā | yonim | vanyam | asadat | punānaḥ | sam | induḥ | gobhiḥ | asarat | sam | at-bhiḥ ||9.97.45||

IAST: eṣa sya te pavata indra somaś camūṣu dhīra uśate tavasvān
Griffith: Strong, wise, for thee who longest for his coming this Soma here flows to the bowls, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: एष स्य ते पवत इन्द्र सोमश्चमूषु धीर उशते तवस्वान्
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | te | pavate | indra | somaḥ | camūṣu | dhīraḥ | uśate | tavasvān || svaḥ-cakṣāḥ | rathiraḥ | satya-śuṣmaḥ | kāmaḥ | na | yaḥ | deva-yatām | asarji ||9.97.46||

IAST: svarcakṣā rathiraḥ satyaśuṣmaḥ kāmo na yo devayatām asarji
Griffith: He, chariot-borne, sun-bright, and truly potent, was poured forth like the longing of the pious.
Devanāgarī: स्वर्चक्षा रथिरः सत्यशुष्मः कामो न यो देवयतामसर्जि
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | te | pavate | indra | somaḥ | camūṣu | dhīraḥ | uśate | tavasvān || svaḥ-cakṣāḥ | rathiraḥ | satya-śuṣmaḥ | kāmaḥ | na | yaḥ | deva-yatām | asarji ||9.97.46||

IAST: eṣa pratnena vayasā punānas tiro varpāṁsi duhitur dadhānaḥ
Griffith: He, purified with ancient vital vigour, pervading all his Daughter's forms and figures,
Devanāgarī: एष प्रत्नेन वयसा पुनानस्तिरो वर्पांसि दुहितुर्दधानः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | pratnena | vayasā | punānaḥ | tiraḥ | varpāṁsi | duhituḥ | dadhānaḥ || vasānaḥ | śarma | tri-varūtham | ap-su | hotā-iva | yāti | samaneṣu | rebhan ||9.97.47||

IAST: vasānaḥ śarma trivarūtham apsu hoteva yāti samaneṣu rebhan
Griffith: Finding his threefold refuge in the waters, goes singing, as a priest, to the assemblies.
Devanāgarī: वसानः शर्म त्रिवरूथमप्सु होतेव याति समनेषु रेभन्
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | pratnena | vayasā | punānaḥ | tiraḥ | varpāṁsi | duhituḥ | dadhānaḥ || vasānaḥ | śarma | tri-varūtham | ap-su | hotā-iva | yāti | samaneṣu | rebhan ||9.97.47||

IAST: nū nas tvaṁ rathiro deva soma pari srava camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ
Griffith: Now, chariot-borne, flow unto us, God Soma, as thou art purified flow to the saucers,
Devanāgarī: नू नस्त्वं रथिरो देव सोम परि स्रव चम्वोः पूयमानः
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | tvam | rathiraḥ | deva | soma | pari | srava | camvoḥ | pūyamānaḥ || ap-su | svādiṣṭhaḥ | madhu-mān | r̥ta-vā | devaḥ | na | yaḥ | savitā | satya-manmā ||9.97.48||

IAST: apsu svādiṣṭho madhumām̐ ṛtāvā devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā
Griffith: Sweetest in waters, rich in meath, and holy, as Savitar the God is, truthfulminded.
Devanāgarī: अप्सु स्वादिष्ठो मधुमाँ ऋतावा देवो न यः सविता सत्यमन्मा
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | tvam | rathiraḥ | deva | soma | pari | srava | camvoḥ | pūyamānaḥ || ap-su | svādiṣṭhaḥ | madhu-mān | r̥ta-vā | devaḥ | na | yaḥ | savitā | satya-manmā ||9.97.48||

IAST: abhi vāyuṁ vīty arṣā gṛṇāno 'bhi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
Griffith: To feast him, flow mid song and hymn, to Vayu, flow purified to Varuna and Mitra.
Devanāgarī: अभि वायुं वीत्यर्षा गृणानोऽभि मित्रावरुणा पूयमानः
pada pāṭha: abhi | vāyum | vītī | arṣa | gr̥ṇānaḥ | abhi | mitrāvaruṇā | pūyamānaḥ || abhi | naram | dhī-javanam | rathe-sthām | abhi | indram | vr̥ṣaṇam | vajra-bāhum ||9.97.49||

IAST: abhī naraṁ dhījavanaṁ ratheṣṭhām abhīndraṁ vṛṣaṇaṁ vajrabāhum
Griffith: Flow to the song-inspiring car-borne Hero, to mighty Indra, him who wields the thunder.
Devanāgarī: अभी नरं धीजवनं रथेष्ठामभीन्द्रं वृषणं वज्रबाहुम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | vāyum | vītī | arṣa | gr̥ṇānaḥ | abhi | mitrāvaruṇā | pūyamānaḥ || abhi | naram | dhī-javanam | rathe-sthām | abhi | indram | vr̥ṣaṇam | vajra-bāhum ||9.97.49||

IAST: abhi vastrā suvasanāny arṣābhi dhenūḥ sudughāḥ pūyamānaḥ
Griffith: Pour on us garments that shall clothe us meetly, send, purified, miIch-kine, abundant yielders.
Devanāgarī: अभि वस्त्रा सुवसनान्यर्षाभि धेनूः सुदुघाः पूयमानः
pada pāṭha: abhi | vastrā | su-vasanāni | arṣa | abhi | dhenūḥ | su-dughāḥ | pūyamānaḥ || abhi | candrā | bhartave | naḥ | hiraṇyā | abhi | aśvān | rathinaḥ | deva | soma ||9.97.50||

IAST: abhi candrā bhartave no hiraṇyābhy aśvān rathino deva soma
Griffith: God Soma, send us chariot-drawing horses that they may bring us treasures bright and golden.
Devanāgarī: अभि चन्द्रा भर्तवे नो हिरण्याभ्यश्वान्रथिनो देव सोम
pada pāṭha: abhi | vastrā | su-vasanāni | arṣa | abhi | dhenūḥ | su-dughāḥ | pūyamānaḥ || abhi | candrā | bhartave | naḥ | hiraṇyā | abhi | aśvān | rathinaḥ | deva | soma ||9.97.50||

IAST: abhī no arṣa divyā vasūny abhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ
Griffith: Send to us in a stream celestial riches, send us, when thou art cleansed, what earth containeth,
Devanāgarī: अभी नो अर्ष दिव्या वसून्यभि विश्वा पार्थिवा पूयमानः
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | arṣa | divyā | vasūni | abhi | viśvā | pārthivā | pūyamānaḥ || abhi | yena | draviṇam | aśnavāma | abhi | ārṣeyam | jamadagni-vat | naḥ ||9.97.51||

IAST: abhi yena draviṇam aśnavāmābhy ārṣeyaṁ jamadagnivan naḥ
Griffith: So that thereby we may acquire possessions and Rsihood in Jamadagni's manner.
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | arṣa | divyā | vasūni | abhi | viśvā | pārthivā | pūyamānaḥ || abhi | yena | draviṇam | aśnavāma | abhi | ārṣeyam | jamadagni-vat | naḥ ||9.97.51||

IAST: ayā pavā pavasvainā vasūni mām̐ścatva indo sarasi pra dhanva
Griffith: Pour forth this wealth with this purification: flow onward to the yellow lake, O Indu.
Devanāgarī: अया पवा पवस्वैना वसूनि माँश्चत्व इन्दो सरसि प्र धन्व
pada pāṭha: ayā | pavā | pavasva | enā | vasūni | mām̐ścatve | indo iti | sarasi | pra | dhanva || bradhnaḥ | cit | atra | vātaḥ | na | jūtaḥ | puru-medhaḥ | cit | takave | naram | dāt ||9.97.52||

IAST: bradhnaś cid atra vāto na jūtaḥ purumedhaś cit takave naraṁ dāt
Griffith: Here, too, the Ruddy, wind-swift, full of wisdom, Shall give a son to him who cometh quickly.
Devanāgarī: ब्रध्नश्चिदत्र वातो न जूतः पुरुमेधश्चित्तकवे नरं दात्
pada pāṭha: ayā | pavā | pavasva | enā | vasūni | mām̐ścatve | indo iti | sarasi | pra | dhanva || bradhnaḥ | cit | atra | vātaḥ | na | jūtaḥ | puru-medhaḥ | cit | takave | naram | dāt ||9.97.52||

IAST: uta na enā pavayā pavasvādhi śrute śravāyyasya tīrthe
Griffith: Flow on for us with this purification to the famed ford of thee whose due is glory.
Devanāgarī: उत न एना पवया पवस्वाधि श्रुते श्रवाय्यस्य तीर्थे
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | enā | pavayā | pavasva | adhi | śrute | śravāyyasya | tīrthe || ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | naigutaḥ | vasūni | vr̥kṣam | na | pakvam | dhūnavat | raṇāya ||9.97.53||

IAST: ṣaṣṭiṁ sahasrā naiguto vasūni vṛkṣaṁ na pakvaṁ dhūnavad raṇāya
Griffith: May the Foe-queller shake us down, for triumph, like a tree's ripe fruit, sixty thousand treasures.
Devanāgarī: षष्टिं सहस्रा नैगुतो वसूनि वृक्षं न पक्वं धूनवद्रणाय
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | enā | pavayā | pavasva | adhi | śrute | śravāyyasya | tīrthe || ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | naigutaḥ | vasūni | vr̥kṣam | na | pakvam | dhūnavat | raṇāya ||9.97.53||

IAST: mahīme asya vṛṣanāma śūṣe mām̐ścatve vā pṛśane vā vadhatre
Griffith: Eagerly do we pray for those two exploits, at the blue lake and Prsana, wrought in battle.
Devanāgarī: महीमे अस्य वृषनाम शूषे माँश्चत्वे वा पृशने वा वधत्रे
pada pāṭha: mahi | ime iti | asya | vr̥ṣanāma | śūṣe iti | mām̐ścatve | vā | pr̥śane | vā | vadhatre iti || asvāpayat | ni-gutaḥ | snehayat | ca | apa | amitrān | apa | acitaḥ | aca | itaḥ ||9.97.54||

IAST: asvāpayan nigutaḥ snehayac cāpāmitrām̐ apācito acetaḥ
Griffith: He sent our enemies to sleep and slew thern, and turned away the foolish and unfriendly.
pada pāṭha: mahi | ime iti | asya | vr̥ṣanāma | śūṣe iti | mām̐ścatve | vā | pr̥śane | vā | vadhatre iti || asvāpayat | ni-gutaḥ | snehayat | ca | apa | amitrān | apa | acitaḥ | aca | itaḥ ||9.97.54||

IAST: saṁ trī pavitrā vitatāny eṣy anv ekaṁ dhāvasi pūyamānaḥ
Griffith: Thou comest unto three extended filters, and hasteriest through each one as they cleanse thee.
Devanāgarī: सं त्री पवित्रा विततान्येष्यन्वेकं धावसि पूयमानः
pada pāṭha: sam | trī | pavitrā | vi-tatāni | eṣi | anu | ekam | dhāvasi | pūyamānaḥ || asi | bhagaḥ | asi | dātrasya | dātā | asi | magha-vā | maghavat-bhyaḥ | indo iti ||9.97.55||

IAST: asi bhago asi dātrasya dātāsi maghavā maghavadbhya indo
Griffith: Thou art the giver of the gift, a Bhaga, a Maghavan for liberal lords, O Indu.
Devanāgarī: असि भगो असि दात्रस्य दातासि मघवा मघवद्भ्य इन्दो
pada pāṭha: sam | trī | pavitrā | vi-tatāni | eṣi | anu | ekam | dhāvasi | pūyamānaḥ || asi | bhagaḥ | asi | dātrasya | dātā | asi | magha-vā | maghavat-bhyaḥ | indo iti ||9.97.55||

IAST: eṣa viśvavit pavate manīṣī somo viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
Griffith: This Soma here, the Wise, the All-obtainer, flows on his way as King of all existence.
Devanāgarī: एष विश्ववित्पवते मनीषी सोमो विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | viśva-vit | pavate | manīṣī | somaḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājā || drapsān | īrayan | vidatheṣu | induḥ | vi | vāram | avyam | samayā | ati | yāti ||9.97.56||

IAST: drapsām̐ īrayan vidatheṣv indur vi vāram avyaṁ samayāti yāti
Griffith: Driving the drops at our assemblies, Indu completely traverses the fleecy filter.
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | viśva-vit | pavate | manīṣī | somaḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājā || drapsān | īrayan | vidatheṣu | induḥ | vi | vāram | avyam | samayā | ati | yāti ||9.97.56||

IAST: induṁ rihanti mahiṣā adabdhāḥ pade rebhanti kavayo na gṛdhrāḥ
Griffith: The Great Inviolate are kissing Indu, and singing in his place like eager sages.
Devanāgarī: इन्दुं रिहन्ति महिषा अदब्धाः पदे रेभन्ति कवयो न गृध्राः
pada pāṭha: indum | rihanti | mahiṣāḥ | adabdhāḥ | pade | rebhanti | kavayaḥ | na | gr̥dhrāḥ || hinvanti | dhīrāḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | kṣipābhiḥ | sam | añjate | rūpam | apām | rasena ||9.97.57||

IAST: hinvanti dhīrā daśabhiḥ kṣipābhiḥ sam añjate rūpam apāṁ rasena
Griffith: The wise men send him forth with ten swift fingers, and balm his form with essence of the waters.
Devanāgarī: हिन्वन्ति धीरा दशभिः क्षिपाभिः समञ्जते रूपमपां रसेन
pada pāṭha: indum | rihanti | mahiṣāḥ | adabdhāḥ | pade | rebhanti | kavayaḥ | na | gr̥dhrāḥ || hinvanti | dhīrāḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | kṣipābhiḥ | sam | añjate | rūpam | apām | rasena ||9.97.57||

IAST: tvayā vayam pavamānena soma bhare kṛtaṁ vi cinuyāma śaśvat
Griffith: Soma, may we, with thee as Pavamana, pile up together all our spoil in battle.
Devanāgarī: त्वया वयं पवमानेन सोम भरे कृतं वि चिनुयाम शश्वत्
pada pāṭha: tvayā | vayam | pavamānena | soma | bhare | kr̥tam | vi | cinuyāma | śaśvat || tat | naḥ | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mamahantām | aditiḥ | sindhuḥ | pr̥thivī | uta | dyauḥ ||9.97.58||

IAST: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
Griffith: This boon vouchsafe us Varuna and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: तन्नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्तामदितिः सिन्धुः पृथिवी उत द्यौः
pada pāṭha: tvayā | vayam | pavamānena | soma | bhare | kr̥tam | vi | cinuyāma | śaśvat || tat | naḥ | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mamahantām | aditiḥ | sindhuḥ | pr̥thivī | uta | dyauḥ ||9.97.58||

IAST: abhi no vājasātamaṁ rayim arṣa puruspṛham
Griffith: STREAM on us riches that are sought by many, best at winning strength
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | vāja-sātamam | rayim | arṣa | puru-spr̥ham || indo iti | sahasra-bharṇasam | tuvi-dyumnam | vibhva-saham ||9.98.1||

IAST: indo sahasrabharṇasaṁ tuvidyumnaṁ vibhvāsaham
Griffith: Riches, O Indu, thousandfold, glorious, conquering the great.
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | vāja-sātamam | rayim | arṣa | puru-spr̥ham || indo iti | sahasra-bharṇasam | tuvi-dyumnam | vibhva-saham ||9.98.1||

IAST: pari ṣya suvāno avyayaṁ rathe na varmāvyata
Griffith: Effused, he hath, as on a car, invested him in fleecy mail:
Devanāgarī: परि ष्य सुवानो अव्ययं रथे न वर्माव्यत
pada pāṭha: pari | syaḥ | suvānaḥ | avyayam | rathe | na | varma | avyata || induḥ | abhi | druṇā | hitaḥ | hiyānaḥ | dhārābhiḥ | akṣāriti ||9.98.2||

IAST: indur abhi druṇā hito hiyāno dhārābhir akṣāḥ
Griffith: Onward hath Indu flowed in streams, impelled, surrounded by the wood.
pada pāṭha: pari | syaḥ | suvānaḥ | avyayam | rathe | na | varma | avyata || induḥ | abhi | druṇā | hitaḥ | hiyānaḥ | dhārābhiḥ | akṣāriti ||9.98.2||

IAST: pari ṣya suvāno akṣā indur avye madacyutaḥ
Griffith: Effused, this Indu hath flowed on, distilling rapture, to the fleece:
Devanāgarī: परि ष्य सुवानो अक्षा इन्दुरव्ये मदच्युतः
pada pāṭha: pari | syaḥ | suvānaḥ | akṣāriti | induḥ | avye | mada-cyutaḥ || dhārā | yaḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | adhvare | bhrājā | na | eti | gavya-yuḥ ||9.98.3||

IAST: dhārā ya ūrdhvo adhvare bhrājā naiti gavyayuḥ
Griffith: He goes erect, as seeking kine in stream, with light, to sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: धारा य ऊर्ध्वो अध्वरे भ्राजा नैति गव्ययुः
pada pāṭha: pari | syaḥ | suvānaḥ | akṣāriti | induḥ | avye | mada-cyutaḥ || dhārā | yaḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | adhvare | bhrājā | na | eti | gavya-yuḥ ||9.98.3||

IAST: sa hi tvaṁ deva śaśvate vasu martāya dāśuṣe
Griffith: For thou thyself, O Indu, God, to every mortal worshipper
Devanāgarī: स हि त्वं देव शश्वते वसु मर्ताय दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | tvam | deva | śaśvate | vasu | martāya | dāśuṣe || indo iti | sahasriṇam | rayim | śata-ātmānam | vivāsasi ||9.98.4||

IAST: indo sahasriṇaṁ rayiṁ śatātmānaṁ vivāsasi
Griffith: Attractest riches thousandfold, made manifest in hundred forms.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | tvam | deva | śaśvate | vasu | martāya | dāśuṣe || indo iti | sahasriṇam | rayim | śata-ātmānam | vivāsasi ||9.98.4||

IAST: vayaṁ te asya vṛtrahan vaso vasvaḥ puruspṛhaḥ
Griffith: Good Vrtra-slayer, may we be still nearest to this wealth of thine
Devanāgarī: वयं ते अस्य वृत्रहन्वसो वस्वः पुरुस्पृहः
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | asya | vr̥tra-han | vaso iti | vasvaḥ | puru-spr̥haḥ || ni | nediṣṭha-tamāḥ | iṣaḥ | syāma | sumnasya | adhrigo ityadhri-go ||9.98.5||

IAST: ni nediṣṭhatamā iṣaḥ syāma sumnasyādhrigo
Griffith: Which many crave, nearest to food and happiness, Resistless One!
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | asya | vr̥tra-han | vaso iti | vasvaḥ | puru-spr̥haḥ || ni | nediṣṭha-tamāḥ | iṣaḥ | syāma | sumnasya | adhrigo ityadhri-go ||9.98.5||

IAST: dvir yam pañca svayaśasaṁ svasāro adrisaṁhatam
Griffith: Whom, bright with native splendour, crushed between the pair of pressingstones-
pada pāṭha: dviḥ | yam | pañca | sva-yaśasam | svasāraḥ | adri-saṁhatam || priyam | indrasya | kāmyam | pra-snāpayanti | ūrmiṇam ||9.98.6||

IAST: priyam indrasya kāmyam prasnāpayanty ūrmiṇam
Griffith: The wavy Friend whom Indra loves-the twice-five sisters dip and bathe,
pada pāṭha: dviḥ | yam | pañca | sva-yaśasam | svasāraḥ | adri-saṁhatam || priyam | indrasya | kāmyam | pra-snāpayanti | ūrmiṇam ||9.98.6||

IAST: pari tyaṁ haryataṁ harim babhrum punanti vāreṇa
Griffith: Him with the fleece they purify, brown, golden-hued, beloved of all,
Devanāgarī: परि त्यं हर्यतं हरिं बभ्रुं पुनन्ति वारेण
pada pāṭha: pari | tyam | haryatam | harim | babhrum | punanti | vāreṇa || yaḥ | devān | viśvān | it | pari | madena | saha | gacchati ||9.98.7||

IAST: yo devān viśvām̐ it pari madena saha gacchati
Griffith: Who with exhilarating juice goes forth to all the Deities.
Devanāgarī: यो देवान्विश्वाँ इत्परि मदेन सह गच्छति
pada pāṭha: pari | tyam | haryatam | harim | babhrum | punanti | vāreṇa || yaḥ | devān | viśvān | it | pari | madena | saha | gacchati ||9.98.7||

IAST: asya vo hy avasā pānto dakṣasādhanam
Griffith: Through longing for this sap of yours ye drink what brings ability,
pada pāṭha: asya | vaḥ | hi | avasā | pāntaḥ | dakṣa-sādhanam || yaḥ | sūriṣu | śravaḥ | br̥hat | dadhe | svaḥ | na | haryataḥ ||9.98.8||

IAST: yaḥ sūriṣu śravo bṛhad dadhe svar ṇa haryataḥ
Griffith: Even him who, dear as heaven's own light, gives to our princes high renown.
Devanāgarī: यः सूरिषु श्रवो बृहद्दधे स्वर्ण हर्यतः
pada pāṭha: asya | vaḥ | hi | avasā | pāntaḥ | dakṣa-sādhanam || yaḥ | sūriṣu | śravaḥ | br̥hat | dadhe | svaḥ | na | haryataḥ ||9.98.8||

IAST: sa vāṁ yajñeṣu mānavī indur janiṣṭa rodasī
Griffith: Indu at holy rites produced you, Heaven and Earth, the Friends of men,
Devanāgarī: स वां यज्ञेषु मानवी इन्दुर्जनिष्ट रोदसी
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vām | yajñeṣu | mānavī iti | induḥ | janiṣṭa | rodasī iti || devaḥ | devī iti | giri-sthāḥ | asredhan | tam | tuvi-svani ||9.98.9||

IAST: devo devī giriṣṭhā asredhan taṁ tuviṣvaṇi
Griffith: Hill-haunting God the Goddesses. They bruised him where the roar was loud.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vām | yajñeṣu | mānavī iti | induḥ | janiṣṭa | rodasī iti || devaḥ | devī iti | giri-sthāḥ | asredhan | tam | tuvi-svani ||9.98.9||

IAST: indrāya soma pātave vṛtraghne pari ṣicyase
Griffith: For Vrtra-slaying Indra, thou, Soma, art poured that he may drink,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय सोम पातवे वृत्रघ्ने परि षिच्यसे
pada pāṭha: indrāya | soma | pātave | vr̥tra-ghne | pari | sicyase || nare | ca | dakṣiṇā-vate | devāya | sadana-sade ||9.98.10||

IAST: nare ca dakṣiṇāvate devāya sadanāsade
Griffith: Poured for the guerdon-giving man, poured for the God who sitteth there.
pada pāṭha: indrāya | soma | pātave | vr̥tra-ghne | pari | sicyase || nare | ca | dakṣiṇā-vate | devāya | sadana-sade ||9.98.10||

IAST: te pratnāso vyuṣṭiṣu somāḥ pavitre akṣaran
Griffith: These ancient Somas, at the break of day, have flowed into the sieve,
Devanāgarī: ते प्रत्नासो व्युष्टिषु सोमाः पवित्रे अक्षरन्
pada pāṭha: te | pratnāsaḥ | vi-uṣṭiṣu | somāḥ | pavitre | akṣaran || apa-prothantaḥ | sanutaḥ | huraḥ-citaḥ | prātariti | tān | apra-cetasaḥ ||9.98.11||

IAST: apaprothantaḥ sanutar huraścitaḥ prātas tām̐ apracetasaḥ
Griffith: Snorting away at early morn these foolish evil-hearted ones.
pada pāṭha: te | pratnāsaḥ | vi-uṣṭiṣu | somāḥ | pavitre | akṣaran || apa-prothantaḥ | sanutaḥ | huraḥ-citaḥ | prātariti | tān | apra-cetasaḥ ||9.98.11||

IAST: taṁ sakhāyaḥ purorucaṁ yūyaṁ vayaṁ ca sūrayaḥ
Griffith: Friends, may the princes, ye and we, obtain this Most Resplendent One.
Devanāgarī: तं सखायः पुरोरुचं यूयं वयं च सूरयः
pada pāṭha: tam | sakhāyaḥ | puraḥ-rucam | yūyam | vayam | ca | sūrayaḥ || aśyāma | vāja-gandhyam | sanema | vāja-pastyam ||9.98.12||

IAST: aśyāma vājagandhyaṁ sanema vājapastyam
Griffith: Gain him who hath the smell of strength, win him whose home is very strength.
pada pāṭha: tam | sakhāyaḥ | puraḥ-rucam | yūyam | vayam | ca | sūrayaḥ || aśyāma | vāja-gandhyam | sanema | vāja-pastyam ||9.98.12||

IAST: ā haryatāya dhṛṣṇave dhanus tanvanti pauṁsyam
Griffith: THEY for the Bold and Lovely One ply manly vigour like a bow:
pada pāṭha: ā | haryatāya | dhr̥ṣṇave | dhanuḥ | tanvanti | pauṁsyam || śukrām | vayanti | asurāya | niḥ-nijam | vipām | agre | mahīyuvaḥ ||9.99.1||

IAST: śukrāṁ vayanty asurāya nirṇijaṁ vipām agre mahīyuvaḥ
Griffith: joyous, in front of songs they weave bright raiment for the Lord Divine.
pada pāṭha: ā | haryatāya | dhr̥ṣṇave | dhanuḥ | tanvanti | pauṁsyam || śukrām | vayanti | asurāya | niḥ-nijam | vipām | agre | mahīyuvaḥ ||9.99.1||

IAST: adha kṣapā pariṣkṛto vājām̐ abhi pra gāhate
Griffith: And he, made beautiful by night, dips forward into strengthening food',
Devanāgarī: अध क्षपा परिष्कृतो वाजाँ अभि प्र गाहते
pada pāṭha: adha | kṣapā | pari-kr̥taḥ | vājān | abhi | pra | gāhate || yadi | vivasvataḥ | dhiyaḥ | harim | hinvanti | yātave ||9.99.2||

IAST: yadī vivasvato dhiyo hariṁ hinvanti yātave
Griffith: What time the sacrificer's thoughts speed on his way the Golden-hued.
Devanāgarī: यदी विवस्वतो धियो हरिं हिन्वन्ति यातवे
pada pāṭha: adha | kṣapā | pari-kr̥taḥ | vājān | abhi | pra | gāhate || yadi | vivasvataḥ | dhiyaḥ | harim | hinvanti | yātave ||9.99.2||

IAST: tam asya marjayāmasi mado ya indrapātamaḥ
Griffith: We cleanse this gladdening drink of his the juice which Indra chiefly drinks---
pada pāṭha: tam | asya | marjayāmasi | madaḥ | yaḥ | indra-pātamaḥ || yam | gāvaḥ | āsa-bhiḥ | dadhuḥ | purā | nūnam | ca | sūrayaḥ ||9.99.3||

IAST: yaṁ gāva āsabhir dadhuḥ purā nūnaṁ ca sūrayaḥ
Griffith: That which kine took into their mouths, of old, and princes take it now.
Devanāgarī: यं गाव आसभिर्दधुः पुरा नूनं च सूरयः
pada pāṭha: tam | asya | marjayāmasi | madaḥ | yaḥ | indra-pātamaḥ || yam | gāvaḥ | āsa-bhiḥ | dadhuḥ | purā | nūnam | ca | sūrayaḥ ||9.99.3||

IAST: taṁ gāthayā purāṇyā punānam abhy anūṣata
Griffith: To him, while purifying, they have raised the ancient psalm of praise:
pada pāṭha: tam | gāthayā | purāṇyā | punānam | abhi | anūṣata || uto iti | kr̥panta | dhītayaḥ | devānām | nāma | bibhratīḥ ||9.99.4||

IAST: uto kṛpanta dhītayo devānāṁ nāma bibhratīḥ
Griffith: And sacred songs which bear the names of Gods have supplicated him.
Devanāgarī: उतो कृपन्त धीतयो देवानां नाम बिभ्रतीः
pada pāṭha: tam | gāthayā | purāṇyā | punānam | abhi | anūṣata || uto iti | kr̥panta | dhītayaḥ | devānām | nāma | bibhratīḥ ||9.99.4||

IAST: tam ukṣamāṇam avyaye vāre punanti dharṇasim
Griffith: They purify him as he drops, courageous, in the fleecy sieve.
pada pāṭha: tam | ukṣamāṇam | avyaye | vāre | punanti | dharṇasim || dūtam | na | pūrva-cittaye | ā | śāsate | manīṣiṇaḥ ||9.99.5||

IAST: dūtaṁ na pūrvacittaya ā śāsate manīṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: Him they instruct as messenger to bear the sage's morning prayer.
Devanāgarī: दूतं न पूर्वचित्तय आ शासते मनीषिणः
pada pāṭha: tam | ukṣamāṇam | avyaye | vāre | punanti | dharṇasim || dūtam | na | pūrva-cittaye | ā | śāsate | manīṣiṇaḥ ||9.99.5||

IAST: sa punāno madintamaḥ somaś camūṣu sīdati
Griffith: Soma, best Cheerer, takes his seat, the while they cleanse him in the bowls.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | punānaḥ | madin-tamaḥ | somaḥ | camūṣu | sīdati || paśau | na | retaḥ | ā-dadhat | patiḥ | vacasyate | dhiyaḥ ||9.99.6||

IAST: paśau na reta ādadhat patir vacasyate dhiyaḥ
Griffith: He as it were impregns the cow, and babbles on, the Lord of Song.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | punānaḥ | madin-tamaḥ | somaḥ | camūṣu | sīdati || paśau | na | retaḥ | ā-dadhat | patiḥ | vacasyate | dhiyaḥ ||9.99.6||

IAST: sa mṛjyate sukarmabhir devo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
Griffith: He is effused and beautified, a God for Gods, by skilful men.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mr̥jyate | sukarma-bhiḥ | devaḥ | devebhyaḥ | sutaḥ || vide | yat | āsu | sam-dadiḥ | mahīḥ | apaḥ | vi | gāhate ||9.99.7||

IAST: vide yad āsu saṁdadir mahīr apo vi gāhate
Griffith: He penetrates the mighty floods collecting all he knows therein.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mr̥jyate | sukarma-bhiḥ | devaḥ | devebhyaḥ | sutaḥ || vide | yat | āsu | sam-dadiḥ | mahīḥ | apaḥ | vi | gāhate ||9.99.7||

IAST: suta indo pavitra ā nṛbhir yato vi nīyase
Griffith: Pressed, Indu, guided by the men, thou art led to the cleaning sieve.
Devanāgarī: सुत इन्दो पवित्र आ नृभिर्यतो वि नीयसे
pada pāṭha: sutaḥ | indo iti | pavitre | ā | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | vi | nīyase || indrāya | matsarin-tamaḥ | camūṣu | ā | ni | sīdasi ||9.99.8||

IAST: indrāya matsarintamaś camūṣv ā ni ṣīdasi
Griffith: Thou, yielding Indra highest joy, takest thy seat within the bowls.
pada pāṭha: sutaḥ | indo iti | pavitre | ā | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | vi | nīyase || indrāya | matsarin-tamaḥ | camūṣu | ā | ni | sīdasi ||9.99.8||

IAST: abhī navante adruhaḥ priyam indrasya kāmyam
Griffith: I. THE Guileless Ones are singing praise to Indra's well beloved Friend,
pada pāṭha: abhi | navante | adruhaḥ | priyam | indrasya | kāmyam || vatsam | na | pūrve | āyuni | jātam | rihanti | mātaraḥ ||9.100.1||

IAST: vatsaṁ na pūrva āyuni jātaṁ rihanti mātaraḥ
Griffith: As, in the morning of its life, the mothers lick the new-born calf.
Devanāgarī: वत्सं न पूर्व आयुनि जातं रिहन्ति मातरः
pada pāṭha: abhi | navante | adruhaḥ | priyam | indrasya | kāmyam || vatsam | na | pūrve | āyuni | jātam | rihanti | mātaraḥ ||9.100.1||

IAST: punāna indav ā bhara soma dvibarhasaṁ rayim
Griffith: O Indu, while they cleanse thee bring, O Soma, doubly-waxing wealth
Devanāgarī: पुनान इन्दवा भर सोम द्विबर्हसं रयिम्
pada pāṭha: punānaḥ | indo iti | ā | bhara | soma | dvi-barhasam | rayim || tvam | vasūni | puṣyasi | viśvāni | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he ||9.100.2||

IAST: tvaṁ vasūni puṣyasi viśvāni dāśuṣo gṛhe
Griffith: Thou in the worshipper's abode causest all treasures to increase.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वसूनि पुष्यसि विश्वानि दाशुषो गृहे
pada pāṭha: punānaḥ | indo iti | ā | bhara | soma | dvi-barhasam | rayim || tvam | vasūni | puṣyasi | viśvāni | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he ||9.100.2||

IAST: tvaṁ dhiyam manoyujaṁ sṛjā vṛṣṭiṁ na tanyatuḥ
Griffith: Set free the. song which mind hath yoked, even as thunder frees the rain:
Devanāgarī: त्वं धियं मनोयुजं सृजा वृष्टिं न तन्यतुः
pada pāṭha: tvam | dhiyam | manaḥ-yujam | sr̥ja | vr̥ṣṭim | na | tanyatuḥ || tvam | vasūni | pārthivā | divyā | ca | soma | puṣyasi ||9.100.3||

IAST: tvaṁ vasūni pārthivā divyā ca soma puṣyasi
Griffith: All treasures of the earth and heaven, O Soma, thou dost multiply.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वसूनि पार्थिवा दिव्या च सोम पुष्यसि
pada pāṭha: tvam | dhiyam | manaḥ-yujam | sr̥ja | vr̥ṣṭim | na | tanyatuḥ || tvam | vasūni | pārthivā | divyā | ca | soma | puṣyasi ||9.100.3||

IAST: pari te jigyuṣo yathā dhārā sutasya dhāvati
Griffith: Thy stream when thou art pressed runs on like some victorious warrior's steed
Devanāgarī: परि ते जिग्युषो यथा धारा सुतस्य धावति
pada pāṭha: pari | te | jigyuṣaḥ | yathā | dhārā | sutasya | dhāvati || raṁhamāṇā | vi | avyayam | vāram | vājī-iva | sānasiḥ ||9.100.4||

IAST: raṁhamāṇā vy avyayaṁ vāraṁ vājīva sānasiḥ
Griffith: Hastening onward through the fleece like a fierce horse who wins the prize.
pada pāṭha: pari | te | jigyuṣaḥ | yathā | dhārā | sutasya | dhāvati || raṁhamāṇā | vi | avyayam | vāram | vājī-iva | sānasiḥ ||9.100.4||

IAST: kratve dakṣāya naḥ kave pavasva soma dhārayā
Griffith: Flow on, Sage Soma, with thy stream to give us mental power and strength,
Devanāgarī: क्रत्वे दक्षाय नः कवे पवस्व सोम धारया
pada pāṭha: kratve | dakṣāya | naḥ | kave | pavasva | soma | dhārayā || indrāya | pātave | sutaḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | ca ||9.100.5||

IAST: indrāya pātave suto mitrāya varuṇāya ca
Griffith: Effused for Indra, for his drink, for Mitra and for Varuna.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय पातवे सुतो मित्राय वरुणाय च
pada pāṭha: kratve | dakṣāya | naḥ | kave | pavasva | soma | dhārayā || indrāya | pātave | sutaḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | ca ||9.100.5||

IAST: pavasva vājasātamaḥ pavitre dhārayā sutaḥ
Griffith: Flow to the filter with thy stream, effused, best winner, thou, of spoil,
pada pāṭha: pavasva | vāja-sātamaḥ | pavitre | dhārayā | sutaḥ || indrāya | soma | viṣṇave | devebhyaḥ | madhumat-tamaḥ ||9.100.6||

IAST: indrāya soma viṣṇave devebhyo madhumattamaḥ
Griffith: O Soma, as most rich in sweets for Indra, Visnu, and the Gods.
pada pāṭha: pavasva | vāja-sātamaḥ | pavitre | dhārayā | sutaḥ || indrāya | soma | viṣṇave | devebhyaḥ | madhumat-tamaḥ ||9.100.6||

IAST: tvāṁ rihanti mātaro harim pavitre adruhaḥ
Griffith: The mothers, void of guiles, caress thee Golden-coloured, in the sieve,
Devanāgarī: त्वां रिहन्ति मातरो हरिं पवित्रे अद्रुहः
pada pāṭha: tvām | rihanti | mātaraḥ | harim | pavitre | adruhaḥ || vatsam | jātam | na | dhenavaḥ | pavamāna | vi-dharmaṇi ||9.100.7||

IAST: vatsaṁ jātaṁ na dhenavaḥ pavamāna vidharmaṇi
Griffith: As cows, O Pavamana, lick the new-born calf, as Law commands.
Devanāgarī: वत्सं जातं न धेनवः पवमान विधर्मणि
pada pāṭha: tvām | rihanti | mātaraḥ | harim | pavitre | adruhaḥ || vatsam | jātam | na | dhenavaḥ | pavamāna | vi-dharmaṇi ||9.100.7||

IAST: pavamāna mahi śravaś citrebhir yāsi raśmibhiḥ
Griffith: Thou, Pavamana, movest on with wondrous rays to great renown.
pada pāṭha: pavamāna | mahi | śravaḥ | citrebhiḥ | yāsi | raśmi-bhiḥ || śardhan | tamāṁsi | jighnase | viśvāni | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he ||9.100.8||

IAST: śardhan tamāṁsi jighnase viśvāni dāśuṣo gṛhe
Griffith: Striving within the votary's house thou drivest all the glooms away.
pada pāṭha: pavamāna | mahi | śravaḥ | citrebhiḥ | yāsi | raśmi-bhiḥ || śardhan | tamāṁsi | jighnase | viśvāni | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he ||9.100.8||

IAST: tvaṁ dyāṁ ca mahivrata pṛthivīṁ cāti jabhriṣe
Griffith: Lord of great sway, thou liftest thee above the heavens, above the earth.
Devanāgarī: त्वं द्यां च महिव्रत पृथिवीं चाति जभ्रिषे
pada pāṭha: tvam | dyām | ca | mahi-vrata | pr̥thivīm | ca | ati | jabhriṣe || prati | drāpim | amuñcathāḥ | pavamāna | mahi-tvanā ||9.100.9||

IAST: prati drāpim amuñcathāḥ pavamāna mahitvanā
Griffith: Thou, Pavamana hast assumed thy coat of mail in majesty.
pada pāṭha: tvam | dyām | ca | mahi-vrata | pr̥thivīm | ca | ati | jabhriṣe || prati | drāpim | amuñcathāḥ | pavamāna | mahi-tvanā ||9.100.9||

IAST: purojitī vo andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave
Griffith: FOR first possession of your juice, for the exhilarating drink,
pada pāṭha: puraḥ-jitī | vaḥ | andhasaḥ | sutāya | mādayitnave || apa | śvānam | śnathiṣṭana | sakhāyaḥ | dīrgha-jihvyam ||9.101.1||

IAST: apa śvānaṁ śnathiṣṭana sakhāyo dīrghajihvyam
Griffith: Drive ye away the dog, my friends, drive ye the long-tongued dog away.
pada pāṭha: puraḥ-jitī | vaḥ | andhasaḥ | sutāya | mādayitnave || apa | śvānam | śnathiṣṭana | sakhāyaḥ | dīrgha-jihvyam ||9.101.1||

IAST: yo dhārayā pāvakayā pariprasyandate sutaḥ
Griffith: He who with purifying stream, effused, comes flowing hitherward,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dhārayā | pāvakayā | pari-prasyandate | sutaḥ || induḥ | aśvaḥ | na | kr̥tvyaḥ ||9.101.2||

IAST: indur aśvo na kṛtvyaḥ
Griffith: Indu, is like an able steed.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dhārayā | pāvakayā | pari-prasyandate | sutaḥ || induḥ | aśvaḥ | na | kr̥tvyaḥ ||9.101.2||

IAST: taṁ duroṣam abhī naraḥ somaṁ viśvācyā dhiyā
Griffith: The men with all-pervading song send unassailable Soma forth,
Devanāgarī: तं दुरोषमभी नरः सोमं विश्वाच्या धिया
pada pāṭha: tam | duroṣam | abhi | naraḥ | somam | viśvācyā | dhiyā || yajñam | hinvanti | adri-bhiḥ ||9.101.3||

IAST: yajñaṁ hinvanty adribhiḥ
Griffith: By pressing-stones, to sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: tam | duroṣam | abhi | naraḥ | somam | viśvācyā | dhiyā || yajñam | hinvanti | adri-bhiḥ ||9.101.3||

IAST: sutāso madhumattamāḥ somā indrāya mandinaḥ
Griffith: The Somas, very rich in sweets, for which the sieve is destined, flow,
pada pāṭha: sutāsaḥ | madhumat-tamāḥ | somāḥ | indrāya | mandinaḥ || pavitra-vantaḥ | akṣaran | devān | gacchantu | vaḥ | madāḥ ||9.101.4||

IAST: pavitravanto akṣaran devān gacchantu vo madāḥ
Griffith: Effused, the source of Indra's joy: may your strong juices reach the Gods.
pada pāṭha: sutāsaḥ | madhumat-tamāḥ | somāḥ | indrāya | mandinaḥ || pavitra-vantaḥ | akṣaran | devān | gacchantu | vaḥ | madāḥ ||9.101.4||

IAST: indur indrāya pavata iti devāso abruvan
Griffith: Indu flows on for Indra's sake: thus have the Deities declared.
pada pāṭha: induḥ | indrāya | pavate | iti | devāsaḥ | abruvan || vācaḥ | patiḥ | makhasyate | viśvasya | īśānaḥ | ojasā ||9.101.5||

IAST: vācas patir makhasyate viśvasyeśāna ojasā
Griffith: The Lord of Speech exerts himself, Ruler of all, because of might.
pada pāṭha: induḥ | indrāya | pavate | iti | devāsaḥ | abruvan || vācaḥ | patiḥ | makhasyate | viśvasya | īśānaḥ | ojasā ||9.101.5||

IAST: sahasradhāraḥ pavate samudro vācamīṅkhayaḥ
Griffith: Inciter of the voice of song, with thousand streams the ocean flows,
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāraḥ | pavate | samudraḥ | vācam-īṅkhayaḥ || somaḥ | patiḥ | rayīṇām | sakhā | indrasya | dive-dive ||9.101.6||

IAST: somaḥ patī rayīṇāṁ sakhendrasya dive-dive
Griffith: Even Soma, Lord of opulence, the Friend of Indra, day by day.
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāraḥ | pavate | samudraḥ | vācam-īṅkhayaḥ || somaḥ | patiḥ | rayīṇām | sakhā | indrasya | dive-dive ||9.101.6||

IAST: ayam pūṣā rayir bhagaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati
Griffith: As Pusan, Fortune, Bhaga, comes this Soma while they make him pure.
Devanāgarī: अयं पूषा रयिर्भगः सोमः पुनानो अर्षति
pada pāṭha: ayam | pūṣā | rayiḥ | bhagaḥ | somaḥ | punānaḥ | arṣati || patiḥ | viśvasya | bhūmanaḥ | vi | akhyat | rodasī iti | ubhe iti ||9.101.7||

IAST: patir viśvasya bhūmano vy akhyad rodasī ubhe
Griffith: He, Lord of the multitude, hath looked upon the earth and heaven.
pada pāṭha: ayam | pūṣā | rayiḥ | bhagaḥ | somaḥ | punānaḥ | arṣati || patiḥ | viśvasya | bhūmanaḥ | vi | akhyat | rodasī iti | ubhe iti ||9.101.7||

IAST: sam u priyā anūṣata gāvo madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ
Griffith: The dear cows lowed in joyful mood together to the gladdening drink.
Devanāgarī: समु प्रिया अनूषत गावो मदाय घृष्वयः
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | priyāḥ | anūṣata | gāvaḥ | madāya | ghr̥ṣvayaḥ || somāsaḥ | kr̥ṇvate | pathaḥ | pavamānāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||9.101.8||

IAST: somāsaḥ kṛṇvate pathaḥ pavamānāsa indavaḥ
Griffith: The drops as they were purified, the Soma juices, made then paths.
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | priyāḥ | anūṣata | gāvaḥ | madāya | ghr̥ṣvayaḥ || somāsaḥ | kr̥ṇvate | pathaḥ | pavamānāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||9.101.8||

IAST: ya ojiṣṭhas tam ā bhara pavamāna śravāyyam
Griffith: O Pavamana, bring the juice, the mightiest, worthy to be famed,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ojiṣṭhaḥ | tam | ā | bhara | pavamāna | śravāyyam || yaḥ | pañca | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi | rayim | yena | vanāmahai ||9.101.9||

IAST: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīr abhi rayiṁ yena vanāmahai
Griffith: Which the Five Tribes have over them, whereby we may win opulence.
Devanāgarī: यः पञ्च चर्षणीरभि रयिं येन वनामहै
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ojiṣṭhaḥ | tam | ā | bhara | pavamāna | śravāyyam || yaḥ | pañca | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi | rayim | yena | vanāmahai ||9.101.9||

IAST: somāḥ pavanta indavo 'smabhyaṁ gātuvittamāḥ
Griffith: For us the Soma juices flow, the drops best furtherers of our weal,
pada pāṭha: somāḥ | pavante | indavaḥ | asmabhyam | gātuvit-tamāḥ || mitrāḥ | suvānāḥ | arepasaḥ | su-ādhyaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ ||9.101.10||

IAST: mitrāḥ suvānā arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svarvidaḥ
Griffith: Effused as friends without a spot, benevolent, finders of the light.
pada pāṭha: somāḥ | pavante | indavaḥ | asmabhyam | gātuvit-tamāḥ || mitrāḥ | suvānāḥ | arepasaḥ | su-ādhyaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ ||9.101.10||

IAST: suṣvāṇāso vy adribhiś citānā gor adhi tvaci
Griffith: Effused by means of pressing-stones, upon the ox-hide visible,
pada pāṭha: susvāṇāsaḥ | vi | adri-bhiḥ | citānāḥ | goḥ | adhi | tvaci || iṣam | asmabhyam | abhitaḥ | sam | asvaran | vasu-vidaḥ ||9.101.11||

IAST: iṣam asmabhyam abhitaḥ sam asvaran vasuvidaḥ
Griffith: They, treasure-finders, have announced food unto us from every side.
pada pāṭha: susvāṇāsaḥ | vi | adri-bhiḥ | citānāḥ | goḥ | adhi | tvaci || iṣam | asmabhyam | abhitaḥ | sam | asvaran | vasu-vidaḥ ||9.101.11||

IAST: ete pūtā vipaścitaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ
Griffith: Tlese Soma juices, skilled in song, purified, blent with milk and curd,
pada pāṭha: ete | pūtāḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ | somāsaḥ | dadhi-āśiraḥ || sūryāsaḥ | na | darśatāsaḥ | jigatnavaḥ | dhruvāḥ | ghr̥te ||9.101.12||

IAST: sūryāso na darśatāso jigatnavo dhruvā ghṛte
Griffith: When moving and when firmly laid in oil, resemble lovely Suns.
Devanāgarī: सूर्यासो न दर्शतासो जिगत्नवो ध्रुवा घृते
pada pāṭha: ete | pūtāḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ | somāsaḥ | dadhi-āśiraḥ || sūryāsaḥ | na | darśatāsaḥ | jigatnavaḥ | dhruvāḥ | ghr̥te ||9.101.12||

IAST: pra sunvānasyāndhaso marto na vṛta tad vacaḥ
Griffith: Let not the power of men restrain the voice of the outpouring juice:
Devanāgarī: प्र सुन्वानस्यान्धसो मर्तो न वृत तद्वचः
pada pāṭha: pra | sunvānasya | andhasaḥ | martaḥ | na | vr̥ta | tat | vacaḥ || apa | śvānam | arādhasam | hata | makham | na | bhr̥gavaḥ ||9.101.13||

IAST: apa śvānam arādhasaṁ hatā makhaṁ na bhṛgavaḥ
Griffith: As Bhrgu's sons chased Makha, so drive ye the greedy hound away.
Devanāgarī: अप श्वानमराधसं हता मखं न भृगवः
pada pāṭha: pra | sunvānasya | andhasaḥ | martaḥ | na | vr̥ta | tat | vacaḥ || apa | śvānam | arādhasam | hata | makham | na | bhr̥gavaḥ ||9.101.13||

IAST: ā jāmir atke avyata bhuje na putra oṇyoḥ
Griffith: The Friend hath wrapped him in his robe, as in his parents arms, a son.
Devanāgarī: आ जामिरत्के अव्यत भुजे न पुत्र ओण्योः
pada pāṭha: ā | jāmiḥ | atke | avyata | bhuje | na | putraḥ | oṇyoḥ || sarat | jāraḥ | na | yoṣaṇām | varaḥ | na | yonim | ā-sadam ||9.101.14||

IAST: saraj jāro na yoṣaṇāṁ varo na yonim āsadam
Griffith: He went, as lover to a dame, to take his station suitor-like.
Devanāgarī: सरज्जारो न योषणां वरो न योनिमासदम्
pada pāṭha: ā | jāmiḥ | atke | avyata | bhuje | na | putraḥ | oṇyoḥ || sarat | jāraḥ | na | yoṣaṇām | varaḥ | na | yonim | ā-sadam ||9.101.14||

IAST: sa vīro dakṣasādhano vi yas tastambha rodasī
Griffith: That Hero who produces strength, he who hath propped both worlds apart,
Devanāgarī: स वीरो दक्षसाधनो वि यस्तस्तम्भ रोदसी
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vīraḥ | dakṣa-sādhanaḥ | vi | yaḥ | tastambha | rodasī iti || hariḥ | pavitre | avyata | vedhāḥ | na | yonim | ā-sadam ||9.101.15||

IAST: hariḥ pavitre avyata vedhā na yonim āsadam
Griffith: Gold-hued, hath wrapped him in the sieve, to settle, priest-like, in his place.
Devanāgarī: हरिः पवित्रे अव्यत वेधा न योनिमासदम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vīraḥ | dakṣa-sādhanaḥ | vi | yaḥ | tastambha | rodasī iti || hariḥ | pavitre | avyata | vedhāḥ | na | yonim | ā-sadam ||9.101.15||

IAST: avyo vārebhiḥ pavate somo gavye adhi tvaci
Griffith: Soma upon the ox's skin through the sheep's wool flows purified.
Devanāgarī: अव्यो वारेभिः पवते सोमो गव्ये अधि त्वचि
pada pāṭha: avyaḥ | vārebhiḥ | pavate | somaḥ | gavye | adhi | tvaci || kanikradat | vr̥ṣā | hariḥ | indrasya | abhi | eti | niḥ-kr̥tam ||9.101.16||

IAST: kanikradad vṛṣā harir indrasyābhy eti niṣkṛtam
Griffith: Bellowing out, the Tawny Steer goes on to Indra's special place.
pada pāṭha: avyaḥ | vārebhiḥ | pavate | somaḥ | gavye | adhi | tvaci || kanikradat | vr̥ṣā | hariḥ | indrasya | abhi | eti | niḥ-kr̥tam ||9.101.16||

IAST: krāṇā śiśur mahīnāṁ hinvann ṛtasya dīdhitim
Griffith: THE Child, when blended with the streams, speeding the plan of sacrifice,
pada pāṭha: krāṇā | śiśuḥ | mahīnām | hinvan | r̥tasya | dīdhitim || viśvā | pari | priyā | bhuvat | adha | dvitā ||9.102.1||

IAST: viśvā pari priyā bhuvad adha dvitā
Griffith: Surpasses all things that are dear, yea, from of old.
pada pāṭha: krāṇā | śiśuḥ | mahīnām | hinvan | r̥tasya | dīdhitim || viśvā | pari | priyā | bhuvat | adha | dvitā ||9.102.1||

IAST: upa tritasya pāṣyor abhakta yad guhā padam
Griffith: The place, near the two pressing-stones of Trita, hath he occupied,
pada pāṭha: upa | tritasya | pāṣyoḥ | abhakta | yat | guhā | padam || yajñasya | sapta | dhāma-bhiḥ | adha | priyam ||9.102.2||

IAST: yajñasya sapta dhāmabhir adha priyam
Griffith: Secret and dear through seven lights of sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: upa | tritasya | pāṣyoḥ | abhakta | yat | guhā | padam || yajñasya | sapta | dhāma-bhiḥ | adha | priyam ||9.102.2||

IAST: trīṇi tritasya dhārayā pṛṣṭheṣv erayā rayim
Griffith: Urge to three courses, on the heights of Trita, riches in a stream.
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | tritasya | dhārayā | pr̥ṣṭheṣu | ā | īraya | rayim || mimīte | asya | yojanā | vi | su-kratuḥ ||9.102.3||

IAST: mimīte asya yojanā vi sukratuḥ
Griffith: He who is passing wise measures his courses out.
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | tritasya | dhārayā | pr̥ṣṭheṣu | ā | īraya | rayim || mimīte | asya | yojanā | vi | su-kratuḥ ||9.102.3||

IAST: jajñānaṁ sapta mātaro vedhām aśāsata śriye
Griffith: Even at his birth the Mothers Seven taught him, for glory, like a sage,
pada pāṭha: jajñānam | sapta | mātaraḥ | vedhām | aśāsata | śriye || ayam | dhruvaḥ | rayīṇām | ciketa | yat ||9.102.4||

IAST: ayaṁ dhruvo rayīṇāṁ ciketa yat
Griffith: So that he, firm and sure, hath set his mind on wealth.
pada pāṭha: jajñānam | sapta | mātaraḥ | vedhām | aśāsata | śriye || ayam | dhruvaḥ | rayīṇām | ciketa | yat ||9.102.4||

IAST: asya vrate sajoṣaso viśve devāso adruhaḥ
Griffith: Under his sway, of one accord, are all the guileless Deities:
Devanāgarī: अस्य व्रते सजोषसो विश्वे देवासो अद्रुहः
pada pāṭha: asya | vrate | sa-joṣasaḥ | viśve | devāsaḥ | adruhaḥ || spārhāḥ | bhavanti | rantayaḥ | juṣanta | yat ||9.102.5||

IAST: spārhā bhavanti rantayo juṣanta yat
Griffith: Warriors to be envied, they, when they are pleased.
pada pāṭha: asya | vrate | sa-joṣasaḥ | viśve | devāsaḥ | adruhaḥ || spārhāḥ | bhavanti | rantayaḥ | juṣanta | yat ||9.102.5||

IAST: yam ī garbham ṛtāvṛdho dṛśe cārum ajījanan
Griffith: The Babe whom they who strengthen Law have generated fair to see,
pada pāṭha: yam | īmiti | garbham | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | dr̥śe | cārum | ajījanan || kavim | maṁhiṣṭham | adhvare | puru-spr̥ham ||9.102.6||

IAST: kavim maṁhiṣṭham adhvare puruspṛham
Griffith: Much longed for at the sacrifice, most liberal Sage,-
pada pāṭha: yam | īmiti | garbham | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | dr̥śe | cārum | ajījanan || kavim | maṁhiṣṭham | adhvare | puru-spr̥ham ||9.102.6||

IAST: samīcīne abhi tmanā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
Griffith: To him, united, of themselves, come the young Parents of the rite,
Devanāgarī: समीचीने अभि त्मना यह्वी ऋतस्य मातरा
pada pāṭha: samīcīne iti sam-īcīne | abhi | tmanā | yahvī iti | r̥tasya | mātarā || tanvānāḥ | yajñam | ānuṣak | yat | añjate ||9.102.7||

IAST: tanvānā yajñam ānuṣag yad añjate
Griffith: When they adorn him, duly weaving sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: samīcīne iti sam-īcīne | abhi | tmanā | yahvī iti | r̥tasya | mātarā || tanvānāḥ | yajñam | ānuṣak | yat | añjate ||9.102.7||

IAST: kratvā śukrebhir akṣabhir ṛṇor apa vrajaṁ divaḥ
Griffith: With wisdom and with radiant eyes unbar to us the stall of heaven,
pada pāṭha: kratvā | śukrebhiḥ | akṣa-bhiḥ | r̥ṇoḥ | apa | vrajam | divaḥ || hinvan | r̥tasya | dīditim | pra | adhvare ||9.102.8||

IAST: hinvann ṛtasya dīdhitim prādhvare
Griffith: Speeding at solemn rite the plan of Holy Law.
pada pāṭha: kratvā | śukrebhiḥ | akṣa-bhiḥ | r̥ṇoḥ | apa | vrajam | divaḥ || hinvan | r̥tasya | dīditim | pra | adhvare ||9.102.8||

IAST: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vaca udyatam
Griffith: To Soma who is purified as ordering Priest the song is raised:
Devanāgarī: प्र पुनानाय वेधसे सोमाय वच उद्यतम्
pada pāṭha: pra | punānāya | vedhase | somāya | vacaḥ | ut-yatam || bhr̥tim | na | bhara | mati-bhiḥ | jujoṣate ||9.103.1||

IAST: bhṛtiṁ na bharā matibhir jujoṣate
Griffith: Bring meed, as 'twere, to one who makes thee glad with hymns.
pada pāṭha: pra | punānāya | vedhase | somāya | vacaḥ | ut-yatam || bhr̥tim | na | bhara | mati-bhiḥ | jujoṣate ||9.103.1||

IAST: pari vārāṇy avyayā gobhir añjāno arṣati
Griffith: Blended with milk and curds he flows on through the long wool of the sheep.
pada pāṭha: pari | vārāṇi | avyayā | gobhiḥ | añjānaḥ | arṣati || trī | sadha-sthā | punānaḥ | kr̥ṇute | hariḥ ||9.103.2||

IAST: trī ṣadhasthā punānaḥ kṛṇute hariḥ
Griffith: The Gold-hued, purified, makes him three seats for rest.
pada pāṭha: pari | vārāṇi | avyayā | gobhiḥ | añjānaḥ | arṣati || trī | sadha-sthā | punānaḥ | kr̥ṇute | hariḥ ||9.103.2||

IAST: pari kośam madhuścutam avyaye vāre arṣati
Griffith: On through the long wool of the sheep to the meath-dropping vat he flows:
pada pāṭha: pari | kośam | madhu-ścutam | avyaye | vāre | arṣati || abhi | vāṇīḥ | r̥ṣīṇām | sapta | nūṣata ||9.103.3||

IAST: abhi vāṇīr ṛṣīṇāṁ sapta nūṣata
Griffith: The Rsis' sevenfold quire hath sung aloud to him.
pada pāṭha: pari | kośam | madhu-ścutam | avyaye | vāre | arṣati || abhi | vāṇīḥ | r̥ṣīṇām | sapta | nūṣata ||9.103.3||

IAST: pari ṇetā matīnāṁ viśvadevo adābhyaḥ
Griffith: Shared by all Gods, Infallible, the Leader of our holy hymns,
pada pāṭha: pari | netā | matīnām | viśva-devaḥ | adābhyaḥ || somaḥ | punānaḥ | camvoḥ | viśat | hariḥ ||9.103.4||

IAST: somaḥ punānaś camvor viśad dhariḥ
Griffith: Golden-hued Soma, being cleansed, hath reached the bowls.
pada pāṭha: pari | netā | matīnām | viśva-devaḥ | adābhyaḥ || somaḥ | punānaḥ | camvoḥ | viśat | hariḥ ||9.103.4||

IAST: pari daivīr anu svadhā indreṇa yāhi saratham
Griffith: After thy Godlike qualities, associate with Indra, go,
Devanāgarī: परि दैवीरनु स्वधा इन्द्रेण याहि सरथम्
pada pāṭha: pari | daivīḥ | anu | svadhāḥ | indreṇa | yāhi | sa-ratham || punānaḥ | vāghat | vāghat-bhiḥ | amartyaḥ ||9.103.5||

IAST: punāno vāghad vāghadbhir amartyaḥ
Griffith: As a Priest purified by priests, Immortal One.
pada pāṭha: pari | daivīḥ | anu | svadhāḥ | indreṇa | yāhi | sa-ratham || punānaḥ | vāghat | vāghat-bhiḥ | amartyaḥ ||9.103.5||

IAST: pari saptir na vājayur devo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
Griffith: Like a car-horse who shows his strength, a God effused for Deities.
pada pāṭha: pari | saptiḥ | na | vāja-yuḥ | devaḥ | devebhyaḥ | sutaḥ || vi-ānaśiḥ | pavamānaḥ | vi | dhāvati ||9.103.6||

IAST: vyānaśiḥ pavamāno vi dhāvati
Griffith: The penetrating Pavamana flows along.
pada pāṭha: pari | saptiḥ | na | vāja-yuḥ | devaḥ | devebhyaḥ | sutaḥ || vi-ānaśiḥ | pavamānaḥ | vi | dhāvati ||9.103.6||

IAST: sakhāya ā ni ṣīdata punānāya pra gāyata
Griffith: SIT down, O friends, and sing aloud to him who purifies himself:
Devanāgarī: सखाय आ नि षीदत पुनानाय प्र गायत
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | ā | ni | sīdata | punānāya | pra | gāyata || śiśum | na | yajñaiḥ | pari | bhūṣata | śriye ||9.104.1||

IAST: śiśuṁ na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye
Griffith: Deck him for glory, like a child, with holy rites.
Devanāgarī: शिशुं न यज्ञैः परि भूषत श्रिये
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | ā | ni | sīdata | punānāya | pra | gāyata || śiśum | na | yajñaiḥ | pari | bhūṣata | śriye ||9.104.1||

IAST: sam ī vatsaṁ na mātṛbhiḥ sṛjatā gayasādhanam
Griffith: Unite him bringing household wealth, even as a calf, with mother kine,
Devanāgarī: समी वत्सं न मातृभिः सृजता गयसाधनम्
pada pāṭha: sam | īmiti | vatsam | na | mātr̥-bhiḥ | sr̥jata | gaya-sādhanam || deva-avyam | madam | abhi | dvi-śavasam ||9.104.2||

IAST: devāvyam madam abhi dviśavasam
Griffith: Him who hath double strength, the God, delighting juice.
pada pāṭha: sam | īmiti | vatsam | na | mātr̥-bhiḥ | sr̥jata | gaya-sādhanam || deva-avyam | madam | abhi | dvi-śavasam ||9.104.2||

IAST: punātā dakṣasādhanaṁ yathā śardhāya vītaye
Griffith: Purify him who gives us power, that he, most Blessed One, may be
pada pāṭha: punāta | dakṣa-sādhanam | yathā | śardhāya | vītaye || yathā | mitrāya | varuṇāya | śam-tamaḥ ||9.104.3||

IAST: yathā mitrāya varuṇāya śaṁtamaḥ
Griffith: A banquet for the Troop, Mitra, and Varuna.
pada pāṭha: punāta | dakṣa-sādhanam | yathā | śardhāya | vītaye || yathā | mitrāya | varuṇāya | śam-tamaḥ ||9.104.3||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ tvā vasuvidam abhi vāṇīr anūṣata
Griffith: Voices have sung aloud to thee as finderout of wealth for us:
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tvā | vasu-vidam | abhi | vāṇīḥ | anūṣata || gobhiḥ | te | varṇam | abhi | vāsayāmasi ||9.104.4||

IAST: gobhiṣ ṭe varṇam abhi vāsayāmasi
Griffith: We clothe the hue thou wearest with a robe of milk.
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tvā | vasu-vidam | abhi | vāṇīḥ | anūṣata || gobhiḥ | te | varṇam | abhi | vāsayāmasi ||9.104.4||

IAST: sa no madānām pata indo devapsarā asi
Griffith: Thou, Indu, art the food of Gods, O Sovran of all gladdening drinks:
Devanāgarī: स नो मदानां पत इन्दो देवप्सरा असि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | madānām | pate | indo iti | deva-psarāḥ | asi || sakhā-iva | sakhye | gātuvit-tamaḥ | bhava ||9.104.5||

IAST: sakheva sakhye gātuvittamo bhava
Griffith: As Friend for friend, be thou best finder of success.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | madānām | pate | indo iti | deva-psarāḥ | asi || sakhā-iva | sakhye | gātuvit-tamaḥ | bhava ||9.104.5||

IAST: sanemi kṛdhy asmad ā rakṣasaṁ kaṁ cid atriṇam
Griffith: Drive utterly away from us each demon, each voracious fiend,
pada pāṭha: sanemi | kr̥dhi | asmat | ā | rakṣasam | kam | cit | atriṇam || apa | adevam | dvayum | aṁhaḥ | yuyodhi | naḥ ||9.104.6||

IAST: apādevaṁ dvayum aṁho yuyodhi naḥ
Griffith: The godless and the false: keep sorrow far away.
pada pāṭha: sanemi | kr̥dhi | asmat | ā | rakṣasam | kam | cit | atriṇam || apa | adevam | dvayum | aṁhaḥ | yuyodhi | naḥ ||9.104.6||

IAST: taṁ vaḥ sakhāyo madāya punānam abhi gāyata
Griffith: SING; ye aloud, O friends, to him who makes him pure for gladdening drink:
Devanāgarī: तं वः सखायो मदाय पुनानमभि गायत
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | madāya | punānam | abhi | gāyata || śiśum | na | yajñaiḥ | svadayanta | gūrti-bhiḥ ||9.105.1||

IAST: śiśuṁ na yajñaiḥ svadayanta gūrtibhiḥ
Griffith: They shall make sweet the Child with sacrifice and laud.
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | madāya | punānam | abhi | gāyata || śiśum | na | yajñaiḥ | svadayanta | gūrti-bhiḥ ||9.105.1||

IAST: saṁ vatsa iva mātṛbhir indur hinvāno ajyate
Griffith: Like as a calf with mother cows, so Indu is urged forth and sent,
pada pāṭha: sam | vatsaḥ-iva | mātr̥-bhiḥ | induḥ | hinvānaḥ | ajyate || deva-avīḥ | madaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | pari-kr̥taḥ ||9.105.2||

IAST: devāvīr mado matibhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
Griffith: Glorified by our hymns, the God-delighting juice.
pada pāṭha: sam | vatsaḥ-iva | mātr̥-bhiḥ | induḥ | hinvānaḥ | ajyate || deva-avīḥ | madaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | pari-kr̥taḥ ||9.105.2||

IAST: ayaṁ dakṣāya sādhano 'yaṁ śardhāya vītaye
Griffith: Effectual means of power is he, he is a banquet for the Troop,
pada pāṭha: ayam | dakṣāya | sādhanaḥ | ayam | śardhāya | vītaye || ayam | devebhyaḥ | madhumat-tamaḥ | sutaḥ ||9.105.3||

IAST: ayaṁ devebhyo madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ
Griffith: He who hath been effused, most rich in meath, for Gods.
pada pāṭha: ayam | dakṣāya | sādhanaḥ | ayam | śardhāya | vītaye || ayam | devebhyaḥ | madhumat-tamaḥ | sutaḥ ||9.105.3||

IAST: goman na indo aśvavat sutaḥ sudakṣa dhanva
Griffith: Flow to us, Indu, passing, strong, effused, with wealth of kine and steeds:
pada pāṭha: go-mat | naḥ | indo iti | aśva-vat | sutaḥ | su-dakṣa | dhanva || śucim | te | varṇam | adhi | goṣu | dīdharam ||9.105.4||

IAST: śuciṁ te varṇam adhi goṣu dīdharam
Griffith: I will spread forth above the milk thy radiant hue.
pada pāṭha: go-mat | naḥ | indo iti | aśva-vat | sutaḥ | su-dakṣa | dhanva || śucim | te | varṇam | adhi | goṣu | dīdharam ||9.105.4||

IAST: sa no harīṇām pata indo devapsarastamaḥ
Griffith: Lord of the tawny, Indu thou who art the God's most special food,
Devanāgarī: स नो हरीणां पत इन्दो देवप्सरस्तमः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | harīṇām | pate | indo iti | devapsaraḥ-tamaḥ || sakhā-iva | sakhye | naryaḥ | ruce | bhava ||9.105.5||

IAST: sakheva sakhye naryo ruce bhava
Griffith: As Friend to friend, for splendour be thou good to men.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | harīṇām | pate | indo iti | devapsaraḥ-tamaḥ || sakhā-iva | sakhye | naryaḥ | ruce | bhava ||9.105.5||

IAST: sanemi tvam asmad ām̐ adevaṁ kaṁ cid atriṇam
Griffith: Drive utterly, far away from us each godless, each voracious foe.
pada pāṭha: sanemi | tvam | asmat | ā | adevam | kam | cit | atriṇam || sāhvān | indo iti | pari | bādhaḥ | apa | dvayum ||9.105.6||

IAST: sāhvām̐ indo pari bādho apa dvayum
Griffith: O Indu, overcome and drive the false afar.
Devanāgarī: साह्वाँ इन्दो परि बाधो अप द्वयुम्
pada pāṭha: sanemi | tvam | asmat | ā | adevam | kam | cit | atriṇam || sāhvān | indo iti | pari | bādhaḥ | apa | dvayum ||9.105.6||

IAST: indram accha sutā ime vṛṣaṇaṁ yantu harayaḥ
Griffith: To Indra, to the Mighty Steer, may these gold-coloured juices go,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमच्छ सुता इमे वृषणं यन्तु हरयः
pada pāṭha: indram | accha | sutāḥ | ime | vr̥ṣaṇam | yantu | harayaḥ || śruṣṭī | jātāsaḥ | indavaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ ||9.106.1||

IAST: śruṣṭī jātāsa indavaḥ svarvidaḥ
Griffith: Drops rapidly produced, that find the light of heaven.
pada pāṭha: indram | accha | sutāḥ | ime | vr̥ṣaṇam | yantu | harayaḥ || śruṣṭī | jātāsaḥ | indavaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ ||9.106.1||

IAST: ayam bharāya sānasir indrāya pavate sutaḥ
Griffith: Effused, this juice victorious flows for Indra, for his maintenance.
pada pāṭha: ayam | bharāya | sānasiḥ | indrāya | pavate | sutaḥ || somaḥ | jaitrasya | cetati | yathā | vide ||9.106.2||

IAST: somo jaitrasya cetati yathā vide
Griffith: Soma bethinks him of the Conqueror, as he knows.
pada pāṭha: ayam | bharāya | sānasiḥ | indrāya | pavate | sutaḥ || somaḥ | jaitrasya | cetati | yathā | vide ||9.106.2||

IAST: asyed indro madeṣv ā grābhaṁ gṛbhṇīta sānasim
Griffith: May Indra in his raptures gain from him the grasp that gathers spoil,
pada pāṭha: asya | it | indraḥ | madeṣu | ā | grābham | gr̥bhṇīta | sānasim || vajram | ca | vr̥ṣaṇam | bharat | sam | apsu-jit ||9.106.3||

IAST: vajraṁ ca vṛṣaṇam bharat sam apsujit
Griffith: And, winning waters, wield the steerstrong thunderbolt.
pada pāṭha: asya | it | indraḥ | madeṣu | ā | grābham | gr̥bhṇīta | sānasim || vajram | ca | vr̥ṣaṇam | bharat | sam | apsu-jit ||9.106.3||

IAST: pra dhanvā soma jāgṛvir indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Flow vigilant for Indra, thou Soma, yea, Indu, run thou on:
Devanāgarī: प्र धन्वा सोम जागृविरिन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: pra | dhanva | soma | jāgr̥viḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava || dyu-mantam | śuṣmam | ā | bhara | svaḥ-vidam ||9.106.4||

IAST: dyumantaṁ śuṣmam ā bharā svarvidam
Griffith: Bring hither splendid strength that finds the light of heaven.
pada pāṭha: pra | dhanva | soma | jāgr̥viḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava || dyu-mantam | śuṣmam | ā | bhara | svaḥ-vidam ||9.106.4||

IAST: indrāya vṛṣaṇam madam pavasva viśvadarśataḥ
Griffith: Do thou, all-beautiful, purify for Indra's sake the mighty juice,
pada pāṭha: indrāya | vr̥ṣaṇam | madam | pavasva | viśva-darśataḥ || sahasra-yāmā | pathi-kr̥t | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.106.5||

IAST: sahasrayāmā pathikṛd vicakṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: Path-maker thou, far seeing, with a thousand ways.
pada pāṭha: indrāya | vr̥ṣaṇam | madam | pavasva | viśva-darśataḥ || sahasra-yāmā | pathi-kr̥t | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.106.5||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ gātuvittamo devebhyo madhumattamaḥ
Griffith: Best finder of prosperity for us, most rich in sweets for Gods,
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | gātuvit-tamaḥ | devebhyaḥ | madhumat-tamaḥ || sahasram | yāhi | pathi-bhiḥ | kanikradat ||9.106.6||

IAST: sahasraṁ yāhi pathibhiḥ kanikradat
Griffith: Proceed thou loudly roaring on a thousand paths.
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | gātuvit-tamaḥ | devebhyaḥ | madhumat-tamaḥ || sahasram | yāhi | pathi-bhiḥ | kanikradat ||9.106.6||

IAST: pavasva devavītaya indo dhārābhir ojasā
Griffith: O Indu, with thy streams, in might, flow for the banquet of the Gods:
pada pāṭha: pavasva | deva-vītaye | indo iti | dhārābhiḥ | ojasā || ā | kalaśam | madhu-mān | soma | naḥ | sadaḥ ||9.106.7||

IAST: ā kalaśam madhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ
Griffith: Rich in meath, Soma, in our beaker take thy place.
pada pāṭha: pavasva | deva-vītaye | indo iti | dhārābhiḥ | ojasā || ā | kalaśam | madhu-mān | soma | naḥ | sadaḥ ||9.106.7||

IAST: tava drapsā udapruta indram madāya vāvṛdhuḥ
Griffith: Thy drops that swim in water have exalted Indra to delight:
Devanāgarī: तव द्रप्सा उदप्रुत इन्द्रं मदाय वावृधुः
pada pāṭha: tava | drapsāḥ | uda-prutaḥ | indram | madāya | vavr̥dhuḥ || tvām | devāsaḥ | amr̥tāya | kam | papuḥ ||9.106.8||

IAST: tvāṁ devāso amṛtāya kam papuḥ
Griffith: The Gods have drunk thee up for immortality.
pada pāṭha: tava | drapsāḥ | uda-prutaḥ | indram | madāya | vavr̥dhuḥ || tvām | devāsaḥ | amr̥tāya | kam | papuḥ ||9.106.8||

IAST: ā naḥ sutāsa indavaḥ punānā dhāvatā rayim
Griffith: Stream opulence to us, ye drops of Soma, pressed and purified,
Devanāgarī: आ नः सुतास इन्दवः पुनाना धावता रयिम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | sutāsaḥ | indavaḥ | punānāḥ | dhāvata | rayim || vr̥ṣṭi-dyāvaḥ | rīti-āpaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ ||9.106.9||

IAST: vṛṣṭidyāvo rītyāpaḥ svarvidaḥ
Griffith: Pouring down rain from heaven in hoods, and finding light.
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | sutāsaḥ | indavaḥ | punānāḥ | dhāvata | rayim || vr̥ṣṭi-dyāvaḥ | rīti-āpaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ ||9.106.9||

IAST: somaḥ punāna ūrmiṇāvyo vāraṁ vi dhāvati
Griffith: Soma, while filtered, with his wave flows through the long wool of the sheep,
Devanāgarī: सोमः पुनान ऊर्मिणाव्यो वारं वि धावति
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | punānaḥ | ūrmiṇā | avyaḥ | vāram | vi | dhāvati || agre | vācaḥ | pavamānaḥ | kanikradat ||9.106.10||

IAST: agre vācaḥ pavamānaḥ kanikradat
Griffith: Shouting while purified before the voice of song.
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | punānaḥ | ūrmiṇā | avyaḥ | vāram | vi | dhāvati || agre | vācaḥ | pavamānaḥ | kanikradat ||9.106.10||

IAST: dhībhir hinvanti vājinaṁ vane krīḻantam atyavim
Griffith: With songs they send the Mighty forth, sporting in wood, above the fleece:
pada pāṭha: dhībhiḥ | hinvanti | vājinam | vane | krīḷantam | ati-avim || abhi | tri-pr̥ṣṭham | matayaḥ | sam | asvaran ||9.106.11||

IAST: abhi tripṛṣṭham matayaḥ sam asvaran
Griffith: Our psalms have glorified him of the triple height.
pada pāṭha: dhībhiḥ | hinvanti | vājinam | vane | krīḷantam | ati-avim || abhi | tri-pr̥ṣṭham | matayaḥ | sam | asvaran ||9.106.11||

IAST: asarji kalaśām̐ abhi mīḻhe saptir na vājayuḥ
Griffith: Into the jars hath he been loosed, like an impetuous steed for war,
Devanāgarī: असर्जि कलशाँ अभि मीळ्हे सप्तिर्न वाजयुः
pada pāṭha: asarji | kalaśān | abhi | mīḷhe | saptiḥ | na | vāja-yuḥ || punānaḥ | vācam | janayan | asisyadat ||9.106.12||

IAST: punāno vācaṁ janayann asiṣyadat
Griffith: And lifting up his voice, while filtered, glided on.
pada pāṭha: asarji | kalaśān | abhi | mīḷhe | saptiḥ | na | vāja-yuḥ || punānaḥ | vācam | janayan | asisyadat ||9.106.12||

IAST: pavate haryato harir ati hvarāṁsi raṁhyā
Griffith: Gold-hued and lovely in his course, througb tangles of the wool he flows,
pada pāṭha: pavate | haryataḥ | hariḥ | ati | hvarāṁsi | raṁhyā || abhi-arṣan | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ ||9.106.13||

IAST: abhyarṣan stotṛbhyo vīravad yaśaḥ
Griffith: And pours heroic fame upon the worshippers.
pada pāṭha: pavate | haryataḥ | hariḥ | ati | hvarāṁsi | raṁhyā || abhi-arṣan | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ ||9.106.13||

IAST: ayā pavasva devayur madhor dhārā asṛkṣata
Griffith: Flow thus, a faithful votary: the streams of meath have been effused.
pada pāṭha: ayā | pavasva | deva-yuḥ | madhoḥ | dhārāḥ | asr̥kṣata || rebhan | pavitram | pari | eṣi | viśvataḥ ||9.106.14||

IAST: rebhan pavitram pary eṣi viśvataḥ
Griffith: Thou comest to the filter, singing, from each side.
pada pāṭha: ayā | pavasva | deva-yuḥ | madhoḥ | dhārāḥ | asr̥kṣata || rebhan | pavitram | pari | eṣi | viśvataḥ ||9.106.14||

IAST: parīto ṣiñcatā sutaṁ somo ya uttamaṁ haviḥ
Griffith: I., HENCE sprinkle forth the juice effused,. Soma, the best of sacred gifts,
Devanāgarī: परीतो षिञ्चता सुतं सोमो य उत्तमं हविः
pada pāṭha: pari | itaḥ | siñcata | sutam | somaḥ | yaḥ | ut-tamam | haviḥ || dadhanvān | yaḥ | naryaḥ | ap-su | antaḥ | ā | susāva | somam | adri-bhiḥ ||9.107.1||

IAST: dadhanvām̐ yo naryo apsv antar ā suṣāva somam adribhiḥ
Griffith: Who, friend of man, hath run amid the water-streams. He hath pressed Soma out with stones.
Devanāgarī: दधन्वाँ यो नर्यो अप्स्वन्तरा सुषाव सोममद्रिभिः
pada pāṭha: pari | itaḥ | siñcata | sutam | somaḥ | yaḥ | ut-tamam | haviḥ || dadhanvān | yaḥ | naryaḥ | ap-su | antaḥ | ā | susāva | somam | adri-bhiḥ ||9.107.1||

IAST: nūnam punāno 'vibhiḥ pari sravādabdhaḥ surabhiṁtaraḥ
Griffith: Now, being purified, flow hither through the fleece inviolate and most odorous.
pada pāṭha: nūnam | punānaḥ | avi-bhiḥ | pari | srava | adabdhaḥ | surabhim-taraḥ || sute | cit | tvā | ap-su | mādāmaḥ | andhasā | śrīṇantaḥ | gobhiḥ | ut-taram ||9.107.2||

IAST: sute cit tvāpsu madāmo andhasā śrīṇanto gobhir uttaram
Griffith: We ladden thee in waters when thou art effused, blending thee still with juice and milk.
Devanāgarī: सुते चित्त्वाप्सु मदामो अन्धसा श्रीणन्तो गोभिरुत्तरम्
pada pāṭha: nūnam | punānaḥ | avi-bhiḥ | pari | srava | adabdhaḥ | surabhim-taraḥ || sute | cit | tvā | ap-su | mādāmaḥ | andhasā | śrīṇantaḥ | gobhiḥ | ut-taram ||9.107.2||

IAST: pari suvānaś cakṣase devamādanaḥ kratur indur vicakṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: Pressed out for all to see, delighting Gods, Indu, Far-sighted One, is mental power.
pada pāṭha: pari | suvānaḥ | cakṣase | deva-mādanaḥ | kratuḥ | induḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.107.3||

IAST: punānaḥ soma dhārayāpo vasāno arṣasi
Griffith: Cleansing thee, Soma, in thy stream, thou flowest in a watery robe:
pada pāṭha: punānaḥ | soma | dhārayā | apaḥ | vasānaḥ | arṣasi || ā | ratna-dhāḥ | yonim | r̥tasya | sīdasi | utsaḥ | deva | hiraṇyayaḥ ||9.107.4||

IAST: ā ratnadhā yonim ṛtasya sīdasy utso deva hiraṇyayaḥ
Griffith: Giver of wealth, thou sittest in the place of Law, O God, a fountain made of gold.
Devanāgarī: आ रत्नधा योनिमृतस्य सीदस्युत्सो देव हिरण्ययः
pada pāṭha: punānaḥ | soma | dhārayā | apaḥ | vasānaḥ | arṣasi || ā | ratna-dhāḥ | yonim | r̥tasya | sīdasi | utsaḥ | deva | hiraṇyayaḥ ||9.107.4||

IAST: duhāna ūdhar divyam madhu priyam pratnaṁ sadhastham āsadat
Griffith: Milking the heavenly udder for dear meath, he hath sat in the ancient gatheringplace.
Devanāgarī: दुहान ऊधर्दिव्यं मधु प्रियं प्रत्नं सधस्थमासदत्
pada pāṭha: duhānaḥ | ūdhaḥ | divyam | madhu | priyam | pratnam | sadha-stham | ā | asadat || ā-pr̥cchyam | dharuṇam | vājī | arṣati | nr̥-bhiḥ | dhūtaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.107.5||

IAST: āpṛcchyaṁ dharuṇaṁ vājy arṣati nṛbhir dhūto vicakṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: Washed by the men, the Strong Farseeing One streams forth nutriti us food that all desire.
pada pāṭha: duhānaḥ | ūdhaḥ | divyam | madhu | priyam | pratnam | sadha-stham | ā | asadat || ā-pr̥cchyam | dharuṇam | vājī | arṣati | nr̥-bhiḥ | dhūtaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ ||9.107.5||

IAST: punānaḥ soma jāgṛvir avyo vāre pari priyaḥ
Griffith: O Soma, while they cleanse thee, dear and watchful in the sheep's long wool,
Devanāgarī: पुनानः सोम जागृविरव्यो वारे परि प्रियः
pada pāṭha: punānaḥ | soma | jāgr̥viḥ | avyaḥ | vāre | pari | priyaḥ || tvam | vipraḥ | abhavaḥ | aṅgiraḥ-tamaḥ | madhvā | yajñam | mimikṣa | naḥ ||9.107.6||

IAST: tvaṁ vipro abhavo 'ṅgirastamo madhvā yajñam mimikṣa naḥ
Griffith: Thou hast become a Singer most like Angiras: thou madest Surya mount to heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विप्रो अभवोऽङ्गिरस्तमो मध्वा यज्ञं मिमिक्ष नः
pada pāṭha: punānaḥ | soma | jāgr̥viḥ | avyaḥ | vāre | pari | priyaḥ || tvam | vipraḥ | abhavaḥ | aṅgiraḥ-tamaḥ | madhvā | yajñam | mimikṣa | naḥ ||9.107.6||

IAST: somo mīḍhvān pavate gātuvittama ṛṣir vipro vicakṣaṇaḥ
Griffith: Bountiful, best of furtherers, Soma floweth on, Rsi and Singer, keen of sight.
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | mīḍhvān | pavate | gātuvit-tamaḥ | r̥ṣiḥ | vipraḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ || tvam | kaviḥ | abhavaḥ | deva-vītamaḥ | ā | sūryam | rohayaḥ | divi ||9.107.7||

IAST: tvaṁ kavir abhavo devavītama ā sūryaṁ rohayo divi
Griffith: Thou hast become a Sage most welcome to the Gods: thou madest Surya mount to heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्वं कविरभवो देववीतम आ सूर्यं रोहयो दिवि
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | mīḍhvān | pavate | gātuvit-tamaḥ | r̥ṣiḥ | vipraḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ || tvam | kaviḥ | abhavaḥ | deva-vītamaḥ | ā | sūryam | rohayaḥ | divi ||9.107.7||

IAST: soma u ṣuvāṇaḥ sotṛbhir adhi ṣṇubhir avīnām
Griffith: Pressed out by pressers, Soma goes over the fleecy backs of sheep,
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | ūm̐ iti | suvānaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ | adhi | snu-bhiḥ | avīnām || aśvayā-iva | haritā | yāti | dhārayā | mandrayā | yāti | dhārayā ||9.107.8||

IAST: aśvayeva haritā yāti dhārayā mandrayā yāti dhārayā
Griffith: Goes, even as with a mare, in tawnycoloured stream, goes in exhilarating stream.
Devanāgarī: अश्वयेव हरिता याति धारया मन्द्रया याति धारया
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | ūm̐ iti | suvānaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ | adhi | snu-bhiḥ | avīnām || aśvayā-iva | haritā | yāti | dhārayā | mandrayā | yāti | dhārayā ||9.107.8||

IAST: anūpe gomān gobhir akṣāḥ somo dugdhābhir akṣāḥ
Griffith: Down to the water-Soma, rich in kine hath flowed with cows, with cows that have been milked.
pada pāṭha: anūpe | go-mān | gobhiḥ | akṣāriti | somaḥ | dugdhābhiḥ | akṣāriti || samudram | na | sam-varaṇāni | agman | mandī | madāya | tośate ||9.107.9||

IAST: samudraṁ na saṁvaraṇāny agman mandī madāya tośate
Griffith: They have approached the mixing-vessel as a sea: the cheerer streams for the carouse.
pada pāṭha: anūpe | go-mān | gobhiḥ | akṣāriti | somaḥ | dugdhābhiḥ | akṣāriti || samudram | na | sam-varaṇāni | agman | mandī | madāya | tośate ||9.107.9||

IAST: ā soma suvāno adribhis tiro vārāṇy avyayā
Griffith: Effused by stones, O Soma, and urged through the long wool of the sheep,
pada pāṭha: ā | soma | suvānaḥ | adri-bhiḥ | tiraḥ | vārāṇi | avyayā || janaḥ | na | puri | camvoḥ | viśat | hariḥ | sadaḥ | vaneṣu | dadhiṣe ||9.107.10||
