IAST: jano na puri camvor viśad dhariḥ sado vaneṣu dadhiṣe
Griffith: Thou, entering the saucers as a man the fort, gold-hued hast settled in the wood.
Devanāgarī: जनो न पुरि चम्वोर्विशद्धरिः सदो वनेषु दधिषे
pada pāṭha: ā | soma | suvānaḥ | adri-bhiḥ | tiraḥ | vārāṇi | avyayā || janaḥ | na | puri | camvoḥ | viśat | hariḥ | sadaḥ | vaneṣu | dadhiṣe ||9.107.10||

IAST: sa māmṛje tiro aṇvāni meṣyo mīḻhe saptir na vājayuḥ
Griffith: He beautifies himself through the sheep's long fine wool, like an impetuous steed in war,
Devanāgarī: स मामृजे तिरो अण्वानि मेष्यो मीळ्हे सप्तिर्न वाजयुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mamr̥je | tiraḥ | aṇvāni | meṣyaḥ | mīḷhe | saptiḥ | na | vāja-yuḥ || anu-mādyaḥ | pavamānaḥ | manīṣi-bhiḥ | somaḥ | viprebhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ ||9.107.11||

IAST: anumādyaḥ pavamāno manīṣibhiḥ somo viprebhir ṛkvabhiḥ
Griffith: Even Soma Pavamana who shall be the joy of sages and of holy bards.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mamr̥je | tiraḥ | aṇvāni | meṣyaḥ | mīḷhe | saptiḥ | na | vāja-yuḥ || anu-mādyaḥ | pavamānaḥ | manīṣi-bhiḥ | somaḥ | viprebhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ ||9.107.11||

IAST: pra soma devavītaye sindhur na pipye arṇasā
Griffith: O Soma,-for the feast of Gods, river-like he hath swelled with surge,
Devanāgarī: प्र सोम देववीतये सिन्धुर्न पिप्ये अर्णसा
pada pāṭha: pra | soma | deva-vītaye | sindhuḥ | na | pipye | arṇasā || aṁśoḥ | payasā | madiraḥ | na | jāgr̥viḥ | accha | kośam | madhu-ścutam ||9.107.12||

IAST: aṁśoḥ payasā madiro na jāgṛvir acchā kośam madhuścutam
Griffith: With the stalk's juice, exhilarating, resting not, into the vat that drops with meath.
Devanāgarī: अंशोः पयसा मदिरो न जागृविरच्छा कोशं मधुश्चुतम्
pada pāṭha: pra | soma | deva-vītaye | sindhuḥ | na | pipye | arṇasā || aṁśoḥ | payasā | madiraḥ | na | jāgr̥viḥ | accha | kośam | madhu-ścutam ||9.107.12||

IAST: ā haryato arjune atke avyata priyaḥ sūnur na marjyaḥ
Griffith: Like a dear son who must be decked, the Lovely One hath clad him in a shining robe.
Devanāgarī: आ हर्यतो अर्जुने अत्के अव्यत प्रियः सूनुर्न मर्ज्यः
pada pāṭha: ā | haryataḥ | arjune | atke | avyata | priyaḥ | sūnuḥ | na | marjyaḥ || tam | īm | hinvanti | apasaḥ | yathā | ratham | nadīṣu | ā | gabhastyoḥ ||9.107.13||

IAST: tam īṁ hinvanty apaso yathā rathaṁ nadīṣv ā gabhastyoḥ
Griffith: Men skilful at their work drive him forth, like a car, into the rivers from their bands.
Devanāgarī: तमीं हिन्वन्त्यपसो यथा रथं नदीष्वा गभस्त्योः
pada pāṭha: ā | haryataḥ | arjune | atke | avyata | priyaḥ | sūnuḥ | na | marjyaḥ || tam | īm | hinvanti | apasaḥ | yathā | ratham | nadīṣu | ā | gabhastyoḥ ||9.107.13||

IAST: abhi somāsa āyavaḥ pavante madyam madam
Griffith: The living drops of Soma juice pour, as they flow, the gladdening drink,
Devanāgarī: अभि सोमास आयवः पवन्ते मद्यं मदम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | somāsaḥ | āyavaḥ | pavante | madyam | madam || samudrasya | adhi | viṣṭapi | manīṣiṇaḥ | matsarāsaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ ||9.107.14||

IAST: samudrasyādhi viṣṭapi manīṣiṇo matsarāsaḥ svarvidaḥ
Griffith: Intelligent drops above the basin of the sea, exhilarating, finding light.
pada pāṭha: abhi | somāsaḥ | āyavaḥ | pavante | madyam | madam || samudrasya | adhi | viṣṭapi | manīṣiṇaḥ | matsarāsaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ ||9.107.14||

IAST: tarat samudram pavamāna ūrmiṇā rājā deva ṛtam bṛhat
Griffith: May Pavamana, King and God, speed with his wave over the sea the lofty rite:
Devanāgarī: तरत्समुद्रं पवमान ऊर्मिणा राजा देव ऋतं बृहत्
pada pāṭha: tarat | samudram | pavamānaḥ | ūrmiṇā | rājā | devaḥ | r̥tam | br̥hat || arṣat | mitrasya | varuṇasya | dharmaṇā | pra | hinvānaḥ | r̥tam | br̥hat ||9.107.15||

IAST: arṣan mitrasya varuṇasya dharmaṇā pra hinvāna ṛtam bṛhat
Griffith: May he by Mitra's and by Varuna's decree flow furthering the lofty rite.
Devanāgarī: अर्षन्मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धर्मणा प्र हिन्वान ऋतं बृहत्
pada pāṭha: tarat | samudram | pavamānaḥ | ūrmiṇā | rājā | devaḥ | r̥tam | br̥hat || arṣat | mitrasya | varuṇasya | dharmaṇā | pra | hinvānaḥ | r̥tam | br̥hat ||9.107.15||

IAST: nṛbhir yemāno haryato vicakṣaṇo rājā devaḥ samudriyaḥ
Griffith: Far-seeing, lovely, guided by the men, the God whose home is in the sea-
Devanāgarī: नृभिर्येमानो हर्यतो विचक्षणो राजा देवः समुद्रियः
pada pāṭha: nr̥-bhiḥ | yemānaḥ | haryataḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | rājā | devaḥ | samudriyaḥ ||9.107.16||

IAST: indrāya pavate madaḥ somo marutvate sutaḥ
Griffith: Soma, the gladdening juice, flows pressed for Indra with his Marut host:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय पवते मदः सोमो मरुत्वते सुतः
pada pāṭha: indrāya | pavate | madaḥ | somaḥ | marutvate | sutaḥ || sahasra-dhāraḥ | ati | avyam | arṣati | tam | īmiti | mr̥janti | āyavaḥ ||9.107.17||

IAST: sahasradhāro aty avyam arṣati tam ī mṛjanty āyavaḥ
Griffith: He hastens o'er the fleece with all his thousand streams: men make him bright and beautiful.
pada pāṭha: indrāya | pavate | madaḥ | somaḥ | marutvate | sutaḥ || sahasra-dhāraḥ | ati | avyam | arṣati | tam | īmiti | mr̥janti | āyavaḥ ||9.107.17||

IAST: punānaś camū janayan matiṁ kaviḥ somo deveṣu raṇyati
Griffith: Purified in the bowl and gendering the hymn, wise Soma joys among the Gods.
Devanāgarī: पुनानश्चमू जनयन्मतिं कविः सोमो देवेषु रण्यति
pada pāṭha: punānaḥ | camū iti | janayan | matim | kaviḥ | somaḥ | deveṣu | raṇyati || apaḥ | vasānaḥ | pari | gobhiḥ | ut-taraḥ | sīdan | vaneṣu | avyata ||9.107.18||

IAST: apo vasānaḥ pari gobhir uttaraḥ sīdan vaneṣv avyata
Griffith: Robed in the flood, the Mighty One hath clad himself with milk and settled in the vats.
pada pāṭha: punānaḥ | camū iti | janayan | matim | kaviḥ | somaḥ | deveṣu | raṇyati || apaḥ | vasānaḥ | pari | gobhiḥ | ut-taraḥ | sīdan | vaneṣu | avyata ||9.107.18||

IAST: tavāhaṁ soma rāraṇa sakhya indo dive-dive
Griffith: O Soma, Indu, every day thy friendship hath been my delight.
Devanāgarī: तवाहं सोम रारण सख्य इन्दो दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: tava | aham | soma | raraṇa | sakhye | indo iti | dive-dive || purūṇi | babhro iti | ni | caranti | mām | ava | pari-dhīn | ati | tān | ihi ||9.107.19||

IAST: purūṇi babhro ni caranti mām ava paridhīm̐r ati tām̐ ihi
Griffith: Many fiends follow me; help me, thou Tawny-hued; pass on beyond these barriers.
Devanāgarī: पुरूणि बभ्रो नि चरन्ति मामव परिधीँरति ताँ इहि
pada pāṭha: tava | aham | soma | raraṇa | sakhye | indo iti | dive-dive || purūṇi | babhro iti | ni | caranti | mām | ava | pari-dhīn | ati | tān | ihi ||9.107.19||

IAST: utāhaṁ naktam uta soma te divā sakhyāya babhra ūdhani
Griffith: Close to thy bosom am I, Soma, day and night. O Tawny-hued, for friendship sake.
Devanāgarī: उताहं नक्तमुत सोम ते दिवा सख्याय बभ्र ऊधनि
pada pāṭha: uta | aham | naktam | uta | soma | te | divā | sakhyāya | babhro iti | ūdhani || ghr̥ṇā | tapantam | ati | sūryam | paraḥ | śakunāḥ-iva | paptima ||9.107.20||

IAST: ghṛṇā tapantam ati sūryam paraḥ śakunā iva paptima
Griffith: Surya himself refulgent with his glow have we o'ertaken in his course like birds.
Devanāgarī: घृणा तपन्तमति सूर्यं परः शकुना इव पप्तिम
pada pāṭha: uta | aham | naktam | uta | soma | te | divā | sakhyāya | babhro iti | ūdhani || ghr̥ṇā | tapantam | ati | sūryam | paraḥ | śakunāḥ-iva | paptima ||9.107.20||

IAST: mṛjyamānaḥ suhastya samudre vācam invasi
Griffith: Deft-handcd! thou when purified liftest thy voice amid the sea.
pada pāṭha: mr̥jyamānaḥ | su-hastya | samudre | vācam | invasi || rayim | piśaṅgam | bahulam | puru-spr̥ham | pavamāna | abhi | arṣasi ||9.107.21||

IAST: rayim piśaṅgam bahulam puruspṛham pavamānābhy arṣasi
Griffith: Thou, Pavamana, makest riches flow to us, yellow, abundant, much-desifed.
pada pāṭha: mr̥jyamānaḥ | su-hastya | samudre | vācam | invasi || rayim | piśaṅgam | bahulam | puru-spr̥ham | pavamāna | abhi | arṣasi ||9.107.21||

IAST: mṛjāno vāre pavamāno avyaye vṛṣāva cakrado vane
Griffith: Making thee pure and bright in the sheep's long wool, tbou hast bellowed, steerlike, in the wood.
Devanāgarī: मृजानो वारे पवमानो अव्यये वृषाव चक्रदो वने
pada pāṭha: mr̥jānaḥ | vāre | pavamānaḥ | avyaye | vr̥ṣā | ava | cakradaḥ | vane || devānām | soma | pavamāna | niḥ-kr̥tam | gobhiḥ | añjānaḥ | arṣasi ||9.107.22||

IAST: devānāṁ soma pavamāna niṣkṛtaṁ gobhir añjāno arṣasi
Griffith: Thou flowest, Soma Pavamana, balmed with milk unto the special place of Gods.
Devanāgarī: देवानां सोम पवमान निष्कृतं गोभिरञ्जानो अर्षसि
pada pāṭha: mr̥jānaḥ | vāre | pavamānaḥ | avyaye | vr̥ṣā | ava | cakradaḥ | vane || devānām | soma | pavamāna | niḥ-kr̥tam | gobhiḥ | añjānaḥ | arṣasi ||9.107.22||

IAST: pavasva vājasātaye 'bhi viśvāni kāvyā
Griffith: Flow on to win us strength, flow on to lofty lore of every kind.
pada pāṭha: pavasva | vāja-sātaye | abhi | viśvāni | kāvyā || tvam | samudram | prathamaḥ | vi | dhārayaḥ | devebhyaḥ | soma | matsaraḥ ||9.107.23||

IAST: tvaṁ samudram prathamo vi dhārayo devebhyaḥ soma matsaraḥ
Griffith: Thou, Soma, as Exhilarator wast the first to spread the sea abroad for Gods.
Devanāgarī: त्वं समुद्रं प्रथमो वि धारयो देवेभ्यः सोम मत्सरः
pada pāṭha: pavasva | vāja-sātaye | abhi | viśvāni | kāvyā || tvam | samudram | prathamaḥ | vi | dhārayaḥ | devebhyaḥ | soma | matsaraḥ ||9.107.23||

IAST: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṁ rajo divyā ca soma dharmabhiḥ
Griffith: Flow to the realm of earth, flow to the realm of heaven, O Soma, in thy righteous ways.
Devanāgarī: स तू पवस्व परि पार्थिवं रजो दिव्या च सोम धर्मभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | pavasva | pari | pārthivam | rajaḥ | divyā | ca | soma | dharma-bhiḥ || tvām | viprāsaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | vi-cakṣaṇa | śubhram | hinvanti | dhīti-bhiḥ ||9.107.24||

IAST: tvāṁ viprāso matibhir vicakṣaṇa śubhraṁ hinvanti dhītibhiḥ
Griffith: Fair art thou whom the sages, O Far-seeing One, urge onward with their songs and hymns.
Devanāgarī: त्वां विप्रासो मतिभिर्विचक्षण शुभ्रं हिन्वन्ति धीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | pavasva | pari | pārthivam | rajaḥ | divyā | ca | soma | dharma-bhiḥ || tvām | viprāsaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | vi-cakṣaṇa | śubhram | hinvanti | dhīti-bhiḥ ||9.107.24||

IAST: pavamānā asṛkṣata pavitram ati dhārayā
Griffith: Over the cleansing sieve have flowed the Pavamanas in a stream,
pada pāṭha: pavamānāḥ | asr̥kṣata | pavitram | ati | dhārayā || marutvantaḥ | matsarāḥ | indriyāḥ | hayāḥ | medhām | abhi | prayāṁsi | ca ||9.107.25||

IAST: marutvanto matsarā indriyā hayā medhām abhi prayāṁsi ca
Griffith: Girt by the Maruts, gladdening, Steeds with Indra's stiength, for wisdom and for dainty food.
Devanāgarī: मरुत्वन्तो मत्सरा इन्द्रिया हया मेधामभि प्रयांसि च
pada pāṭha: pavamānāḥ | asr̥kṣata | pavitram | ati | dhārayā || marutvantaḥ | matsarāḥ | indriyāḥ | hayāḥ | medhām | abhi | prayāṁsi | ca ||9.107.25||

IAST: apo vasānaḥ pari kośam arṣatīndur hiyānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ
Griffith: Urged onward by the pressers, clad in watery robes, Indu is speeding to the vat.
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | vasānaḥ | pari | kośam | arṣati | induḥ | hiyānaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ || janayan | jyotiḥ | mandanāḥ | avīvaśat | gāḥ | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | na | niḥ-nijam ||9.107.26||

IAST: janayañ jyotir mandanā avīvaśad gāḥ kṛṇvāno na nirṇijam
Griffith: He gendering light, hath made the glad Cows low, while he takes them as his garb of state.
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | vasānaḥ | pari | kośam | arṣati | induḥ | hiyānaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ || janayan | jyotiḥ | mandanāḥ | avīvaśat | gāḥ | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | na | niḥ-nijam ||9.107.26||

IAST: pavasva madhumattama indrāya soma kratuvittamo madaḥ
Griffith: FOR Indra, flow thou Soma on, as gladdening juice most sweet, intelligent,
Devanāgarī: पवस्व मधुमत्तम इन्द्राय सोम क्रतुवित्तमो मदः
pada pāṭha: pavasva | madhumat-tamaḥ | indrāya | soma | kratuvit-tamaḥ | madaḥ || mahi | dyukṣa-tamaḥ | madaḥ ||9.108.1||

IAST: mahi dyukṣatamo madaḥ
Griffith: Great, cheering, dwelling most in heaven.
pada pāṭha: pavasva | madhumat-tamaḥ | indrāya | soma | kratuvit-tamaḥ | madaḥ || mahi | dyukṣa-tamaḥ | madaḥ ||9.108.1||

IAST: yasya te pītvā vṛṣabho vṛṣāyate 'sya pītā svarvidaḥ
Griffith: Thou, of whom having drunk the Steer acts like a steer. drinking of this that finds the light,
Devanāgarī: यस्य ते पीत्वा वृषभो वृषायतेऽस्य पीता स्वर्विदः
pada pāṭha: yasya | te | pītvā | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vr̥ṣa-yate | asya | pītā | svaḥ-vidaḥ || saḥ | su-praketaḥ | abhi | akramīt | iṣaḥ | accha | vājam | na | etaśaḥ ||9.108.2||

IAST: sa supraketo abhy akramīd iṣo 'cchā vājaṁ naitaśaḥ
Griffith: He, Excellently Wise, is come to strengthening food, to spoil and wealth like Etasa.
pada pāṭha: yasya | te | pītvā | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vr̥ṣa-yate | asya | pītā | svaḥ-vidaḥ || saḥ | su-praketaḥ | abhi | akramīt | iṣaḥ | accha | vājam | na | etaśaḥ ||9.108.2||

IAST: tvaṁ hy aṅga daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ
Griffith: For, verily, Pavamana, thou bast, splendidest, called all the generations of
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह्यङ्ग दैव्या पवमान जनिमानि द्युमत्तमः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | aṅga | daivyā | pavamāna | janimāni | dyumat-tamaḥ || amr̥ta-tvāya | ghoṣayaḥ ||9.108.3||

IAST: amṛtatvāya ghoṣayaḥ
Griffith: The Gods to immortality.
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | aṅga | daivyā | pavamāna | janimāni | dyumat-tamaḥ || amr̥ta-tvāya | ghoṣayaḥ ||9.108.3||

IAST: yenā navagvo dadhyaṅṅ aporṇute yena viprāsa āpire
Griffith: By whom Dadhyac Navagva opens fastened doors, by whom the sages gained their wish,
Devanāgarī: येना नवग्वो दध्यङ्ङपोर्णुते येन विप्रास आपिरे
pada pāṭha: yena | nava-gvaḥ | dadhyaṅ | apa-ūrṇute | yena | viprāsaḥ | āpire || devānām | sumne | amr̥tasya | cāruṇaḥ | yena | śravāṁsi | ānaśuḥ ||9.108.4||

IAST: devānāṁ sumne amṛtasya cāruṇo yena śravāṁsy ānaśuḥ
Griffith: By whom they won the fame of lovely Amrta in the felicity of Gods.
Devanāgarī: देवानां सुम्ने अमृतस्य चारुणो येन श्रवांस्यानशुः
pada pāṭha: yena | nava-gvaḥ | dadhyaṅ | apa-ūrṇute | yena | viprāsaḥ | āpire || devānām | sumne | amr̥tasya | cāruṇaḥ | yena | śravāṁsi | ānaśuḥ ||9.108.4||

IAST: eṣa sya dhārayā suto 'vyo vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ
Griffith: Effused, he floweth in a stream, best rapture-giver, in the long wool of the sheep,
Devanāgarī: एष स्य धारया सुतोऽव्यो वारेभिः पवते मदिन्तमः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | dhārayā | sutaḥ | avyaḥ | vārebhiḥ | pavate | madin-tamaḥ || krīḷan | ūrmiḥ | apām-iva ||9.108.5||

IAST: krīḻann ūrmir apām iva
Griffith: Sporting, as 'twere the waters' wave.
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | dhārayā | sutaḥ | avyaḥ | vārebhiḥ | pavate | madin-tamaḥ || krīḷan | ūrmiḥ | apām-iva ||9.108.5||

IAST: ya usriyā apyā antar aśmano nir gā akṛntad ojasā
Griffith: He who from out the rocky cavern took with might the redmrefulgent watery Cows,
Devanāgarī: य उस्रिया अप्या अन्तरश्मनो निर्गा अकृन्तदोजसा
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | usriyāḥ | apyāḥ | antaḥ | aśmanaḥ | niḥ | gāḥ | akr̥ntat | ojasā || abhi | vrajam | tatniṣe | gavyam | aśvyam | varmī-iva | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | ā | ruja ||9.108.6||

IAST: abhi vrajaṁ tatniṣe gavyam aśvyaṁ varmīva dhṛṣṇav ā ruja
Griffith: Thou masterest the stable full of kine and steeds: burst it, brave Lord, like one in mail.
Devanāgarī: अभि व्रजं तत्निषे गव्यमश्व्यं वर्मीव धृष्णवा रुज
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | usriyāḥ | apyāḥ | antaḥ | aśmanaḥ | niḥ | gāḥ | akr̥ntat | ojasā || abhi | vrajam | tatniṣe | gavyam | aśvyam | varmī-iva | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | ā | ruja ||9.108.6||

IAST: ā sotā pari ṣiñcatāśvaṁ na stomam apturaṁ rajasturam
Griffith: Press ye and pour him, like a steed, laudworthy, speeding through the region and the flood,
Devanāgarī: आ सोता परि षिञ्चताश्वं न स्तोममप्तुरं रजस्तुरम्
pada pāṭha: ā | sota | pari | siñcata | aśvam | na | stomam | ap-turam | rajaḥ-turam || vana-krakṣam | uda-prutam ||9.108.7||

IAST: vanakrakṣam udaprutam
Griffith: Who swims in water, roan in wood;
pada pāṭha: ā | sota | pari | siñcata | aśvam | na | stomam | ap-turam | rajaḥ-turam || vana-krakṣam | uda-prutam ||9.108.7||

IAST: sahasradhāraṁ vṛṣabham payovṛdham priyaṁ devāya janmane
Griffith: Increaser of the water, Steer with thousand streams, dear to the race of Deities;
Devanāgarī: सहस्रधारं वृषभं पयोवृधं प्रियं देवाय जन्मने
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāram | vr̥ṣabham | payaḥ-vr̥dham | priyam | devāya | janmane || r̥tena | yaḥ | r̥ta-jātaḥ | vi-vavr̥dhe | rājā | devaḥ | r̥tam | br̥hat ||9.108.8||

IAST: ṛtena ya ṛtajāto vivāvṛdhe rājā deva ṛtam bṛhat
Griffith: Who born in Law hath waxen mighty by the Law, King, God, and lofty Ordinance.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन य ऋतजातो विवावृधे राजा देव ऋतं बृहत्
pada pāṭha: sahasra-dhāram | vr̥ṣabham | payaḥ-vr̥dham | priyam | devāya | janmane || r̥tena | yaḥ | r̥ta-jātaḥ | vi-vavr̥dhe | rājā | devaḥ | r̥tam | br̥hat ||9.108.8||

IAST: abhi dyumnam bṛhad yaśa iṣas pate didīhi deva devayuḥ
Griffith: Make splendid glory shine on us, thou Lord of strengthening food, God, as the Friend of Gods:
Devanāgarī: अभि द्युम्नं बृहद्यश इषस्पते दिदीहि देव देवयुः
pada pāṭha: abhi | dyumnam | br̥hat | yaśaḥ | iṣaḥ | pate | didīhi | deva | deva-yuḥ || vi | kośam | madhyamam | yuva ||9.108.9||

IAST: vi kośam madhyamaṁ yuva
Griffith: Unclose the fount of middle air.
pada pāṭha: abhi | dyumnam | br̥hat | yaśaḥ | iṣaḥ | pate | didīhi | deva | deva-yuḥ || vi | kośam | madhyamam | yuva ||9.108.9||

IAST: ā vacyasva sudakṣa camvoḥ suto viśāṁ vahnir na viśpatiḥ
Griffith: Roll onward to the bowls, O Mighty One, effused, as Prince supporter of the tribes.
Devanāgarī: आ वच्यस्व सुदक्ष चम्वोः सुतो विशां वह्निर्न विश्पतिः
pada pāṭha: ā | vacyasva | su-dakṣa | camvoḥ | sutaḥ | viśām | vahniḥ | na | viśpatiḥ || vr̥ṣṭim | divaḥ | pavasva | rītim | apām | jinva | go-iṣṭaye | dhiyaḥ ||9.108.10||

IAST: vṛṣṭiṁ divaḥ pavasva rītim apāṁ jinvā gaviṣṭaye dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Pour on us rain from heaven, send us the waters' flow: incite our thoughts to win the spoil.
Devanāgarī: वृष्टिं दिवः पवस्व रीतिमपां जिन्वा गविष्टये धियः
pada pāṭha: ā | vacyasva | su-dakṣa | camvoḥ | sutaḥ | viśām | vahniḥ | na | viśpatiḥ || vr̥ṣṭim | divaḥ | pavasva | rītim | apām | jinva | go-iṣṭaye | dhiyaḥ ||9.108.10||

IAST: etam u tyam madacyutaṁ sahasradhāraṁ vṛṣabhaṁ divo duhuḥ
Griffith: They have drained him the Steer of heaven, him with a thousand streams, distilling rapturous joy,
Devanāgarī: एतमु त्यं मदच्युतं सहस्रधारं वृषभं दिवो दुहुः
pada pāṭha: etam | ūm̐ iti | tyam | mada-cyutam | sahasra-dhāram | vr̥ṣabham | divaḥ | duhuḥ || viśvā | vasūni | bibhratam ||9.108.11||

IAST: viśvā vasūni bibhratam
Griffith: Him who brings all things excellent.
pada pāṭha: etam | ūm̐ iti | tyam | mada-cyutam | sahasra-dhāram | vr̥ṣabham | divaḥ | duhuḥ || viśvā | vasūni | bibhratam ||9.108.11||

IAST: vṛṣā vi jajñe janayann amartyaḥ pratapañ jyotiṣā tamaḥ
Griffith: The Mighty One was born Immortal, giving life, lightening darkness with his shine.
Devanāgarī: वृषा वि जज्ञे जनयन्नमर्त्यः प्रतपञ्ज्योतिषा तमः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | vi | jajñe | janayan | amartyaḥ | pra-tapan | jyotiṣā | tamaḥ || saḥ | su-stutaḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | niḥ-nijam | dadhe | tri-dhātu | asya | daṁsasā ||9.108.12||

IAST: sa suṣṭutaḥ kavibhir nirṇijaṁ dadhe tridhātv asya daṁsasā
Griffith: Wcll-praised by. sages he hath. by his wondrous power assumed the Threefold as his robe.
Devanāgarī: स सुष्टुतः कविभिर्निर्णिजं दधे त्रिधात्वस्य दंससा
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | vi | jajñe | janayan | amartyaḥ | pra-tapan | jyotiṣā | tamaḥ || saḥ | su-stutaḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | niḥ-nijam | dadhe | tri-dhātu | asya | daṁsasā ||9.108.12||

IAST: sa sunve yo vasūnāṁ yo rāyām ānetā ya iḻānām
Griffith: Effused is he who brings good things, who brings us bounteous gifts and sweet refreshing food,
Devanāgarī: स सुन्वे यो वसूनां यो रायामानेता य इळानाम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sunve | yaḥ | vasūnām | yaḥ | rāyām | ā-netā | yaḥ | iḷānām || somaḥ | yaḥ | su-kṣitīnām ||9.108.13||

IAST: somo yaḥ sukṣitīnām
Griffith: Soma who brings us quiet homes:
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sunve | yaḥ | vasūnām | yaḥ | rāyām | ā-netā | yaḥ | iḷānām || somaḥ | yaḥ | su-kṣitīnām ||9.108.13||

IAST: yasya na indraḥ pibād yasya maruto yasya vāryamaṇā bhagaḥ
Griffith: He whom our Indra and the Marut host shall drink, Bhaga shall drink with Aryarnan,
Devanāgarī: यस्य न इन्द्रः पिबाद्यस्य मरुतो यस्य वार्यमणा भगः
pada pāṭha: yasya | naḥ | indraḥ | pibāt | yasya | marutaḥ | yasya | vā | aryamaṇā | bhagaḥ || ā | yena | mitrāvaruṇā | karāmahe | ā | indram | avase | mahe ||9.108.14||

IAST: ā yena mitrāvaruṇā karāmaha endram avase mahe
Griffith: By whom we bring to us Mitra and Varuna and Indra for our great defence.
Devanāgarī: आ येन मित्रावरुणा करामह एन्द्रमवसे महे
pada pāṭha: yasya | naḥ | indraḥ | pibāt | yasya | marutaḥ | yasya | vā | aryamaṇā | bhagaḥ || ā | yena | mitrāvaruṇā | karāmahe | ā | indram | avase | mahe ||9.108.14||

IAST: indrāya soma pātave nṛbhir yataḥ svāyudho madintamaḥ
Griffith: Soma, for Indra's drink do thou, led by the men, well-wcaponcd and most gladdening,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय सोम पातवे नृभिर्यतः स्वायुधो मदिन्तमः
pada pāṭha: indrāya | soma | pātave | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | su-āyudhaḥ | madin-tamaḥ || pavasva | madhumat-tamaḥ ||9.108.15||

IAST: pavasva madhumattamaḥ
Griffith: Flow on with greatest store of sweets.
pada pāṭha: indrāya | soma | pātave | nr̥-bhiḥ | yataḥ | su-āyudhaḥ | madin-tamaḥ || pavasva | madhumat-tamaḥ ||9.108.15||

IAST: indrasya hārdi somadhānam ā viśa samudram iva sindhavaḥ
Griffith: Enter the Soma-holder, even Indra's heart, as rivers pass into the sea,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य हार्दि सोमधानमा विश समुद्रमिव सिन्धवः
pada pāṭha: indrasya | hārdi | soma-dhānam | ā | viśa | samudram-iva | sindhavaḥ || juṣṭaḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | vāyave | divaḥ | viṣṭambhaḥ | ut-tamaḥ ||9.108.16||

IAST: juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave divo viṣṭambha uttamaḥ
Griffith: Acceptable to Mitra, Vayu, Varuna, the noblest Pillar of the heavens.
Devanāgarī: जुष्टो मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे दिवो विष्टम्भ उत्तमः
pada pāṭha: indrasya | hārdi | soma-dhānam | ā | viśa | samudram-iva | sindhavaḥ || juṣṭaḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | vāyave | divaḥ | viṣṭambhaḥ | ut-tamaḥ ||9.108.16||

IAST: pari pra dhanvendrāya soma svādur mitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya
Griffith: PLEASANT to Indra's Mitra's, Pusan's Bhaga's taste, sped onward, Soma, with thy flowing stream.
Devanāgarī: परि प्र धन्वेन्द्राय सोम स्वादुर्मित्राय पूष्णे भगाय
pada pāṭha: pari | pra | dhanva | indrāya | soma | svāduḥ | mitrāya | pūṣṇe | bhagāya ||9.109.1||

IAST: indras te soma sutasya peyāḥ kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ
Griffith: Let Indra drink, O Soma, of thy juice for wisdom, and all Deities for strength.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्ते सोम सुतस्य पेयाः क्रत्वे दक्षाय विश्वे च देवाः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | te | soma | sutasya | peyāḥ | kratve | dakṣāya | viśve | ca | devāḥ ||9.109.2||

IAST: evāmṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukro arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ
Griffith: So flow thou on as bright celestial juice, flow to the vast, immortal dwelling-place.
Devanāgarī: एवामृताय महे क्षयाय स शुक्रो अर्ष दिव्यः पीयूषः
pada pāṭha: eva | amr̥tāya | mahe | kṣayāya | saḥ | śukraḥ | arṣa | divyaḥ | pīyūṣaḥ ||9.109.3||

IAST: pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānāṁ viśvābhi dhāma
Griffith: Flow onward, Soma, as a mighty sea, as Father of the Gods to every form.
Devanāgarī: पवस्व सोम महान्समुद्रः पिता देवानां विश्वाभि धाम
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | mahān | samudraḥ | pitā | devānām | viśvā | abhi | dhāma ||9.109.4||

IAST: śukraḥ pavasva devebhyaḥ soma dive pṛthivyai śaṁ ca prajāyai
Griffith: Flow on, O Soma, radiant for the Gods and Heaven and Earth and bless our progeny.
Devanāgarī: शुक्रः पवस्व देवेभ्यः सोम दिवे पृथिव्यै शं च प्रजायै
pada pāṭha: śukraḥ | pavasva | devebhyaḥ | soma | dive | pr̥thivyai | śam | ca | pra-jāyai ||9.109.5||

IAST: divo dhartāsi śukraḥ pīyūṣaḥ satye vidharman vājī pavasva
Griffith: Thou, bright Juice, art Sustainer of the sky: flow, mighty, in accordance with true Law.
Devanāgarī: दिवो धर्तासि शुक्रः पीयूषः सत्ये विधर्मन्वाजी पवस्व
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | dhartā | asi | śukraḥ | pīyūṣaḥ | satye | vi-dharman | vājī | pavasva ||9.109.6||

IAST: pavasva soma dyumnī sudhāro mahām avīnām anu pūrvyaḥ
Griffith: Soma, flow splendid with thy copious stream through the great fleece as in the olden time.
Devanāgarī: पवस्व सोम द्युम्नी सुधारो महामवीनामनु पूर्व्यः
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | dyumnī | su-dhāraḥ | mahām | avīnām | anu | pūrvyaḥ ||9.109.7||

IAST: nṛbhir yemāno jajñānaḥ pūtaḥ kṣarad viśvāni mandraḥ svarvit
Griffith: Bom, led by men, joyous, and purified, let the Light-finder make all blessings flow:
Devanāgarī: नृभिर्येमानो जज्ञानः पूतः क्षरद्विश्वानि मन्द्रः स्वर्वित्
pada pāṭha: nr̥-bhiḥ | yemānaḥ | jajñānaḥ | pūtaḥ | kṣarat | viśvāni | mandraḥ | svaḥ-vit ||9.109.8||

IAST: induḥ punānaḥ prajām urāṇaḥ karad viśvāni draviṇāni naḥ
Griffith: Indu, while cleansed, keeping the people safe, shall give us all possessions for our own.
Devanāgarī: इन्दुः पुनानः प्रजामुराणः करद्विश्वानि द्रविणानि नः
pada pāṭha: induḥ | punānaḥ | pra-jām | urāṇaḥ | karat | viśvāni | draviṇāni | naḥ ||9.109.9||

IAST: pavasva soma kratve dakṣāyāśvo na nikto vājī dhanāya
Griffith: Flow on for wisdom, Soma, and for power, as a strong courser bathed, to win the prize.
Devanāgarī: पवस्व सोम क्रत्वे दक्षायाश्वो न निक्तो वाजी धनाय
pada pāṭha: pavasva | soma | kratve | dakṣāya | aśvaḥ | na | niktaḥ | vājī | dhanāya ||9.109.10||

IAST: taṁ te sotāro rasam madāya punanti somam mahe dyumnāya
Griffith: The pressers purify this juice of thine, the Soma, for delight, and lofty fame
Devanāgarī: तं ते सोतारो रसं मदाय पुनन्ति सोमं महे द्युम्नाय
pada pāṭha: tam | te | sotāraḥ | rasam | madāya | punanti | somam | mahe | dyumnāya ||9.109.11||

IAST: śiśuṁ jajñānaṁ harim mṛjanti pavitre somaṁ devebhya indum
Griffith: They deck the Gold-hued Infant, newlyborn, even Soma, Indu, in the sieve for Gods.
Devanāgarī: शिशुं जज्ञानं हरिं मृजन्ति पवित्रे सोमं देवेभ्य इन्दुम्
pada pāṭha: śiśum | jajñānam | harim | mr̥janti | pavitre | somam | devebhyaḥ | indum ||9.109.12||

IAST: induḥ paviṣṭa cārur madāyāpām upasthe kavir bhagāya
Griffith: Fair Indu hath flowed on for rapturous joy, Sage for good fortune in the waters' lap.
pada pāṭha: induḥ | paviṣṭa | cāruḥ | madāya | apām | upa-sthe | kaviḥ | bhagāya ||9.109.13||

IAST: bibharti cārv indrasya nāma yena viśvāni vṛtrā jaghāna
Griffith: He bears the beauteous name of Indra, that wherewith he overcame all demon foes.
Devanāgarī: बिभर्ति चार्विन्द्रस्य नाम येन विश्वानि वृत्रा जघान
pada pāṭha: bibharti | cāru | indrasya | nāma | yena | viśvāni | vr̥trā | jaghāna ||9.109.14||

IAST: pibanty asya viśve devāso gobhiḥ śrītasya nṛbhiḥ sutasya
Griffith: All Deities are wont to drink of him, pressed by the men and blent with milk and curds.
Devanāgarī: पिबन्त्यस्य विश्वे देवासो गोभिः श्रीतस्य नृभिः सुतस्य
pada pāṭha: pibanti | asya | viśve | devāsaḥ | gobhiḥ | śrītasya | nr̥-bhiḥ | sutasya ||9.109.15||

IAST: pra suvāno akṣāḥ sahasradhāras tiraḥ pavitraṁ vi vāram avyam
Griffith: He hath flowed forth with thousand streams effused, flowed ihsough the filter and the sheep's long wool.
Devanāgarī: प्र सुवानो अक्षाः सहस्रधारस्तिरः पवित्रं वि वारमव्यम्
pada pāṭha: pra | suvānaḥ | akṣāriti | sahasra-dhāraḥ | tiraḥ | pavitram | vi | vāram | avyam ||9.109.16||

IAST: sa vājy akṣāḥ sahasraretā adbhir mṛjāno gobhiḥ śrīṇānaḥ
Griffith: With endless genial flow the Strong hath run, purified by the waters, blent with milk.
Devanāgarī: स वाज्यक्षाः सहस्ररेता अद्भिर्मृजानो गोभिः श्रीणानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vājī | akṣāriti | sahasra-retāḥ | at-bhiḥ | mr̥jānaḥ | gobhiḥ | śrīṇānaḥ ||9.109.17||

IAST: pra soma yāhīndrasya kukṣā nṛbhir yemāno adribhiḥ sutaḥ
Griffith: Pressed out with stones, directed by the men, go fortli, O Soma, into Indra's throat.
Devanāgarī: प्र सोम याहीन्द्रस्य कुक्षा नृभिर्येमानो अद्रिभिः सुतः
pada pāṭha: pra | soma | yāhi | indrasya | kukṣā | nr̥-bhiḥ | yemānaḥ | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ ||9.109.18||

IAST: asarji vājī tiraḥ pavitram indrāya somaḥ sahasradhāraḥ
Griffith: The mighty Soma with a thousand streams is poured to Indra through the cleansing sieve.
Devanāgarī: असर्जि वाजी तिरः पवित्रमिन्द्राय सोमः सहस्रधारः
pada pāṭha: asarji | vājī | tiraḥ | pavitram | indrāya | somaḥ | sahasra-dhāraḥ ||9.109.19||

IAST: añjanty enam madhvo rasenendrāya vṛṣṇa indum madāya
Griffith: Indu they balm with pleasant milky juice for Indra, for the Steer, for his delight.
Devanāgarī: अञ्जन्त्येनं मध्वो रसेनेन्द्राय वृष्ण इन्दुं मदाय
pada pāṭha: añjanti | enam | madhvaḥ | rasena | indrāya | vr̥ṣṇe | indum | madāya ||9.109.20||

IAST: devebhyas tvā vṛthā pājase 'po vasānaṁ harim mṛjanti
Griffith: Lightly, for sheen, they cleanse thee for the Gods, gold-coloured, wearing water as thy robe.
Devanāgarī: देवेभ्यस्त्वा वृथा पाजसेऽपो वसानं हरिं मृजन्ति
pada pāṭha: devebhyaḥ | tvā | vr̥thā | pājase | apaḥ | vasānam | harim | mr̥janti ||9.109.21||

IAST: indur indrāya tośate ni tośate śrīṇann ugro riṇann apaḥ
Griffith: Indu to Indra streams, yea, downward streams, Strong, flowing to the floods, and mingling -there.
Devanāgarī: इन्दुरिन्द्राय तोशते नि तोशते श्रीणन्नुग्रो रिणन्नपः
pada pāṭha: induḥ | indrāya | tośate | ni | tośate | śrīṇan | ugraḥ | riṇan | apaḥ ||9.109.22||

IAST: pary ū ṣu pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: O'ERPOWERING Vrtras, forward run to win great strength:
Devanāgarī: पर्यू षु प्र धन्व वाजसातये परि वृत्राणि सक्षणिः
pada pāṭha: pari | ūm̐ iti | su | pra | dhanva | vāja-sātaye | pari | vr̥trāṇi | sakṣaṇiḥ || dviṣaḥ | taradhyai | r̥ṇa-yāḥ | naḥ | īyase ||9.110.1||

IAST: dviṣas taradhyā ṛṇayā na īyase
Griffith: Thou speedest to subdue like one exacting debts.
pada pāṭha: pari | ūm̐ iti | su | pra | dhanva | vāja-sātaye | pari | vr̥trāṇi | sakṣaṇiḥ || dviṣaḥ | taradhyai | r̥ṇa-yāḥ | naḥ | īyase ||9.110.1||

IAST: anu hi tvā sutaṁ soma madāmasi mahe samaryarājye
Griffith: In thee, effused, O Soma, we rejoice ourselves for great supremacy in fight.
Devanāgarī: अनु हि त्वा सुतं सोम मदामसि महे समर्यराज्ये
pada pāṭha: anu | hi | tvā | sutam | soma | madāmasi | mahe | samarya-rājye || vājān | abhi | pavamāna | pra | gāhase ||9.110.2||

IAST: vājām̐ abhi pavamāna pra gāhase
Griffith: Thou, Pavamana, enterest into mighty deeds,
pada pāṭha: anu | hi | tvā | sutam | soma | madāmasi | mahe | samarya-rājye || vājān | abhi | pavamāna | pra | gāhase ||9.110.2||

IAST: ajījano hi pavamāna sūryaṁ vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ
Griffith: O Pavamana, thou didst generate the Sun, and spread the moisture out with power,
Devanāgarī: अजीजनो हि पवमान सूर्यं विधारे शक्मना पयः
pada pāṭha: ajījanaḥ | hi | pavamāna | sūryam | vi-dhāre | śakmanā | payaḥ || go-jīrayā | raṁhamāṇaḥ | purandhyā ||9.110.3||

IAST: gojīrayā raṁhamāṇaḥ puraṁdhyā
Griffith: Hasting to us with plenty vivified with milk.
pada pāṭha: ajījanaḥ | hi | pavamāna | sūryam | vi-dhāre | śakmanā | payaḥ || go-jīrayā | raṁhamāṇaḥ | purandhyā ||9.110.3||

IAST: ajījano amṛta martyeṣv ām̐ ṛtasya dharmann amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ
Griffith: Thou didst produce him, Deathless God mid mortal men for maintenance of Law and lovely Amrta:
Devanāgarī: अजीजनो अमृत मर्त्येष्वाँ ऋतस्य धर्मन्नमृतस्य चारुणः
pada pāṭha: ajījanaḥ | amr̥ta | martyeṣu | ā | r̥tasya | dharman | amr̥tasya | cāruṇaḥ || sadā | asaraḥ | vājam | accha | sanisyadat ||9.110.4||

IAST: sadāsaro vājam acchā saniṣyadat
Griffith: Thou evermore hast moved making strength flow to us.
pada pāṭha: ajījanaḥ | amr̥ta | martyeṣu | ā | r̥tasya | dharman | amr̥tasya | cāruṇaḥ || sadā | asaraḥ | vājam | accha | sanisyadat ||9.110.4||

IAST: abhy-abhi hi śravasā tatardithotsaṁ na kaṁ cij janapānam akṣitam
Griffith: All round about hast thou with glory pierced for us as 'twere a never-failing well for men to drink,
Devanāgarī: अभ्यभि हि श्रवसा ततर्दिथोत्सं न कं चिज्जनपानमक्षितम्
pada pāṭha: abhi-abhi | hi | śravasā | tatarditha | utsam | na | kam | cit | jana-pānam | akṣitam || śaryābhiḥ | na | bharamāṇaḥ | gabhastyoḥ ||9.110.5||

IAST: śaryābhir na bharamāṇo gabhastyoḥ
Griffith: Borne on thy way in fragments from the presser's arms.
pada pāṭha: abhi-abhi | hi | śravasā | tatarditha | utsam | na | kam | cit | jana-pānam | akṣitam || śaryābhiḥ | na | bharamāṇaḥ | gabhastyoḥ ||9.110.5||

IAST: ād īṁ ke cit paśyamānāsa āpyaṁ vasuruco divyā abhy anūṣata
Griffith: Then, beautifully radiant, certain Heavenly Ones, have sung to him their kinship as they looked thereon,
Devanāgarī: आदीं के चित्पश्यमानास आप्यं वसुरुचो दिव्या अभ्यनूषत
pada pāṭha: āt | īm | ke | cit | paśyamānāsaḥ | āpyam | vasu-rucaḥ | divyāḥ | abhi | anūṣata || vāram | na | devaḥ | savitā | vi | ūrṇute ||9.110.6||

IAST: vāraṁ na devaḥ savitā vy ūrṇute
Griffith: And Savitar the God opens as 'twere a stall.
pada pāṭha: āt | īm | ke | cit | paśyamānāsaḥ | āpyam | vasu-rucaḥ | divyāḥ | abhi | anūṣata || vāram | na | devaḥ | savitā | vi | ūrṇute ||9.110.6||

IAST: tve soma prathamā vṛktabarhiṣo mahe vājāya śravase dhiyaṁ dadhuḥ
Griffith: Soma, the men of old whose grass was trimmed addressed the hymn to thee for mighty strength and for renow
Devanāgarī: त्वे सोम प्रथमा वृक्तबर्हिषो महे वाजाय श्रवसे धियं दधुः
pada pāṭha: tve iti | soma | prathamāḥ | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | mahe | vājāya | śravase | dhiyam | dadhuḥ || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | vīra | vīryāya | codaya ||9.110.7||

IAST: sa tvaṁ no vīra vīryāya codaya
Griffith: So, Hero, urge us onward to heroic power.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नो वीर वीर्याय चोदय
pada pāṭha: tve iti | soma | prathamāḥ | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | mahe | vājāya | śravase | dhiyam | dadhuḥ || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | vīra | vīryāya | codaya ||9.110.7||

IAST: divaḥ pīyūṣam pūrvyaṁ yad ukthyam maho gāhād diva ā nir adhukṣata
Griffith: They have drained forth from out the great depth of the sky the old primeval milk of heaven that claims t
Devanāgarī: दिवः पीयूषं पूर्व्यं यदुक्थ्यं महो गाहाद्दिव आ निरधुक्षत
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | pīyūṣam | pūrvyam | yat | ukthyam | mahaḥ | gāhāt | divaḥ | ā | niḥ | adhukṣata || indram | abhi | jāyamānam | sam | asvaran ||9.110.8||

IAST: indram abhi jāyamānaṁ sam asvaran
Griffith: They lifted up their voice to Indra athis birth.
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | pīyūṣam | pūrvyam | yat | ukthyam | mahaḥ | gāhāt | divaḥ | ā | niḥ | adhukṣata || indram | abhi | jāyamānam | sam | asvaran ||9.110.8||

IAST: adha yad ime pavamāna rodasī imā ca viśvā bhuvanābhi majmanā
Griffith: As long as thou, O Pavamana, art above this earth and heaven and all existence in thy might,
Devanāgarī: अध यदिमे पवमान रोदसी इमा च विश्वा भुवनाभि मज्मना
pada pāṭha: adha | yat | ime iti | pavamāna | rodasī iti | imā | ca | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | majmanā || yūthe | na | niḥ-sthāḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vi | tiṣṭhase ||9.110.9||

IAST: yūthe na niṣṭhā vṛṣabho vi tiṣṭhase
Griffith: Thou standest like a Bull the chief amid the herd.
Devanāgarī: यूथे न निष्ठा वृषभो वि तिष्ठसे
pada pāṭha: adha | yat | ime iti | pavamāna | rodasī iti | imā | ca | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | majmanā || yūthe | na | niḥ-sthāḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vi | tiṣṭhase ||9.110.9||

IAST: somaḥ punāno avyaye vāre śiśur na krīḻan pavamāno akṣāḥ
Griffith: In the sheep's wool hath Soma Pavamana flowed, while they cleanse him, like a playful infant,
Devanāgarī: सोमः पुनानो अव्यये वारे शिशुर्न क्रीळन्पवमानो अक्षाः
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | punānaḥ | avyaye | vāre | śiśuḥ | na | krīḷan | pavamānaḥ | akṣāriti || sahasra-dhāraḥ | śata-vājaḥ | induḥ ||9.110.10||

IAST: sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja induḥ
Griffith: Indu with hundred powers and hundred currents.
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | punānaḥ | avyaye | vāre | śiśuḥ | na | krīḷan | pavamānaḥ | akṣāriti || sahasra-dhāraḥ | śata-vājaḥ | induḥ ||9.110.10||

IAST: eṣa punāno madhumām̐ ṛtāvendrāyenduḥ pavate svādur ūrmiḥ
Griffith: Holy and sweet, while purified, this Indu flows on, a wave of pleasant taste, to Indra,-
Devanāgarī: एष पुनानो मधुमाँ ऋतावेन्द्रायेन्दुः पवते स्वादुरूर्मिः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | punānaḥ | madhu-mān | r̥ta-vā | indrāya | induḥ | pavate | svāduḥ | ūrmiḥ || vāja-saniḥ | varivaḥ-vit | vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||9.110.11||

IAST: vājasanir varivovid vayodhāḥ
Griffith: Strength-winner, Treasure-finder, Life. bestower.
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | punānaḥ | madhu-mān | r̥ta-vā | indrāya | induḥ | pavate | svāduḥ | ūrmiḥ || vāja-saniḥ | varivaḥ-vit | vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||9.110.11||

IAST: sa pavasva sahamānaḥ pṛtanyūn sedhan rakṣāṁsy apa durgahāṇi
Griffith: So flow thou on, subduing our assailants, chasing the demons hard to beencountered,
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pavasva | sahamānaḥ | pr̥tanyūn | sedhan | rakṣāṁsi | apa | duḥ-gahāṇi || su-āyudhaḥ | sasahvān | soma | śatrūn ||9.110.12||

IAST: svāyudhaḥ sāsahvān soma śatrūn
Griffith: Well-armed and conquering our foes, O Soma.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pavasva | sahamānaḥ | pr̥tanyūn | sedhan | rakṣāṁsi | apa | duḥ-gahāṇi || su-āyudhaḥ | sasahvān | soma | śatrūn ||9.110.12||

IAST: ayā rucā hariṇyā punāno viśvā dveṣāṁsi tarati svayugvabhiḥ sūro na svayugvabhiḥ
Griffith: WITH this his golden splendour purifying him, he with his own allies subdues all enemies, as Sara with his own allies
Devanāgarī: अया रुचा हरिण्या पुनानो विश्वा द्वेषांसि तरति स्वयुग्वभिः सूरो न स्वयुग्वभिः
pada pāṭha: ayā | rucā | hariṇyā | punānaḥ | viśvā | dveṣāṁsi | tarati | svayugva-bhiḥ | sūraḥ | na | svayugva-bhiḥ || dhārā | sutasya | rocate | punānaḥ | aruṣaḥ | hariḥ || viśvā | yat | rūpā | pari-yāti | r̥kva-bhiḥ | sapta-āsyebhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ ||9.111.1||

IAST: dhārā sutasya rocate punāno aruṣo hariḥ
Griffith: Cleansing himself with stream of juice he shines forth yellow-hued and red,
Devanāgarī: धारा सुतस्य रोचते पुनानो अरुषो हरिः
pada pāṭha: ayā | rucā | hariṇyā | punānaḥ | viśvā | dveṣāṁsi | tarati | svayugva-bhiḥ | sūraḥ | na | svayugva-bhiḥ || dhārā | sutasya | rocate | punānaḥ | aruṣaḥ | hariḥ || viśvā | yat | rūpā | pari-yāti | r̥kva-bhiḥ | sapta-āsyebhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ ||9.111.1||

IAST: viśvā yad rūpā pariyāty ṛkvabhiḥ saptāsyebhir ṛkvabhiḥ
Griffith: When with the praisers he encompasses all forms, with praisers having seven mouths.
pada pāṭha: ayā | rucā | hariṇyā | punānaḥ | viśvā | dveṣāṁsi | tarati | svayugva-bhiḥ | sūraḥ | na | svayugva-bhiḥ || dhārā | sutasya | rocate | punānaḥ | aruṣaḥ | hariḥ || viśvā | yat | rūpā | pari-yāti | r̥kva-bhiḥ | sapta-āsyebhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ ||9.111.1||

IAST: tvaṁ tyat paṇīnāṁ vido vasu sam mātṛbhir marjayasi sva ā dama ṛtasya dhītibhir dame
Griffith: That treasure of the Panis thou discoveredst; thou with thy mothers deckest thee in thine abode, with song of worship in thine home.
Devanāgarī: त्वं त्यत्पणीनां विदो वसु सं मातृभिर्मर्जयसि स्व आ दम ऋतस्य धीतिभिर्दमे
pada pāṭha: tvam | tyat | paṇīnām | vidaḥ | vasu | sam | mātr̥-bhiḥ | marjayasi | sve | ā | dame | r̥tasya | dhīti-bhiḥ | dame || parā-vataḥ | na | sāma | tat | yatra | raṇanti | dhītayaḥ || tridhātu-bhiḥ | aruṣībhiḥ | vayaḥ | dadhe | rocamānaḥ | vayaḥ | dadhe ||9.111.2||

IAST: parāvato na sāma tad yatrā raṇanti dhītayaḥ
Griffith: As 'twere from far, the hymn is heard, where holy songs resound in joy.
Devanāgarī: परावतो न साम तद्यत्रा रणन्ति धीतयः
pada pāṭha: tvam | tyat | paṇīnām | vidaḥ | vasu | sam | mātr̥-bhiḥ | marjayasi | sve | ā | dame | r̥tasya | dhīti-bhiḥ | dame || parā-vataḥ | na | sāma | tat | yatra | raṇanti | dhītayaḥ || tridhātu-bhiḥ | aruṣībhiḥ | vayaḥ | dadhe | rocamānaḥ | vayaḥ | dadhe ||9.111.2||

IAST: tridhātubhir aruṣībhir vayo dadhe rocamāno vayo dadhe
Griffith: He with the ruddy-hued, threefold hath won life-power, he, glittering, hath won life-power.
pada pāṭha: tvam | tyat | paṇīnām | vidaḥ | vasu | sam | mātr̥-bhiḥ | marjayasi | sve | ā | dame | r̥tasya | dhīti-bhiḥ | dame || parā-vataḥ | na | sāma | tat | yatra | raṇanti | dhītayaḥ || tridhātu-bhiḥ | aruṣībhiḥ | vayaḥ | dadhe | rocamānaḥ | vayaḥ | dadhe ||9.111.2||

IAST: pūrvām anu pradiśaṁ yāti cekitat saṁ raśmibhir yatate darśato ratho daivyo darśato rathaḥ
Griffith: He moves intelligent, directed to the East. The very beauteous car rivals the beams of light, the beautiful celestial car.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वामनु प्रदिशं याति चेकितत्सं रश्मिभिर्यतते दर्शतो रथो दैव्यो दर्शतो रथः
pada pāṭha: pūrvām | anu | pra-diśam | yāti | cekitat | sam | raśmi-bhiḥ | yatate | darśataḥ | rathaḥ | daivyaḥ | darśataḥ | rathaḥ || agman | ukthāni | pauṁsyā | indram | jaitrāya | harṣayan || vajraḥ | ca | yat | bhavathaḥ | anapa-cyutā | samat-su | anapa-cyutā ||9.111.3||

IAST: agmann ukthāni pauṁsyendraṁ jaitrāya harṣayan
Griffith: Hymns, lauding manly valour, came, inciting Indra to success, that ye may be unconquered,
pada pāṭha: pūrvām | anu | pra-diśam | yāti | cekitat | sam | raśmi-bhiḥ | yatate | darśataḥ | rathaḥ | daivyaḥ | darśataḥ | rathaḥ || agman | ukthāni | pauṁsyā | indram | jaitrāya | harṣayan || vajraḥ | ca | yat | bhavathaḥ | anapa-cyutā | samat-su | anapa-cyutā ||9.111.3||

IAST: vajraś ca yad bhavatho anapacyutā samatsv anapacyutā
Griffith: Both thy bolt and thou, both be unconquered in the war.
pada pāṭha: pūrvām | anu | pra-diśam | yāti | cekitat | sam | raśmi-bhiḥ | yatate | darśataḥ | rathaḥ | daivyaḥ | darśataḥ | rathaḥ || agman | ukthāni | pauṁsyā | indram | jaitrāya | harṣayan || vajraḥ | ca | yat | bhavathaḥ | anapa-cyutā | samat-su | anapa-cyutā ||9.111.3||

IAST: nānānaṁ vā u no dhiyo vi vratāni janānām
Griffith: WE all have various thoughts and plans, and diverse are the ways of men.
Devanāgarī: नानानं वा उ नो धियो वि व्रतानि जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: nānānam | vai | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | dhiyaḥ | vi | vratāni | janānām || takṣā | riṣṭam | rutam | bhiṣak | brahmā | sunvantam | icchati | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.112.1||

IAST: takṣā riṣṭaṁ rutam bhiṣag brahmā sunvantam icchatīndrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: The Brahman seeks the worshipper, wright seeks the cracked, and leech the maimed. Flow, Indu, flow for
Devanāgarī: तक्षा रिष्टं रुतं भिषग्ब्रह्मा सुन्वन्तमिच्छतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: nānānam | vai | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | dhiyaḥ | vi | vratāni | janānām || takṣā | riṣṭam | rutam | bhiṣak | brahmā | sunvantam | icchati | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.112.1||

IAST: jaratībhir oṣadhībhiḥ parṇebhiḥ śakunānām
Griffith: The smith with ripe and seasoned plants, with feathers of the birds of air,
pada pāṭha: jaratībhiḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | parṇebhiḥ | śakunānām || kārmāraḥ | aśma-bhiḥ | dyu-bhiḥ | hiraṇya-vantam | icchati | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.112.2||

IAST: kārmāro aśmabhir dyubhir hiraṇyavantam icchatīndrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: With stones, and with enkindled flames, seeks him who hath a store of gold. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's
pada pāṭha: jaratībhiḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | parṇebhiḥ | śakunānām || kārmāraḥ | aśma-bhiḥ | dyu-bhiḥ | hiraṇya-vantam | icchati | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.112.2||

IAST: kārur ahaṁ tato bhiṣag upalaprakṣiṇī nanā
Griffith: A bard am I, my dad's a leech, mammy lays corn upon the stones.
pada pāṭha: kāruḥ | aham | tataḥ | bhiṣak | upala-prakṣiṇī | nanā || nānā-dhiyaḥ | vasu-yavaḥ | anu | gāḥ-iva | tasthima | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.112.3||

IAST: nānādhiyo vasūyavo 'nu gā iva tasthimendrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Striving for wealth, with varied plans, we follow our desires like kine. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sa
Devanāgarī: नानाधियो वसूयवोऽनु गा इव तस्थिमेन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: kāruḥ | aham | tataḥ | bhiṣak | upala-prakṣiṇī | nanā || nānā-dhiyaḥ | vasu-yavaḥ | anu | gāḥ-iva | tasthima | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.112.3||

IAST: aśvo voḻhā sukhaṁ rathaṁ hasanām upamantriṇaḥ
Griffith: The horse would draw an easy car, gay hosts attract the laugh and jest.
pada pāṭha: aśvaḥ | voḷhā | su-kham | ratham | hasanām | upa-mantriṇaḥ || śepaḥ | romaṇ-vantau | bhedau | vāḥ | it | maṇḍūkaḥ | icchati | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.112.4||

IAST: śepo romaṇvantau bhedau vār in maṇḍūka icchatīndrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: The male desires his mate's approach, the frog is eager for the flood, Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake
Devanāgarī: शेपो रोमण्वन्तौ भेदौ वारिन्मण्डूक इच्छतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: aśvaḥ | voḷhā | su-kham | ratham | hasanām | upa-mantriṇaḥ || śepaḥ | romaṇ-vantau | bhedau | vāḥ | it | maṇḍūkaḥ | icchati | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.112.4||

IAST: śaryaṇāvati somam indraḥ pibatu vṛtrahā
Griffith: LET Vrtra-slaying Indra drink Soma by Saryanavan's side,
pada pāṭha: śaryaṇā-vati | somam | indraḥ | pibatu | vr̥tra-hā || balam | dadhānaḥ | ātmani | kariṣyan | vīryam | mahat | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.1||

IAST: balaṁ dadhāna ātmani kariṣyan vīryam mahad indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Storing up vigour in his heart, prepared to do heroic deeds. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: बलं दधान आत्मनि करिष्यन्वीर्यं महदिन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: śaryaṇā-vati | somam | indraḥ | pibatu | vr̥tra-hā || balam | dadhānaḥ | ātmani | kariṣyan | vīryam | mahat | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.1||

IAST: ā pavasva diśām pata ārjīkāt soma mīḍhvaḥ
Griffith: Lord of the Quarters, flow thou on, boon Soma, from Arjika land,
Devanāgarī: आ पवस्व दिशां पत आर्जीकात्सोम मीढ्वः
pada pāṭha: ā | pavasva | diśām | pate | ārjīkāt | soma | mīḍhvaḥ || r̥ta-vākena | satyena | śraddhayā | tapasā | sutaḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.2||

IAST: ṛtavākena satyena śraddhayā tapasā suta indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Effused with ardour and with faith, and the true hymn of sacrifice. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: ऋतवाकेन सत्येन श्रद्धया तपसा सुत इन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: ā | pavasva | diśām | pate | ārjīkāt | soma | mīḍhvaḥ || r̥ta-vākena | satyena | śraddhayā | tapasā | sutaḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.2||

IAST: parjanyavṛddham mahiṣaṁ taṁ sūryasya duhitābharat
Griffith: Hither hath Surya's Daughter brought the wild Steer whom Parjanya nursed.
pada pāṭha: parjanya-vr̥ddham | mahiṣam | tam | sūryasya | duhitā | ā | abharat || tam | gandharvāḥ | prati | agr̥bhṇan | tam | some | rasam | ā | adadhuḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.3||

IAST: taṁ gandharvāḥ praty agṛbhṇan taṁ some rasam ādadhur indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Gandharvas have seized bold of him, and in the Soma laid the juice. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: तं गन्धर्वाः प्रत्यगृभ्णन्तं सोमे रसमादधुरिन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: parjanya-vr̥ddham | mahiṣam | tam | sūryasya | duhitā | ā | abharat || tam | gandharvāḥ | prati | agr̥bhṇan | tam | some | rasam | ā | adadhuḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.3||

IAST: ṛtaṁ vadann ṛtadyumna satyaṁ vadan satyakarman
Griffith: Splendid by Law! declaring Law, truthspeaking, truthful in thy works,
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | vadan | r̥ta-dyumna | satyam | vadan | satya-karman || śraddhām | vadan | soma | rājan | dhātrā | soma | pari-kr̥ta | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.4||

IAST: śraddhāṁ vadan soma rājan dhātrā soma pariṣkṛta indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Enouncing faith, King Soma! thou, O Soma, whom thy maker decks. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: श्रद्धां वदन्सोम राजन्धात्रा सोम परिष्कृत इन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | vadan | r̥ta-dyumna | satyam | vadan | satya-karman || śraddhām | vadan | soma | rājan | dhātrā | soma | pari-kr̥ta | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.4||

IAST: satyamugrasya bṛhataḥ saṁ sravanti saṁsravāḥ
Griffith: Together flow the meeting streams of him the Great and truly Strong.
pada pāṭha: satyam-ugrasya | br̥hataḥ | sam | sravanti | sam-sravāḥ || sam | yanti | rasinaḥ | rasāḥ | punānaḥ | brahmaṇā | hare | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.5||

IAST: saṁ yanti rasino rasāḥ punāno brahmaṇā hara indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: The juices of the juicy meet. Made pure by prayer, O Golden-hued, flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: सं यन्ति रसिनो रसाः पुनानो ब्रह्मणा हर इन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: satyam-ugrasya | br̥hataḥ | sam | sravanti | sam-sravāḥ || sam | yanti | rasinaḥ | rasāḥ | punānaḥ | brahmaṇā | hare | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.5||

IAST: yatra brahmā pavamāna chandasyāṁ vācaṁ vadan
Griffith: O Pavamana, where the priest, as he recites the rhythmic prayer,
Devanāgarī: यत्र ब्रह्मा पवमान छन्दस्यां वाचं वदन्
pada pāṭha: yatra | brahmā | pavamāna | chandasyām | vācam | vadan || grāvṇā | some | mahīyate | somena | ā-nandam | janayan | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.6||

IAST: grāvṇā some mahīyate somenānandaṁ janayann indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Lords it o'er Soma with the stone, with Soma bringing forth delight, flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: ग्राव्णा सोमे महीयते सोमेनानन्दं जनयन्निन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: yatra | brahmā | pavamāna | chandasyām | vācam | vadan || grāvṇā | some | mahīyate | somena | ā-nandam | janayan | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.6||

IAST: yatra jyotir ajasraṁ yasmim̐l loke svar hitam
Griffith: O Pavarnana, place me in that deathless, undecaying world
pada pāṭha: yatra | jyotiḥ | ajasram | yasmin | loke | svaḥ | hitam || tasmin | mām | dhehi | pavamāna | amr̥te | loke | akṣite | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.7||

IAST: tasmin māṁ dhehi pavamānāmṛte loke akṣita indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Wherein the light of heaven is set, and everlasting lustre shines. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: तस्मिन्मां धेहि पवमानामृते लोके अक्षित इन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: yatra | jyotiḥ | ajasram | yasmin | loke | svaḥ | hitam || tasmin | mām | dhehi | pavamāna | amr̥te | loke | akṣite | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.7||

IAST: yatra rājā vaivasvato yatrāvarodhanaṁ divaḥ
Griffith: Make me immortal in that realm where dwells the King, Vivasvan's Son,
pada pāṭha: yatra | rājā | vaivasvataḥ | yatra | ava-rodhanam | divaḥ || yatra | amūḥ | yahvatīḥ | āpaḥ | tatra | mām | amr̥tam | kr̥dhi | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.8||

IAST: yatrāmūr yahvatīr āpas tatra mām amṛtaṁ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Where is the secret shrine of heaven, where are those waters young and fresh. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra
pada pāṭha: yatra | rājā | vaivasvataḥ | yatra | ava-rodhanam | divaḥ || yatra | amūḥ | yahvatīḥ | āpaḥ | tatra | mām | amr̥tam | kr̥dhi | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.8||

IAST: yatrānukāmaṁ caraṇaṁ trināke tridive divaḥ
Griffith: Make me immortal in that realm where they move even as they list,
pada pāṭha: yatra | anu-kāmam | caraṇam | tri-nāke | tri-dive | divaḥ || lokāḥ | yatra | jyotiṣmantaḥ | tatra | mām | amr̥tam | kr̥dhi | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.9||

IAST: lokā yatra jyotiṣmantas tatra mām amṛtaṁ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: In the third sphere of inmost heaven where lucid worlds are full of light. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's
Devanāgarī: लोका यत्र ज्योतिष्मन्तस्तत्र माममृतं कृधीन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: yatra | anu-kāmam | caraṇam | tri-nāke | tri-dive | divaḥ || lokāḥ | yatra | jyotiṣmantaḥ | tatra | mām | amr̥tam | kr̥dhi | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.9||

IAST: yatra kāmā nikāmāś ca yatra bradhnasya viṣṭapam
Griffith: Make me immortal in that realm of eager wish and strong desire,
Devanāgarī: यत्र कामा निकामाश्च यत्र ब्रध्नस्य विष्टपम्
pada pāṭha: yatra | kāmāḥ | ni-kāmāḥ | ca | yatra | bradhnasya | viṣṭapam || svadhā | ca | yatra | tr̥ptiḥ | ca | tatra | mām | amr̥tam | kr̥dhi | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.10||

IAST: svadhā ca yatra tṛptiś ca tatra mām amṛtaṁ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: The region of the radiant Moon, where food and full delight are found. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake
Devanāgarī: स्वधा च यत्र तृप्तिश्च तत्र माममृतं कृधीन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: yatra | kāmāḥ | ni-kāmāḥ | ca | yatra | bradhnasya | viṣṭapam || svadhā | ca | yatra | tr̥ptiḥ | ca | tatra | mām | amr̥tam | kr̥dhi | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.10||

IAST: yatrānandāś ca modāś ca mudaḥ pramuda āsate
Griffith: Make me immortal in that realm where happiness and transports, where
pada pāṭha: yatra | ā-nandāḥ | ca | modāḥ | ca | mudaḥ | pra-mudaḥ | āsate || kāmasya | yatra | āptāḥ | kāmāḥ | tatra | mām | amr̥tam | kr̥dhi | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.11||

IAST: kāmasya yatrāptāḥ kāmās tatra mām amṛtaṁ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Joys and felicities combine, and longing wishes are fulfilled. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: कामस्य यत्राप्ताः कामास्तत्र माममृतं कृधीन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: yatra | ā-nandāḥ | ca | modāḥ | ca | mudaḥ | pra-mudaḥ | āsate || kāmasya | yatra | āptāḥ | kāmāḥ | tatra | mām | amr̥tam | kr̥dhi | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.113.11||

IAST: ya indoḥ pavamānasyānu dhāmāny akramīt
Griffith: THE man who walketh as the Laws of Indu Pavamana bid,-
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indoḥ | pavamānasya | anu | dhāmāni | akramīt || tam | āhuḥ | su-prajāḥ | iti | yaḥ | te | soma | avidhat | manaḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.114.1||

IAST: tam āhuḥ suprajā iti yas te somāvidhan mana indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Men call him rich in children, him, O Soma, who hath met thy thought. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake
Devanāgarī: तमाहुः सुप्रजा इति यस्ते सोमाविधन्मन इन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indoḥ | pavamānasya | anu | dhāmāni | akramīt || tam | āhuḥ | su-prajāḥ | iti | yaḥ | te | soma | avidhat | manaḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.114.1||

IAST: ṛṣe mantrakṛtāṁ stomaiḥ kaśyapodvardhayan giraḥ
Griffith: Kasyapa, Rsi, lifting up thy voice with hymn-composers' lauds,
pada pāṭha: r̥ṣe | mantra-kr̥tām | stomaiḥ | kaśyapa | ut-vardhayan | giraḥ || somam | namasya | rājānam | yaḥ | jajñe | vīrudhām | patiḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.114.2||

IAST: somaṁ namasya rājānaṁ yo jajñe vīrudhām patir indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Pav reverence to King Soma born the Sovran Ruler of the plants. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: सोमं नमस्य राजानं यो जज्ञे वीरुधां पतिरिन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: r̥ṣe | mantra-kr̥tām | stomaiḥ | kaśyapa | ut-vardhayan | giraḥ || somam | namasya | rājānam | yaḥ | jajñe | vīrudhām | patiḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.114.2||

IAST: sapta diśo nānāsūryāḥ sapta hotāra ṛtvijaḥ
Griffith: Seven regions have their several Suns; the ministering priests are seven;
Devanāgarī: सप्त दिशो नानासूर्याः सप्त होतार ऋत्विजः
pada pāṭha: sapta | diśaḥ | nānā-sūryāḥ | sapta | hotāraḥ | r̥tvijaḥ || devāḥ | ādityāḥ | ye | sapta | tebhiḥ | soma | abhi | rakṣa | naḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.114.3||

IAST: devā ādityā ye sapta tebhiḥ somābhi rakṣa na indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Seven are the Aditya Deities,-with these, O Soma, guard thou us. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: देवा आदित्या ये सप्त तेभिः सोमाभि रक्ष न इन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: sapta | diśaḥ | nānā-sūryāḥ | sapta | hotāraḥ | r̥tvijaḥ || devāḥ | ādityāḥ | ye | sapta | tebhiḥ | soma | abhi | rakṣa | naḥ | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.114.3||

IAST: yat te rājañ chṛtaṁ havis tena somābhi rakṣa naḥ
Griffith: Guard us with this oblation which, King Soma, hath been dressed for thee.
Devanāgarī: यत्ते राजञ्छृतं हविस्तेन सोमाभि रक्ष नः
pada pāṭha: yat | te | rājan | śr̥tam | haviḥ | tena | soma | abhi | rakṣa | naḥ || arāti-vā | mā | naḥ | tārīt | mo iti | ca | naḥ | kim | cana | āmamat | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.114.4||

IAST: arātīvā mā nas tārīn mo ca naḥ kiṁ canāmamad indrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: Let not malignity conquer us, let nothing evil do us harm. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.
Devanāgarī: अरातीवा मा नस्तारीन्मो च नः किं चनाममदिन्द्रायेन्दो परि स्रव
pada pāṭha: yat | te | rājan | śr̥tam | haviḥ | tena | soma | abhi | rakṣa | naḥ || arāti-vā | mā | naḥ | tārīt | mo iti | ca | naḥ | kim | cana | āmamat | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||9.114.4||
